novel_info.title: Tensura: The Multiverse Planeswalker
novel_info.author: XElenea
novel_info.summary: Reincarnating into a fantasy world is truly extraordinary, especially a fantasy world with a backdrop of Heroes and Demon Lords; it was a recipe for an exhilarating and incredible adventure.That’s what Damien is experiencing right now, reincarnating into the Tensuraverse.But the first thing that crossed his mind after reincarnating wasn’t whether he was part of the grand scheme of the battle between Hero and Demon Lord, but whether he had reincarnated as one of the weakest creatures in the entire world… a Slime?Fortunately, he didn’t suffer such an unfortunate fate. But as the saying goes, if you're so lucky for no reason, misfortune will be the price you pay. Although he didn’t reincarnate as a slime, he reincarnated as a Hybrid Majin-Human instead.To make matters worse, he was reincarnated in a region that adheres to the anti-monster doctrine of a certain Demon Lord’s church, a perfect recipe for discrimination and ostracism against him.But luckily, it seems the Voice of the World took pity on him for enduring such a fate and granted him [Planeswalker].A Unique Skill that allows him to explore another worlds freely.Incredible, right?But that’s not all. In addition to this skill, he was given a skill that makes him stronger with every powerful familiar he possesses.No doubt about it, with these two skills, his future is bright…Servants, Pokémon, Majin, Beasts, and all the powerful fictional characters he once admired… it seems that building his own kingdom composed entirely of his familiars is the surefire path to becoming the strongest!--[Tensura] [Pokémon] [Nasuverse] [Konosuba] [Highschool DxD] [Kumo desu ga Nani ka?] [Soul Land] [Dungeon Fighter Online] [No Game No Life] [Mondaiji-tachi]... and others.

chapters.title: Chapter 1 1: [TP] 1: Ogerpon
chapters.content:
"No matter where I go, the air here is so much better than on Earth."
The boy stood at the edge of the forest, looking down at the little creature by his side. "What do you think of this new world, Ogerpon?"
"Bo ne?"
Ogerpon, the legendary Pokémon from the Pokémon games Scarlet and Violet, tilted her head.
Her green body was adorned with white flowers and yellow circular patterns. The outer sides of her legs were black, the inner sides white, with two green leaves sprouting between her toes.
From her appearance, it looked as though Ogerpon wore a green cloak, with large, thorny black vines growing from its upper edge, the topmost pair resembling horns.
Hearing Damien's question, her tangerine-colored face lit up, her starry eyes squinting happily into slits. "Bo ne~ Bo ne um! (New world, Ogerpon likes it!)"
"Good to know you like it."
Damien watched the little creature bounce around, letting out cheerful cries, and couldn't help but smile.
He gently patted Ogerpon's head before opening her status panel.
[Ogerpon]
[Contractor: Damien]
[Race: Elemental Spirit]
[Existence Value (Magicule): 6500]
[Magic: Grass-type Pokémon Magic (Grass-type Moves)]
[Intrinsic Skills: Element Absorption, Ability Enhancement]
[Unique Skills: Destroyer (Possesses the power to destroy any material), Grower (Can grow stronger by defeating opponents)]
"Destroyer and Grower, huh?"
What appeared before Damien wasn't a Pokémon status screen but a panel unique to this world.
A month ago, Damien had awakened memories of his previous life.
In this life, he was a farm boy from a village on the outskirts of the Kingdom of Falmuth.
The Kingdom of Falmuth, located northwest of the Jura Forest, boasted a population of thirty million citizens, plus another ten million from the Free Guild, making it one of the most powerful nations in the Western Countries.
However, life for ordinary civilians in Falmuth was far from ideal.
Falmuth was a feudal nation ruled by nobles. Commoners could barely avoid starvation, existing solely to be exploited by the lofty rulers.
"So, I've been reincarnated into another world?"
From initial confusion to excitement upon hearing the Voice of the World, it took Damien mere minutes to grasp the nature of the world he'd been thrust into.
"The Kingdom of Falmuth, the Jura Forest... these are straight out of Tensuraverse!"
The boy looked identical to Damien from his previous life, just younger, around fifteen or sixteen years old.
As for the reason for his reincarnation...
Damien's final memory was of a truck, its headlights flashing white.
"So, did I soul-transmigrate, or was I reincarnated into this world and only now awakened my past life's memories?"
If it was the former, Damien detected no trace of another soul.
His predecessor's memories, from childhood to now, felt as vivid as his own, without the slightest sense of discord.
"Either way, getting to live again is a win."
With a mindset of making the best of it, Damien began to accept his new identity.
Soon, he realized his status in this world was rather peculiar.
Despite being a mixed-blood Majin... a hybrid of human and Majinkind... his predecessor had inherited little of the Majin's power and faced discrimination from regular humans, making him an outcast in the village.
Fortunately, Damien wasn't entirely without resources.
As a transmigrator, he hadn't awakened a system, which was a slight disappointment, but he did possess a unique cheat.
Back in the present, Damien closed Ogerpon's status panel.
"Open my panel."
With a slight shift of his thoughts, a new panel appeared in his mind.
[Damien]
[Race: Hybrid Majin-Human]
[Existence Value: 3500]
[Magic: Energy Cube Creation, Spirit Space, Appraisal]
[Intrinsic Skills: Adaptability (Your body can adapt to any system's power)]
[Unique Skills: Planeswalker [Exceptional] (You can open gates to unknown worlds and travel through them), Leader (By gaining followers, you can increase your Existence Value), Capturer (Form contracts with other beings, turning them into familiars)]
[Familiars: Ogerpon]
[Marked Worlds: Pokémonverse]
In the Tensuraverse, there existed a peculiar force called the Voice of the World. It provided feedback whenever an individual underwent changes, acquired skills, or experienced skill evolution.
In short, the Voice of the World could be understood as the rules and system of this world.
Whenever you gained a new skill or underwent a significant change, as long as it resonated with the world's strings and left a mark, you would receive the world's blessing.
Damien possessed three Unique Skills: Planeswalker, Leader, and Capturer.
The first, Planeswalker, likely tied to his transmigrator status, carried the suffix [Exceptional].
[Unique Skill: Traveler]
Grants the ability to leave the Central World and travel between planes or planets within the Tensuraverse.
[Planeswalker [Exceptional]
Damien's Unique Skill took Planeswalker further, allowing him to break through world boundaries and visit other universes.
The Tensuraverse was vast, divided into three main parts:
"The material world, devoid of Magicule."
"The spiritual world, purely of Magicule."
"The chaos world, blending material and energy."
As Damien examined his attributes, he explained the basics of this new world to Ogerpon. "The chaos world varies based on the concentration of Magicule... high, medium, and low."
Earth, where the original protagonist Rimuru had lived before reincarnating, was a material world without Magicule.
The world Damien now inhabited, home to Demon Lords and the Voice of the World, was the pinnacle of chaos worlds.
Known as the Central World, it served as the cornerstone and hub of the material, spiritual, and chaos world systems.
Moreover, because the Central World was constantly bathed in high concentrations of Magicule, its very essence had undergone profound changes.
"Bo ne?"
Ogerpon bent down, her small hands poking at the soil and stones on the ground before tilting her head. "Ogerpon thinks this place doesn't feel much different from the old world."
"That's because you've gotten stronger, Ogerpon."
Damien said, "Every blade of grass, every tree, even a grain of dirt here is far more durable and solid than in other worlds."
To put it simply, while humans in the Central World and on Earth might look and function similarly, their physical capabilities were on entirely different levels.
A force that could destroy a kilometers-wide area on Earth might only create a hundred-meter crater in the Central World.
This was the confidence that allowed Damien to travel between worlds without fear of instant death.
Though he was merely an E-rank human boy in the Central World, in the Pokémonverse he'd just visited, he was a super rookie among super rookies.
"I get it now!"
Ogerpon's eyes lit up with realization. She stood and looked at Damien with admiration. "That's why Damien is so amazing! Zip, zap, zoom... you took down those bad guys for Ogerpon!"
What Ogerpon referred to was Damien's first journey.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 2 2: [TP] 2: Demon Lord
chapters.content:
The Planeswalker's ability to traverse worlds came in two forms: returning to previously visited worlds or opening pathways to new ones.
The Pokémonverse was Damien's first destination and, so far, his only one.
To prepare for this journey, Damien had spent half a month arming himself as best he could before boldly opening the gate to a new world.
For his first crossing, Damien arrived in the Sinnoh region.
Penniless at the time, he relied on trading Cardinal World minerals, prepared in advance, with the residents of a local town.
Fortunately, his first destination was the Pokémonverse.
As widely known, the people of the Pokémonverse were generally warm, hospitable, and straightforward.
This made Damien's task of securing travel funds remarkably smooth.
With money in hand, Damien began planning his itinerary.
The gates opened by the Planeswalker ability had a limited duration. In the Pokémonverse, for instance, they lasted only seven days.
After that, he would be forcibly returned to the Cardinal World.
Then, a seven-day cooldown would follow before he could open another gate.
With just seven days, Damien decided that the most efficient and cost-effective Pokémon to bond with was Ogerpon.
In the games, Ogerpon boasted formidable combat abilities and versatile mechanics.
Moreover, she had a gentle temperament.
Though a bit mischievous, she was kind at heart, fearful of loneliness, and eager to connect with others.
'Close by, low difficulty.'
'Other Pokémon require nurturing and might not even cross my path.'
'Only Ogerpon's location is certain... go there, and I can start winning her over.'
With his decision made, Damien promptly purchased a ticket to Kitakami.
Damien's luck was truly remarkable.
He vividly recalled that day, climbing Oni Mountain and finding, in an empty cave, a pitiful figure clutching a teal mask, alone and desolate.
Whatever plans Damien had initially held, in that moment, he genuinely wanted to give her a warm home.
"Hello, Ogerpon."
After some interaction and bonding, Damien earned Ogerpon's trust and helped her reclaim her lost mask. "Want to come with me and see the world outside?"
Forget the troublesome folks of Kitakami or the so-called Loyal Three.
With his superhuman base-world physique, Damien showed them what true strength meant!
Yes, no Pokémon were needed.
With just himself and his fists, Damien single-handedly swept through all of Kitakami!
Of course, he didn't actually harm anyone.
At most, he destroyed the shrine housing the masks and gave Okidogi a solid knock on the head.
All in all, Damien's journey to the Pokémonverse was a resounding success.
He brought Ogerpon back with him and gained two abilities classified as "magic" by the Cardinal World: Energy Cube Creation and Spirit Space.
As the name suggested, Energy Cube Creation allowed Damien to transform fruits into energy cubes of various flavors.
Adapted by the world's rules, these energy cubes were suitable not only for Ogerpon but also for regular humans.
They were akin to the compressed rations of Damien's previous life, packing substantial nutrition into small cubes.
As for Spirit Space, it was the result of the Voice of the World analyzing the Poké Balls Damien brought back.
The Poké Balls vanished, replaced by a personal spatial pocket where Damien could store his familliars.
These were the full extent of the benefits Damien gained from the Pokémonverse through his Planeswalker ability.
"It's time to leave."
Damien turned, glancing at the distant village with little attachment in his eyes.
This land belonged to the Kingdom of Falmuth.
Having read the original novel, Damien knew how deplorable this nation was.
The nobles extorted relentlessly, living in decadence and excess, utterly indifferent to the plight of commoners.
Moreover, the humans here harbored a deep-seated hatred for monsters, which naturally extended to mixed-blood Majins like Damien.
Damien's race, mixed-blood Majin, stemmed from the union of a Majin and a human.
However, perhaps due to the passage of time, the Majin blood in Damien's veins was too diluted.
Before awakening his memories, he exhibited no traits distinct from ordinary humans.
Even so, life in the village was far from pleasant.
The notion that monsters were evil was deeply ingrained in Falmuth, and mixed-blood Majins like Damien faced the same discrimination.
This had been his life until a month ago.
That day, Damien suddenly awakened his past-life memories and heard the Voice of the World.
The Voice of the World bestowed upon him the Unique Skills: Planeswalker, Leader, and Capturer.
Beyond the exceptional Planeswalker, the Capturer skill allowed Damien to form contracts and take on familliars.
This skill was somewhat akin to a "beast tamer" profession, but far more convenient and powerful.
As for Leader...
It complemented Capturer perfectly.
Whenever Damien gained a familliar, their Existence Value would, to some extent, feed back into Damien, boosting his own.
Likewise, as Damien's Existence Value increased, his familliars would also benefit.
Existence Value was a unique concept in the Tensuraverse.
It was somewhat like combat power but not entirely tied to strength. Instead, it influenced an individual's total Magicule and their inherent rank.
Take Ogerpon, for example. Upon arriving in the Cardinal World, the Voice of the World automatically granted her the Unique Skills Destroyer and Grower.
Along with these came an energy system collectively known as Magicule.
Had she remained the original Ogerpon, even as a Pokémon from Scarlet and Violet with mastery over various moves, she would likely only rank as a D-grade in the Cardinal World.
However, thanks to Damien's Capturer skill, a master-familliar bond was formed between him and Ogerpon.
This bond earned her the Cardinal World's recognition upon their return.
"Existence Value?"
Ogerpon could also see her status panel. Pointing to one attribute, she asked, "Is that the thing called Magicule?"
"Exactly."
Damien praised her, "Ogerpon, you're amazing! With 6500 points of Magicule, you've already reached B-rank in the Cardinal World."
"B-rank?"
Ogerpon tilted her head, curious. "What about you, Damien?"
"As for me…"
Damien glanced at his 3500 points of Magicule. "I'm probably around C-rank."
In this world, aside from regular animals, races deemed harmful to humans were collectively called "monsters."
Among them, highly intelligent races were "Majins." while powerful humanoid monsters were "Majinkind."
Based on their threat level, the Free Guild classified them into simple ranks:
Special S (Calamity Grade): Beyond a single nation's ability to handle, requiring united efforts from multiple nations, a threat to humanity's survival.
S (Disaster Grade): Can be managed with a major nation's forces.
Special A (Catastrophe Grade): Capable of threatening an entire nation.
A (Hazard Grade): Can cause severe damage to a city.
B: Black Spider, Ogre Tribe, etc.... capable of destroying a village single-handedly.
C: Lizardman Tribe, Pegasus, etc.... slightly stronger than trained professional soldiers.
D: Orc Tribe, etc.... dangerous enough that three or four average adults could be at risk.
E: Goblin, etc.... slightly weaker than an average adult, often appearing in groups.
F: No combat ability.
Based on Existence Value and Magicule calculations, Ogerpon was roughly equivalent to a B-rank Ogre, possessing the destructive power to wipe out a village of hundreds on her own.
When combined with her Destroyer skill and the potential for further growth through her Grower skill, Ogerpon's actual combat ability and potential were even greater.
In short, as Damien put it…
He gently patted Ogerpon's head, grinning. "My Ogerpon has the makings of a Demon Lord!"
***

chapters.title: Chapter 3 3: [TP] 3: Get ‘Em!
chapters.content:
"Bo ne um…"
Praised by Damien, Ogerpon gleefully bounced and twirled around him, resembling an adorable little girl.
Her curiosity about the new world was insatiable.
Danger wasn't a concern here.
They were at the forest's edge, near a human village where Damien had lived and knew well.
What really caught his attention was how Ogerpon paid no mind to the dirt and grass clinging to her.
In just a short while, she'd already gotten herself delightfully messy.
"Bo ne Bo ne (Demon Lord, Demon Lord, Ogerpon wants to be a Demon Lord!)"
Ogerpon had no clue what a Demon Lord was.
But if Damien said it was impressive, it had to be true.
"To become a Demon Lord, Ogerpon, you first need to master your new powers." Damien said, finding a clearing far enough from the village. "Come on, try out your skills and get a feel for the changes in your body."
"Bo ne!"
Without hesitation, Ogerpon began her practice.
Ogerpon had the potential to grow into a Demon Lord.
But not every Pokémon shared her potential.
To earn the Cardinal World's recognition and be granted Magicule, a Pokémon first had to become Damien's familliar through his Capturer skill.
The number of familliarsDamien could have was tied to the strength of his Capturer skill.
Currently, he could only contract up to three familliars.
With such limited slots, Damien was cautious about which Pokémon to bond with.
Kitakami's lonely little Ogerpon was, in his mind, the easiest divine beast to recruit.
From what Damien knew, only Pokémon Gods, and Legendary Pokémon had the potential to grow into Demon Lord-level beings.
"Every contract slot is incredibly valuable." Damien mused.
He hadn't ruled out capturing more Pokémon.
Even the weakest Pokémon, when brought to the Cardinal World, could be trained into respectable fighters.
Unfortunately, with his current situation, even if he had more slots, he lacked the means to protect and nurture weaker Pokémon.
"I'll have to wait until later to return to the Pokémonverse and catch a Gardevoir…"
When it came to Damien's favorite Pokémon, Gardevoir was definitely near the top.
But reality was harsh, and he had to reluctantly set aside his dream of a psychic queen for now.
"Bo ne!"
"Bo ne, bo ne!"
Unaware of Damien's wandering thoughts, Ogerpon was swinging her cudgel, unleashing a variety of Pokémon moves.
Well, they weren't exactly Pokémon moves anymore.
Transformed by Magicule and the world's rules, Ogerpon's moves had been converted into "Common Skills."
No longer powered solely by her innate type energy, they were now fueled by Magicule, making them a form of unique magic... Pokémon Magic.
"Ogerpon feels so much stronger!"
Looking at the tree she'd just snapped with a single swing, Ogerpon compared Kitakami to this world. "My strength is way up, and my stamina's gotten a big boost too!"
"It's not just a few times stronger." Damien said, gently ruffling her head. "The physical laws of the two worlds are different."
"The Pokémonverse is a low-magic chaos world."
The Cardinal World, on the other hand, surpassed even high-concentration chaos worlds, qualifying as an ultra-concentration chaos world.
By a simple calculation, each step up in Magicule concentration boosted an individual's performance by a tier.
Take Ogerpon now: in the Cardinal World, she could shatter a tree with one swing, earning a D-rank evaluation.
(A strike capable of breaking a giant tree equates to D-rank, a standard that holds across most worlds.)
In a high-concentration world, that same strike would rank as C-grade.
If she returned to the Pokémonverse, Ogerpon could probably take down titans like Groudon or Rayquaza with a casual flick of her cudgel.
"Ogerpon doesn't totally get it, but it sounds super impressive!"
Ogerpon wore a look of awed confusion. She wasn't the sharpest, but if Damien said she'd gotten stronger, it had to be true.
For the only friend she'd met in centuries, now her family, Ogerpon had absolute trust in Damien.
"Get used to your new powers as quickly as you can." Damien said, glancing toward the depths of the forest. "If we want to find a good spot to build our new home, we've got a long road ahead."
He'd already decided to leave the human village and head to the Jura Forest to forge his own path.
With the Leader and Capturer skills, Damien resolved to follow Rimuru's example, turning this unclaimed forest into his own domain!
"Ogerpon's super strong!"
Raising her cudgel high, Ogerpon chirped, "Leave building our new home to me!"
"Woo ya~~"
Seeing Ogerpon's confident, adorable demeanor, Damien couldn't resist. Before she could react, he scooped her up from behind.
"There are some pretty powerful monsters in this forest, you know."
"Ogerpon's not scared!"
Damien lifted her high, and after a moment of initial panic, Ogerpon peered curiously at the Jura Forest ahead.
'Damien, Ogerpon will protect you!'
Pokémon trainers, Pokémon, traveling, battling... these were things Ogerpon had only seen from travelers visiting Kitakami.
Now, she had her own trainer and was ready to embark on her own adventure!
"Rustle Rustle"
With Ogerpon's protection, Damien had no need to fear monster threats.
And so, he left the village he'd grown up in and ventured into the Jura Forest.
Along the way, they encountered numerous monsters radiating dangerous auras.
Fortunately, none were particularly strong. Against Ogerpon, a B-rank whose combat prowess rivaled A-rank monsters, none could withstand even a single blow.
These monsters became fodder for Ogerpon's experience (Magicule), fueling her growth.
Thud, thud, thud!!
Suddenly, as Damien navigated the forest, the ground beneath him trembled. "Something big's coming, Ogerpon!"
"Bo ne?!"
Without needing further prompting, Ogerpon summoned her cudgel and positioned herself in front of Damien.
"Roar!!"
Moments later, a massive black figure, nearly four meters tall and resembling a wall, emerged before them.
It was a black bear exuding a savage aura.
Its arms and legs were covered in tough bristles, with faint black energy coursing over its body. A pair of blood-red eyes locked onto Ogerpon and Damien behind her.
Clearly, this beast was coming for them.
Monsters in the forest typically had keen senses of smell and hearing.
And two obvious targets like Damien and Ogerpon were impossible to miss.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 4 4: [TP] 4: Terror
chapters.content:
"So, it sees us as food?"
Damien recognized the black bear's identity. "A C-rank monster, Terror Burst Bear. Think you can handle it, Ogerpon?"
"No problem!"
Ogerpon wasn't new to fighting the monsters of this world.
A mere C-rank wasn't enough to intimidate her.
"Good."
Damien quickly stepped back to a safe distance.
He fixed his gaze on the Terror Burst Bear, a spark of anticipation in his eyes. "If you're coming for us, you'd better be ready to become dinner yourself."
"Go all out, Ogerpon."
Damien grinned. "Tonight, we're having bear paws!"
"Got it!"
Ogerpon gripped her cudgel, her body surging with green Grass-type Magicule.
In the next instant, she vanished from where she stood.
Whoosh!
Swish, swish, swish!
Ogerpon transformed into a streak of green light, darting between the trees so swiftly that the once-ferocious Terror Burst Bear was left bewildered.
Phantasmal afterimages overwhelmed the bear, leaving it unable to keep up.
"Now's the chance!"
"Bo ne!"
Suddenly, a three-to-four-meter-long cudgel, formed entirely of energy, descended from above, slamming into the bear's skull.
Thud!
Boom!
Its head shattered, blood splattered, and the bear's massive, house-sized body collapsed alongside it.
"Bo ne!"
Ogerpon leapt down from the air, landing steadily in front of Damien, striking a cool pose for good measure.
[Notice: Individual 'Ogerpon' has defeated C-rank monster 'Terror Burst Bear']
[Unique Skill 'Grower' successfully absorbed Magicule]
[Gained Existence Value: 3 EP]
In just a few days, Ogerpon's Magicule had risen from 6500 to 7000.
The Grower skill was undeniably overpowered.
As long as she kept defeating or killing opponents, she could harvest Magicule.
And Magicule was the key to a monster's evolution.
"Nice work."
Damien praised, "You've got full control over your magic and strength now, Ogerpon."
"Bo ne um~~"
Ogerpon dissipated her cudgel back into Grass-type Magicule, scratching her head shyly at Damien's compliments.
"Your Magicule went up by 500."
"If we'd run into more monsters, you could've gotten even stronger."
Damien thought of Rimuru from the original story, whose Predator skill was even more absurd than Ogerpon's Grower.
Of course, beings like Rimuru or Ogerpon, who could grow stronger by devouring or defeating other monsters, were rare in the Cardinal World.
Monster evolution wasn't easy.
Before Rimuru's rise, an A-rank ogre in the Ogre Tribe was a legend unseen for a millennium.
It wasn't common, but not impossible either. If Ogerpon could defeat another thousand monsters, she could evolve into an A-rank monster.
"Ogerpon got a little stronger just now."
"It feels like I've been getting so much stronger lately."
Ogerpon bounced back to Damien's side, tilting her head curiously. "Is it because of that stuff called Magicule (EP)?"
"Exactly."
Damien patted her head, explaining, "In this world, Magicule is closely tied to a monster's strength."
"Generally, the more Magicule a monster has, the stronger they are."
This didn't quite apply to humans, though.
Humans relied more on techniques, unlike the skill-based power of monsters.
"The Terror Burst Bear we just took down was a C-rank monster."
"And you, Ogerpon, are B-rank."
Damien shared what he knew. "After B-rank comes B+, A-, and the higher A-rank."
In the Cardinal World, Existence Value roughly translated to ranks as follows:
0–1000: E-rank
1000–3000: D-rank
3000–6000: C-rank
6000–8000: B-rank
8000–9000: B+-rank
9000–10000: A–rank
Then, 10,000 was a threshold. Breaking it meant becoming an A-rank monster, earning the "Hazard" designation.
10000–100000: A-rank
The A-rank range was vast, on an entirely different level from lower ranks.
Typically, an A-rank Hazard monster could single-handedly destroy a city in the human world.
At the higher Special A-rank, a monster became a "Catastrophe" capable of wiping out a nation.
Breaking the 100,000 Existence Value barrier earned a Special A-rank designation.
Of course, Special A-rank had its own spectrum.
Some Special A monsters, unable to progress further, were labeled Catastrophes.
But those who broke their limits and continued evolving, reaching 200,000 Existence Value, became what humans called "Demon Lords." or Demon Lord Seeds.
In the original story, Demon Lord Seeds weren't portrayed as overwhelmingly powerful, sometimes barely qualifying as Demon Lords.
But in this real world, humans didn't distinguish between Demon Lords and Demon Lord Seeds so casually.
A Demon Lord Seed was a Demon Lord... a colossal Catastrophe capable of threatening or even destroying a nation.
The emergence of such a being could lead to millions of deaths and tens of millions displaced.
Even in the Cardinal World, let alone a modern society, it would be a global catastrophe.
"Ogerpon's gonna be a Demon Lord!"
Ogerpon's resolve to become a Demon Lord grew stronger. The little creature's thoughts were simple: "That way, Ogerpon can protect Damien even better!"
"Haha."
Damien's heart warmed. Truly my loyal companion.
"Come lend a hand, Ogerpon." Damien said. "I'll make you something tasty!"
"Ohhh!"
The Terror Burst Bear was far too big for Damien and Ogerpon to eat alone.
But that was no issue.
Damien had Spirit Space, where he could store the remaining bear meat without worrying about spoilage.
They weren't short on food... Damien's space held plenty of supplies bought from the Pokémonverse.
But bear paws? Those were something Damien had only heard of in his past life.
Now that he had the chance to try them, he wasn't about to pass it up.
"Hm?"
Suddenly, Damien noticed Ogerpon staring at the fallen Terror Burst Bear.
"What's wrong?" He guessed her thoughts. "Feeling uneasy?"
"A little, but not much."
Ogerpon shook her head. The Pokémonverse had regular animals too.
She wouldn't kill Pokémon, as they were her kind.
But ordinary animals? She didn't mind.
It was much like the relationship between monsters and beasts in the Cardinal World.
Monsters were intelligent, with their own language, capable of communication and emotion.
Beasts like the Terror Burst Bear, however, were driven purely by instinct.
They weren't even products of natural reproduction.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 5 5: [TP] 5: Majin
chapters.content:
"Looks like I need to explain where these beasts come from, Ogerpon."
Over the past few days, Damien and Ogerpon had defeated many beasts, including a few monsters.
But they hadn't gone for the kill.
With the Grower skill, defeating and killing yielded the same amount of Magicule.
This made them prefer simply overcoming opponents rather than mindless slaughter.
"First off, this beast we call a Terror Burst Bear... don't let its flesh and blood fool you into thinking it's like us, Ogerpon."
Damien explained, "In truth, its body is entirely made of Magicule."
"Completely made of Magicule?"
"This world has three main forms of existence:
One, the astral body, which houses the soul and is the most fragile.
Two, the spiritual body, which stores power.
Three, the material body, directly connected to the world."
Seeing Ogerpon's 'I don't get it, but I'm amazed' expression, Damien couldn't help but chuckle. "Alright, alright, I know this is a bit much for you."
"To put it simply, the beasts in this world, no matter how strong, are products of spiritual bodies fused with Magicule."
"They don't have souls."
Spiritual bodies are everywhere, intangible and formless. You can't destroy them with the rules of the physical world.
When the Terror Burst Bear died, the spiritual body driving it had already dissipated.
All that remained was a pile of Magicule-infused meat.
"But creatures like you, Ogerpon, are called monsters."
Monsters have souls, making them fundamentally no different from humans.
"Ogerpon's a monster."
Ogerpon tilted her head and asked, "What about you, Damien? Are you a human or a monster?"
From appearances alone, Damien would definitely be seen as human.
But that wasn't the full story.
Damien was a mixed-blood Majin, the product of a Majin and human union.
It's worth noting that a mixed-blood Majin isn't the same as a half-Majin.
Half-Majins typically refer to humans transformed into Majins, also called human-Majins, a completely different concept from Damien's mixed-blood Majin status.
"Half-Majin, mixed-blood Majin."
Ogerpon scratched her head, still not fully understanding but grasping the gist.
"I'm not entirely sure myself." Damien admitted. "From what I know, mixed-blood Majins are supposed to be incredibly rare in this world."
The Cardinal World wasn't some fantasy realm where monsters and humans could easily produce offspring.
Only humanoid monsters were classified as Majins.
When Majins reproduce, a significant portion of their Magicule is passed to their offspring through inheritance.
This is true for Majin-to-Majin reproduction. But when a Majin pairs with a human, it's no exaggeration to say the Majin parent essentially ceases to exist.
Losing a large amount of Magicule is akin to losing most of their lifespan, even for the world's ceiling, the Creation God, Star Dragon King.
'My predecessor's origins are a bit odd.'
'A mixed-blood Majin, yet I don't know what kind of monster the non-human bloodline comes from.'
Fortunately, Damien wasn't particularly reliant on the power his Majin bloodline might offer.
Even without awakening it, it didn't affect him much.
'Having some monster blood is already a win. Why ask for more?'
In the Cardinal World, monsters had it better than humans and found it easier to grow stronger.
This was evident in the original novel, where the protagonist was a monster.
Thanks to his Majin blood, Damien also had the monster-like ability to grow stronger by increasing his Magicule and evolving.
His only regret was not having a convenient ability like Rimuru's.
To boost his Magicule, he had to train himself, building it up step by step.
Alternatively, he could rely on Ogerpon.
Before crossing to the Pokémonverse and bonding with Ogerpon, Damien's Existence Value was a mere 300, barely qualifying for an E-rank evaluation, about on par with a forest goblin.
But as Ogerpon's Existence Value climbed to 7000, Damien's saw a dramatic leap.
From 300 to 3800 now... a 3500-point increase, roughly half of Ogerpon's gain.
With 3000–6000 Existence Value, by Cardinal World standards, he'd reached the level of a C-rank monster.
As for actual combat ability...
Unlike Ogerpon, a Pokémon naturally adept at fighting, Damien, with two lifetimes, had no formal combat training.
None of his three Unique Skills... Planeswalker, Leader, or Capturer... offered combat enhancements.
In a real fight, he couldn't muster C-rank monster strength, managing only to bully D-rank orcs with brute force.
As mentioned before, Existence Value determined the amount of Magicule.
More Magicule meant greater magical power.
The relationship between Magicule and magical power could be likened to a mana bar's capacity, current mana, and mana recovery rate.
(While the original work doesn't distinguish magical power, for clarity, we'll separate Magicule and magical power here.)
For example, 1000 Magicule versus 10,000 seems like a tenfold difference.
But the former recovers 1% magical power per second, while the latter recovers 5%.
In numbers, the former can expend 10 points of magical power per second, while the latter can burn through 500.
This creates a fiftyfold gap in basic magical output, not counting additional magic, inherent abilities, unique skills, resistances, and so on.
Of course, combat outcomes aren't solely about stats and abilities. Martial skills and real-world experience also play a role.
The best example is Hakurou from the original story.
Hakurou's Magicule was around 100,000, not particularly high.
Yet, with his swordsmanship, he could take on foes with far greater Magicule.
That's the boost martial skill and experience can provide.
Crackle~
The firewood ignited, flames greedily consuming dry leaves, popping and snapping.
Skewered bear meat sat on the grill, its savory aroma quickly spreading through the crisp air.
The meat, seared by the flames, turned from bright red to golden brown, with oil dripping into the fire, sparking wisps of smoke.
Gulp~~
Seeing Ogerpon drooling, Damien picked up a skewer and handed it to her. "Heh, here, dig in."
"Thanks! Chomp."
Ogerpon took a big bite, her eyes squinting in bliss. "So yummy~~"
Damien grabbed a skewer for himself.
The food in this world... whether mushrooms from the forest or animal meat... was incredibly delicious.
'Is this the effect of Magicule?'
Damien could only marvel at how extraordinary things were in a high-tier world.
As he ate, he didn't idle, using the break to ponder his future path.
"Martial skills, magic, combat experience…"
"I've got no way to learn magic or martial skills."
"And combat experience is too risky."
"As expected, being a trainer suits me best."
Damien knew his role: a summoner, the kind who stays behind his summoned creatures and cheers them on.
His Leader skill paired perfectly with Ogerpon's Grower, making them an ideal team.
Ogerpon could grow stronger by defeating or killing monsters and enemies, gaining Magicule.
Of course, this growth wasn't limitless.
First, each individual could only be defeated once for experience unless they achieved a major breakthrough.
Repeatedly defeating the same target wouldn't yield more.
Additionally, this Magicule growth had a cap, not an endless well.
Even so, for a Unique Skill, Grower was impressive, capable of pushing Ogerpon to Demon Lord Seed status.
To break through to Special A-rank or even S-rank... a True Demon Lord... Grower would need to evolve further.
As for how to evolve it…
Damien's gaze shifted to his Planeswalker skill, currently on cooldown. "I wonder if the next world will have a way to make Ogerpon and me even stronger?"
***

chapters.title: Chapter 6 6: [TP] 6: Camp
chapters.content:
Time passed quickly.
A week had gone by since Damien and Ogerpon entered the forest.
On the morning of the seventh day, they finally found the perfect spot to build their new home.
Deep in the woods, a clear stream flowed gently, like nature's delicate thread weaving a tranquil haven.
Sunlight filtered through the gaps in the leaves, dancing on the water's surface, sparkling like countless golden gems.
The stream's banks were lush with green grass, dotted with wildflowers that released a faint, sweet fragrance.
"Are we going to live here from now on?"
Ogerpon crouched down, her small hands gently brushing the flowers at her feet, clearly in high spirits.
"What do you think, Ogerpon?"
"There are lots of fruits in the forest, and fish in the water." Ogerpon said. "Ogerpon loves it here!"
"Glad you like it."
Damien patted Ogerpon's head. It wasn't that he wanted to leave the village.
His predecessor had a rough life there, and after awakening his memories, Damien had no intention of enduring others' scorn any longer.
So, after preparing thoroughly, he dealt with those who had discriminated against or bullied him.
Before drawing the attention of human adventurers, he gathered his supplies and ventured into the Pokémonverse.
Unlike his predecessor, Damien actually preferred the idea of being part of Majinkind over humanity.
After all, in the Cardinal World, becoming a Demon Lord was the true path to power.
The Majin blood in Damien's veins gave him the potential to undergo a monster's evolution ritual, progressing from low to high until achieving Demon Lord awakening.
To reach that goal, conquering humans was pointless.
For a monster to grow, beyond innate potential, they needed achievements to boost their Existence Value, evolving continuously until reaching Demon Lord Seed status.
Territory, followers, and battle records.
All three were essential.
With his Planeswalker skill, Damien could travel to other worlds to gain power and companions.
Ogerpon's Grower skill was even more straightforward... fighting to grow stronger, naturally reaching unimaginable heights.
Their current location was in the western part of the Jura Forest.
No powerful monster tribes lived nearby, and with Ogerpon's B-rank strength and array of Pokémon moves, they had more than enough to establish a foothold here.
Even if they encountered a monster above B-rank, they could abandon the spot immediately.
Running wasn't shameful.
Surviving meant they could always return for revenge later.
"I'll go pick some fruit in the forest."
With a plan in mind, Damien began assigning tasks. "Ogerpon, can you cut down those trees over there?"
"Those ones?"
"Yeah, from here to there, and that patch on the left."
Damien pointed out the area. "We're building our new home by the stream. Clearing those trees will give us space to plant crops later."
"The felled trees can be used to build a house." Damien added. "We'll have more companions in the future, so we need to prepare enough living space."
"New companions!"
Ogerpon loved lively environments. "Ogerpon wants to build a big, big house for lots and lots of friends to live in!"
"But… Ogerpon doesn't know how to build a house."
She quickly realized she'd always lived in caves and had no idea how to construct one.
"Don't worry, leave the house-building to me."
In his past life, Damien had dabbled in carpentry as a hobby, particularly in building simple wooden cabins, and he remembered the details clearly.
"Damien's so awesome!!"
Hearing that Damien could build a house, Ogerpon's starry eyes widened, brimming with admiration.
Pokémon truly were creatures that could heal the heart.
Ogerpon was practically Damien's perfect companion!
"I'm off to gather fruit."
With his superhuman physique, picking fruit posed no danger.
Even if a monster appeared, Ogerpon would be at his side in an instant.
The two split up to work.
Damien first gathered various edible fruits he recognized, ones with good flavor, and washed them in the stream.
He also caught four plump fish to add to their lunch.
Unfortunately, they'd already eaten all the Terror Burst Bear meat, or their meal could've been even more lavish.
Damien decided to conserve the supplies he'd brought from the Pokémonverse.
He couldn't be sure future worlds would offer enough resources.
If he ended up in a post-apocalyptic or primitive world, he'd have to use his Planeswalker ability to return to the Pokémonverse for supplies... a hassle he wanted to avoid.
So, he'd save where he could.
With fresh food available, there was no need to dip into their reserves.
"Damien, Damien, is this enough?"
"If it's not, Ogerpon can chop more!"
On the clearing by the stream, Ogerpon's small frame hoisted a massive log above her head, one that would take two people to carry.
With her Pokémon moves and B-rank strength, trees that would take ordinary people hours to fell were snapped effortlessly by Ogerpon.
"That's enough, that's enough."
Damien hurriedly stopped her. "No rush, take it slow. We've got plenty of time."
Seeing Ogerpon's boundless energy, Damien felt a pang of guilt, like he was exploiting a child worker.
"Bo ne!"
But Ogerpon, ignoring his words, heaved the log with force, sending it flying.
Clearly, she wasn't listening, diving into the work with no concept of slacking off.
Boom!
In just half an hour, Ogerpon not only felled the trees but even began basic processing.
A neat stack of logs now piled high on the grass.
Despite all this labor, Ogerpon wasn't tired... she was thriving.
After years of solitude on Kitakami's Oni Mountain, she'd finally found someone willing to connect with her in Damien.
Her fear of loneliness and centuries of isolation meant that, for Ogerpon, even harder tasks were a joy: 'As long as I'm with Damien, Ogerpon's happy doing anything!'
***

chapters.title: Chapter 7 7: [TP] 7: Spider Beast
chapters.content:
"You've worked hard. Come eat something."
Damien called Ogerpon to a stop, patting her head with a smile as he pulled freshly washed fruits from a basket.
As a Grass-type Pokémon, Ogerpon could theoretically sustain herself with water and photosynthesis to meet her energy needs.
But survival alone wasn't enough for a Pokémon to grow.
A rich, nutritious diet was the foundation for becoming stronger.
"Bo ne um!"
Ogerpon happily took the fruit Damien offered, her two little fangs chomping down with a crunch.
Instantly, sweet and tangy juice filled her mouth.
"Delicious!"
Ogerpon sat shoulder-to-shoulder with Damien on a rock, her short legs dangling and swinging.
Savoring the tasty fruit with her family by her side, Ogerpon felt utterly content.
"We're running out of daylight today, so we'll just set up a simple tent. Tomorrow, we'll properly build our new home."
As Damien spoke, he wiped fruit stains from Ogerpon's body.
His every gesture was like that of a caring brother looking after an innocent little sister.
A gentle breeze rustled the trees, their shadows swaying.
The two lay under the shade, easing the fatigue accumulated from the day's work.
"Let's get started, Ogerpon."
After their lunch break, Damien and Ogerpon resumed their tasks.
"Bo ne!!"
Ogerpon sprang up, grabbing a log before Damien could even ask.
"Shape this log like this."
Damien planned to build a fence to protect their future home. "Oh, and we need to dig a deep trench around the perimeter."
Of course, he wouldn't leave all the work to Ogerpon... that would be unfair.
Damien would join in digging the trench.
Tools weren't an issue. During his time in the Pokémonverse, he'd purchased plenty of construction tools and brought them back to the Cardinal World.
Working together, Damien swung a hammer, driving wooden stakes into the ground.
Whenever he ran out of materials, Ogerpon was there in a flash, hauling over piles of processed timber.
The little creature was brimming with enthusiasm!
Rustle~~
Suddenly, a sound from the jungle snapped the working duo to attention.
"What's that noise?"
Damien's expression grew serious. "Something's coming."
A week of forest exploration had given him plenty of experience handling danger.
Instead of recklessly approaching, he cautiously stepped back.
"Bo ne!"
Ogerpon dropped her log, flashing in front of Damien, her hand summoning a cudgel glowing with green light.
Soon, a bizarre creature... a mix of centipede and spider... emerged before them.
"What kind of beast is this?"
Damien had purchased a monster guidebook from the Free Guild back in the village.
Yet he had no recollection of this massive insectoid creature.
"Appraisal!"
Without hesitation, Damien cast his Appraisal skill on the beast.
Multi-Legged Spider Beast
Type: Hybrid Insect Monster
Rank: C (Existence Value: 3800)
Inherent Abilities: Web Spinning, Deadly Venom
Description: A monster that recently appeared in the Jura Forest. It poisons its prey before consuming their flesh with its mouthparts.
Threat Level: Low
'This is a monster?'
'Was there anything like this in the original story?'
The thought crossed Damien's mind but was quickly dismissed. "The original story was just a novel. This is a real world."
'The forest has countless species. It can't just be limited to what's written in the book.'
'And since it's a monster, it should be possible to communicate, right?'
But the spider beast didn't look remotely capable of communication... it seemed even more beastly than the other creatures they'd encountered.
For now, Damien led Ogerpon back, keeping a safe distance.
"Hey!"
Damien tried to reason with the creature. "Can we calm down? We mean no harm."
"If this is your territory, we can leave."
Both Damien and Ogerpon were principled at heart.
If this area was already claimed, their actions... cutting down trees and building a fence... could indeed be seen as intrusive.
"Screech!!"
But the Multi-Legged Spider Beast seemed to understand nothing, spewing a wave of venom toward them.
"Damn it!"
Damien and Ogerpon dodged swiftly.
Hiss~~
Glancing back, they saw the trees and ground where the venom landed turn black and reek, as if corroded by acid.
There was no doubt... this creature meant to kill them.
"Bo ne?"
Ogerpon awaited Damien's orders. His gaze hardened as he said, "Watch out for its venom and webs. Stick to ranged moves if you can."
"Then, take it down!"
"Got it!"
Ogerpon's lips curled, her little fangs glinting with a mix of cuteness and ferocity.
"Bo ne um!"
She swung her cudgel with gusto.
With a stomp, a surge of pale green energy radiated from her, covering a ten-meter radius.
This was Grassy Terrain, a magic derived from her Pokémon move!
Unlike the original Grassy Terrain, which benefited both sides, Ogerpon's version only aided her and those she recognized as allies.
"Screech!!"
The spider beast was clearly startled by Ogerpon's move.
The scattered magical energy disrupted its sensory antennae, stripping it of environmental awareness.
In its panic, the beast instinctively sprayed webs forward.
But Ogerpon was ready, dodging the attack with a quick flash.
"Now's your chance!"
Damien shouted, "Use Seed Bomb!"
"Bo ne!"
Ogerpon opened her mouth, unleashing a barrage of golden light particles.
The particles hit the spider beast, triggering a massive explosion that elicited pained screeches.
"Break all its legs!"
No longer hesitating, Damien gave the order for close combat. "Use Ivy Cudgel!"
"Hya!"
Ogerpon had been waiting for this. With a mighty stomp that cracked the earth, she shot forward like lightning, her monstrous strength shattering every one of the spider beast's legs.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 8 8: [TP] 8: Artificial Monster
chapters.content:
"Screech!!"
With a deafening crash, the Multi-Legged Spider Beast wailed in agony.
Without its legs to support it, its body collapsed heavily to the ground.
A flood of inky green blood, reeking with a foul stench, forced Ogerpon to back away.
"Bo ne~~"
Ogerpon retreated to Damien's side, her face scrunched in disgust. "This thing stinks!"
"Cough, cough, cough."
Damien, too, wore a grimace of discomfort.
He seriously doubted whether such a creature could possess intelligence.
The beasts they'd encountered before had edible flesh.
But this spider beast? It was practically a biochemical weapon.
"Biochemical weapon?"
Damien used his Appraisal skill on the spider beast again.
This time, he activated the skill's 'Appraisal' function.
Appraisal allowed for targeted analysis of an object. For instance, appraising a sword would reveal its attributes.
But basic Appraisal couldn't provide detailed specifics.
With Appraisal, you could learn the sword's thickness, length, weight, and material.
The precision depended on what you wanted to know.
While Appraisal wasn't as convenient as Rimuru's Great Sage, it covered the basics well enough.
"Appraisal: Does this spider beast possess intelligence?"
[Notice: No]
"???"
Damien's eyes widened, wondering if he'd misheard. "Wait, didn't it say this was a monster?! No intelligence, and you're sure it's a monster?"
[Notice: Artificial monster, akin to a constructed lifeform]
"…"
Damien pieced it together.
In simple terms, this thing wasn't a naturally born monster. It had a soul, but not a complete one... merely soul fragments.
The specifics eluded him.
All he knew was that this spider beast didn't need to be treated as an intelligent being.
"Tch, just a brainless mob, then."
Damien frowned, fanning the air in front of his nose. "Finish it off, Ogerpon."
"Bo ne!"
Ogerpon didn't question why.
If Damien asked, she'd act without hesitation.
Thud!
Her Ivy Cudgel swung, green energy striking from dozens of meters away.
The immense force smashed into the spider beast's head, obliterating half its body like a burst watermelon. It was deader than dead.
[Individual 'Ogerpon' has killed 'Multi-Legged Spider Beast,' gaining 5 Existence Points]
Ogerpon's built-in experience notification let Damien know the Existence Value gained from the spider beast.
"5 Existence Points, 2 more than the Terror Burst Bear's 3."
Damien didn't dwell on the Magicule gained from the kill. His focus was on the term 'artificial monster.'
"Feels like we're getting tangled in something bad."
Damien shook his head, dismissing the unnecessary worry. "Power. As long as we get strong enough, no scheme or trick can touch us."
"Ogerpon, how does this spider beast compare to the Terror Burst Bear?"
"Hm…"
Ogerpon thought for a moment. "Ogerpon thinks the spider beast is weak."
Despite her cautious approach... using Grassy Terrain to disrupt its senses and Seed Bomb to lower its guard... these were just strategies she'd developed for safety.
In truth, Ogerpon could've taken it down with a single swing.
The same went for the Terror Burst Bear.
"But Ogerpon still thinks the bear was tougher!"
It was her gut feeling. She couldn't explain why, but the Terror Burst Bear felt more threatening.
"Intuition, huh?"
Damien trusted Ogerpon's instincts. He looked down at the shattered spider beast. "It's an artificial construct, after all. Can't compare to a genuine C-rank beast."
Of course, part of it was that Ogerpon had grown stronger since then.
When they faced the Terror Burst Bear, her Magicule was around 7000.
Now, after a full week, it had climbed from 6500 to 8000.
Ogerpon hadn't held back on this journey.
Any monster or beast that could provide experience got a taste of her cudgel, whether it was worth it or not.
Damien treated it like Pokémon grinding.
For beasts, Ogerpon minimized damage, knocking them out quickly to meet the 'defeat' condition.
For monsters, as long as they surrendered, her Grower skill would absorb the corresponding Magicule.
Plus, Damien left food for the defeated.
Still new to his awakened memories, he wasn't yet comfortable with ruthless plundering.
He got experience, they got food.
A win-win!
"Ogerpon used this much magic for the Terror Burst Bear."
"And this much for the bug."
Ogerpon gestured with her short arms, though Damien couldn't quite follow.
"Basically, fighting the bug took way less magic."
Since arriving in the Cardinal World, Ogerpon had noticed her energy reserves had grown significantly.
Not just in quantity... her recovery speed had skyrocketed too.
Back in the Pokémonverse, a single battle would leave her needing a breather.
But now?
Ogerpon could handle dozens of those fights without breaking a sweat.
Higher Existence Value meant more Magicule, which scaled with magical power and stamina.
Coupled with her incredible recovery rate and unique Pokémon moves, Ogerpon's strength far exceeded a simple B-rank label.
Damien figured she could even hold her own against A-rank or A+-rank monsters.
"Alright."
Damien didn't dwell on it further.
Artificial monsters were too far removed from their current concerns.
Their priority now was burying this mangled spider beast to prevent it from polluting their land.
In Damien's memory, insectoid monsters often had ties to the spiritual world's insect tribes.
Over the next few days, while working, they faced three more waves of insectoid monster attacks.
Damien had no idea why this area had so many of them.
But Ogerpon wasn't one to back down.
Her Ivy Cudgel earned her the title of the Pokémonverse's mini-Kaido.
Having adapted to her Pokémon-based magic, she fought with increasing ease, often taking out enemies before they could even act.
"Is there a nest of insectoid monsters nearby?"
Damien watched as Ogerpon used roots to drag the remaining carcasses underground for burial.
He held a dagger, a pile of materials harvested from the three insectoid monsters beside him.
Despite the stench, Damien gritted his teeth and cleaned the materials, determined not to waste anything.
"Should we investigate?"
As he cleaned, Damien pondered. "No, it's just me and Ogerpon. Even if we found a nest, it'd take too much time and effort... not worth it."
With the camp mostly built, Damien decided to let it go.
His Planeswalker skill would be off cooldown in a few hours, by tomorrow at the latest, allowing him to cross worlds again.
The Planeswalker's travel ability had a cooldown period.
The length depended on how long Damien spent in the other world.
Last time, he stayed in the Pokémonverse for seven days, so the cooldown in the Cardinal World was also seven days.
This applied only after returning to the Cardinal World.
While in another world, Damien could return at any time to avoid insurmountable dangers.
"Might as well treat it as a monster spawn point."
For some reason, Damien thought having the occasional spider beast show up wasn't such a bad thing.
It saved them the trouble of hunting for monsters.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 9 9: [TP] 9: The Ogres
chapters.content:
Meanwhile, dozens of kilometers from Damien's chosen campsite, a small village of about three hundred inhabitants nestled within the forest.
The architecture leaned toward traditional wooden structures, with a distinct aesthetic.
The figures moving about were striking: men dressed as warriors, women in flowing garments, all towering in stature with horns protruding from their foreheads.
If Damien were here, he'd recognize this as the village of the Ogre Tribe, the same one destroyed by Falmuth's orc army in the original story.
The Ogre Tribe, a Majin race close to Majinkind, averaged B-rank strength, capable of leveling human villages single-handedly.
With a population of around three hundred, their collective power could easily fend off an A-rank monster's assault.
By human adventurer standards, they were a terrifying force capable of razing entire cities.
Yet, despite their fearsome appearance, the Ogre Tribe wasn't prone to destruction or slaughter.
On the contrary, though they loved a good fight, they upheld loyalty and honor, never targeting the weak or innocent.
They often worked as mercenaries, earning rewards from other monster tribes in the forest or humans outside, sustaining their village's growth.
Over centuries, the Ogre Tribe had become one of the three dominant powers in the Jura Forest.
To the south, the massive Orc Tribe, numbering in the hundreds of thousands.
To the north, the Lizardman Tribe, with over ten thousand members, each surpassing C-rank.
And in the west, the Ogre Tribe, only three hundred strong but with every adult wielding B-rank power.
These three forces kept each other in check, forming a delicate balance that maintained a superficial peace in the Jura Forest.
This equilibrium had held for a long time.
Human adventurers rarely ventured deep into the Jura Forest, and the Ogres avoided attacking neighboring nations or factions.
But recently, a swarm of mysterious insectoid monsters disrupted the peace in the forest's western region.
They slaughtered wild beasts and plundered resources vital to the monster tribes.
At first, the Ogres paid little mind.
The Jura Forest, steeped in Veldora's Magicule, could spawn all sorts of monsters and beasts... no one could predict what might emerge.
However, not long ago, a group of their tribesmen hunting in the forest was ambushed by hundreds of C-rank insectoid monsters, barely escaping with their lives.
If not for the young lord leading a rescue, the group would've been wiped out.
For the population-scarce Ogres, every member was precious.
Even so, two tribesmen perished in the attack.
One's body was dragged off by the insects, while the other succumbed shortly after being brought back to the village.
"We can't let this continue!!"
A burly, red-haired ogre addressed the elderly red ogre in the leader's seat. "Father, gather the village's warriors. Let's exterminate those disgusting bugs!"
This red-haired ogre was none other than the future Benimaru, who would later serve Rimuru and become the Tempest's marshal.
But for now, he, along with Shion, Shuna, Hakurou, Souei, and Kurobe, had yet to receive their names.
In the Cardinal World, most monsters lacked names.
Once named, a monster became a "Named Monster." gaining a massive boost in potential and life essence.
Unfortunately, the Ogre village currently had no Named Monsters.
After all, an ogre evolving into an Oni was a legend unseen for a millennium.
"What's your take, old man?"
The leader turned to the white-haired elder deep in thought beside him.
This battle-hardened, swordsmanship-master elder was revered by the entire tribe.
In truth, if he weren't so devoted to his swordsmanship, he would've been the tribe's leader.
"I've never seen such insectoid monsters in the Jura Forest. They don't seem native."
Unlike the spider-type insect Damien encountered, the Ogres and other forest tribes faced a variety of insectoids... mantis, centipede, beetle, butterfly... covering nearly every battlefield role, like living weapons.
"But I wonder, are these insects truly monsters?"
"By classification, they are indeed monsters." The red ogre leader said, equally puzzled. "But we tried communicating with them. It's impossible."
Beasts were unintelligent, driven by instinct, pure monsters.
Monsters, however, were sentient, with their own tribes, often capable of peaceful coexistence.
"No matter what, the young lord's idea is sound."
"These insectoid monsters keep appearing endlessly, so there must be a nest or stronghold."
"Only by finding and destroying it can we eliminate these dangerous creatures at their source."
Hakurou's proposal won the approval of the gathered Ogres.
The red ogre chief began organizing a team.
He assigned the future Benimaru to lead, including Shion, Souei, Shuna, and Hakurou himself, to search the forest for the insectoid nest and launch an attack to wipe out the mysterious threat.
Night fell, and Damien remained unaware of the insectoids' origins or the Ogre Tribe's preparations to hunt them.
After a full day's work, Damien and Ogerpon completed their first wooden cabin.
The cabin resembled a tent, standing one person tall with a triangular structure, spacious enough for both to live in and shield them from wind and rain.
A campfire burned in front of the cabin, with the two taking turns keeping watch to fend off potential beast or monster attacks.
This was temporary.
Once Planeswalker's cooldown ended, Damien planned to take Ogerpon to a new world.
If luck was on their side, they could find a place to rest and replenish supplies.
Ogerpon took the first half of the night, Damien the second, ensuring she'd have enough energy and focus to handle any trouble in the next world.
The campfire crackled, its faint glow flickering in the darkness.
Inside the wooden cabin, Damien felt the serene quiet of the night forest.
Ogerpon rested on his lap, her small body curled up, smacking her lips as if dreaming of delicious treats.
Despite being in the wild, she slept as if wrapped in the coziest blankets.
As long as she was by Damien's side, Ogerpon felt utterly secure.
'What a little foodie, drooling in her sleep.'
Wiping the saliva from her fangs, Damien gently stroked Ogerpon's hood-like body.
His hand brushed over the pointed horns on her head, part of her body rather than mere decoration.
Yet, her texture was surprisingly soft.
Even her supposedly sharp horns felt plush in his hands.
Like a caring brother, Damien watched over her until dawn, with no further insectoid attacks.
As the first light broke, a faint glow pierced the horizon.
In the hazy dawn, mist drifted like gossamer through the forest, soft light filtering through sparse treetops, dappling the damp ground where dewdrops gleamed silver on tender grass.
"Bo ne?"
Waking from her slumber, Ogerpon rubbed her sleepy eyes, instinctively searching for Damien.
The moment she saw him, the worry in her eyes melted away.
In its place was pure joy and trust.
"Damien, Damien, are we still building the house today?"
With yesterday's experience, Ogerpon had picked up some tricks for construction.
She was eager to tackle a bigger cabin, one spacious enough for both of them!
"Let's pause for now."
Damien patted her head, then led her to the stream for a quick wash. After a simple breakfast of mushroom stew and a few energy cubes, he announced the day's plan.
"I'm thinking of opening a gate to another world to scout it out."
Damien said, "If the new world's too primitive, we'll use our daily jump to go back to the Pokémonverse."
The Pokémonverse had advanced technology.
Damien could import tools and resources from there to quickly set up a proper camp.
He had no plans to capture more Pokémon for now.
Planeswalker couldn't bring others along unless they were his familliars.
With limited familliar slots, Damien wasn't ready to use his remaining two on Pokémon.
"But if we hit a dangerous world, we'll come right back."
"Mm, Ogerpon will protect Damien!"
"Then I'm counting on you, Ogerpon."
Stretching, Damien looked at Ogerpon, who was brimming with energy and raring to go. "Ready?"
"Bo ne!"
Ogerpon flexed in a bodybuilder pose, signaling she was pumped!
"Nice, full of spirit!"
With that, Damien activated his Planeswalker skill, now off cooldown.
"Let's go!"
A flicker of light, and the campsite was empty, save for the smoldering campfire, its smoke curling into the damp morning air.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 10 10: [TP] 10: Cheat
chapters.content:
When Damien opened his eyes, he found himself in an indescribable space.
The surroundings were pitch black, save for a small illuminated area before him, glowing with a deep, starry radiance.
"Bo ne?"
Ogerpon clung to Damien's hand, her small face etched with shock.
The little creature had no idea where they were.
What happened to the promised other world?
Why had they ended up in this dark, eerie place?
"Hold on, let me figure this out."
Damien was about to ponder where they were and what kind of world they'd entered.
But then, beams of light bloomed before his eyes.
"Bo ne!!"
The sudden glow startled Ogerpon, who swiftly summoned her Ivy Cudgel and positioned herself protectively in front of Damien.
Despite her shyness and fear of loneliness, Ogerpon was fearless when it mattered.
"Wait a second."
Damien steadied her, focusing on the scene ahead.
Before them appeared a chair, a small round table, and a spread of tea and pastries.
Seated in the chair was a blue-haired girl.
"Welcome to the afterlife. Though brief, this gentleman's life has come to an end."
She looked about fifteen or sixteen, breathtakingly beautiful, surpassing anything Damien could have imagined.
How to put it?
The moment he saw her, the word "goddess" flashed through his mind.
Yes, only a goddess could possess such otherworldly beauty.
Her clear, water-blue hair gave an ethereal, gentle impression.
Her perfectly proportioned body... neither too full nor too slight... was draped in a loose, pale purple garment, often called a hagoromo.
"Hm?"
Suddenly, the blue-haired girl, mid-recitation, seemed to notice something.
Her clear blue eyes, matching her hair, fixed on Damien and Ogerpon, who stood before him with her mouth agape, showing two tiny fangs in an adorably fierce expression.
"???"
For a moment, the girl locked eyes with them.
"Huh?"
"Huhhh?"
Gradually, the expression of the beautiful blue-haired girl shifted, as if she couldn't quite grasp the situation.
"…"
Damien and Ogerpon stayed still, not making any sudden moves.
Especially Damien, who felt an odd sense of déjà vu, as if he'd seen this scene before.
Blue hair, goddess-like beauty, and that outfit…
"Hold it!!"
Before Damien could ask, the scatterbrained goddess exclaimed, "Who are you people?!"
"Did the ascension mechanism break down?"
"And where did you two come from?"
"This is overtime! Overtime!"
"I protest! I firmly protest overtime!!"
Aqua had clearly noticed something unusual about Damien and Ogerpon.
As the goddess overseeing the afterlife for young souls, no matter how dim-witted, Aqua could tell they were still very much alive.
This felt more like an isekai scenario.
But reversed... people from another world had suddenly appeared in her space.
"Ahem, please calm down, great Water Goddess Aqua-sama."
"Eh?!"
Hearing Damien call her name, Aqua froze, then broke into a smug grin.
"Pfft, pfft, pfft."
The girl covered her mouth, barely containing her glee. "I don't know where you're from, but you've heard of the great Water Goddess Aqua!"
"No helping it, then! Fine, I'll graciously acknowledge you!!"
"…"
Aqua's reaction left Damien, who'd prepared a slew of persuasive arguments, feeling like an idiot.
Yes, he'd deliberately called her name.
His goal? To reach the Konosubaverse.
Its adventuring system and skill points were perfect for someone like him, who had Magicule and attributes but no combat skills.
But now…
"You want to go to another world to defeat the Demon King?"
Aqua plopped back into her chair, calmly opening a bag of chips and munching away in front of Damien and Ogerpon.
It was hard to believe someone with such a stunning, saintly face could act so rudely.
Even worse, with that dismissive attitude, why does she still look so beautiful?!
Damien didn't know where to begin with his complaints.
Thankfully, he'd already known what kind of goddess Aqua was.
So, sorry, Aqua!
No matter how gorgeous she was, Damien had no interest in getting involved with her.
Associating with a dimwit like her was a crime in itself.
And with Aqua's personality, who knew what chaos she'd cause if she tagged along?
"Ahem, yes."
Damien said, "My companion and I are traveling across worlds, facing strong opponents to grow stronger."
"Oh."
Aqua didn't think much of it... her empty head couldn't hold complex thoughts.
Conspiracies and schemes? Far less interesting than Damien's "great Water Goddess Aqua-sama."
Having heard her name, they must be her devotees.
And Aqua was quite lenient with her believers.
"Sure."
Aqua said, "Nobody wants to go to that world anyway. If you're willing to help, that's great."
"Then…"
Damien went for the kill. "Great, wise, beautiful, and noble Aqua-sama, could you grant us a small… perk?"
"Hmph!"
Aqua basked in his flattery, practically begging for more. Keep talking, you smooth talker!
"Normally, that's a no-go."
"But who am I? The great Goddess Aqua!"
"Behold! Accept with gratitude the blessing of the exalted Goddess Aqua!"
With a grand wave, parchments scattered around Damien like falling petals.
"Ohhh!!"
Damien exclaimed, "Truly worthy of Aqua-sama!"
This wasn't flattery anymore... it was genuine.
Handing out perks right off the bat? Aqua, you're a real one.
Sure, she was a bit dim, but when it came to treating others, she spared no expense.
In the original novel, Aqua's debts often came from splurging on feasts for entire guilds.
Even for an outsider like Damien, she was willing to bend the rules and grant a cheat ability.
For that generosity alone, Damien silently vowed: If I see Aqua and Kazuma struggling like in the original story, I'll lend you some gold coins, Aqua.
"Choose one."
"But only one."
Aqua pointed at Ogerpon. "Her life composition is unique, tied to you, so she can't receive a cheat."
In short, by Konosuba's rules, Ogerpon was Damien's summoned creature.
If that allowed extra cheats, Damien could summon a hundred skeletons and fleece the gods dry.
"Fair enough."
Damien was a bit disappointed, but rules were rules.
You can't be too greedy... scoring a free cheat from Aqua was already a win.
"By the way."
Flipping through the parchments would take too long, so Damien decided to ask directly. "Is there a cheat that lets you quickly learn skills?"
"Oh, that one."
Aqua, who often read comics and light novels in her downtime, instantly got it. "That one lets you copy skills from people you touch. The catch is, copied skills start at Level 1, and their effectiveness depends on your own attributes."
That was Konosuba's system.
Skill points could be spent on any learnable skill, and you could keep investing to level them up.
Take Megumin's Explosion magic... it required a ton of skill points to unlock.
Leveling it up demanded even more.
Megumin's Explosion was so powerful because she specialized, dumping all her points into it.
So, as Aqua explained, if Damien copied Megumin's Explosion, he'd get a Level 1 version.
And if his Magicule wasn't sufficient, he wouldn't even be able to cast it.
"So, that cheat's kinda meh."
Aqua said, "You still want it?"
"Hm…"
Damien didn't decide immediately, asking about other cheats he thought might suit him.
But they all had limitations or thresholds that didn't quite fit him and Ogerpon right now.
"Alright."
With no better options, Damien made his choice. "I'll take the skill-copying ability."
"So, uh…"
Aqua blinked. "What's your name again?"
"I'm Damien, and this is Ogerpon."
"Bo ne um!"
Ogerpon was utterly confused, her mind swirling with Who am I? Where am I? What am I doing here?
"Damien-san, and your familiar Ogerpon, you're about to head to another world as a reserve hero to defeat the Demon King. When you succeed, you'll receive a gift from the gods."
"You can have any wish granted, no matter what it is."
As Aqua chanted, a glowing magic circle appeared beneath Damien and Ogerpon, lifting them gently upward.
Damien didn't resist... this was the power of Konosuba's gods, far beyond his current ability to defy.
Ogerpon, ever obedient, stayed quietly in Damien's arms, not making a fuss.
"Hero! May you stand out among the reserve heroes and become the one to defeat the Demon King!"
"Now, set forth!"
Light enveloped Damien and Ogerpon, Aqua's voice echoing in their ears.
When the light faded, Damien found himself on a medieval European street.
Carriages clattered over cobblestones, and rows of red-brick houses lined the way. Beastmen with animal ears and elves with pointed ears mingled among the passersby. Without a doubt, this was Axel, the beginner town from Konosuba.
***
