chapters.title: Chapter 11 11: [TP] 11: Power Expression
chapters.content:
"Did it really go that smoothly?"
Damien was still a bit dazed. He'd hoped to gain more advantages in this new world.
But he hadn't expected things to go this well.
Setting aside the power level of Konosuba's world for now, its adventurer skill system and leveling mechanics were undeniably helpful for someone like Damien in his current state.
"Not bad, Aqua."
"Thanks a ton!"
Damien quickly examined the divine gift he'd received... the ability called "Copy."
[Damien]
[Race: Hybrid Majin-Human]
[Existence Value: 3505]
[Magic: Energy Cube Creation, Spirit Space, Appraisal]
[Intrinsic Skills: Adaptability]
[Unique Skills: Planeswalker [Exceptional] (Returnable), Leader, Capturer, Learner (Analyzes and copies abilities of others)]
[Familiars: Ogerpon]
[Marked Worlds: Pokémonverse, Konosubaverse]
"Learner!"
Seeing the description of "Learner" in his Unique Skills, Damien knew this trip was already worth it.
The Voice of the World from the Cardinal World didn't exist in Konosuba's world.
The two operated under different frameworks, unable to directly influence each other.
But!
Thanks to the exceptional nature of his Planeswalker skill, Damien acted like an anchor cast from the Cardinal World into Konosuba's.
Like a signal tower, he could interact with the Cardinal World's Voice of the World at any time.
This interaction didn't just apply to him.
It extended to familliars within a certain range, like Ogerpon.
So, the moment Damien gained the Copy ability, the Cardinal World analyzed and reclassified it.
The result? His Copy cheat vanished.
In its place was the powerful Unique Skill "Learner."
"Let's see the purity of this Unique Skill."
Damien focused on the word "Learner."
Soon, detailed information about the skill flooded his mind.
"Learner's replication isn't instant."
Damien mused, "It takes varying amounts of time to analyze an ability based on its strength."
"Only after the analysis is complete can I learn the skill and make it my own."
In theory, as long as the ability wasn't "Unique" or "Physiological." Damien could copy it.
"Unique" meant one-of-a-kind in the entire world.
"Physiological" referred to abilities requiring specific physical traits... like a tail, a third hand, or specialized organs.
However, if a physiological ability could be replicated with Magicule... like spider webbing made of magical energy rather than physical silk... Damien could mimic it with his own magic.
The exact limits of Learner were unclear since he'd only just acquired it.
"Gotta find some targets to test Learner's effects."
As Damien thought this, Ogerpon gently tugged at his hand.
"What's up, Ogerpon?"
"Where are we, Damien?"
Ogerpon had seen similar Western fantasy architecture before, back in the village at the forest's edge where Damien once lived.
But that rural village couldn't compare to the bustling beginner city of Axel.
Compared to Axel's vibrancy, that village was a backwater.
"This is the new world we're exploring next."
Damien patted Ogerpon's head, smiling. "Don't worry, I know a bit about this place. Just follow my lead."
"Mm-hm!"
Ogerpon was brimming with curiosity about this new world.
The dazzling market stalls and the varied attire of passersby left her starry-eyed, a sight for someone who hadn't seen much of the world.
"Now, let's think."
"First, we'll head to the Adventurer's Guild and register as adventurers."
Damien recalled Konosuba's plot, knowing that only by becoming an adventurer and getting a skill card could he fully integrate into this world.
With his Adaptability skill, Damien wasn't worried about being unable to access Konosuba's power system.
Ogerpon, however, might face some adjustment issues.
Without Adaptability to blend into this world, she'd still operate under the Cardinal World's rules.
As Damien had noted before, the Cardinal World's power level far exceeded most others.
While Konosuba's world had magical elements... its flora and fauna infused with magic, granting them supernatural strength and resilience... the magic concentration here paled compared to the Cardinal World.
By Chaos World standards, it was only medium-tier.
In simple terms, Ogerpon, a B-rank in the Cardinal World, would jump two major tiers in Konosuba, equivalent to Special A-rank.
Damien could do the same by disabling Adaptability, boosting his power to A-rank.
But that would cut him off from acquiring Konosuba's power system.
"By the way, Ogerpon, you need to control your strength in this world. Don't use more than B-rank Magicule."
"Huh?"
Ogerpon looked at Damien, puzzled, as he explained, "This trip is different from when we went to the Pokémonverse."
"There, I entered with my real body."
"This time, it's a bit different."
By slipping into Aqua's reincarnation process, Damien had exploited a loophole in Konosuba's rules, making the system treat him as a native.
In essence, his actions were like sneaking in under a false identity.
"I want to gain this world's powers."
"So we need to keep a low profile and avoid being rejected by its rules."
If Damien disabled Adaptability and stepped outside this world's framework, Konosuba's rules would blacklist him.
Worst case, he'd be expelled, unable to return.
At best, he'd lose the chance to harness Konosuba's system to strengthen the Cardinal World.
Neither outcome was acceptable.
"Bo ne!"
Ogerpon raised her hand. "Ogerpon gets it! Ogerpon will be careful!"
"You don't have to be too careful."
Damien smiled. "Just keep your power around B-rank, and it'll be fine."
"If we hit real danger, survival comes first."
"A world's just a world. There'll be other chances."
While staying cautious, Damien saw no harm in keeping things discreet.
"Ogerpon has a question!"
"Go ahead."
"Why B-rank?"
Ogerpon felt incredibly strong now and wasn't sure what Damien meant by B-rank in this context.
"Hm…"
"Let me explain simply."
Damien said, "It's about power expression. Can you follow, Ogerpon?"
"Power expression?"
"Exactly."
Damien elaborated, "Worlds differ. The Cardinal World is much stronger. A rock there might be tougher than steel here."
"In the Cardinal World, your normal attack could destroy a house."
"That's what we call B-rank power expression!"
"Now here's the question."
Damien pointed at the street beneath them. "If you went all out in this world, what kind of damage could you cause?"
Each tier of magic concentration marked a major power gap.
In Konosuba, Ogerpon was equivalent to a Special A-rank monster.
A Special A-rank's full strike?
"Everything here is so fragile."
Ogerpon wasn't dumb... her battle instincts were sharp, and she quickly judged, "One punch from Ogerpon could make the whole city collapse."
A Special A-rank's full attack could cause earthquake-level destruction to Axel.
That was Special A-rank power expression!
"Got it?"
Damien said, "In Konosuba, you need to keep your power expression the same as in the Cardinal World."
"So, Ogerpon's punch should only make a few-meter crater?"
"Exactly!"
Damien nodded. "That's the idea!"
If you're B-rank in the Cardinal World, you stick to B-rank expression in the new world.
Unlike his Pokémonverse trip, where Damien entered with his real body and didn't need to worry about power expression.
Back then, as an E-rank, he jumped three tiers in a lower Chaos World, reaching B-rank.
The Kitakami villagers stood no chance against a B-rank Damien... one punch per troublemaker!
"Worlds have memories. We can fool them once, but not twice with the same trick."
So, unless Ogerpon gained something like Adaptability, she'd need to match her Cardinal World power expression in other worlds.
"Ogerpon gets it!"
She wasn't the type of Pokémon to cause trouble for her master.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 12 12: [TP] 12: The Adventurer’s Guild
chapters.content:
"Excuse me, could you tell me where the Adventurer's Guild is?"
Damien stopped a passerby to ask for directions, and with their guidance, he and Ogerpon found the guild.
The Adventurer's Guild in the city was an imposing structure. Even before entering, Damien and Ogerpon caught the enticing aroma of food wafting from inside.
"Bo ne?"
Ogerpon sniffed. "It smells so good! Is this a restaurant?"
"The guild here doubles as a tavern. Adventurers can order meals inside." Damien explained as he pushed open the guild's doors.
Stepping inside, they were greeted by a grand hall large enough for a banquet, lined with neatly arranged long tables.
Though it wasn't mealtime yet, several adventurer parties were already gathered, drinking and boasting loudly.
The lively chatter filled the guild with a vibrant atmosphere.
"Ah, welcome!"
"If you're looking for work, head to the counter inside. If you're here to eat, there are plenty of open seats... feel free to sit anywhere."
As soon as they entered, a friendly waitress with short red hair approached them.
The arrival of new faces drew the attention of adventurers clad in armor, leather, and mage robes, their gazes settling on Damien and Ogerpon.
"What's that?"
"A monster?"
"Probably a familiar or something. It's kinda cute."
"Yeah, super cute."
"…"
Damien didn't mind... he looked entirely human, nothing noteworthy.
Ogerpon, however, was a bit of an eye-catcher.
The Konosubaverse didn't have Pokémon.
Here, monsters... aside from the Demon King's forces... lacked intelligence, functioning as pure beasts.
Familiars in this world were akin to summoned creatures.
Though some adventurers were summoners, none had ever seen a familiar like Ogerpon.
"Bo ne?"
Overwhelmed by the stares, Ogerpon shyly hid behind Damien.
Her reaction only drew more attention.
Especially from some of the prettier female adventurers, who instantly fell for the little girl-like Ogerpon.
But since they didn't know Damien, they hesitated to approach.
"Come on, Ogerpon."
Damien took her hand, ignoring the murmurs and curious looks.
The adventurers meant no harm... just curiosity.
Soon, Damien and Ogerpon crossed the hall to the counter.
Four staff members were at the counter, two of them women. Damien approached the one he recognized from the anime... a mature blonde woman.
"You two…"
The receptionist, Luna, curiously studied Damien and Ogerpon. "Er, I mean, sir, how can I assist you?"
Luna initially mistook Ogerpon for a human girl.
It was understandable... Ogerpon was barely over a meter tall, equivalent to a seven- or eight-year-old human child.
But up close, though adorable, Ogerpon clearly wasn't human, resembling a sentient monster instead.
Still, seeing how well-behaved she was, and given this was the adventurers' stronghold, Luna assumed she was Damien's familiar or summoned creature.
"I'd like to register as an adventurer."
"Oh, a newcomer? No problem at all."
Luna smiled. "For a 1000 Eris registration fee, you can undergo an attribute assessment."
"Registration fee…"
"Ahem."
Damien realized he didn't have this world's currency.
Unlike Kazuma and Aqua's frantic situation, he stayed calm and pulled a nugget of gold, mined from the Jura Forest, from his Spirit Space, placing it on the counter.
"We've come from far away and spent all our Eris on the journey. Can the guild accept gold for transactions?"
Gold was a precious metal in most worlds.
To prepare for situations like this, Damien had brought plenty of gold, minerals, and gems.
Of course, this gold nugget had been processed.
Damien had analyzed and reduced its Magicule concentration by several levels to match Konosuba's standards before offering it.
Otherwise, it'd just be "some unknown metal that looks like gold" in this world.
Different worlds, different physical rules.
Without processing, Damien wouldn't dare use it.
"Um, please wait a moment."
Luna was startled by the gold nugget. "I'll grab the testing equipment right away!"
Surprised or not, Luna didn't hesitate to do her job.
As Damien expected, the Adventurer's Guild was a jack-of-all-trades, even handling appraisals for gold and treasures.
"This…!"
But soon, Damien ran into trouble.
"Such a strong magical reaction!"
Luna stared at the testing device in shock, the curvy blonde receptionist exclaiming, "It's just gold, but it has more Magicule than a high-grade magic crystal!"
"Unbelievable!"
"Could this gold have come from a magic crystal mine?"
Not just Luna, but the gold shop owner called to appraise it was equally stunned.
"Er, well…"
Damien scratched his cheek awkwardly. Oops! Guess I didn't reduce the Magicule enough.
I thought I'd brought it down to a medium Chaos World level!
Apparently, even among medium Chaos Worlds, Magicule levels varied.
Konosuba's world was on the lower end of that spectrum.
"Can it be exchanged?"
"It can, it can."
The gold shop owner adjusted his glasses. "The question is, how do you want to exchange it?"
"What do you mean?"
"Do you want to trade it as gold or as a high-potency magic crystal?"
The owner had never seen anything like this.
Turning perfectly good gold into a magic crystal? Young people sure were creative.
"Ahem!"
Damien got it. "Which is worth more?"
"Magic crystal, obviously!"
"Alright, sell it as a magic crystal, please."
Soon, Damien exchanged the gold nugget for roughly 3 million Eris.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 13 13: [TP] 13: Class
chapters.content:
The initial 1000 Eris fee was waived by the Adventurer's Guild as a minor expense.
However, Damien paid another 1000 Eris for Ogerpon's appraisal.
"Huh?"
"An appraisal for this little one?"
Luna was puzzled but couldn't refuse since Damien was willing to pay.
She handed two cards to Damien and Ogerpon, then explained the essence of being an adventurer.
"Look here on the card... see the 'Level' section?"
Luna said, "As you both know, everything in this world contains a soul."
"Any being that consumes or kills another, ending its life, can absorb a fragment of that being's soul memory... what we call 'Experience Points.'"
"Normally, these Experience Points aren't visible." Luna continued. "But with this card, the Experience Points an adventurer absorbs are displayed, along with their corresponding level."
"This is the standard for measuring an adventurer's strength, and the number of foes defeated is recorded here too."
"As Experience Points accumulate, beings can experience sudden rapid growth at certain points, known as breaking through a level-up threshold."
In simple terms, leveling up brought benefits like skill points for learning new abilities and boosts to attributes.
"Ogerpon, do you feel anything?"
Damien glanced at his card, noticing its attribute values differed greatly from the Cardinal World's system.
Without a reference, he couldn't make sense of it.
As for Ogerpon…
Her card remained blank, showing no reaction even after she touched it.
"Hm?"
"Is the card broken?"
Luna was baffled, assuming it was a defective card.
But even after swapping it out, the new card stayed blank.
This shouldn't have been possible.
Even summoned creatures or otherworldly visitors should have their soul values detected and displayed due to Konosuba's rules.
Ogerpon's case, however, was beyond Luna's understanding.
"So strange. I've never seen this before."
"What exactly is this child?"
Ogerpon wasn't native to Konosuba... she hailed from the Cardinal World and the Pokémonverse.
To put it simply, she was cloaked in the Cardinal World's laws, which Konosuba's rules couldn't penetrate, treating her as an extension of Damien.
Because of this, if Ogerpon unleashed her full power, Konosuba's world would hold Damien accountable and expel them both.
"Maybe because she's my familiar." Damien offered.
"Even if she's a familiar, the card should still…"
Luna mumbled softly but didn't pry further into Damien's privacy. "May I see your card, sir?"
"Sure, here."
Luna took Damien's card and, sure enough, found a 'Familiar' entry listing Ogerpon.
While Ogerpon wasn't recognized independently, Damien was seen as a native by Konosuba's rules.
Through him, the world easily classified Ogerpon as his familiar.
The 'Familiar: Ogerpon' entry on his card was proof.
"It seems this little one is quite an extraordinary familiar."
Luna didn't dig deeper... prying into others' affairs was improper.
As a guild receptionist, she knew better than to overstep.
"Next, please fill out this form with your height, weight, age, and physical characteristics."
With Luna's help, Damien completed all the required information.
"Alright, that's done."
"Now, please touch this slate to determine your ability parameters."
Luna added, "Then, based on the values, you can choose your desired class."
"It's finally time."
Damien's two biggest goals in Konosuba were Aqua's cheat ability and its class system.
Though he already had the Learner skill, he still craved a class.
Classes provided attribute boosts.
The Cardinal World gave him Magicule, and Learner let him acquire skills.
But Magicule only affected Existence Value.
It didn't directly tie to physical attributes like strength or speed.
In the Cardinal World, aside from natural armor and skin, Majins relied on passive traits, not a system where higher levels meant greater physical prowess.
For that, Damien had to seek power in other worlds.
His first stop? Konosuba's class system!
"Your strength, vitality, magic, dexterity, and agility are all excellent."
Luna recommended, "With these attributes, you could go straight for advanced classes."
The C-rank attributes from the Cardinal World translated to elite status in Konosuba.
By advanced classes, Luna meant options like Crusader, Swordmaster, Archpriest, or Archwizard.
Damien didn't choose immediately, instead carefully questioning Luna about the details of each advanced class.
True to her professionalism, Luna patiently explained the pros, cons, and characteristics of each.
"You're sure about choosing Martial Artist?"
Luna cautioned, "To be blunt, Martial Artist's defense is weaker than Crusader's, and its attack isn't as strong as Swordmaster's."
"Yes."
Damien settled on the Martial Artist class, a physical melee profession.
He chose it because its level-up bonuses aligned with his current needs.
Vitality, strength, agility, dexterity…
Martial Artist's boosts weren't as high as other advanced classes in any single area, but they were balanced.
In Damien's plan, he could use his familliars like Ogerpon to raise his Existence Value, increasing his Magicule.
When activating the skill card earlier, he'd noticed something.
Every adventurer starts with accumulated initial Experience Points.
After all, a person reaching adulthood would've gained some experience.
Take Aqua in the original story... she had amassed tons of skill points upon becoming an adventurer.
Why? Her base level was already high.
Similarly, Damien's stored Experience Points totaled over 30,000... roughly ten times his Existence Value.
Converting Magicule to level up in Konosuba didn't deplete his Magicule.
It remained intact, effectively granting him an extra set of attributes and skills layered atop his Cardinal World stats.
Also, Konosuba's Experience Point system differed from traditional MMORPGs.
According to Luna, reaching Level 100 required about 1 million Experience Points.
While the max level was fixed, differences in starting points, class choices, learned skills, and growth potential meant the gap between Level 100 adventurers could be as vast as the difference between a human and a dog.
Leader boosts Magicule, Magicule converts to Experience Points, which raise Martial Artist levels for attribute gains.
Then, skill points can be spent on the most cost-effective skills.
Skills gained via Learner started at Level 1 and needed skill points to level up.
That's Konosuba's rules.
I wonder what'll happen when I bring these skills back.
But that wasn't Damien's main concern... he didn't choose Learner for Konosuba's skills.
Learner's true value lay in the worlds he'd visit later.
Copying Unique Skills from other worlds and making them his own... that was Learner's real potential.
"Please keep your skill card safe and choose your skills carefully. For quests, check the bulletin board for ones you like."
"Thanks, Miss Luna."
In their short interaction, Damien had already grown familiar with Luna.
He led Ogerpon away from the counter, pulling out his skill card to review the Martial Artist's available skills.
"Before spending points, I'll copy every skill I can."
With that in mind, Damien chose a long table, ordered some food, and, while eating with Ogerpon, used Appraisal to scan the adventurers in the hall.
[Defense], [Steal], [Haste], [Cross Slash], [One-Handed Sword Mastery], [Beginner Magic]…
A variety of skills, mostly low-level, but some advanced ones requiring many skill points were mixed in.
The only downside? This was Konosuba's beginner town, so adventurer levels were generally low.
"Hm?"
Suddenly, Damien noticed a figure in the guild, his gaze locking onto their profile:
[Name: Yunyun]
[Class: Archwizard]
[Skills: Advanced Magic, Intermediate Magic, Teleport, High-Speed Casting, Multi-Casting, Magic Amplification…]
"Advanced Magic?"
Konosuba's magic system wasn't like typical fireballs, healing spells, or wind blades.
It was more akin to Heroes of Might and Magic's Beginner Wisdom, Intermediate Wisdom, and Advanced Wisdom.
[Advanced Magic] required 30 skill points and the Archwizard class.
Once learned, it allowed the Archwizard to freely acquire powerful destructive spells.
Leveling up Advanced Magic increased the potency of those high-level spells.
In short, it was a one-trick pony that dominated.
Mages didn't need dozens of spells... just Advanced Magic and specialized practice in certain powerful spells.
This wasn't a game world. Casting the same fireball multiple times, or choosing when and at what angle, depended on the adventurer.
For Damien, this system was perfect!
No Archwizard class?
No problem!
Learner: I've got this!
Without hesitation, Damien copied every skill Yunyun possessed.
"Oh, if Yunyun's here, where's Megumin?"
He hadn't forgotten Konosuba's most powerful spell: Explosion.
Soon, he spotted a certain chuunibyou Crimson Majin little girl.
Learner: Copying… Complete!
Done!
Damien mentally high-fived himself, thinking this trip was a goldmine.
Dozens of classes, over 100 skills.
He even found another Martial Artist in the crowd and copied all their skills, saving himself tons of skill points.
No wonder it's Konosuba's beginner town... talent everywhere!
A new class, Martial Artist, plus a way to convert Magicule into Experience Points for base attribute boosts.
And Learner, the ultimate cheat skill.
"Now, which skills should I level up?"
"With over 30,000 Experience Points, I can hit Level 15."
Martial Artist was an advanced class, granting 15 base skill points plus 2 per level.
Basic classes had no bonus, intermediate classes gave 1 extra point, and advanced classes gave 2.
This created a clear gap between adventurers.
"45 skill points for leveling skills…"
Skills had a level cap, displayed as Lv1, Lv2, up to MAX, where they couldn't be upgraded further.
"With limited points, I need to spend them wisely."
Damien scanned his acquired skills, ignoring non-upgradable passives and focusing on percentage-based buffs.
Like the magic skill [High-Speed Casting].
[High-Speed Casting Lv1]: Reduces casting time by 10%.
Simple but brutal!
It didn't boost casting speed... it cut time directly.
A 10-second spell would take 9 seconds with this skill.
At Lv10, it'd be instant!
"This skill's a must."
Similar was [Multi-Casting].
[Multi-Casting Lv1]: Allows casting two spells simultaneously.
At Lv2, it'd allow three.
Seeing this, Damien could already imagine spamming Fireball (Intermediate Magic) with Multi-Casting, unleashing hundreds at once.
"Everything's gone so smoothly so far."
Damien had no plans to get involved in Konosuba's plot... he needed to grow quickly, and this world was too relaxed for that.
It was better suited for resupplying than power-leveling.
You say Konosuba has monsters to fight?
Damien's answer: Not enough!
The monster population here was too sparse.
In this world, eating food that granted high Experience Points was the best way to level up.
Killing monsters was more about solving problems or fulfilling quest contracts.
Even reaching Level 100 only required about 1 million Experience Points.
Converted to Magicule, that was roughly 100,000 or less.
The exact conversion would only be clear after Damien leveled up here and returned to the Cardinal World.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 14 14: [TP] 14: Wingman
chapters.content:
"Next…"
Damien turned his attention to the Martial Artist class skill list. "Let's see which skills suit me now."
The Martial Artist class was a hybrid of physical and magical abilities.
Unlike mages, who focused purely on ranged magic, Martial Artists used magic for support and self-enhancement.
This was quite similar to the magic swordsmen often seen in Western fantasy novels.
"Passive enhancement skills activate permanently once selected... nice, I'll take those."
"No need to invest in active skills for now."
Damien mused, "The Level 1 skills I copied from others are enough."
[Strength Enhancement Lv1]: Increases base Strength attribute by 15%
[Robust Vitality Lv1]: Increases max HP by 15%, boosts HP recovery speed by 50%
[Agility Lv1]: Increases base Agility attribute by 15%
…
Among the Martial Artist's skills, Damien favored those boosting strength, HP, agility, and recovery speed.
These skills tied to "base attributes."
Base attributes in Konosuba came from leveling up, with a cap at Level 100.
Of course, this was just Konosuba's level system.
Damien planned to visit other worlds to find more ways to convert Magicule into physical strength.
He theorized these skills didn't just boost Konosuba's attributes but enhanced his core self.
For example, if Konosuba's Level 100 granted 10,000 HP, maxing [Robust Vitality] would increase it by 1.5 times, to 25,000.
Other skills followed similar limits.
But!
If these skills enhanced Damien himself, not just the fixed 10,000 HP, then after amassing vitality across multiple worlds... say, 1,000,000 HP... maxed Robust Vitality would add 1,500,000.
This was a boost beyond Konosuba's class panel.
It applied permanently to Damien, not just a Level 100 Konosuba character.
"No hesitation needed!"
Damien decisively spent 9 skill points on "Vitality." upgrading it to [Robust Vitality LvMAX].
"Whoa!"
"This feeling! Hiss~~ It's something else."
In that moment, Damien felt a surge of vibrant life force coursing through him.
His body's recovery ability also skyrocketed.
In numbers, it was a 150% boost to base HP and a 500% increase in base recovery speed.
"What a domineering skill!"
Damien clearly felt the power of Robust Vitality.
Exclusive to the advanced Martial Artist class, other classes might have similar skills, but their numerical boosts wouldn't compare.
Among the many copied skills, one from the Crusader class caught Damien's attention.
[Life Link LvMAX]: Crusader exclusive skill. Bind to a teammate to share HP.
Simple and brutal.
Life Link meant shared HP.
The downside? Damage was calculated based on the one attacked.
A Crusader had higher defense than a squishy mage.
But if the mage was hit, the shared HP pool would take a big hit.
In other words, it was like giving the Crusader a weak point... attack the mage to bypass the knight's armor and defense.
The benefits, though, were clear.
It protected teammates, prevented sudden losses, and added extra HP.
"It seems like a weakness for the Crusader, but not really."
Mages typically stayed in the back, rarely taking hits.
The frontline Crusader, meanwhile, gained the mage's HP as a bonus.
With good team synergy, this skill was practically god-tier.
The front line wouldn't fall, so the back line stayed safe.
Even in emergencies, it prevented losing key damage dealers, boosting fault tolerance.
"Ogerpon."
Life Link immediately made Damien think of his trusty partner.
As his familliar, Ogerpon naturally qualified as a "teammate."
After explaining Life Link's effects, Ogerpon agreed without hesitation.
"This way, Ogerpon can protect Damien even better!"
Her mission was to keep Damien safe. If anything happened to him, she'd lose it.
Now, with this skill, she wouldn't have to worry about anyone sneak-attacking her Trainer.
[Link Complete. Target: Familiar 'Ogerpon']
Damien checked his skill card, noticing his HP hadn't increased.
Is it because Konosuba's system can't detect Ogerpon's attributes?
He considered the possibility but could feel a new connection between them.
The HP sharing from Life Link was active.
It just worked differently than he'd expected.
Damien didn't dwell on it.
Knowing they could protect each other was enough.
"Um…"
A mage girl in a witch hat, dressed lightly, cautiously eyed Ogerpon. "Can I… hold her?"
"Ogerpon?"
"Bo ne!"
Ogerpon could clearly sense others' intentions, good or bad.
She didn't mind the people here.
They seemed to like her.
"Bo ne bo ne!"
But Ogerpon had her own conditions.
"What's she saying?"
The mage girl stood nervously, both anxious and excited.
"Girls are fine, but men? No way... she'll attack."
Damien wasn't about to let his little buddy be touched by rough-looking guys.
"No problem!"
The mage girl patted her chest confidently. "We'll keep her safe and won't let any smelly guys near!"
"Alright, then it's fine."
"Bo ne!!"
Ogerpon raised her hand, her adorable demeanor instantly winning over the female adventurers.
"Eek!!"
Sure enough, the guild's girls had been watching Ogerpon for a while.
With Damien's introduction, they swarmed over.
In no time, Ogerpon became the guild's darling, showered with affection by the female adventurers.
***
Bonus Chapter:

500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 15 15: [TP] 15: Drinks
chapters.content:
"Hey, that's not very fair, buddy."
A burly, rough-looking man suddenly plopped down in front of Damien.
"Sorry." Damien said, unfazed. "My Ogerpon's so cute, I can't let just any guy touch her."
"Pretty bold for a newbie!"
The man wasn't interested in cute things... he was just here to greet the newcomer.
"Two mugs of fizz ale!"
"Your fizz ale, sir."
A waitress promptly set two mugs of fizz ale in front of the man and Damien.
The man slid one to Damien. "Welcome to the adventurer life!!"
As Damien expected, the guy meant no harm... just making introductions.
"Thanks."
Damien didn't refuse, choosing to embrace Konosuba's vibe.
In this world, he'd play the part of a rookie adventurer in the starter town, and bonding with the locals was clearly a must.
Plus, after a month of crossing worlds, he hadn't had a proper chat with anyone in ages.
Gulp, gulp, gulp~~
Damien downed the fizz ale in one go, slamming the empty mug on the table.
Thud!
"Ha! Refreshing!"
Wiping the foam from his lips, Damien thought, No wonder Aqua loves this stuff... it's damn good.
"Not bad, right?"
The bald, burly adventurer grinned. "That's Axel's signature fizz ale!"
"Really hits the spot."
As Damien spoke, other male adventurers crowded around, introducing themselves.
Axel's adventurer circle was tight-knit.
Everyone pretty much knew each other.
When a newbie joined, they'd make a point to connect... same as with Aqua and Kazuma in the original story.
"Miss Luna!"
After being offered a third mug of fizz ale, Damien couldn't sit still.
He knew what these old-timers were up to.
They'd seen him score 3 million Eris and wanted him to foot the bill for drinks.
But Damien didn't care!
He was a guy, after all.
Why sweat the small stuff?
Besides, those Eris were pocket change to him.
If he wanted, he could pull out a hundred, a thousand more magic-infused gold nuggets.
"Fizz ale's on me today... drink up!"
Damien tossed out a few more diluted-magic gold nuggets. "The drinks are on me! I'm paying!!!"
"Woooo!!!"
"Long live the newbie!!"
"Damien! Damien! Damien!!"
"Hahaha~~"
Caught up in the guild's rowdy energy, Damien joined the boisterous adventurers, drinking and joking.
Money flowed like water, but the stress from a month of crossing worlds melted away just as fast.
"No… no more… I'm done…"
"I'm… at my limit…"
Burp~~
The guild was littered with sprawled-out adventurers, but Damien stood tall, downing his final sip of fizz ale.
"Hmph."
Tossing his wooden mug onto a towering pile, he scanned the room with a smug smirk. "A bunch of lightweights, huh? That's it?!"
Sadly, the bald guy who'd started it all was already passed out.
Otherwise, he'd probably have said, "Sorry, Damien-sama, for not keeping up."
"Bo ne~~"
With the chaos subsiding, Ogerpon hopped over from the crowd of girls.
She was thrilled.
The ladies here weren't just pretty... they were kind and had ordered her tons of food.
Energy Cubes were tasty, but nothing beat the satisfaction of chowing down on meat.
As a Grass-type Pokémon, Ogerpon could survive on water and sunlight alone.
But she could also eat meat or even digest plant fibers to get by.
"Full yet?" Damien asked. "If not, we can order more."
"Ogerpon's stuffed."
She patted her rounded belly, beaming with satisfaction. "Everyone gave Ogerpon so much yummy food. Ogerpon likes them!"
"Good to hear."
Damien was glad Ogerpon was enjoying this world.
When he took her from the Pokémonverse, he'd promised they'd see countless amazing sights together.
The Cardinal World's forest adventures aside, Axel's beginner town had brought her plenty of joy.
"Miss Luna."
Before leaving the guild, Damien settled the tab with Luna. "After the fizz ale costs, I've got 2.4 million Eris left."
"Mm."
"Keep the change. Get some tasty treats for the lovely ladies here."
"And for you too, Miss Luna."
Damien waved to the crowd. "Today's on me, everyone! Eat and drink to your heart's content... no need to hold back!"
A second batch of gold nuggets had netted him 4 million Eris.
After covering the drinks, 2.4 million remained... more than enough to treat the guild's girls.
"Consider it my hello gift."
Damien said, "See you next time, Miss Luna, and everyone!"
"Bye-bye, Ogerpon~~"
"Thanks for the treat, handsome!"
"Catch ya later~~"
Generous and good-looking, Damien wasn't like Kazuma. In no time, he'd won over nearly every adventurer in the guild.
"Let's go, Ogerpon."
"Bo ne!"
Leaving the Adventurer's Guild, Ogerpon and Damien stepped back onto the streets. She curiously asked about their next move.
"We'll stock up on supplies here, then head out."
Damien didn't plan to linger in Konosuba's world. He needed Ogerpon to defeat monsters to boost her Magicule.
Space bags, lumber, stone, spices, vegetable monsters, fruit monsters, various meats, and daily necessities…
It took half a day, until nightfall, for Damien to finish his massive shopping spree.
The original 3 million Eris dwindled to 500,000, showing that Eris didn't stretch as far as he'd thought.
"Please send two meal sets to our room, thanks."
Back at the inn, Damien ordered food from the front desk, then flopped onto the soft bed, letting out a long breath.
"Tired, Ogerpon?"
"Nope."
Ogerpon was a bit weary but tried not to show it. "Ogerpon can keep going!"
"No need to push yourself."
Damien gently stroked her head, pulling her into a hug.
"Bo ne~~"
Ogerpon wasn't actually tired.
As long as she was with Damien, she was happy no matter what they did.
"Rest well tonight. Tomorrow, we'll take on some extermination quests."
"Time to fight?"
Ogerpon perked up, eager. "Ogerpon will do her best!"
"Whoa, hold on!" Damien exclaimed. "Your punches are already scary enough. Any harder, and you'll blow Axel to bits."
"Bo ne?"
"Ease up, use just a little strength."
"Okay…"
Ogerpon listened to Damien. Whatever he said, she'd follow.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC
***

chapters.title: Chapter 16 16: [TP] 16: Aqua’s Devourer
chapters.content:
"Hey, Damien, my man!"
"Here to pick up a quest, Damien?"
"Morning, Ogerpon!"
"Bo ne!"
Damien and Ogerpon exchanged greetings with the crowd as they approached the quest bulletin board.
After yesterday's events, the guild had fully accepted them both.
"Mr. Damien, looking to take on a quest?" Luna asked, approaching.
"Yeah." Damien replied, glancing at her. "Got any recommendations?"
"For new adventurers, how about this? Giant Toad Extermination."
Giant Toad Extermination.
Yes, the same toads from the anime's opening where Aqua and Kazuma took on the quest and nearly got swallowed.
"Sounds good."
Damien nodded, accepting the quest under Luna's guidance.
The god-slaying toads that repeatedly swallowed the Water Goddess Aqua.
Let's see what you're made of.
Damien was intrigued by the toads that made Aqua say, "Up close, frogs are kinda cute, huh?"
Thud! Thud! Thud!
On a lush green hillside, Damien and Ogerpon stood at a vantage point, gazing at the giant toads hopping in the distance.
Every breeding season, these toads multiplied rapidly, wreaking havoc on nearby towns and troubling residents.
"Appraisal!"
Damien didn't act immediately, instead using his Appraisal skill on the giant toads.
[Giant Toad]
Level: 5
Attributes: [Omitted]
Inherent Abilities: Slippery Body (Damage Reduction), Succulent Flesh
"Strange inherent abilities."
Damien didn't know how to comment on "Succulent Flesh." "But Level 5? Not exactly strong."
Rather than the toads being weak, it was more that Kazuma and Aqua in the original story were just that pathetic.
"Ogerpon, remember what I told you about controlling your strength."
"Let's use these toads for a power regulation test."
"And then…"
Damien scanned the area. "Take out that blue one over there."
"That one?" Ogerpon asked.
"Yeah, that's the one!"
Damien pointed at a blue toad flirting with a pink and a yellow toad. "Strutting around like that, acting all cocky... I've had enough of it!"
"Get it!!"
"Bo ne!!"
Ogerpon obeyed without hesitation, leaping into action.
She was lightning-fast, darting from the hillside to the hopping blue toad in a blink.
"Ribbit?"
The blue toad seemed to notice something approaching.
It lowered its head, its nearly ten-meter-tall body looming over Ogerpon like a mountain of flesh.
"Ivy Cudgel!!"
Unlike the clueless toad, Ogerpon didn't wait for it to react. She summoned her Ivy Cudgel and swung at its belly.
Boom!
As the cudgel struck, a storm of blue fluorescence erupted, distorting the air and ground in an instant.
A deafening explosion, like dozens of bombs detonating at once, sent a terrifying force surging into the toad's body.
"Ribbit?"
Splat!
With a pained croak, the giant toad's body burst like a popped balloon.
In the next moment, its flesh and blood sprayed, coating Ogerpon and painting the cracked ground a vivid red.
But that wasn't the end.
The shockwave from Ogerpon's strike flattened the hill beneath the toad.
Caught in the collateral damage were the innocent pink and yellow toads, obliterated alongside their blue paramour before they could even react.
"I…"
"Hiss~~"
Damien stared, dumbstruck, sucking in a sharp breath.
He hadn't expected Ogerpon's first attack in this world to be this destructive.
Ogerpon herself was just as stunned.
"Bo ne…"
She felt sticky all over. The giant toad was now a pile of gore.
The scene sent shivers down both their spines.
Ogerpon's swing was like a needle popping a water-filled balloon... no difference at all.
"You okay, Ogerpon?"
Damien rushed to her side, summoning water elements to clean the blood off her.
"Ogerpon's not hurt."
"But… is this okay?"
Ogerpon worried she'd ruined Damien's experiment. She hadn't expected the toad to be so fragile despite its size.
It couldn't be helped.
As a B-rank in the Cardinal World, Ogerpon's power in Konosuba scaled to A-rank destruction.
Special A-rank... what did that mean?
In the original Tensura story, after being named, Benimaru, Shion, and Shuna evolved from B-rank Ogres to A-rank Oni.
During the war with the Orc army, Shion's casual downward slash could carve a hundred-meter-deep chasm.
Benimaru's Black Flame Prison could slaughter hundreds of Orcs in one go.
With the same power expression, Ogerpon's single cudgel strike obliterating a Level 5 toad and the hill beneath it was par for the course.
And this was with her holding back.
If she went all out, she could probably reduce a dozens-meter-high hill to rubble.
"Special A-rank monsters are terrifying!"
After seeing Ogerpon's display, Damien decided she couldn't unleash her power freely in Konosuba.
He checked his skill card, noting a 2-point increase in Experience Points.
This confirmed something.
Monsters defeated by Ogerpon still counted toward Damien's Experience Points.
Made sense... summoners didn't have to let their summons weaken enemies and then finish them off themselves, right?
"Take a break, Ogerpon."
Damien had her stay on guard while he stretched and picked his own target.
The Giant Toad Extermination quest required five kills.
But more was always better.
Damien didn't want to waste time on low-level quests. His real goal was to calculate the conversion ratio between Konosuba's Experience Points and the Cardinal World's Magicule.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 17 17: [TP] 17: This Invincible Body!
chapters.content:
"I've chosen you."
Selecting a pink giant toad, Damien exerted force under his feet, and his entire body shot out like an arrow released from a bow.
"Take this!!"
Descending from above, Damien crashed down like a meteor, delivering a flying kick to the pink giant toad.
Smack!
A familiar scene unfolded before Damien's eyes once again.
As his foot connected with the toad's head, he felt no resistance whatsoever, his entire body piercing through the creature as if diving into water.
Boom!
The ground shattered, countless rocks flying in all directions. Damien stood at the center of a massive crater, drenched in blood, his clothes stained with sticky chunks of flesh and innards.
Behind him lay the obliterated remains of the giant toad.
"What's going on?"
Feeling the slimy sensation on his body, Damien shuddered. "I didn't even use magic. Is my physical body really this strong?"
"No, that's not right."
Damien glanced at his status panel, focusing on the new skills, particularly the passive ones.
Ignoring the magic-based passives for now, the physical ones... Lancer, Knight, Swordsman, Crusader, Dragon Knight, Martial Artist, Fighter, Thief... combined, even at just level 1, provided over a 100% boost.
And that 100% was on top of Damien having converted all his magicules into experience points to enhance his body.
"A body reinforced by magicules as the foundation."
"Add to that the class passives and the Martial Artist's enhancements, and my attributes have been boosted by at least 300%."
With such physical enhancements, Damien's body, already at an A-rank level, was practically indistinguishable from a Special A-rank.
In the Cardinal World, existence value didn't always correlate directly with combat strength.
The Storm Dragon, with its 80 million existence value, wasn't necessarily stronger than an True Demon Lord.
But Damien was different now.
With magicules fused into his flesh and blood, he had already surpassed nearly all monsters.
"Alright."
"I underestimated my own strength."
Damien cast a water-element spell to clean himself, finally feeling a bit more at ease.
"Bo-ne?"
"I'm fine."
Like Ogerpon, Damien was in a sorry state, but as their eyes met, they burst into laughter in unison.
"Alright, just a bit longer, and we'll head back for a bath."
Damien didn't return immediately, instead continuing to hunt giant toads.
This time, he was less reckless, using the basic Fireball spell to attack nearby toads from a distance.
After slaying his 50th giant toad, Damien finally heard the sound of his magicule value increasing.
"Fifty toads, each giving 2 experience points, that's 100 points."
At level 15, fighting level 5 monsters naturally came with an experience penalty, so he only gained 2 points per toad.
But what truly shocked Damien wasn't this... it was the conversion rate between experience points and magicules.
Magicules converted to experience points at a 1:10 ratio.
But the reverse, experience points to magicules, was a staggering 100:1.
This massive disparity left Damien dumbfounded.
"Why?"
He pondered for a long time before arriving at a possible explanation: "The experience points in the Konosubaverse are low-tier energy. Converting low-tier to high-tier energy naturally comes with a huge ratio."
"The earlier conversion of magicules to experience points likely faced some kind of interference."
It was like a bad signal reception... magicules suffered some loss during the conversion process.
"If that's the case, then experience points aren't as cost-effective as I thought."
"Even if I reached max level, that's only 1 million experience points."
"Converted, that's just 10,000 magicules."
To reach max level in the Konosubaverse, Damien couldn't even imagine how many monsters he'd need to defeat or how much experience-rich food he'd have to consume.
"Whatever, even if it's only 10,000, it's still magicules."
"It's better than nothing."
Damien shook his head, pushing aside his swirling thoughts, and called to Ogerpon, "Let's go, we're heading back."
Boom!!
Halfway back, a dazzling beam of light descended from the sky, landing not far from Axel City.
"What's that?"
The familiar sight sparked a realization in Damien, "Could it be that Advocate of Gender Equality and the Useless Goddess get Isekai'd?"
His thoughts on Kazuma...
How to put it?
Pretty bizarre.
Damien didn't dislike him.
For a guy with no cheat powers, dragging along a bunch of problematic teammates and still managing to defeat the Demon King?
Honestly, that was pretty impressive.
Of course, Damien had no intention of interacting with the original Konosuba crew.
His sole focus was on getting stronger.
He had no time to waste on Konosuba's comedic daily antics.
"Let Aqua and Kazuma toil at the construction site for half a month first."
"This way, Ogerpon."
Without hesitation, Damien grabbed Ogerpon and headed in the opposite direction of Aqua and Kazuma.
Getting tangled up with those two now? Damien was genuinely worried he'd get dragged into their mess.
Especially Aqua...
Even with the gratitude for his original cheat, Damien didn't dare get too close to her.
The two returned to the inn, where they took a bath.
The townsfolk along the way didn't pay much attention to their blood-soaked, disheveled appearance.
Adventurers, after all, were expected to look rough.
Unbeknownst to them, across the stream, a blonde girl clad in Crusader armor was trembling with flushed cheeks, utterly shocked by the scene.
Huff~ Huff~
The girl named Darkness clenched her fists tightly. "That man, he doesn't even spare his own familiar!"
"Gufufufu~~"
Hiss!!
Suddenly, Damien, on his way to the inn, shivered.
"Bo-ne?"
"It's nothing."
Damien scratched his head, puzzled. "For some reason, I feel like something creepy is watching me."
"A ghost?"
"No idea."
Damien glanced around but found nothing amiss.
He didn't bother using any detection skills... it wasn't necessary.
In a place like Axel, nothing could harm them.
"No need to worry about it."
"If someone dares to make a move against us." Damien scoffed, "I'll show them the true might of one-shotting a giant toad!"
***

chapters.title: Chapter 18 18: [TP] 18: Cardinal World
chapters.content:
"Where are they?"
"Those two adventurers I saw yesterday!"
The next day, the blonde girl named Darkness entered the Adventurer's Guild.
She glanced around, hoping to spot Damien and Ogerpon from the previous evening, but after a thorough search, she found no trace of them.
"Not here?"
"Are they out on a quest?"
With this thought, Darkness approached Luna, inquiring about Damien.
Asking about adventurers wasn't considered rude in the Konosubaverse.
As the saying goes, this place wasn't full of scheming and intrigue.
"You're talking about Mr. Damien and his familiar, Ogerpon, right?" Luna asked.
"Damien? Damien.. yes Damien."
Darkness repeated Damien's name a few times before continuing, "I want to join their party. Could you keep an eye out for Mr. Damien's whereabouts?"
"Sure, I can do that, but wouldn't posting a notice be faster?"
"I'll post a notice too."
The mere thought of Damien and Ogerpon's sticky, disheveled state sent shivers through Darkness's body.
The girl unconsciously pressed her thighs together, her fair face flushing with strange fantasies.
"Uh…"
Seeing Darkness's odd reaction, Luna hesitated, unsure whether to pass this information to Damien.
"Alright." Luna said. "Next time I see Mr. Damien, I'll let him know."
However, neither Luna nor Darkness knew that Damien had already left the Konosubaverse.
Whether to accept Darkness, the masochistic Crusader, into his party was a decision Damien would have to make upon his return.
Cardinal World
"Bo-ne!"
Two figures appeared on a grassy hill... Damien and Ogerpon, freshly returned from the Konosubaverse.
[New information acquired, initiating analysis…]
[Analysis complete]
[Acquired Intrinsic Skills: Melee Mastery, All-Weapon Mastery, All-Class Mastery]
[Acquired Special Skill: Magicule Solidification]
[Acquired New Magic: Explosion Magic, Advanced Magic, Elemental Magic, Healing Arts…]
[Magic integration complete, acquired Class: Mage]
[Detected Divine Blessing, initiating appraisal…]
[Appraisal complete]
[Acquired Unique Skill: Learner]
"I'm back." Damien muttered, opening his status panel.
[Damien]
[Race: Hybrid Majin-Human]
[Existence Value: 4015 EP]
[Magic: Energy Cube Creation, Pokémon Space, Appraisal, Explosion Magic, Advanced Magic, Advanced Healing Arts, etc.]
[Class: Mage (can directly construct magic using magical power)]
[Special Skill: Magicule Solidification (can convert magicules into spirit and flesh for storage)]
[Intrinsic Skills: Adaptability, Melee Mastery, All-Weapon Mastery, All-Class Mastery, etc.]
[Unique Skills: Planeswalker [Exceptional], Leader, Capturer, Learner (can acquire others' Common Skills and intrinsic abilities)]
[Familiar: Ogerpon (8031 EP, B-rank)]
[Marked Worlds: Pokémonverse, Konosubaverse]
"The Mage class must be the result of integrating all the Konosuba magic." Damien mused.
"My intrinsic abilities now include a bunch of mastery-level melee skills."
On top of that, he had gained a Unique Skill called Learner.
'Can acquire others' Common Skills and intrinsic abilities.'
In the Cardinal World, skills were divided into four tiers: Intrinsic Skills, Common Skills, Extra Skills, and Unique Skills.
Above those were Ultimate Skills, which only True Demon Lords could awaken.
"According to this world's rules, only those with special souls can acquire Unique Skills."
In the original story, a character named Shogo, summoned from another world, gained a Unique Skill by sacrificing a girl named Seiki's soul.
A single otherworldly soul was needed to obtain one Unique Skill.
That showed just how rare Unique Skills were.
Even Rimuru, at the start, only had Great Sage and Predator as Unique Skills.
"This trip to the Konosubaverse was a huge haul."
In just one day, Damien had reaped such rewards, further proving the immense power of his Exceptional-grade Planeswalker ability.
As Damien immersed himself in the changes to his status panel, Ogerpon's alarmed cry interrupted his thoughts.
"Damien!!"
"Hm?"
Following Ogerpon's gaze, Damien's pupils narrowed. "What's that?"
"Our camp!!"
The sight before them was one of devastation. The camp, which should have had its basic structures completed, was reduced to ruins, leaving Ogerpon... who had no idea what happened... stunned.
"Who did this?"
Ogerpon was furious.
The camp might have been simple, but it was built bit by bit by Damien.
It was their blood and sweat.
"Those jerks who trashed Damien's hard work…"
Ogerpon wanted nothing more than to summon its thorny vine club and give the culprits a good thrashing.
"Calm down."
Damien soothed the enraged Ogerpon, and the two cautiously approached to investigate.
"These tracks… they look like they were left by some kind of giant insect."
Damien crouched down, noticing footprints in the dirt. "Did that bug monster's buddies come looking for us?"
Sure enough, the air still carried the faint stench of those insect monsters.
No mistake... it was them.
"Damn it!"
"Ogerpon hates big bugs!"
Ogerpon felt frustrated, but more than that, it was heartbroken over the camp they had worked so hard to build.
"It's alright, don't be mad."
Damien smiled, patting the little creature's head to comfort it. "At least we avoided the bug monsters' attack, right?"
"Besides, this is a wake-up call."
Damien continued, "This place isn't safe."
"What do we do?"
"We either find a new spot for our camp." Damien said, "or we track down those bugs' nest and wipe them out at the source!"
No one threatens our home and gets away with it.
If the neighbors were intelligent Majins capable of communication, Damien, not being bloodthirsty, would have been happy to talk and coexist peacefully.
But these bug monsters? Forget whether they had brains... they clearly had no intention of negotiating with Damien.
From the start, the multi-legged spider monsters saw Damien and Ogerpon as food.
The subsequent attacks were the same, all aimed at devouring them.
If that was the case, Damien wouldn't hold back.
Either he didn't act, or he acted decisively, wiping them out to the last!
***

chapters.title: Chapter 19 19: [TP] 19: Peril
chapters.content:
"What should we do, Ogerpon?"
"Um…"
Ogerpon replied, "Ogerpon will listen to Damien."
Ogerpon knew she wasn't the brightest, and that was fine.
Like a Pokémon, following the trainer's lead was nothing to be ashamed of.
"If it were up to me, I'd play it cautious."
Damien was just thinking aloud; he didn't actually expect Ogerpon, the little goof, to have any grand insights.
"Cautious?"
"Yeah." Damien nodded. "The camp's destruction makes me just as angry. I want to charge in and wipe out those disgusting bugs."
"But we don't know their numbers or the strength of their strongest fighters."
"Rushing in blindly isn't wise."
Hearing this, Ogerpon felt a pang of guilt. "If only Ogerpon were stronger."
That way, Damien wouldn't have to hold back.
They were the ones being targeted, yet they had to swallow their anger.
"You're already plenty strong." Damien said sincerely. With Ogerpon's B-rank evaluation, she could take on A-rank monsters and hold her own.
In the Jura Forest, that put her firmly at the top of the food chain.
Only A-rank monsters with a Disaster rating could make Ogerpon think twice.
"Here's the plan." Damien decided. "No matter what, we need to find the source of these bug monsters and pinpoint their nest's location and distance from us."
Whether they were relocating to a new base or preparing to counter the bugs' attacks, knowing the target's location was critical.
Plus, Damien had his eyes on these bug monsters.
Before Ogerpon could evolve into a Demon Lord Seed, her Unique Skill Grower required a large number of monsters to fuel its accelerated growth.
Defeating or slaying them would help Ogerpon level up quickly.
"I don't know how many bugs there are, but there's definitely a lot."
"If we can take them all out, Ogerpon's existence value might break past 10,000, reaching A-rank."
With an A-rank Ogerpon by his side, Damien's safety in the Jura Forest would be secured.
It would also give him more options when traveling to other worlds.
So, Damien shared his plan with Ogerpon. "In simple terms, we find their nest first, then assess their strength."
"If we can take them, we go all in and turn those bugs into experience points for you, Ogerpon!"
"If we can't, we pull back."
As the saying goes, as long as you live, there's always another chance.
It's not cowardice... it's a strategic retreat.
"Once you hit A-rank, Ogerpon, we'll come back." Damien added, "and crush them!"
"Yeah!" Ogerpon wasn't afraid of a fight. "Ogerpon will follow Damien's lead!"
"Haha." Damien chuckled, patting Ogerpon's small head before crouching down to activate the Ranger class skill Tracking.
In an instant, magicules rippled outward from Damien, spreading in all directions.
Trees, bushes, rocks…
A flood of information filled Damien's mind.
He felt immersed in a grayscale world, his senses carpet-searching for traces of anything and everything.
"Got it."
Three minutes later, processing the skill's feedback, Damien opened his eyes.
His expression was odd.
"What's wrong, Damien?"
"There's a group of presences heading toward the bug nest."
As he spoke, Damien cast several spells.
[Stealth]
[Presence Concealment]
[Trace Erasure]
Three Konosuba Hunter skills activated in succession, and Damien signaled to Ogerpon. "Let's go check it out."
"Bo-ne!"
With their presences hidden, Damien and Ogerpon followed the bug monsters' tracks.
They traveled for about half an hour.
At their speed, they covered over 200 kilometers.
"Damien, it's the bugs' stench."
Ogerpon's nose twitched. "And another smell I don't recognize... some kind of monster."
Bang!
Boom!
Skreee~~
Damien's sense of smell wasn't as sharp as Ogerpon's, but he could hear the sounds of combat ahead.
"The bugs are fighting someone."
"Looks like we're not the only ones in the forest being targeted by these insects!"
Without revealing themselves, Damien remained cautious.
Ogerpon, meanwhile, displayed the stealth skills she honed on Oni Mountain.
The two silently climbed into the treetops, using the foliage as cover to observe the fierce clash in the distance.
They saw over thirty tall, humanoid creatures with muscular builds, horns on their foreheads, and skin in shades of purple, red, and blue... unlike any human.
"The Ogre Tribe?"
Almost instantly, Damien recognized these humanoid monsters.
The creatures battling the bugs were none other than the B-rank Ogre Tribe, native to the depths of the Jura Forest.
His gaze fell on a red-skinned ogre wielding a blade and a purple-skinned, one-horned female ogre brandishing a long sword.
"Benimaru and Shion?"
Their appearances differed slightly from the anime Damien knew, but they were similar enough.
That made sense.
They hadn't yet been named by Rimuru, so they retained their ogre forms.
Plus, transitioning from 2D to 3D naturally altered their look.
"The ones fighting the bugs are the Ogre Tribe."
Noticing the scattered, broken bodies of ogres on the ground, Damien quickly pieced together the situation. "The bugs must have attacked their village, so the ogres sent a team to find the nest, and now they're clashing."
"But…" Damien frowned. "Was this in the original story?"
"Or did my presence cause a butterfly effect?"
He wasn't sure which it was.
Not dwelling on it, he focused on the current situation.
"There are at least 500 bugs down there."
"Over 300 C-rank monsters, more than 100 C+-rank, and a few dozen B--rank."
Seeing the dozen or so mangled ogre corpses, it was clear the ogres were losing this fight.
"With so many bugs ganging up on forty ogres, no wonder they're taking such heavy losses."
Damien considered intervening, perhaps forging a connection with the Ogre Tribe.
He glanced at Ogerpon, weighing whether to let her join the fray.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 20 20: [TP] 20: Shuna and Shion
chapters.content:
Boom!
As more bug monsters swarmed from the distance, Damien hesitated.
Sure, these were characters from the anime, and the Ogre Tribe was known for its bold, straightforward nature. Saving them would likely bring more benefits than drawbacks.
But letting Ogerpon jump into the fray... would that be too risky?
"Bo-ne!"
Suddenly, Damien felt a tug at his sleeve. Looking down, he saw Ogerpon's eyes burning with determination.
"You want to fight, Ogerpon?"
"Bo-ne!"
Ogerpon sensed a kindred spirit in the Ogre Tribe.
"Kindred?"
"I see."
Damien understood. After being transformed in the Cardinal World, Ogerpon had become a Elemental Spirit, likely a variant of the Ogre Tribe.
Finding others with a similar aura, the little creature naturally wanted to help.
"Alright."
Damien quickly devised a plan. "Don't get bogged down in the fight. Get them out of the encirclement as fast as you can. I'll provide support from the rear."
"Bo-ne!"
Ogerpon nodded vigorously, then darted out from the tree.
Meanwhile, the Ogre Tribe, trapped in the bugs' encirclement, was in dire straits.
"Damn it!"
"These disgusting bugs must have something commanding them from behind!"
The red-haired ogre, Benimaru, cleaved a centipede-like bug's head with his blade and swiftly retreated to his comrades before it could thrash wildly.
"That thing's hiding underground. We can't force it out."
The blue-skinned ogre, Souei, moved with agility, covering gaps and preventing further losses.
Their team of 40 had dwindled to 28.
Twelve of their kin had already perished.
For an Ogre Tribe village of only 300, losing twelve able-bodied warriors was a devastating blow.
While the entire tribe could fight, only about 200 reached B-rank combat strength.
Children and elders typically capped at C+-rank.
Of course, rankings were just that... rankings.
Magicules marked a monster's evolutionary leap, but a high magicule count didn't always mean superior combat power.
Take Ogerpon, for example.
With just over 8,000 magicules, she was at the upper end of B-rank.
The ogres... Benimaru, Souei, Shion, and Shuna... had magicule counts 1,000 to 2,000 lower than Ogerpon's.
But the gap in combat ability?
Against the current Ogerpon, this team of 40 B-rank ogres would likely face a one-sided slaughter.
That was the difference in skill depth.
Ogerpon wielded at least 30 magic abilities derived from Pokémon moves.
She had melee, ranged, defensive, restorative, supportive, and transformative skills.
And that didn't even include her Unique Skill, Destroyer.
In a real fight, one Seed Bomb from Ogerpon would force the ogres to dodge or be crippled... if not killed... on impact.
Monsters with Unique Skills had the potential to reach Special A-rank.
That was the weight of a Unique Skill... the mark of a Demon Lord Seed!
Huff… huff…
The purple-haired, one-horned female ogre, Shion, shielded the pink-haired ogre princess while slashing a beetle-like bug with her greatsword.
"You okay?"
Seeing this, Shuna unleashed a fire magic spell, turning the bug into a massive fireball.
"Onii-sama, I have enough magic left for one large-scale illusion."
As the village's shaman, Shuna was one of the few ogres with spellcasting abilities, staying in the rear to provide support and healing.
"There are too many."
Shion gritted her teeth. "These bugs are endless, coming in wave after wave!"
"We can't keep this up…"
Despite the frustration, Benimaru knew their current numbers couldn't break through the bug nest's defenses.
They needed to return to the village, report the situation, and bring more tribesmen to eradicate this threat near their home.
"Watch out!!"
At that moment, Shion yanked Shuna to her side.
In that brief moment, a grotesque, mosquito-like bug had slipped through their defenses, closing in on Shuna.
If Shion hadn't acted in time, the giant mosquito's stinger would have pierced Shuna's heart.
"Die!!"
Without hesitation, Shion swung her greatsword, cleaving the mosquito in two.
"Ah!!"
But she hadn't anticipated another bug breaking through.
As she dispatched the mosquito, her strength momentarily spent, a mantis-like bug slashed through several comrades and charged at the two women.
"Damn it!"
Seeing Shuna in danger again, Shion made a snap decision, shielding the girl with her body.
Splurch!
A razor-sharp blade struck, tearing through flesh and exposing white bone.
"Urgh…"
Shion felt a searing pain.
She tried to counterattack, but the injury to her spine left her limbs weak, nearly dropping her greatsword.
"Heal, heal!!"
"I'll heal you right now!"
Shuna pressed her hands over Shion's wound, pale green healing magic glowing from her palms.
But the mantis bug was already too close, and Benimaru and the others couldn't reach them before its blades descended.
Skreee~~
As the green insect blades loomed larger, Shuna's only option was to push her friend away with all her strength.
At least one of them could survive.
"No!!"
Shion, sprawled on the ground, could only watch as Shuna faced death.
Despair overwhelmed the ogre girl.
She was powerless.
Is this the end?
Shuna felt death's breath, but she wasn't afraid.
Her only fear was for her brother and best friend, dreading their annihilation here.
"Bo-ne!"
Yet, the expected agony of a pierced heart never came.
Instead, a clear, melodious sound, like a nightingale's song, rang out.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 21 21: [TP] 21: The Ferocity
chapters.content:
Crack! Snap!
Shuna's eyes snapped open, witnessing a scene she could scarcely have imagined.
A small figure had appeared before her and Shion, seemingly out of nowhere.
Barely over a meter tall, the figure wielded a club woven from green vines.
And this club, at that moment, stood like an impassable chasm between the two women and the bug monster's razor-sharp blade.
"The attack… it's blocked…"
Shuna and Shion could hardly believe their eyes.
That massive, razor-sharp insect blade couldn't even dent a simple wooden club.
No!
It wasn't just that it couldn't dent it!
Crunch!
Cracks spread across the insect blade, extending toward the mantis-like monster's limbs.
"Who… are you?"
Benimaru and the others witnessed the scene as well.
Uncertain of Ogerpon's origins, they could only sense a shared lineage from her aura.
Ogre Tribe!
She was one of their kind!
"Ogerpon has entered the battlefield!"
"What?"
The next moment, under the stunned gazes of the Ogre Tribe, a green spiked club, brimming with surging magicules, obliterated the giant mantis before it!
Not knocked back... shattered!
And it didn't stop there!
The vine club's momentum carried forward, sweeping aside five or six bugs blocking the path between Benimaru and the two women, sending them flying!
Boom!
A gust of wind roared, whipping the ogres' clothes and stirring up dust that clouded their vision, prompting them to adopt defensive stances against potential surprise attacks.
Whoosh! Whoosh!
Thud!
But the expected assault never came.
Instead, a figure darted through the battlefield, accompanied by the agonized screeches of bug monsters from all directions.
Splat!
A single swing of the club, and a bug's body shattered into pieces.
Ogerpon dodged the splattering, foul ichor, scanning her surroundings before stomping her foot.
Instantly, green fluorescent light danced in the air, and blades of grass sprouted from the earth.
"What's happening?"
"This is…"
"My body… it's healing?"
"Is someone casting Healing Arts on us?"
In that moment, every ogre on the battlefield felt the effects of the grassy terrain, their wounds slowly mending.
Hiss!
"My back… it's so itchy."
Shion, whose spine had been injured, was among those healed.
"Who is she?"
Shion and Shuna turned their gazes forward in unison.
As the dust settled, Ogerpon, resembling a little girl, stood atop a fallen scorpion-like bug, looking down at the Ogre Tribe.
She wore a green grass mask, with three others... blue, gray, and red... floating behind her in a triangular formation.
These masks, as if carved from gemstones, gleamed like works of art in the sunlight.
Unlike her Pokémon days, Ogerpon's Mask Glow ability had evolved dramatically in this world.
Most notably, she was no longer limited to a single mask's transformation.
She could summon four masks simultaneously, using one as the core to form a quad-mask array, gaining the enhancements of all four.
"Hah!"
Under Ogerpon's control, the grass-type energy flowed into the Well Mask, Hearth Mask, and Cornerstone Mask.
Water, fire, rock, and grass... four energies swirled around her, turning the battlefield into her personal stage.
"An ogre?"
"And a child at that?"
Ogerpon's aura felt familiar to Shuna and Shion.
But the problem was her size... she was so small.
Standing barely over a meter tall, she was dwarfed by the Ogre Tribe, whose average height neared two meters, making her seem less than a child.
Yet!
The power Ogerpon displayed.
And the immense magicules she radiated silently proclaimed her strength.
"I'm here to help."
Ogerpon summoned another vine club, adopting a dual-wielding stance.
"Help?"
Benimaru took notice of her, about to ask more, but she was already charging back into the fray.
"Wait!"
He tried to call her back, but Ogerpon was too fast.
Empowered by the quad-mask array, Damien's Leader ability, and her own Destroyer Unique Skill, Ogerpon's strength had skyrocketed.
Her B-rank magicules were her foundation, but in her mask state, she could face B+-rank monsters head-on.
With Damien's Leader buffs, supportive magic, and her Destroyer ability, even an A-rank opponent wasn't out of reach!
"So strong!"
What unfolded before the Ogre Tribe was a scene of utter domination.
"What kind of monster is she? That power…"
"Could she be the legendary Oni?"
Despite her petite frame, every strike from Ogerpon unleashed earth-shaking destruction.
Destroyer!
No matter the target, a hit meant annihilation.
Weapons, armor... it didn't matter.
Unless you bore a blessing on par with Destroyer's Unique Skill, it was a rule-like judgment!
Hit, and destroy.
Ignoring defense entirely!
Boom!
In midair, Ogerpon spun, wielding her twin vine clubs like a horizontal tornado, pulverizing surrounding bugs into dust.
Her staggering combat prowess and explosive output left the Ogre Tribe's jaws on the ground.
"What a ferocious fighting style!"
"She's so small, yet where does that monstrous strength come from?"
"Those massive bugs with their thick shells… taken out with a single swing…"
The Ogre Tribe, never having witnessed the cheat-like power of a Unique Skill, was utterly shaken by Ogerpon's otherworldly might.
"Young Lord, what do we do?"
The future Souei, now just a blue-skinned ogre trained in ninja arts, spoke up. "The tribe has regrouped, and the retreat path has been cleared by… that little girl."
Mentioning Ogerpon, Souei felt his worldview shattering.
So ferocious!
That destructive power, that unstoppable charge.
This was the true violence of the Ogre Tribe!
***

chapters.title: Chapter 22 22: [TP] 22: Take Action
chapters.content:
"We can't let our ally, who stepped in to help, fight alone!"
Benimaru had no intention of retreating without Ogerpon, at the very least.
Boom!
But before he could issue a clear order, the ground ahead began to tremble.
The earth collapsed, revealing hidden pits beneath.
The next moment, a swarm of bug monsters surged from the darkness like a tidal wave.
"Holy... !"
The sheer number made even Damien, watching from a distance, twitch his lips. "What are these things? There's way too many!"
A quick scan revealed no fewer than 5,000 bugs.
And there were likely more underground.
As for their ranks...
Through his Appraisal skill, Damien noted these bugs were weaker than the first batch they encountered, and smaller in size.
"Most are D-rank, with C--rank making up about 20%. There are plenty of C-rank, and around a hundred C+-rank."
Damien dismissed the D-rank monsters.
For Ogerpon's Grower ability to gain experience, the monsters couldn't be too far below her level.
Generally, killing anything below C--rank wouldn't increase her existence value.
So, despite the sheer number of bugs, only about 20%... roughly 1,000... counted as viable fodder.
"Even so, taking down this batch should push Ogerpon to a true A-rank monster."
In the Cardinal World's mechanics, reaching A-rank with a Disaster evaluation meant Ogerpon had a high chance of evolving into a stronger ogre form.
"Should we retreat?"
Damien wasn't too concerned about the D-rank bugs.
They couldn't even scratch Ogerpon's defenses.
More importantly…
[Defeated C-rank monster x1, gained 4 existence points]
[Defeated C--rank monster x2, gained 3 existence points]
[Defeated C+-rank monster x1, gained 8 existence points]
[...]
Since Ogerpon joined the battle, every kill granted her existence points.
In just ten minutes, her existence value had risen from 8,000+ to 8,500+.
"At this rate, with the remaining bugs…"
Damien calculated silently. "Over 1,000 C-rank and above bugs should push Ogerpon past 10,000 existence points, securing an A-rank evaluation, right?"
A-rank was a dividing line.
There was a qualitative gap between A-rank and below.
Even the weakest A-rank monster could take on a 300-strong Ogre Tribe village single-handedly.
"Let's do this!"
Damien made up his mind. He wasn't about to let this juicy opportunity slip away.
"Ogerpon!"
"Damien?"
Through their familiar bond, Ogerpon heard Damien's voice.
"Can you keep fighting?"
"Ogerpon's not tired at all!"
Ogerpon was brimming with energy, smashing bugs one by one. "Ogerpon could fight them all day!"
Atta girl, you're basically Captain America!
Of course, that was just a joke.
In truth, the Elemental Spirit race's hidden trait was their astonishing physical prowess and bottomless stamina.
Especially now, as Ogerpon kept slaying enemies, her Grower talent was voraciously absorbing nutrients, converting them into magicules.
Per Cardinal World logic, the more magicules, the more energy an individual had.
So, after this battle, not only had Ogerpon barely expended magic or stamina, but her surging magicules left her in peak condition.
"Got it."
"Then…"
Learning Ogerpon's state, Damien cast an amplification spell. "Friends of the Ogre Tribe, Ogerpon and I are here to help."
"That voice?"
On the battlefield, the regrouped ogres, led by Benimaru, looked up to find the source.
"Is he talking about Ogerpon, that terrifyingly strong little one?"
"So her name's Ogerpon?"
"Such an odd name."
"Wait, she already has a name?"
"She's a named monster?"
Ignoring his tribe's shock and murmurs, Benimaru waited quietly for Damien's next words.
Damien had no intention of joining the fray directly.
He saw himself as a backline summoner and mage... getting caught in the enemy's encirclement would be foolish.
"Next, I'll unleash a powerful spell on the bug nest to force them out."
"If the nest's forces are beyond our expectations, I'll have Ogerpon retreat immediately."
"You should do the same... escape with Ogerpon!"
Damien's plan was straightforward, and Benimaru quickly grasped it.
The nest's numbers and strength were unknown.
If Damien's spell drew out tens of thousands of bugs, staying would be suicide. They'd need to return to the village for reinforcements.
But if the nest's forces weren't as overwhelming as feared…
Then the Ogre Tribe wouldn't be needed.
'I've got my ace, Ogerpon, who can take on armies!'
"Everyone!!"
Without much hesitation, Benimaru made his decision. "Follow the voice's commands!!"
Shuna was his sister, Shion his childhood friend.
Ogerpon had saved their lives.
That debt alone was more than Benimaru could repay.
And abandoning a fighting ally to flee? That would shame the Ogre Tribe!
"Not bad."
From afar, Damien nodded approvingly at Benimaru's quick formation change.
"Let's begin!"
Ignoring Benimaru's group, Damien raised both hands, channeling all his magic into them.
Thanks to Ogerpon's slaughter, Damien's magicules had broken past 4,500.
With his current magic capacity, he met the requirements to cast Konosuba's strongest spell.
And what was Konosuba's strongest spell?
No question about it... the signature move of the quirky Crimson Majin little girl, Megumin: Explosion!
In Konosuba, Megumin poured every skill point from leveling up into Explosion.
This turned her Explosion into something akin to a miniature nuke.
Whoosh!
Damien's Explosion was still level 1, unupgraded.
But!
Upon returning to the Cardinal World, his Mage class had unlocked endless possibilities.
Freely manipulating magic, stirring the winds, harnessing omnipresent elements... earth, water, wind, fire, light, dark, even time and space…
Explosion wasn't strictly a fire spell, despite its name.
It was, in essence, a destruction spell.
It absorbed, compressed, and disassembled surrounding magical elements, then unleashed devastating destruction in an instant.
Just like what Damien was doing now.
Using his Mage abilities, he deeply analyzed Explosion's essence.
It was no longer just a shortcut skill but the raw core of its power.
Magic drained rapidly, but thanks to his Mage class, new magic flowed into him, only to be consumed again.
This cycle repeated, pouring ever more energy into the spell.
"What's happening?"
The massive disturbance from drawing in magical elements made the air within kilometers of Damien feel oppressively heavy.
The ogres, led by Shuna, felt a primal dread welling up inside.
Run!
Get out now!
Their monster instincts screamed to flee the area immediately!
"This magic…"
Shuna, a spellcaster herself, sensed the atmospheric ripples more keenly than the warrior ogres like Shion or Benimaru.
In her eyes, Damien's position had become a bottomless, pitch-black abyss.
The abyss devoured all, like a dark sun blotting out the sky, casting a shadow over every heart.
Buzz!
Colorful magical particles converged toward Damien's palms, forming vibrant, radiant streams.
Trees swayed, the sky darkened, and a massive star-ring slowly materialized overhead.
Then, a colossal crimson magic circle appeared.
But it wasn't over…
A second, third, fourth…
Dozens of magic circles layered atop one another, stacking into a towering structure that pierced the heavens, as if roaring defiance at the gods themselves.
***
