chapters.title: Chapter 23 23: [TP] 23: Nuclear
chapters.content:
Gulp!
Benimaru, Shion, Souei, and the other ogres couldn't help but swallow hard.
They stared in awe at the apocalyptic scene unfolding in the sky, momentarily forgetting their battle with the bug monsters.
Fortunately, the bugs had already retreated.
Even brainless monsters could sense the approaching danger.
They were scurrying back to their nest, forming layers of insect walls in a futile attempt to block the impending divine punishment.
"Get away from the nest, now!"
Damien's voice rang out again in the ears of the Ogre Tribe.
This time, they didn't hesitate.
Each one wished they had an extra pair of legs, sprinting as fast as they could away from the nest, now locked in the crosshairs of countless magic circles.
"Bo-ne?"
Ogerpon swatted away a bug trying to cling to her, following the ogres' lead.
As for Damien...
He was pouring all his focus into controlling the Explosion spell, slowing its descent to give the Ogre Tribe and Ogerpon more time to escape the blast zone.
"Hm?"
At that same moment, in another part of the Jura Forest, a girl with emerald hair, beautiful as an elf, opened her eyes.
"The forest's spirits are trembling…"
She instinctively looked toward a certain direction. "What's happening?"
There, elemental spirits were frantically converging on a single point.
The girl, Treyni, was a high-ranking Dryad, a guardian of the forest.
"Magic?"
As the embodiment of the forest, Treyni could sense every blade of grass and tree, receiving their feedback.
But this time, she was utterly perplexed.
Chaos!
An unprecedented cacophony!
The trees and plants of the forest were chattering like they'd gone mad.
One cried, "The forest is doomed!" Another wailed, "A catastrophe! It's terrifying!"
Treyni couldn't extract a clear answer from the noise.
The only thing she was certain of was that the culprit behind this chaos was a type of magic she'd never encountered.
"What kind of magic could draw in so many elements?"
No longer hesitating, Treyni cast a Dryad teleportation spell, her body dissolving into specks of light.
"This is…"
When Treyni reformed, she was met with the sight of a towering structure of magic circles piercing the clouds.
Hundreds, thousands of magic circles left her dumbfounded.
"What?"
She'd seen powerful magic before.
But what kind of magic could be this complex?
Other mages adorned their circles with patterns.
Damien? He used magic circles to create intricate patterns.
"Who's casting such terrifying magic?"
Treyni quickly locked onto Damien, standing on a tree, maintaining control to prevent the spell from spiraling out of hand.
"Human?"
"No, that's not right."
Treyni noticed Damien's golden pupils, a trait no human could possess. "A hybrid? Part human, part Majin, leaning more toward Majin."
She didn't label him a forest destroyer.
In fact, compared to Damien, those bug monsters... recently appeared from who-knows-where... were the real filth that needed to be eradicated.
And now, Damien's target was none other than the bugs the forest spirits deemed "villains."
That gave Treyni even less reason to interfere.
"Have they all retreated?"
"Bo-ne!"
Ogerpon appeared beside Damien, reporting the Ogre Tribe's position.
"Good work, Ogerpon."
"Now…"
Seeing Ogerpon's return, Damien began to release his hold on the Explosion spell. "Let's watch some grand fireworks."
[Ultimate Explosion Magic: Explosion!]
Whoosh!
As Damien lowered his hands, the world fell silent.
The forest, sky, and earth... every flower, grass, and tree... sank into a deathly stillness.
Color drained away, leaving boundless white and void, and an unimaginable depth of destruction capable of overturning everything!
BOOM!
A massive mushroom cloud rose in the distance, centered on the bug nest. Everything within a one-kilometer radius was vaporized in an instant.
The earth quaked as if the heavens had collapsed, shockwaves rippling outward in all directions.
The militarized nation of Dwargon to the north and the Sorcerous Dynasty of Sarion to the south soon felt the tremors from the Jura Forest.
High-ranking officials scrambled, and word quickly reached the Dwarf King and Sarion's Queen.
Skreee!
Unaware of the massive upheaval his strike had caused, Damien was fixated on the bug nest.
The layered insect walls were useless.
Faced with this apocalyptic scene, the bugs could only screech as they were evaporated by the Explosion spell.
Damien didn't know the full extent of the damage below.
But after such a magical bombardment, the bugs had to be devastated. Anything below C-rank lacked the resilience to survive, reduced to ash.
Even C-rank monsters, if they survived, were left clinging to life.
Only B--rank and B-rank bugs might endure.
But even they were heavily injured, their strength reduced to a fraction.
"Sugoi!!"
Ogerpon, standing in front of Damien to shield him from the shockwaves, had stars in her eyes, practically radiating "admiration."
"Indeed…"
Damien was equally awestruck by his own attack. "No wonder it's Konosuba's strongest Explosion spell. It lives up to its name."
For some reason, he started to understand Megumin.
There was no problem a single Explosion couldn't solve.
And if there was? Fire another!
But my Explosion seems quite different from Megumin's.
It's practically a different spell, isn't it?
Compared to Megumin's Explosion in the Konosubaverse, Damien's was far more terrifying.
The blast's core alone spanned 1.2 kilometers.
Its total area of effect rivaled a major city in the Cardinal World's human nations.
Without a doubt, if this spell hit a human kingdom, it would erase an entire city... and its tens or hundreds of thousands of inhabitants... from the map.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 24 24: [TP] 24: Evolution
chapters.content:
In terms of monster destruction levels, the Explosion spell Damien poured nearly fifteen minutes into condensing reached the instantaneous burst power of a Special A-rank monster's full magicule output.
For context, this Explosion was equivalent to the devastation caused by a Special A-rank monster self-destructing.
Special A-rank monsters, with over 100,000 magicules, were far beyond Damien's current comprehension.
Yet, through the extreme manipulation of Explosion's potential, Damien, with a mere C+-rank foundation, achieved this unthinkable feat.
This showcased the immense potential of Explosion and the massive boost from his Mage class.
"Now's your chance, Ogerpon!"
With so many incapacitated monsters, this was the perfect feast for Ogerpon.
"Bo-ne!"
Without needing Damien's command, Ogerpon seized the moment, unleashing area-of-effect magic derived from Pokémon moves.
In an instant, Seed Bomb and Leaf Storm swept the battlefield, energy spheres raining down like a storm, shredding the crippled bugs into fragments.
[Defeated C+-rank monster x15, gained 120 existence points]
[Defeated B--rank monster x8, gained 160 existence points]
[Defeated B-rank monster x4, gained 400 existence points]
[...]
The flood of notifications for gaining magicules was like the sweetest music to Damien, nearly making him grin.
[Individual 'Ogerpon' existence value has reached 10,000, triggering evolution]
"Evolution?"
Reaching 10,000 existence points so quickly caught Damien off guard.
But what shocked him more was the "evolution" prompt Ogerpon triggered.
As a Pokémon, Ogerpon was already in her final form, unable to evolve further.
"So, this evolution must be the transformation of a Majin into a higher-tier Majin."
Ogerpon, standing amidst the battlefield, glowed with a dazzling light.
"Bo-ne?"
The little creature was a bit flustered.
Fortunately, Damien quickly communicated through their bond, explaining the mechanics of monster evolution.
"Ogerpon's going to evolve?"
Evolution was a dream for any Pokémon.
Ogerpon was eager to see what she'd become.
[Evolution complete]
[Individual 'Ogerpon' has evolved from 'Elemental Spirit' to 'Oni']
"Bo-ne!"
Ogerpon, once just 1.2 meters tall, had grown to over 1.5 meters.
Her orange face was gone, replaced by a slightly youthful, fair complexion.
Her green cloak transformed into an emerald kimono, her hands hidden beneath wide sleeves. Her pale green hair flowed, and her black-wrapped legs clacked on wooden sandals as she ran toward Damien.
"Damien, Damien, Ogerpon got so much bigger!"
Ogerpon's pale golden eyes, sparkling with star patterns, glimmered with boundless magic, captivating Damien's gaze.
"This is a monster's evolution. You're an Oni now, Ogerpon."
Damien fondly patted her head, and she immediately looked content.
He opened Ogerpon's status panel.
[Ogerpon]
[Contractor: Damien]
[Race: Oni]
[Existence Value: 12,000 (A-rank)]
[Magic: Pokémon Moves, Appraisal
[Class Skills: Melee Mastery (includes Swordsman, Knight, Lancer, Crusader, Hunter, Thief, etc.)]
[Inherent Abilities: Elemental Hyper-Absorption, Ability Hyper-Enhancement, Hyper-Speed Regeneration]
[Extra Skills: Mask Glow (unleashes inner power, summoning masks of different attributes)]
[Special Skills: Magicule Solidification, Explosion Magic (pseudo-nuclear strike magic condensing vast magicules), Oni Transformation (comprehensive attribute boost)]
[Unique Skills: Destroyer, Grower]
"Her race changed to Oni."
No surprise there.
In the Cardinal World's lore, Elemental Spirits and the Ogre Tribe were on the same tier, both B-rank Majins.
Their first evolution led to A-rank Oni, followed by Special Divine Onis or Soul Onis.
Divine Onis excelled in melee, while Soul Onis leaned toward magic, though both were on the same level.
As they grew stronger, Divine Onis and Soul Onis could earn the Demon Lord Seed title, recognized by the Voice of the World, qualifying them to evolve into True Demon Lords.
This process, however, was arduous.
For Ogerpon, as Damien's familiar, she couldn't awaken independently.
Damien would need to collect souls and grant them to her for her to become a True Demon Lord.
"Appraisal and melee skills?"
Ogerpon hadn't possessed these before.
"Is this because of me?"
Damien recalled how, in the original story, Rimuru's named monsters sometimes inherited his abilities.
"Ogerpon's case must be similar."
"During evolution, she inherited some of my abilities."
Damien mused, "Appraisal lets Ogerpon better understand her opponents, and the Konosuba-derived Melee Mastery makes her already melee-focused style even stronger."
"Elemental Hyper-Absorption, Ability Hyper-Enhancement, Hyper-Speed Regeneration."
"Hyper-Absorption and Hyper-Enhancement are advanced versions of Elemental Absorption and Ability Enhancement, giving Ogerpon higher magic resistance and faster magic absorption."
"Ability Hyper-Enhancement likely evolved from traits like Defiant."
As for Magicule Solidification and Hyper-Speed Regeneration...
Hyper-Speed Regeneration was self-explanatory, a recovery ability surpassing the Ogre Tribe's. Per Appraisal's feedback, it allowed survival unless her head was severed, with feats like limb regrowth and organ repair.
"Magicule Solidification is probably like mine, converting magicules into 'levels' to boost base attributes."
In the Cardinal World, magicules and monsters were like a pool and its water.
The water didn't reinforce the pool.
So, a 100,000-magicule entity versus a 10,000,000-magicule one didn't have as drastic a physical strength gap as one might think.
But with Magicule Solidification, it became like a level 50 facing a level 100.
Even if the level 100 monster exhausted its magic, its base attributes far outstripped a mere level 50's.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 25 25: [TP] 25: Special A-Rank!
chapters.content:
With the Magicule Solidification skill, as long as Damien and Ogerpon kept increasing their magicules, their physical strength would grow proportionally.
"Finally, there's Explosion Magic and Oni Transformation."
In the Cardinal World, Explosion Magic was classified as a "Nuclear Strike Magic."
This referred to magic with the destructive power of a nuclear weapon, a benchmark for assessing magic's destructive potential in the Cardinal World.
The Explosion spell Damien had cast, expending vast magic and time, fell within the scope of a small-scale Nuclear Strike Magic.
Of course, due to the Cardinal World's higher physical constants... stronger soil, rocks, and gravity... its effects were amplified.
A nuclear-level blast in the Cardinal World could sink continents or even destroy planets in other worlds.
"Ogerpon's mastered this wide-range destructive move too?"
Damien felt quite pleased.
His own attributes couldn't match Ogerpon's.
While she lacked the passive boosts of his Mage class, her A-rank magic reserves far surpassed his current level.
It was easy to imagine how terrifying an Explosion cast by the current Ogerpon would be.
"Ogerpon."
"Bo-ne?"
"What's Oni Transformation like?"
Curious, Damien asked Ogerpon to Majinstrate.
Her body erupted with fierce magicules.
In an instant, Ogerpon's form expanded, growing from under 1.4 meters to 1.8 meters tall.
Sharp oni horns, fierce eyes, and a seemingly delicate yet explosively powerful frame... all screamed the terror of Ogerpon in this state.
If the old Ogerpon was a cute little girl, the fully transformed Ogerpon was now a stunning, statuesque beauty.
Even Damien, who saw her as a little sister, couldn't help but steal a few extra glances.
[Oni Transformation]
[Description: Temporarily boosts combat power by one rank, but consumes significant magic.]
"Appraisal."
Without hesitation, Damien used Appraisal on Ogerpon in this state.
[Ogerpon]
[Danger Assessment: Special A (Disaster-Class)]
"Disaster-Class!!"
Damien hadn't expected Oni Transformation to provide such a massive boost.
Having evolved into an upper-tier A-rank Oni, Ogerpon's magicule count remained A-rank, but her combat power could rival seasoned A+-rank fighters.
With Oni Transformation, she'd earned a Special A-rank assessment.
"Ogerpon, how long can you maintain this state?"
"Um…"
Ogerpon thought for a moment, replying obediently, "About five minutes."
So, at full power, Ogerpon could sustain Special A-rank combat strength for five minutes.
"Alright, change back."
"Okay."
Ogerpon's body shrank rapidly, returning to her petite little girl form in a blink.
"Ogerpon got stronger. Did Damien gain any power from Ogerpon?"
"Haha, of course."
Damien patted her head, chuckling. "Ogerpon's given me a whopping 6,000 existence points."
"I'm B-rank now, you know."
His Leader Unique Skill allowed Damien to gain roughly half of his familiar's existence points.
With Ogerpon at 12,000, Damien received 6,000.
Plus, Damien had made his own breakthrough.
His base existence value was only 500 before.
But this battle earned him "merit." recognized by the Voice of the World.
It wasn't much, but it pushed him out of weakling territory.
In numbers, his existence value rose from 500 to 1,500... equivalent to a D-rank monster.
"So, Damien's magicules are at 7,500 now, right?"
Ogerpon perked up. "Ogerpon will keep working hard to help Damien evolve too!"
Yes, Damien could evolve as well.
As a Majin-human hybrid, his human side aside, his Majinic bloodline granted him the ability to evolve like a monster.
He still didn't know what his Majinic bloodline was, though.
Another piece of good news: as Damien advanced from C-rank to B-rank, his familiar slots increased from 1/3 to 1/6.
"Three new familiar slots per rank-up?"
Damien had thought the familiar limit was fixed, but it grew with his strength.
This meant he didn't need to be so stingy with familiar slots.
"Bo-ne?"
Suddenly, Ogerpon, snuggling close to Damien, sensed something.
She turned her head toward a direction but saw nothing suspicious, leaving her puzzled.
"What's wrong?"
Damien noticed her reaction and asked curiously.
"A gaze…"
Ogerpon said, "It felt like someone was watching us, but Ogerpon couldn't find them."
"This is the second time. The first was when Master cast Explosion."
"Watching us?"
Damien didn't dismiss it as Ogerpon being paranoid.
Though a monster now, she retained her Pokémon instincts for sensing danger.
Who could be spying on us?
Damien considered several possibilities, like Clayman, one of the Ten Great Demon Lords.
The bugs' sudden appearance felt out of place, unlike the original story.
Without his intervention, even if Benimaru escaped, the Ogre Tribe would've suffered heavy losses.
Besides Clayman, there are the Jura Forest's guardians... the Dryads.
Damien couldn't pinpoint who it was. The Dryads aren't a problem; I have no real conflict with them.
His Explosion aimed to eradicate the bugs harming the forest's ecosystem.
The Dryads wouldn't hold that against him.
But if it's Clayman…
In the original story, Clayman seemed like a clown.
But he was still a Demon Lord. Damien wouldn't underestimate him.
Per the novel, a half-awakened Clayman had around 700,000 existence points.
Right now, he's likely weaker... maybe 300,000 to 400,000.
That strength was an insurmountable foe for Damien and Ogerpon.
"We'll have to hope the next few worlds help Ogerpon grow stronger quickly."
Clayman wasn't an True Demon Lord, just a Demon Lord Seed.
With Ogerpon's Grower skill, even as a Demon Lord Seed, she could keep growing.
With the Jura Forest as nourishment and abilities from other worlds…
Given time, surpassing Clayman would be a breeze for Damien and Ogerpon.
"For now…"
Damien turned his gaze to Benimaru and the others approaching, a slight smile tugging at his lips. "It's time for you to lend us your strength."
***

chapters.title: Chapter 26 26: [TP] 26: Invitation
chapters.content:
"Is… is it over?"
The pink-haired ogre girl, the future Shuna, was still dazed.
She had joined her brother and tribesmen to form a scouting party, successfully locating the bug monsters' nest.
Their initial plan was to probe the bugs' strength and estimate their numbers.
But who could've predicted the supposedly mindless bugs would feign weakness, luring the Ogre Tribe deeper?
By the time they realized, it was too late.
Surrounded by a tidal wave of bugs, they had no choice but to follow her brother's lead, fighting desperately to break through.
Yet, the bugs seemed to anticipate their every move.
Killing one wave only brought another to fill the gap.
Endless, unkillable.
Soon, casualties mounted.
Magic and stamina drained, weapons broke, and tribesmen fell one after another.
For the Ogre Tribe, famed for their martial prowess, all that remained was a desperate last stand.
But when her best friend fell protecting her, Shuna had prepared for death.
Yet, death never came.
"Bo-ne!"
Shuna would never forget.
In her darkest, most hopeless moment, a petite figure descended from the heavens, saving her and her friend.
Her appearance differed from theirs.
But the blood coursing through her was unmistakably their own.
She was an ogre!
There was no doubt!
The same horns, the same ferocious strength and relentless drive.
A peerless might Shuna had never imagined.
Boom!
The earth trembled, the deafening roar ringing in her ears. Shion, now recovered, pulled Shuna to safety.
Shuna instinctively glanced back.
She saw a towering structure of hundreds of magic circles, stacking skyward.
"Ultimate Explosion Magic: Explosion!"
Snapping out of her reverie, Shuna stared at the massive crater that seemed to pierce the earth. "Is this… really magic?"
"Explosion Magic is so strong…"
Like Shuna, Shion, Benimaru, and the surviving ogres were equally stunned.
"Look over there!"
"Is that… a human?"
As the dust settled, they spotted two figures at the crater's edge... one being the petite kin who saved them.
But what shocked the Ogre Tribe was the figure beside Ogerpon: Damien.
"Damien, they're coming."
Noticing the approaching ogres, Ogerpon stepped protectively in front of Damien, eyeing them warily.
"You're human?"
They stared at Damien in disbelief, unable to fathom how a human reached this deep in the forest.
The Jura Forest was a monster's paradise. Humans only hunted low-level monsters at its edges, never venturing this far.
"No, not human."
"His eyes... those aren't human pupils."
"And his aura… he must be a Majin-human."
The ogres quickly noticed Damien's golden eyes and immense magicules... powers no human could possess.
"My apologies, we were rude."
Benimaru, as the team's leader, stepped forward and bowed to Damien. "Was that Nuclear Strike Magic your doing?"
"If you mean Explosion Magic, yes, that was me."
"Thank you for aiding us in our time of need!"
Hearing Damien's confirmation, Benimaru bowed lower. "We are the Ogre Tribe, living in this forest. May I ask who you are?"
"I'm Damien. This is Ogerpon."
"Ogerpon? Damien?"
"They have names?"
The ogres were even more shocked to learn they'd met two named monsters.
Not just Ogerpon... Damien was a named monster too.
And, perhaps it was their imagination, but Benimaru felt Ogerpon's oppressive aura had grown exponentially stronger since earlier.
"That pressure!"
Benimaru, Shion, Shuna, and Souei... future key figures under Rimuru... felt both gratitude for Ogerpon's rescue and growing reverence.
"Could it be… the legendary Oni?"
"No mistake... only an upper-tier Oni could be this powerful!!"
The surviving ogres gazed at Ogerpon with awe and admiration.
Ogerpon was an A-rank Oni, the evolved form of the Ogre Tribe.
In the monster world, strength reigned supreme.
Ogerpon was stronger, had saved them, and was a higher form of their kin.
With all these factors combined, Benimaru and the others didn't hesitate. "Please, both of you, come to our village. Let us repay your aid in our time of crisis!"
"Uh…"
"Sure, we'll take you up on that."
Damien had no intention of refusing. He needed Ogerpon to grind monsters for experience, and a 300-strong Ogre Tribe village was perfect. "Our camp in the forest was destroyed by those bugs anyway."
"You built a camp in the forest?"
"Those damn bugs!"
"No worries, our village is large. You're welcome to settle there."
"Also, may we ask the relationship between you and Lady Ogerpon?"
This was what the ogres were most curious about.
They respected Damien immensely, as he'd unleashed that earth-shattering Nuclear Strike Magic.
He was as much their savior as Ogerpon.
But they felt a closer kinship with Ogerpon.
"She's my family."
Damien gave a simple explanation of his bond with Ogerpon.
He didn't tell the full truth, instead describing her as a child he found in the wilderness.
They'd survived together in the forest, like siblings.
"Damien is Ogerpon's most important person!"
Ogerpon timely took Damien's hand, showing her closeness.
"I see."
The ogres nodded in understanding.
Intelligent monsters meeting and living together wasn't common but not impossible.
As for Damien himself…
His Majin-human hybrid status was no secret.
Humans might shun hybrids, but in the monster world, strength trumped all... no one cared about mixed blood.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 27 27: [TP] 27: Ogre Village
chapters.content:
"Why not stay in our village, then?"
Benimaru's enthusiasm was palpable. The Ogre Tribe was known for their loyalty and pride, disdaining deceit or scheming.
They were deeply grateful to Damien and Ogerpon for saving their lives.
And, of course, there was the matter of their strength.
If Damien, such a powerful spellcaster, joined the village alongside Ogerpon, an A-rank Oni, the Ogre Tribe's power would skyrocket.
"Well, we'll need to think it over."
Damien didn't agree immediately, feigning hesitation.
"Onii-sama, you're being rude!"
Seeing Damien's reluctance, Shuna quickly took over from Benimaru, suggesting they not rush things and first offer proper hospitality.
Whether they stayed would depend on seeing the village.
"Right, right, my apologies for being hasty."
Yet to face the tragedy of their clan's destruction, Benimaru was still a brash, straightforward guy.
"Alright, then."
With the Ogre Tribe's warm invitation, Damien saw no reason to refuse.
After all, he had his own plans to recruit the Ogre Tribe.
Damien held a fondness for them, knowing their future from the original story and wanting to prevent their demise at the hands of the Orc Lord.
Three hundred ogres, averaging B-rank.
Such a formidable force, if under Damien's command, would allow him to establish a firm foothold in the Jura Forest.
Moreover, the Ogre Tribe had great potential, capable of evolving into Oni, or even Divine Onis or Soul Onis.
An army like that was not something Damien would pass up.
And so, Damien joined the Ogre Tribe's group, preparing to return to their village.
Before that, the ogres needed to collect the remains of their fallen kin.
They didn't blame Damien's magic for obliterating some of their tribesmen's bodies, leaving many reduced to ash.
Their sentiment was, "Being buried in the Jura Forest isn't so bad."
"And with so many bugs to accompany them…"
The Ogre Tribe viewed life and death with acceptance.
In such dire circumstances, Damien's intervention was already more than they could've hoped for.
Cleaning the battlefield was mainly to check for survivors.
As expected, there were none.
The bugs' claws carried a potent toxin that even the Ogre Tribe's resilience could only resist briefly.
Shion's survival was nothing short of a miracle.
"Rest in peace, everyone…"
"Lord Damien and Lady Ogerpon have avenged you."
Soon after, led by Benimaru, the ogres held a simple memorial.
Damien and Ogerpon watched silently from the side, not participating, waiting for the ceremony to conclude.
"Sorry to keep you waiting."
"No trouble at all."
"Please, follow us."
Benimaru led the way toward the village, with Damien and Ogerpon trailing behind.
Along the way, Shuna and Shion kept glancing back.
They were very curious about Ogerpon.
But with Ogerpon sticking close to Damien to protect him, the two girls couldn't find a chance to thank her.
"We're here."
"Welcome to the Ogre Tribe's village!"
Emerging from the dense forest, Damien saw a quaint village.
It was small, with a distinct Japanese architectural style, featuring wooden structures lined along streets in a grid pattern.
Damien knew the reason for this.
The grandfather of the ogre elder, named Byakuya Araki, had crossed over from Japan 300 years ago.
His influence led the Ogre Tribe to wield swords and value loyalty even more than human knights in this world.
The Ogre Tribe bowed to no one.
But once they pledged allegiance, their loyalty was unwavering.
"What happened?"
The village's ogres had noticed Benimaru's return early on.
The families of the fallen were stricken with grief, women and children weeping uncontrollably.
But sorrow held little weight in the monster world, unlike the self-pity of humans.
Perhaps they'd long accepted life and death.
Those who lost kin claimed their loved ones' remains or belongings, burying them in the village's nearby graveyard.
Throughout, Damien showed no impatience, offering basic respect.
"Father!"
After handling the fallen, Benimaru finally had time to introduce Damien to his father, an older red-haired ogre.
"Thank you for your aid."
"Please accept our heartfelt gratitude!"
Led by Benimaru's father, the ogres bowed in unison to Damien.
"No need for that."
Damien waved it off. "I was just passing by and had a score to settle with those bugs, so I lent a hand."
"Even so." The ogre leader said sincerely, "in such a dire situation, without your intervention, my son, daughter, and the others would likely have perished."
"Father, how long are you going to keep Lord Damien and Lady Ogerpon standing here?"
Shuna interjected, "Both lords fought fiercely and traveled far with us. They must be exhausted."
"Right, right!"
Like his son, the ogre leader chuckled awkwardly. "My oversight."
"Honestly!"
Shuna turned to Damien and Ogerpon. "Please wait a moment, my lords. I'll have hot water prepared for a bath."
"Uh…"
Damien wanted to say it wasn't necessary.
But seeing Shuna's earnest gaze, he exchanged a look with Ogerpon and relented. "Alright, thank you."
Shuna was right.
After trekking through the forest, with the sun nearly set, claiming they weren't tired would be a lie.
Shuna's perceptiveness showed a sensitivity rare among the Ogre Tribe.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 28 28: [TP] 28: The Popular Ogerpon
chapters.content:
Splash!
Shuna soon led Damien and Ogerpon to a slightly elevated area.
Here stood a bathhouse.
This particular section, reserved for honored guests, was typically closed off and only opened to welcome distinguished visitors.
"Not bad at all…"
Leaning against the bathhouse's edge, Damien let out a contented sigh. "What do you think, Ogerpon?"
"Ogerpon feels all soft and squishy…"
Beside him was Ogerpon, submerged in the hot water with only half her head above the surface.
Logically, the little girl should've used the women's bathhouse.
But Ogerpon, worried for Damien's safety, insisted on staying with him.
With no other choice, Damien let her join him in the bath.
It's not a big deal, right?
There's nothing to see anyway.
Not only was Ogerpon short, but her figure was also unremarkable.
Aside from her soft skin, she looked like a child under ten.
Given Damien's tastes, he wasn't about to make a move on such a young girl... she was more like a little sister to him.
"Lord Damien, these are clothes for you and Lady Ogerpon."
"I've left them outside."
Halfway through their bath, Shuna and Shion brought clean clothes.
"Thanks!"
Though Damien had plenty of supplies in his spatial storage, he couldn't refuse the Ogre Tribe's kindness.
Soon, cleansed of their fatigue, Damien and Ogerpon donned the clothes prepared by the ogres.
The style resembled Japanese yukata.
Given the Ogre Tribe's origins, this clothing choice felt fitting to Damien.
"Let's go."
Leaving the bathhouse, Damien spotted Shuna and Shion waiting.
Without a word, he followed them to the village's central plaza for the banquet the ogres had prepared.
"They're here!"
"Is that the legendary Oni?"
"She's so small, but her magicules are terrifying!"
"Don't you think she's adorable?"
"Hey, show some respect! Lady Ogerpon saved us!"
Compared to Damien, Ogerpon was clearly the star of the show.
Who could blame them? She was an Oni.
Oni were the stuff of legend for the Ogre Tribe.
It had been countless years since they'd seen an upper-tier Majin of their bloodline!
"Go on, Ogerpon."
Damien patted Ogerpon's back, encouraging her to show off. "Let them see your power."
"Bo-ne?"
Ogerpon blinked, then realized what he meant.
"Bo-ne!!"
She summoned her green vine club, and behind her, massive gem-like masks glowed brilliantly.
This dazzling display instantly captured every ogre's heart.
"Ohhh!!"
"What a beautiful figure!"
"Truly worthy of a legendary Oni!"
"Is this Lady Ogerpon's power?"
The village erupted in excitement.
But it wasn't over!
"Vine Club: Explosive Strike!"
Ogerpon channeled magic into her vine club and swung it toward the night sky.
Boom!
A beam of green, red, blue, and gray light shot upward, bursting into brilliant fireworks under the dark sky.
"Wow~~~"
The eyes of young ogre children reflected the vibrant display.
Adult ogres, meanwhile, felt the unparalleled power in Ogerpon's casual strike.
"So… so strong…"
"Onee-chan's amazing~~"
Unlike the reserved adults, the kids only knew Ogerpon was awesome.
Seeing Ogerpon swarmed by children, Damien signaled she didn't need to worry about him.
Their life-link ensured that if one was harmed, the other would sense it immediately.
"Go have fun, Ogerpon."
Damien then headed toward the ogre leader, who'd been waiting.
"Oh, right."
Damien stopped Shuna, who was following him.
"Let me add some flavor to tonight's feast."
He opened his spatial storage, pulling out ingredients and spices from the Konosubaverse.
At first, Shuna hesitated.
But the aroma and taste of Damien's spices exceeded her expectations.
The scent alone immersed her in a flavor she'd never experienced.
When she used the spices on the roasted meat the ogres often ate, an explosive aroma swept the plaza.
"This!"
"What's that smell? It's incredible!"
"Is this really roasted meat?"
"So delicious! Too delicious!"
"It's because of these spices? Amazing!"
That night, bonfires lit the village to celebrate their victory over the forest-threatening bugs and to welcome Damien and Ogerpon.
At Damien's urging, Ogerpon joined Shuna, Shion, and the other female ogres.
Rooted in the Japanese Momotaro legend, Ogerpon's personality and habits meshed perfectly with the Ogre Tribe, and she quickly bonded with them.
Meanwhile, Damien sat with Benimaru, his father, and Hakurou.
"You must be the village's eldest, right?"
Damien poured a cup of wine for the elder, gesturing for him to try it.
He wasn't worried about harm.
With their life-link, fatal attacks on Damien were nullified, converted to numerical damage, and transferred to Ogerpon.
Before, he'd worried about draining Ogerpon.
Now, with Hyper-Speed Regeneration, she could recover any life loss in moments.
This was why Damien could sit calmly with Hakurou, a swordsmanship master.
"Thank you, young man."
Hakurou smiled, sipped the wine, and his eyes lit up.
"What rich, exquisite wine…"
Even the stoic elder was captivated by Damien's brew, quietly speculating about his origins.
Rare spices, fine wine, immense strength…
A reincarnator from another world?
But Hakurou harbored no ill will.
Damien had saved the village's younger generation.
That debt was beyond repayment.
The danger Damien imagined in the Ogre Tribe's village was impossible.
Bound by loyalty and gratitude, the Ogre Tribe would never harm their benefactor.
"Lord Damien, our tribe can never repay your kindness."
"If you'd settle in our village, it would be our honor."
Knowing Damien was still considering, the ogre leader suggested, "You and Lady Ogerpon can stay at my home for now. Tomorrow, we'll build you a house."
"And if you later wish to establish a new home elsewhere, we'll help find a suitable spot."
Though he said this, the leader hoped Damien would stay.
This temporary stay was a chance to convince him.
"Thank you for the trouble."
That night, Damien and Ogerpon stayed at the ogre leader's home.
Despite being in the Jura Forest, Damien enjoyed the comforts of a civilized world.
Without a doubt, this was far more pleasant than building a camp from scratch.
***
Hi guys, I hope you're all doing well! I want to share that I'm currently working on a new project related to Lord of Mysteries.
If you're interested, feel free to visit my profile and start reading. Below is a brief summary:
[Lord of Mysteries: Incarnation of Chaos]
Have you ever wondered what would happen if someone from a Lovecraftian world got isekai'd into another world built on Lovecraftian themes? Well, it's absolute chaos.
Meet Alaric, a human(questionably) survivor of the madness and chaos caused by a certain crawling chaos, who, thanks to the kindness of a certain bubble daddy, got isekai'd into the "fake it till you make it" world.
What will he do in this strange new world? Climb the ladder of power to become that impossible god unless you're just a pawn of a certain russian priest or a certain goth mommy?
Or become a cheshire cat, leaping onto the 4D chessboard to disrupt the schemes and mind games of these bizarre folks?
For Alaric, it's not a tough choice. But before he picks either path, he must, of course, uphold the time-honored tradition of isekai'd victims(questionably) that forms the foundation of this world.
What's that tradition?
Keeping a diary.
---
[Alaric's Transmigration Diary]
[Day 1: I encountered Amon. Used a special technique to summon a projection of the Ancient Sun God, who personally delivered a heavy slap to Amon. Hope Amon appreciates this weighty paternal affection.]
[Day 2: I received an invitation from the Aurora Order. Told them I want it all... looks, brains, and combat prowess... and invited them to join my newly founded Joker Club.]
[Day 3: I met Leonard and acknowledged Gramps Pallez. Declined Leonard's enthusiastic suggestion for the old man to move in with me, as I'd rather not have a old man critiquing my every move, even in private moments.]
[Day 4: I told Klein I plan to pray to a deity named The Fool. Watched his eyes widen in shock and kindly offered him some eye drops.]
[Day 5: I listened to Medici perform a two-hour comedy routine. Suggested he go professional and invited him to share a meal.]
.
.
.
[Day 666: I fully absorbed a certain crawling chaos fragment within me. From now on, I am the Fifth Pillar.]

chapters.title: Chapter 29 29: [TP] 29: The Dryad
chapters.content:
"Hurry!"
"Bring the materials over!"
"We need to finish the house today!!"
The next morning, the Ogre Tribe, led by Benimaru and Souei, began constructing a new home for Damien and Ogerpon.
Building the wooden house was swift, with the ogres' monstrous strength turning them into a veritable construction crew.
In just one morning, a team of dozens completed a two-story house in the style of Japan's Edo period, complete with a small garden outside, filled with wildflowers picked by the village children.
"What do you think?"
Shuna was assigned to liaise with Damien.
Any requests he had could be raised with her, and the ogres would do their best to fulfill them.
"It's great. I'm very satisfied!"
Damien and Ogerpon thanked Shuna, appreciating the Ogre Tribe's sincerity and straightforwardness.
They repaid kindness with action.
Efficient and forthright, they were ideal allies.
"Hm?"
"Bo-ne!"
That very night, an unexpected guest arrived at Damien and Ogerpon's new home.
Clad in a flowing green dress adorned with sprouts and branches, her stunning beauty left even Damien... who'd seen countless influencers in his past life... momentarily awestruck.
Fortunately, knowing her identity kept him from being swept away by her grace and charm.
Instead, Damien grew wary, joining Ogerpon in eyeing the visitor cautiously.
"It seems you know who I am."
The guest was Treyni, guardian of the Jura Forest. She gracefully curtsied and introduced herself. "I am Treyni, steward of this forest."
"A Dryad?"
Damien didn't play coy, directly acknowledging her identity. "What brings the mysterious Dryad lady to visit us in the dead of night?"
His tension wasn't unwarranted... Treyni's strength was hard to gauge.
Firstly, her true form was a "Great Spirit Tree" in the forest.
Her current Dryad form was more like a projection.
In terms of monster ranking, Treyni was near Special A-rank.
In a straight fight, her strength was comparable to Ogerpon's.
With cheats like Destroyer and Explosion Magic, Ogerpon had a good chance of defeating Treyni one-on-one.
However, Treyni was unique.
Much of her power stemmed from her contracted spirit, the Elemental Lord of Wind.
With over a million magicules, the Elemental Lord of Wind rivaled an True Demon Lord. In the original story, it even severed Laplace's arm.
If Treyni summoned the Elemental Lord of Wind, Damien and Ogerpon's only option would be to activate Planeswalker and flee to another world.
"No need to be on guard. I bear no ill will."
Thankfully, Treyni was gentle by nature.
As long as the Jura Forest's ecosystem wasn't harmed, she wouldn't intervene.
"No worries."
Treyni smiled. "In fact, I'm here to thank you both for resolving a major crisis for the forest."
"You mean those bug monsters?"
"Yes."
Treyni then explained the bugs' origins.
Several months ago, they appeared from another world, building a nest in the forest.
They multiplied at an alarming rate, beyond even Treyni's expectations.
Unnoticed, they became a dire threat to the forest.
Had Damien not intervened, Treyni would've had to seek help from other monster tribes, as she did during the Orc Lord crisis.
"Do you know where they came from?"
"Well…"
Treyni shook her head regretfully. "I only know they're not from this world. Beyond that, I'm unsure."
"Alright."
Damien suspected the bugs were linked to the Celestial Demon, a corrupted version of the Cardinal World's angels, possibly bioengineered weapons for invading other worlds.
But such matters were far beyond his current concerns.
"No need for thanks."
Damien said, "I'll be living in the Ogre Tribe's village, making me a part of the forest."
"I don't mind taking out threats to the forest like those bugs."
This wasn't flattery but his genuine sentiment.
"That's wonderful."
Treyni beamed. "From now on, Mr. Damien and Miss Ogerpon are our neighbors. I hope we can get along harmoniously."
Damien's indifference was one thing, but Treyni couldn't take it for granted.
She began pondering what gift would suit as thanks for their protection of the forest.
"Well, I look forward to working together."
Confirming Treyni's lack of hostility, Damien relaxed, taking the chance to ask about the current state of affairs.
For instance, how many years remained before the main story began.
From Treyni, he learned the Storm Dragon was still sealed, meaning Rimuru hadn't yet reincarnated into this world.
Further details were beyond his ability to discern.
"If you need anything, Mr. Damien, just call my name."
Treyni added, "As long as you're in this forest, I'll hear you."
"Got it."
Having connected with a powerhouse like Damien, Treyni's visit achieved its purpose.
The Jura Forest was like a neighborhood, and Damien and Ogerpon were new residents.
Knowing Damien was a courteous, rule-abiding neighbor, Treyni felt reassured.
"I won't disturb your rest any longer."
With a curtsy, Treyni's form dissolved into green specks of light.
"Phew…"
Only when Treyni's presence fully vanished did Ogerpon lower her tightly gripped vine club.
"It's okay, we can stand down. She doesn't seem hostile."
Knowledge was one thing, but Damien never dropped his guard.
Ogerpon's combat stance was a precaution, just in case.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 30 30: [TP] 30: Experience Points!
chapters.content:
"That woman just now gave Ogerpon a dangerous vibe."
Ogerpon couldn't quite explain it. Despite Treyni lacking the oppressive aura of a powerhouse, Ogerpon's instincts screamed that in a fight, she and Damien would be the ones to fall.
"Probably because of the Elemental Lord of Wind."
Damien explained Treyni's ability to summon the Elemental Lord of Wind, reigniting Ogerpon's drive to grow stronger.
"The path to getting stronger is right in front of us."
"We need to seize this chance."
Damien was referring to the Ogre Tribe. Ogerpon was now A-rank, meaning only enemies at B--rank or higher could provide her with experience points.
C-rank monsters, even C+-rank, were no longer viable fodder for her.
"Uh-huh, there are lots of strong guys in the village."
"Ogerpon wants to fight them!"
The Ogre Tribe's village had nearly 300 residents.
Excluding those who had died, were away on mercenary missions, or were too young, the village could still muster 200 combatants above B--rank.
"That's what I'm thinking."
"But…"
Damien mused, "What's a good excuse?"
They couldn't just have Ogerpon beat up the ogres for no reason, right?
"Ogerpon thinks, how about training guidance?"
"Training guidance?"
"Yeah."
Damien nodded. "The Ogre Tribe loves to fight. They must spar regularly."
"This is the perfect chance for Ogerpon to take them on."
As an A-rank Oni, an upper-tier Majin, Ogerpon guiding and sparring with the Ogre Tribe while defeating them was entirely reasonable.
The outcome was smoother than Damien expected.
He didn't even need to propose it... the Ogre Tribe came to him.
Led by the ogre leader and Hakurou, a group of young ogres visited Damien and Ogerpon.
They hoped that during their stay, Damien could guide the village's youth.
"Absolutely!"
It was like a pillow delivered to a sleepy head. Damien was still pondering how to suggest a spar when the ogres handed him the opportunity.
However, he didn't want to reveal Ogerpon's Grower ability, which let her level up by defeating enemies.
Her Grower skill, paired with Damien's Leader, was their shortcut to rapid growth until they hit one million magicules.
With other familiars, Damien wouldn't mind sharing.
But with the newly acquainted Ogre Tribe?
Caution was warranted.
"Chief."
"Yes, Lord Damien?"
The ogre leader was deeply respectful, leaving Damien a bit exasperated.
But considering the Ogre Tribe's warrior ethos, he went along with it.
"Next, I'll have Ogerpon spar with the village's ogres."
To avoid exposing Grower while maximizing experience gains, Damien decided to scale up the sparring.
"They can come one-on-one or team up in groups."
Damien ruffled Ogerpon's hair. "Don't worry, I'll have Ogerpon go easy. No one will get seriously hurt."
"Bo-ne!"
Ogerpon flashed an innocent smile, instantly winning more favor from the ogres.
"Is that really okay?"
"Won't this trouble Lady Ogerpon too much?"
The ogre leader was floored by Damien's decision.
He hadn't expected such dedication. Not only did Damien agree immediately, but he also ensured everyone could benefit, considering their feelings.
In that moment, the leader's resolve to keep Damien and Ogerpon in the village strengthened.
Even if it meant giving up his position, he'd do it!
"I'll gather everyone now!"
Setting aside persuading Damien to stay, the leader rushed to share the good news with the village.
"What's that?"
"What's going on?"
The Ogre Tribe's central plaza was just a large clearing surrounded by wooden houses.
A raised platform stood there, used for sparring matches.
"It's Lady Ogerpon!"
"She's willing to train us and help us get stronger!"
The Ogre Tribe revered strength and craved power.
Sparring with an upper-tier Majin like Ogerpon, whose strength likely exceeded A-rank, was a dream they'd never dared entertain.
"Lady Ogerpon will teach us combat skills?"
"Fighting such a powerful Majin? I can't wait!"
In the dog-eat-dog world of monsters, the Ogre Tribe was slightly better off.
At least Hakurou and the elders taught the younger generation swordsmanship and combat skills.
But that was it.
Challenging higher-ranked monsters meant risking death.
Now, an A-rank Oni... possibly stronger... offered to be their sparring partner.
No wonder the ogre leader made such a request.
Experience against a powerhouse was rare, and the Ogre Tribe had to seize this chance.
"How do you want to do this?"
Standing in the center of the arena, Ogerpon summoned her vine club, planting it before her. "One-on-one, or all at once?"
By Damien's side, Ogerpon was a sweet, clingy little sister.
But this shy, socially anxious girl transformed on the battlefield, becoming more ferocious than anyone.
One swing, one KO; three swings, hearts shattered.
Her record of leaving a certain peach-themed hero with centuries of trauma wasn't for show.
I, Ogerpon, the Mini Kaido of Kitakami!
No-named foes, taste my Shuron Hakke!
***

.
[Day 666: I fully absorbed a certain crawling chaos fragment within me. From now on, I am the Fifth Pillar.]

chapters.title: Chapter 31 31: [TP] 31: Destroyer
chapters.content:
"Please guide me, Lady Ogerpon."
The first to step up was Benimaru, the young leader of the Ogre Tribe.
Brandishing his katana, his towering 2.5-meter frame loomed over Ogerpon like a mountain.
Yet, despite the stark size difference, it was Benimaru who felt nervous, not Ogerpon.
"Just one?"
Ogerpon tilted her head, her playful, adorable demeanor instantly winning the hearts of the ogres.
My Ogerpon's too cute.
Damien, alongside the ogre leader and Hakurou, stood at the arena's edge on a high vantage point.
From here, they had a clear view of Ogerpon's battles with the Ogre Tribe.
"I want to know how far I am from a true A-rank!"
"A-rank?"
At Benimaru's words, Ogerpon tilted her head again.
But she wasn't just A-rank.
Her magicule level was A-rank, true, but her actual combat power was firmly Special A-tier.
If Benimaru was using Ogerpon as a benchmark for A-rank Majins, he was in for a rude awakening.
"Please, enlighten me!"
Unaware he'd underestimated Ogerpon's strength, Benimaru raised his katana, assuming a middle guard stance.
"Alright."
"As you wish…"
Ogerpon looked up, twirling her green vine club as if it weighed nothing.
A-rank or not didn't matter.
Her goal was simply to claim Benimaru's experience points.
"Ready?"
"Yes... "
Whoosh!
The moment Benimaru replied, his pupils shrank.
In an instant, Ogerpon vanished from his sight.
Fast!
So fast that, among the entire village, only Hakurou barely caught a glimpse of her movement.
"What?"
By the time Benimaru reacted, a tidal wave of monstrous force surged toward him.
The burly red-haired ogre instinctively raised his katana to block.
But Ogerpon's vine club stopped just short of his face.
Boom!!
Before Benimaru could recover from the shock, a fierce gust from her swing hit him.
The next moment, he was sent flying, crashing through several wooden houses and disappearing down the street.
"This…"
The entire Ogre Tribe froze, stunned.
Silence fell, as if they couldn't process Ogerpon's seemingly effortless strike.
What just happened?
They only saw Ogerpon vanish and reappear.
Then their young leader flew like a meteor and passed out.
High-speed movement?
No!
Hakurou, standing beside Damien, was startled by his own guess. Was that spatial teleportation? She has such a skill?
But what about that overwhelming force in her swing?
Hakurou's combat experience was vast. In the original story, he'd deduced Rimuru's skill origins from brief contact.
But this time, he was stumped.
"Young Lord!!!"
Finally, some ogres snapped out of it.
They rushed frantically toward where Benimaru had landed.
After digging through the rubble, they pulled out an unconscious Benimaru.
"Young Lord?"
"Young Lord, are you okay? Young Lord?!!"
Fortunately, the village had an experienced healer.
After examining Benimaru, they found he was merely unconscious, with minimal injuries.
"He's just out cold." The healer said. "Most of his wounds are superficial. With our ogre recovery, he'll heal quickly."
"Phew…"
Relieved by the healer's diagnosis, the ogres relaxed.
After the initial panic, they felt awe for Ogerpon's power and marvel at her precise control.
"So strong!"
"Not only is Lady Ogerpon powerful, but her mastery of force is incredible!"
"Unbelievable."
"Besides Elder, I've never seen anyone do this."
The "Elder" was of course Hakurou.
Yet even he struggled to replicate Ogerpon's delicate balance of injuring without killing.
It involved techniques beyond most people's comprehension.
Hakurou didn't know this stemmed from Konosuba's martial arts, transformed by Cardinal World rules into a new class system.
Before now, the Cardinal World had no equivalent skills.
In terms of martial prowess, Ogerpon stood at the Cardinal World's peak, matched only by a few human grandmasters.
Hakurou's swordsmanship neared that level, but age had sapped his strength.
"Don't worry, Ogerpon held back."
Damien said, "Bring him over."
Despite such destruction, Benimaru's light injuries proved Ogerpon's restraint.
Soon, the unconscious Benimaru was brought to Damien.
"Healing Magic!"
Damien raised his hand, golden magicules cascading down. Benimaru's wounds healed visibly.
This miraculous sight drew gasps from the ogres.
"His injuries are healed. He'll wake up soon."
After treating Benimaru, Damien turned to Hakurou. "With your experience, Elder, did you catch the finesse in Ogerpon's strike?"
"I'm afraid I'm too dull." Hakurou shook his head, sighing. "I couldn't grasp the mystery of Lady Ogerpon's move. Please, Mr. Damien, enlighten me."
He didn't voice his initial guess.
He'd thought Ogerpon used some kind of spatial teleportation to cross dozens of meters instantly.
But he quickly dismissed it.
It wasn't teleportation.
Her movement was something Hakurou couldn't comprehend... a bizarre technique.
"It's destruction."
Damien didn't tease him, explaining the essence of Ogerpon's strike. "Ogerpon has the power to completely destroy anything she touches."
***
Hi guys, I hope you're all doing well! I want to share that I'm currently working on a new project related to Lord of Mysteries.
If you're interested, feel free to visit my profile and start reading. Below is a brief summary:
[Lord of Mysteries: Incarnation of Chaos]
Have you ever wondered what would happen if someone from a Lovecraftian world got isekai'd into another world built on Lovecraftian themes? Well, it's absolute chaos.
Meet Alaric, a human(questionably) survivor of the madness and chaos caused by a certain crawling chaos, who, thanks to the kindness of a certain bubble daddy, got isekai'd into the "fake it till you make it" world.
What will he do in this strange new world? Climb the ladder of power to become that impossible god unless you're just a pawn of a certain russian priest or a certain goth mommy?
Or become a cheshire cat, leaping onto the 4D chessboard to disrupt the schemes and mind games of these bizarre folks?
For Alaric, it's not a tough choice. But before he picks either path, he must, of course, uphold the time-honored tradition of isekai'd victims(questionably) that forms the foundation of this world.
What's that tradition?
Keeping a diary.
---
[Alaric's Transmigration Diary]
[Day 1: I encountered Amon. Used a special technique to summon a projection of the Ancient Sun God, who personally delivered a heavy slap to Amon. Hope Amon appreciates this weighty paternal affection.]
[Day 2: I received an invitation from the Aurora Order. Told them I want it all... looks, brains, and combat prowess... and invited them to join my newly founded Joker Club.]
[Day 3: I met Leonard and acknowledged Gramps Pallez. Declined Leonard's enthusiastic suggestion for the old man to move in with me, as I'd rather not have a old man critiquing my every move, even in private moments.]
[Day 4: I told Klein I plan to pray to a deity named The Fool. Watched his eyes widen in shock and kindly offered him some eye drops.]
[Day 5: I listened to Medici perform a two-hour comedy routine. Suggested he go professional and invited him to share a meal.]
.
.
.
[Day 666: I fully absorbed a certain crawling chaos fragment within me. From now on, I am the Fifth Pillar.]

chapters.title: Chapter 32 32: [TP] 32: Godly Skill
chapters.content:
"Destruction?!"
Hakurou's pupils narrowed as he realized something. "Could it be?! Did her strike just shatter the air and space itself?"
"So that's how it is…"
Seeing Damien's silent smile, Hakurou was inwardly shocked, his hand trembling as he stroked his beard.
Ogerpon's spatial movement wasn't a spatial skill but a variant of Destroyer.
By breaking space itself, she achieved an ultra-violent instant leap.
This method was far swifter than standard coordinate-based teleportation and nearly impossible to disrupt.
Of course, crossing shattered space would severely damage most bodies.
Only someone like Ogerpon, with her monstrous physical strength and bug-level recovery, could dare use such a method.
"How reckless…"
Hakurou's lips twitched, finding Ogerpon's approach absurd.
"And what about the force in her strike?"
"Oh, that?" Damien replied. "Besides her sheer superhuman strength, it's likely because she used Destroyer to pulverize everything in her path."
After her evolution, Ogerpon's Destroyer skill had deepened.
Before, it could only destroy what she saw or touched.
Now, she could obliterate phenomena like air resistance, gravity, light, and sound based on her needs.
"A violent strike that shatters space and destroys rules."
Had Ogerpon not held back, letting her vine club land on Benimaru's head, Hakurou and the ogre leader couldn't imagine the outcome.
At minimum, his head would've exploded.
Part of the village behind him might've been obliterated by the shockwave.
"This is Lady Ogerpon's power?"
Shion and Souei, watching the duel, had expected Benimaru's defeat but not his inability to withstand a single move.
And Ogerpon had gone easy.
"Cough! Cough, cough, cough!"
Damien's healing magic was remarkable. Benimaru soon stirred.
Sitting up dazed, the memory of Ogerpon's strike flashed in his mind, making his heart skip.
Only when Souei called out did he snap back.
"Thank you for your guidance, Lady Ogerpon!"
Benimaru bowed sincerely, utterly convinced of her strength.
He was certain her power far exceeded A-rank.
A-rank was just her magicule level; her combat prowess was likely Disaster-Class (Special A).
"Want to go again?"
"Anyone can try, as many times as you like."
Ogerpon slung her vine club over her shoulder, scanning the ogres with a challenge.
"Don't worry about getting hurt. Ogerpon won't go too far."
Damien didn't mention that, in case of an accident, he could revive them.
Resurrection, the ultimate skill of Konosuba's High Priest class.
His version wasn't as overpowered as Aqua's.
It had strict limits: the body had to be mostly intact, missing no more than 30%, and death couldn't exceed five minutes.
The five-minute limit wasn't absolute.
It hinged on the soul. If the soul remained and Damien could reconstruct the body, revival was straightforward.
"Uh-huh, I'll go easy."
Ogerpon flashed a pure smile.
Pokémon loved to fight, and even as a monster, Ogerpon retained that trait.
Over the next three days, under the guise of assessing the village's strength, Ogerpon beat up all 250 ogres, including the kids.
She was measured, though.
With the young ones, she mostly played, even when knocking them away.
Benimaru, despite his loss, didn't give up.
This time, he teamed up with Souei, Shion, and a dozen others.
The outcome was predictable.
Against absolute strength, numbers meant nothing.
Whether facing one, dozens, or a hundred-strong ogre legion, they couldn't touch Ogerpon.
Only elites like Hakurou and the ogre leader gave her a slight thrill.
Hakurou's swordsmanship was cunning and elusive.
But Ogerpon's perception was uncanny, and with Grassy Terrain, she could lock onto enemies using natural elements.
The ogre leader was immensely strong and durable.
Yet he faced Ogerpon's Destroyer skill.
Her vine club, empowered by Destroyer, was like the mythical Monkey King's staff... one graze caused injury, one hit meant death.
Hakurou's sword merely brushed her vine club and shattered into fragments.
The ogre leader fared worse.
His arm, grazed by the club, turned to blood mist, half his body reduced to pulp.
Thankfully, Damien's god-tier healing magic saved him, restoring him fully.
This battle made the Ogre Tribe fully grasp Ogerpon's terror.
A-rank magicules, Special A-rank combat power.
Ogerpon earned their respect and awe, claiming the title of the tribe's strongest.
"Damien, Ogerpon feels stronger!"
"Indeed."
In their wooden house, Damien set up a soundproof barrier. He gently stroked the now-teenage Ogerpon's hair, praising, "Two hundred fifty ogres, the weakest at B--rank, the strongest, Hakurou, at B+."
On average, each ogre gave Ogerpon about 80 magicules.
Her magicules surged from 12,000 to 33,000.
"Thanks to you, Ogerpon, I can break through to A-rank too."
Leader granted Damien 50% of his familiar's existence points. With his original 1,500, he now had 18,000... well beyond A-rank standards.
[Detected that individual 'Damien' meets evolution conditions. Evolve?]
The Voice of the World had sounded in Damien's mind halfway through Ogerpon's battles.
But he held off, waiting for Ogerpon to peak before breaking through.
"Ogerpon won't let anyone disturb Damien!"
As she spoke, Ogerpon wove a magic barrier outside Damien's soundproof one to block magicule fluctuations, ensuring his evolution went unnoticed.
"I'm counting on you, Ogerpon."
Seeing Ogerpon stand guard with her vine club, Damien silently commanded, "Evolve!"
***

chapters.title: Chapter 33 33: [TP] 33: Dragonoid
chapters.content:
"Argh!!"
As evolution began, the vast magicules within Damien surged chaotically.
A searing pain tore through his body, forcing a cry of agony from his lips.
"Damien!!"
Ogerpon jumped in alarm.
She wanted to check on him, but a voice in her mind urged her not to interfere.
This was normal... a transformation unique to Damien.
He wasn't pure human or Majin but a hybrid of both.
This intense reaction was the awakening of his Majinic bloodline!
[Bloodline Appraisal Initiated…]
Until now, Damien had been unaware of his Majinic heritage.
Only as the Voice of the World echoed did his Majinic bloodline fully activate.
[Appraisal Complete: Pseudo-Dragonoid Bloodline Activated]
[Acquired Exclusive Skill: Stardust Manipulation]
[Evolution Successful: Individual 'Damien' Gains Race 'Dragonoid (Pseudo)']
[Skill 'Appraisal' Upgraded to Extra Skill 'Dragon's Eye']
[...]
As the pain subsided, the Voice of the World's prompts flooded Damien's mind, overwhelming him just as he began to recover.
But this time, instead of distress, he felt exhilaration.
Stardust Manipulation!
It's actually Stardust Manipulation!!
And Dragonoid? Damien never imagined his body's latent Majinic bloodline would be dragonoid.
Moreover, it stemmed from the Cardinal World's pinnacle, the Star Dragon King!
In Tensuraverse, 'Dragonoid' wasn't a race but a designation for a singular entity: Milim, one of the three oldest Demon Lords.
Milim, daughter of the Star Dragon King and human Lucia, inherited her father's infinite magicules and dragonoid bloodline, making her the unique 'Dragonoid.'
Now, the Voice of the World had granted Damien the 'Dragonoid' race.
Pseudo-Dragonoid, but still Dragonoid!
However…
After the initial thrill, Damien pondered, Where did this body's dragonoid bloodline come from?
Milim could be ruled out.
She was a little girl, unlikely to have human offspring.
Excluding natural reproduction, Damien could only think of one explanation: Magicule Contamination.
In the original story, the Storm Dragon Veldora's leaking magicules birthed Charybdis.
Powerful magicules could spawn independent lifeforms, so it wasn't a stretch that they could infuse someone with partial power.
"So, my body's ancestors were exposed to the Star Dragon King's or Milim's magicules."
"And they were lucky enough to survive, passing those magicule factors through their bloodline."
Given Milim's unique Dragonoid status, Damien doubted any of his ancestors had awakened this power.
This aligned with his original body's memories of entirely human ancestors.
"The Star Dragon King's bloodline was too potent, preventing my ancestors from awakening it."
Damien wondered, "So why did I awaken it?"
Reflecting on his uniqueness, he considered his Planeswalker talent.
The ability to traverse worlds was likely the key to activating his dragonoid bloodline.
A faint dragonoid bloodline, combined with Planeswalker's world-hopping and the Cardinal World's magicules, created this miracle.
Sure, 'Pseudo' was tagged onto Dragonoid.
Damien estimated he'd need to become a Demon Lord Seed, or fully awaken as a True Demon Lord, to drop the 'Pseudo.'
"No matter. It's only a matter of time."
"Gaining the Dragonoid bloodline opens an evolution path with immense potential."
"Most importantly, I've acquired Stardust Manipulation early."
Even with knowledge of the original novel, Damien's understanding of stardust was limited.
Stardust, simply put, was highly compressed, concentrated magicules.
Just as matter consists of atoms and molecules, magicules have a base unit: Spiritons.
Damien had previously puzzled over magicule values.
For example, why was 9,999 magicules B-rank, while 10,000 was A-rank, despite a mere 1-point difference?
A 10,000-magicule A-rank monster could easily crush a 9,999-magicule B-rank one.
Was that 1-point gap really so vast?
Shouldn't breaking from B to A-rank cause a massive magicule surge?
Now, Damien understood.
That 1-point difference was a qualitative leap.
Below 10,000, magicules were measured in spiritons.
9,999 magicules could be broken down into 99.99 million spiritons.
But upon reaching A-rank, a monster's magicules became a cohesive whole.
The base unit shifted from spiritons to pure magicules.
10,000 magicules were exactly that... 10,000 magicules.
They were indivisible unless the A-rank monster chose otherwise, making it impossible for outsiders to break them down into spiritons.
This transformation massively increased an A-rank's weight in the Cardinal World.
When A-rank collided with anything below, the latter would shatter instantly.
A-rank control was also beyond B-rank imagination.
They could split one magicule into millions of spiritons for precise manipulation, achieving effects far surpassing their B-rank days.
This was the A-rank's voluntary separation.
Others couldn't harm you, but you could wield your power with greater finesse.
This disparity formed the A-rank divide.
"Maybe this explains the difference between Skills, Intrinsic Skills, and Unique Skills."
"Only Special A-rank monsters possess Unique Skills…"
Damien mused, "Conversely, reincarnators with Unique Skills, if developed properly, will eventually reach Special A-rank."
Unique Skills were likely the product of refined magicules, recognized by the Voice of the World.
"So, A-rank to Special A-rank is about finding your path."
"Find it, and you ascend to Special A-rank, earning the Demon Lord Seed title."
Damien roughly grasped the monster-to-Majin-Lord evolution process. "I have four Unique Skills: Planeswalker, Leader, Capturer, and Learner."
Capturer and Leader weren't particularly strong on their own.
Compared to Rimuru's near-omnipotent Predator, they paled.
Capturer allowed contracting high-potential individuals, waiting for them to grow, then letting the Voice of the World elevate the user.
The results were promising but difficult.
Capturer lacked combat power, making the user vulnerable early on.
Without a noble or lordly status to command loyalty, it was nearly useless.
Leader was easier.
Theoretically, anyone willing to follow could contribute magicules.
But their contribution wouldn't match Ogerpon's 50% yield.
Most followers offered maybe 3%.
How many subordinates would Damien need to amass enough magicules for Demon Lord Seed?
"Without a decade or two, building such a force is impossible."
Fortunately, Leader and Capturer complemented each other.
Combined, their effect rivaled Rimuru's Predator.
Planeswalker's limitless potential was immeasurable, so he set it aside.
Lastly, Learner wasn't far behind Predator.
Copying and enhancing abilities was a cheat-tier skill in any isekai novel.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 34 34: [TP] 34: Skill Potential
chapters.content:
"If we categorize Unique Skills, Learner would rank alongside Predator as a high-tier Unique Skill."
"Meanwhile, Leader and Capturer, with their growth potential, would be mid-tier Unique Skills."
Despite their flaws, Leader and Capturer were far superior to the skills of some summoned reincarnators in the original story.
Damien recalled three otherworlders from the source material.
Shogo's Berserker, Kirara's Bewitching Orator, and Kyoya's Slasher.
In Damien's view, their Unique Skills were inferior to Leader and Capturer.
These skills were more ability-focused, granting decent combat power upon acquisition.
However, Berserker, Bewitching Orator, and Slasher had clear weaknesses: limited growth potential.
Damien believed Unique Skills truly shone after breaking through to Special A-rank.
Take his Leader and Capturer.
Even as a Demon Lord, he could keep strengthening himself with these skills.
"By this classification, Ogerpon's Destroyer would be a low-tier Unique Skill."
Damien pondered, then opened his current status panel.
[Damien]
[Race: Dragonoid (Pseudo)]
[Rank: A-rank Upper Majin (18,060 EP)]
[Class: Mage]
[Common Skills: Domestic Magic, Healing Magic, Elemental Magic, Pokémon Magic, etc.]
[Intrinsic Skills: Adaptability, All-Class Mastery]
[Extra Skills: Dragon's Eye, Explosion Magic]
[Unique Skills: Planeswalker [Exceptional], Leader, Capturer, Learner]
[Special Skills: Magicule Solidification, Stardust Manipulation]
[Familiars: Ogerpon (1/12)]
[Marked Worlds: Pokémonverse, Konosubaverse]
Skills were ranked by strength and rarity: Common Skills, Extra Skills, Unique Skills.
Special Skills were outliers, unmeasurable by strength alone and uncopyable.
Extra Skills, also called Additional or EX Skills, were another tier.
Intrinsic Skills were typically passive or tied to racial traits.
"Over 18,000 magicules, and my familiar slots jumped from 6 to 12."
"C-rank gave 3 slots, B-rank 6, and now A-rank gives 12."
Damien's original plan was to seek familiars in other worlds, like Ogerpon.
"The slot increase is faster than I expected."
He thought, "Maybe I don't need to focus solely on other worlds."
"The Cardinal World has plenty of potential candidates too."
Take the Ogre Tribe's Shuna, Shion, Benimaru, and Souei, who in the original story had the potential to awaken Ultimate Skills.
Souei's future magicule count exceeded 1.2 million, while Shion and Benimaru, with specialized weapons, surpassed 5 million each.
Excluding Shuna, the trio's combined magicules reached 11.2 million.
With a 50% feedback rate, taking them as familiars could yield over 6 million magicules.
Allocating four slots to them wouldn't just break even... it'd be a massive gain.
"Half my familiar slots should go to nurturing hub-world talents."
Damien didn't forget the other 250+ ogres. "Even if they can't become familiars, Leader can draw power from followers."
Familiars gave 50%, named followers 15%.
Regular followers, based on loyalty, provided 1-3% magicules.
Excluding B--rank children, the remaining 200+ ogres averaged 6,500 magicules.
At a minimum 1% feedback, that's 65 × 200, nearly 13,000 magicules.
With high loyalty, it could hit 40,000.
"But meeting the conditions for recruitment isn't that simple."
Leader's ability to harness collective power was powerful but not without limits.
A mere "I pledge loyalty" wouldn't make someone a follower.
A genuine, heartfelt submission was required to form a magicule bond.
The Ogre Tribe revered strength, but reverence wasn't allegiance.
"Is there a way to quickly earn monsters' loyalty?"
"Wait!"
Damien had an idea. "Naming!"
Yes, naming!
It was the simplest, most direct way to secure the Ogre Tribe's loyalty.
With 18,000 magicules, Damien couldn't touch the 10,000 threshold, leaving 8,000 for naming.
The strongest ogres, Hakurou and the ogre leader, had 9,000 and 8,500 magicules, respectively.
Naming them would cost 2,500 magicules.
"At 10,000 magicules, Hakurou and the ogre leader could evolve into Oni."
"With named followers providing 15% magicules, I'd gain at least 3,000 back."
"So, this deal doesn't lose... it nets me 500."
Naming ogres with over 8,500 magicules was essentially cost-free.
"Damien, your aura... it's so much stronger!"
"Yeah."
Damien smiled. "Thanks to you, Ogerpon, I evolved successfully."
"I'm now an upper Majin, just like you."
Ogerpon was thrilled at Damien's evolution, happier than when she grew stronger herself.
"Ogerpon, can you fetch the red-haired guy, uh…"
Damien almost said 'Benimaru' but remembered they hadn't been named yet.
With no choice, he described Shuna, Shion, Benimaru, and Souei's appearances for Ogerpon to fetch them.
"Ogerpon's on it!"
The little girl took the order and bounced out eagerly.
"Slow down, don't trip!"
"I won't! Ogerpon's not clumsy!"
Ogerpon turned back, sticking out her tongue. "Only dummies trip on flat ground!"
With that, she sped up instead of slowing down.
"This girl…"
Watching Ogerpon's playful antics, Damien couldn't help but smile.
His little sister figure was always so lively, her cheer infectious.
No matter the moment, being with Ogerpon always lifted his spirits.
***

What will he do in this strange new world? Climb the ladder of power to become that impossible god unless you're just a pawn of a certain russian priest or a certain goth mommy?
Or become a cheshire cat, leaping onto the 4D chessboard to disrupt the schemes and mind games of these bizarre folks?
For Alaric, it's not a tough choice. But before he picks either path, he must, of course, uphold the time-honored tradition of isekai'd victims(questionably) that forms the foundation of this world.
What's that tradition?
Keeping a diary.
---
[Alaric's Transmigration Diary]
[Day 1: I encountered Amon. Used a special technique to summon a projection of the Ancient Sun God, who personally delivered a heavy slap to Amon. Hope Amon appreciates this weighty paternal affection.]
[Day 2: I received an invitation from the Aurora Order. Told them I want it all... looks, brains, and combat prowess... and invited them to join my newly founded Joker Club.]
[Day 3: I met Leonard and acknowledged Gramps Pallez. Declined Leonard's enthusiastic suggestion for the old man to move in with me, as I'd rather not have a old man critiquing my every move, even in private moments.]
[Day 4: I told Klein I plan to pray to a deity named The Fool. Watched his eyes widen in shock and kindly offered him some eye drops.]
[Day 5: I listened to Medici perform a two-hour comedy routine. Suggested he go professional and invited him to share a meal.]
.
.
.
[Day 666: I fully absorbed a certain crawling chaos fragment within me. From now on, I am the Fifth Pillar.]

chapters.title: Chapter 35 35: [TP] 35: New Familiars
chapters.content:
"Lord Damien?"
Soon after, Benimaru, Shuna, Shion, and Souei followed Ogerpon into Damien's wooden house, kneeling respectfully.
They intended to ask why Damien had summoned them.
But upon looking up, they noticed a change in him.
This?!
Such a powerful aura!
How did Lord Damien grow so much stronger so suddenly?
Damien's evolution left them stunned.
They knew monsters underwent a transformation called evolution upon breaking through bottlenecks.
But Damien's evolution was eerily silent.
They'd seen him just an hour or two ago.
Now, his aura had surged from early B-rank to this overwhelming level.
The gap between 10,000 and 9,999 magicules was just 1 point.
Yet that single point felt like a tangible, crushing pressure to the ogres.
"Oh, sorry, my bad."
Damien reined in his unstable, post-evolution magicules, suppressing his presence to B-rank levels.
This eased the ogres' discomfort.
It also made them realize why Damien seemed so much stronger.
Was Lord Damien hiding his strength all along?
No wonder!
Benimaru thought, How could a B-rank monster unleash such cataclysmic magic?
It makes sense if he was concealing his true power.
Growing more convinced, Benimaru pondered Damien's real strength.
A-rank?
Definitely, given the oppressive magicule aura he'd just exuded.
But Benimaru suspected that wasn't Damien's full power.
Could Lord Damien be Special A-rank?
The thought gripped him. Yes, even Lady Ogerpon is A-rank. For her to follow him, Lord Damien must be even stronger.
Special A-rank.
That was the most powerful existence Benimaru could imagine.
Beyond that lay the legendary Demon Lords (Demon Lord Seeds).
"Don't be nervous. I called you here to discuss something."
Damien calmed the four, then spoke gently. "I'd like you to become my familiars. Are you willing?"
"Familiars?"
"Yeah, like Ogerpon."
Damien paused, framing it in terms they'd understand. "Think of it as followers or 'retainers.'"
With his Capturer Unique Skill and strength surpassing theirs, Damien could forcibly bind them.
But he disliked coercion.
And he wanted genuinely loyal subordinates.
"Familiars are different from regular followers. They're more like my companions."
Damien didn't mention the benefits, focusing instead on the bond.
To him, familiars shouldn't be tied to profit.
Saying, "Become my familiar, and you'll get stronger," would taint the oath, making it less pure.
"I'm willing!"
The first to speak wasn't Benimaru or Souei but Shuna.
"It's an honor to be companions with Lady Ogerpon."
Shuna added, "And if not for Lord Damien's intervention, I'd have died to that bug monster."
"A life debt can't be repaid easily."
"I may be unworthy, but I wish to serve at your side."
With that, Shuna gracefully bowed to Damien.
"Uh…"
Damien hesitated but didn't refuse.
Whatever her reasons, Shuna's desire to repay him was sincere. That was enough.
"No need for that."
"As my familiar, we're family now."
Smiling, Damien said, "Welcome aboard."
"That's not fair!"
Seeing Damien accept Shuna, Shion turned to Benimaru apologetically. "Sorry, Young Lord, but I also want to be Lord Damien's familiar."
"I understand."
Though called the Young Lord and heir to the village, Benimaru's title was nominal.
At least, Shion and Souei hadn't formally sworn fealty to him.
The four were childhood friends, not master and servant.
Shion's reason mirrored Shuna's.
In that desperate moment, Damien and Ogerpon had saved them.
A life debt was paramount.
Now that Damien offered, why would Shion refuse?
Besides, Damien emphasized he sought trusted companions, not slaves.
That sincerity alone could sway many ogres, let alone Shuna and Shion, who owed him their lives.
"May I ask, Lord Damien, what are your plans?"
Souei, usually taciturn, spoke up. He wasn't opposed to following Damien.
The Ogre Tribe often worked as mercenaries across the Jura Forest.
Being Damien's retainer wasn't much different from mercenary work.
The latter was temporary; the former demanded lifelong loyalty.
Damien's strength and Ogerpon's power fit the monster world's need to follow the strong.
But if that were all, the original story's Gelmud wouldn't have failed with the Ogre Tribe.
What truly moved Souei was Damien's definition of familiars.
Not servants or underlings, but family.
For such a lord, Souei was willing to pledge his loyalty.
"My plans?"
Damien said, "Probably to gather strength and become a Demon Lord."
Demon Lord!!
The words stunned the four, their faces etched with shock.
"You have such ambitions?" Souei's expression grew solemn, but his tone was earnest. "I'm willing to be your shadow, aiding you in achieving Demon Lord greatness!!"
Finding a lord of such caliber, worth dying for, was Souei's dream!
"Shadow, huh…"
Seeing Souei's sincerity, Damien nodded. "Alright, I'll be counting on you."
***
Hi guys, I hope you're all doing well! I want to share that I'm currently working on a new project related to Lord of Mysteries.
If you're interested, feel free to visit my profile and start reading. Below is a brief summary:
[Lord of Mysteries: Incarnation of Chaos]
Have you ever wondered what would happen if someone from a Lovecraftian world got isekai'd into another world built on Lovecraftian themes? Well, it's absolute chaos.

Or become a cheshire cat, leaping onto the 4D chessboard to disrupt the schemes and mind games of these bizarre folks?
For Alaric, it's not a tough choice. But before he picks either path, he must, of course, uphold the time-honored tradition of isekai'd victims(questionably) that forms the foundation of this world.
What's that tradition?
Keeping a diary.
---
[Alaric's Transmigration Diary]
[Day 1: I encountered Amon. Used a special technique to summon a projection of the Ancient Sun God, who personally delivered a heavy slap to Amon. Hope Amon appreciates this weighty paternal affection.]
[Day 2: I received an invitation from the Aurora Order. Told them I want it all... looks, brains, and combat prowess... and invited them to join my newly founded Joker Club.]
[Day 3: I met Leonard and acknowledged Gramps Pallez. Declined Leonard's enthusiastic suggestion for the old man to move in with me, as I'd rather not have a old man critiquing my every move, even in private moments.]
[Day 4: I told Klein I plan to pray to a deity named The Fool. Watched his eyes widen in shock and kindly offered him some eye drops.]
