chapters.title: Chapter 36 36: [TP] 36: Naming
chapters.content:
Accepting the loyalty of Shuna, Shion, and Souei, Damien turned his gaze to Benimaru.
The red-haired young lord of the Ogre Tribe was visibly conflicted.
With his sister and two childhood friends choosing to follow Damien, Benimaru also felt the urge to become his retainer.
Especially after Damien declared his ambition to become a Demon Lord.
Personally, having been crushed by Ogerpon's overwhelming power, Benimaru already respected Damien.
Serving such a formidable figure brought him no shame.
But there was a problem.
"I'm sorry."
Benimaru's reluctance was palpable, yet he made his choice. "I'm the young lord of the Ogre Tribe. I can't abandon the village."
"So, please forgive me, but I cannot follow you, Lord Damien!"
"I see…"
Far from being upset, Damien admired Benimaru's resolve, thinking he was indeed the man who, in the original story, became the Grand Marshal of the Jura Tempest Federation.
With such responsibility, Benimaru's presence would allow Damien to venture to other worlds with peace of mind, knowing the Cardinal World was secure.
"You've misunderstood."
Damien waved a hand. "I don't plan to leave the Ogre Tribe's village."
"What?"
Benimaru was stunned, as were Shuna, Shion, and Souei.
"You mean…"
"I want to take in the Ogre Tribe!"
Damien didn't hide his ambition. "I'll make this place my stronghold, the foundation for my path to Demon Lord!"
"This!"
The four exchanged glances, momentarily at a loss.
Taking in the Ogre Tribe was, in essence, conquering it.
If anyone else had said this, Benimaru and the others would have fought to the death.
The Ogre Tribe would rather die than submit to force.
But Damien was different.
First, his life-saving grace... Damien and Ogerpon had preserved the village's younger generation, securing its future.
Then, Ogerpon had single-handedly defeated the entire tribe.
No fancy magic, just raw power.
With her vine club and fists, she dominated them in their own domain.
An upper-tier Majin of their kin, a savior of their village, combined with Damien's charisma and friendly attitude.
Rather than conquest, it felt like Damien and Ogerpon wanted to become part of them.
"Conquest?"
Shion blurted out, "It's more like Lord Damien wants to protect us and lead us further!"
"Exactly."
Shuna tugged at her brother's sleeve, her meaning clear.
If they didn't seize this opportunity, they'd be fools.
"Please accept my loyalty, Lord Damien!"
Benimaru didn't hesitate, pressing his hands to the ground. "I can't decide for the village, but I'm willing to follow you!"
He was only the young lord; the true chief was his father.
But so what?
On the matter of pledging to Damien, Benimaru chose his side.
Besides, he didn't believe his father was blind to the situation.
Gaining Damien and Ogerpon's protection for the mere cost of leadership?
Shuna and Benimaru locked eyes.
The siblings saw the same thought in each other: If Father doesn't get it, we don't mind staging a coup to show him what it means to adapt.
"Welcome as my companions."
Damien raised his hand, and four invisible oaths enveloped them. "I hereby grant you names."
"Benimaru!"
"Shion!"
"Shuna!"
"Souei!"
Damien kept their names as in the original story.
The four, receiving his names, were filled with disbelief.
They'd thought Damien's call for followers was nominal, never expecting him to name them.
"Lord Damien!!"
Shocked, they worried for him.
Naming monsters consumed vast magicules, harming the giver's strength.
"No need to worry."
"Feel the changes within you."
To Damien, magicules were like currency.
Using Capturer, he began binding the four as familiars.
Benimaru's base magicules were 7,500, Shion's 7,000, Souei's 7,200, and Shuna's 6,500.
With Leader, 50% of their magicules would bolster Damien.
That equated to gaining 14,100 magicules out of thin air.
Naming required two conditions.
First, a significant magicule gap between the namer and named.
Thus, Hakurou and the ogre leader, both under 10,000, couldn't name each other to reach A-rank.
In the original story, Rimuru named the Storm Dragon Veldora via a soul-level equal contract, not standard naming.
Second, naming required enough magicules to trigger evolution.
To name the four, their magicules needed to reach 10,000+.
Only then could they evolve from Ogres to Oni.
"10,800 magicules?"
But since Damien would recover half via Leader, the actual cost was only 5,400.
"So, I'm gaining 9,000 magicules."
Not only did he avoid loss, but his magicules rose from 18,000 to around 27,000.
If 10,000+ was A-rank, then nearing 30,000 made Damien and Ogerpon mid-tier A-rank.
Recruiting hub-world monsters as familiars was advantageous since Damien knew their ranks and magicule counts upfront.
Unlike Ogerpon, who was a blind box until brought to the Cardinal World.
With potential travel to dangerous worlds ahead, Damien aimed to bolster his forces.
With Shuna, Shion, Benimaru, and Souei as familiars, he could take them to new worlds via his spatial storage, like Ogerpon.
Four low-tier A-ranks and one mid-tier A-rank as escorts boosted his security immensely.
Boom!!!
The simultaneous evolution of four ogres caused a commotion greater than Damien's.
Without a barrier to conceal it, the uproar drew the attention of Hakurou and the other ogres.
Soon, countless ogres swarmed Damien's house, surrounding it.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 37 37: [TP] 37: Evolution
chapters.content:
"What's that commotion?"
Hakurou's gaze sharpened. "Such intense Magicule fluctuations... there's no mistake. A monster is evolving to a higher level!"
"Evolution?!"
The Red Ogre leader was utterly shocked, sensing the auras of Benimaru, Shuna, and others within the Magicules.
If his perception was correct, didn't that mean the ones evolving were them?!
"Everyone, stay calm and don't disturb Benimaru and the others."
Damien emerged from the wooden house with Ogerpon, briefly explaining what had happened inside to Hakurou and the others.
Upon hearing that Damien had expended his own Magicules to name Benimaru, Shuna, Shion, and Souei, the Red Ogre leader's expression changed instantly.
"Thank you, Lord Damien!"
"Our Ogre tribe pledges to follow your lead and serve at your command!"
Once Benimaru and the others completed their evolution, they would become four new A-rank Kijin.
The Ogre tribe's rise in the Jura Forest was now unstoppable, and at such a time, a powerful and wise leader was crucial.
Like Benimaru and Shuna, the Red Ogre leader chose to submit to Damien.
Soon after, as the Magicule fluctuations subsided, four figures emerged from the wooden house... none other than the newly evolved Benimaru, Shuna, Shion, and Souei.
As in the original novel, their appearances had undergone dramatic changes.
"Lord Damien!"
Benimaru and Souei knelt on one knee, pledging their loyalty to Damien.
Shuna and Shion, being women, knelt on both knees, bowing gracefully to Damien and vowing their unwavering devotion.
Of course, such oaths held little practical weight.
Not only were the four already Damien's subordinates, bound to obey his commands, but the naming system of this Cardinal World ensured that those named would feel a deep, almost familial dependence and obedience toward the one who named them.
This change was subtle.
For instance, Shuna and Shion now gazed at Damien with eyes full of affection and admiration, a stark contrast to their previous awe.
"Rise." Damien said, gesturing for the four to stand. He then used his Dragon Eye to appraise their current attributes.
[Benimaru]
[Race: Ogre → Kijin]
[Magicules: A-rank Upper Majin (12000 EP)]
[Magic: Battlewill, Sorcery, Fire-type Pokemon Magic]
[Extra Abilities: Magic Perception, Space Manipulation, Tyrant's Flame, Magic Flame Transformation]
[Unique Skill: Great Marshal (Thought Acceleration, Thought Domination, Predictive Calculation, Army Inspiration)]
[Special Skill: Magic Solidification]
[Resistances: Status Abnormality Nullification, Pain Nullification, Physical Attack Nullification, Natural Influence Resistance, Mental Attack Resistance, Holy Magic Attack Resistance]
Benimaru's Magicules weren't 10,000 but 12,000.
The additional 2,000 Magicules had nothing to do with Damien.
They were purely a gift from the Voice of the World upon Benimaru's evolution, effectively granting Damien an extra 1,000 Magicules in return.
"Great Marshal... indeed, a commanding-type unique skill."
Its emergence confirmed Benimaru's potential to grow into a Demon Lord-class being.
"Battlewill and Sorcery must be inherited from the Ogre tribe, variants of Aura Combat and special magic."
Most of the remaining abilities stemmed from Damien or were granted through his naming and subordinate system.
Magic Perception was a common ability among monsters, nothing remarkable.
Space Manipulation likely derived from Spirit Space and Planeswalker.
Due to Damien's bond with his subordinates, he could replicate most of their awakened abilities, excluding unique skills.
Indeed, Damien now possessed Space Manipulation as an extra skill.
"Tyrant's Flame and Magic Flame Transformation."
Damien recalled that in the original novel, Benimaru had similar abilities, gained from Rimuru devouring an upper Fire Elemental Spirit.
However, Damien hadn't consumed any Fire Spirit.
"Could it be due to Explosion Magic?"
Benimaru already mastered fire-based Sorcery, making him highly compatible with Explosion Magic.
Their synergy awakened these two new skills.
"This Tyrant's Flame is quite powerful." Damien noted, sensing feedback from the skill. "Like my Explosion Magic, it can ignite internal Magicules instantly, unleashing power akin to a nuclear blast."
Unlike Explosion Magic's long charge time, Tyrant's Flame allowed control over its release speed.
Short bursts produced flame projectiles; prolonged compression yielded explosive infernos.
With sufficient Magicules, Benimaru would become a terrifying artillery, incinerating all obstacles in Damien's path.
"Magic Flame Transformation elementalizes the physical body."
Its effect resembled the Burn-Burn Fruit from One Piece, but it could burn and absorb surrounding matter to replenish Magicules.
In Magic Flame Transformation, paired with the overwhelming Tyrant's Flame, Benimaru's strength was so far beyond his pre-evolution self that he seemed like a different species.
In this Cardinal World, Magicule quantity didn't directly equate to combat strength.
Before evolving, Benimaru's attributes were rudimentary:
[Benimaru]
[Race: Ogre]
[Magicules: B-rank Lower Majin (7500 EP)]
[Magic: Battlewill, Sorcery]
[Inherent Abilities: Monstrous Strength, Regeneration]
Lacking extra or unique skills, he relied on the Ogre tribe's passive abilities, barely surviving in the forest.
Despite having 7500 Magicules, his combat strength was only mid-tier among B-rank beings.
"Magicules are the foundation, but skills define the line between the strong and the weak."
Gifted by Damien, Benimaru's true combat power now allowed him to defeat tens of thousands of B-rank monsters.
Compared to his pre-evolution self, the current Benimaru could take on a thousand of his former selves.
Moreover, his Great Marshal unique skill enabled him to share some abilities with his subordinates, boosting the entire legion's combat strength several-fold.
"Very impressive."
Damien was highly satisfied with Benimaru's abilities.
"Thank you for your recognition."
Benimaru bowed his head, his face calm but his heart brimming with excitement.
The naming bond, combined with the subordinate oath, doubly ensured that Benimaru, Shuna, and the others were bound to Damien... body and soul.
In this world, nothing brought them greater joy than Damien's approval.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 38 38: [TP] 38: Step Down!
chapters.content:
[Shion]
[Race: Ogre → Kijin]]
[Magicules: A-rank Upper Majin (12000 EP)]
[Magic: Battlewill, Sorcery, Dark-type Pokémon Magic]
[Extra Skills: Battle God Transformation, Magic Perception, Multi-Barrier, Overpower]
[Unique Skill: Tyrant (Thought Acceleration, Universal Perception, Super Strength, Super Regeneration, Magic Disruption)]
[Special Skill: Magic Solidification]
[Resistances: Omitted]
"Battle God Transformation and Tyrant, huh?"
Shion's Battle God Transformation was a transformation ability.
Unlike Benimaru's elementalization, Shion's ability channeled continuously regenerating Magicules to enhance her physical body, akin to an advanced version of Magic Solidification.
Though unable to elementalize, her strength, defense, and vitality surged dramatically.
"A pure berserker specialization."
If Benimaru was a battle mage, Shion was a berserker, embodying overwhelming force.
Paired with Tyrant's Super Strength and Super Regeneration, she surpassed Benimaru in one-on-one combat, second only to Ogerpon.
[Souei]
[Race: Ogre → Kijin]
[Magicules: A-rank Upper Majin (12000 EP)]
[Magic: Battlewill, Ghost-type Pokémon Magic]
[Extra Skills: Magic Perception, Shadow Manipulation, Spatial Movement, Infinite Clones]
[Unique Skill: Concealer (Thought Acceleration, Hyper Speed, One-Hit Kill, Stealth)]
[Special Skill: Magic Solidification]
[Resistances: Omitted]
"Souei's definitely an assassin type."
In the original novel, Souei served as Rimuru's shadow guard and ninja.
After receiving Damien's naming, Souei awakened the unique skill Concealer, specializing in assassination and stealth.
[Shuna]
[Race: Ogre → Kijin]
[Magicules: A-rank Upper Majin (12000 EP)]
[Magic: Sorcery, Elemental Magic, Illusion Magic, Fairy-type Pokémon Magic]
[Extra Skills: Magic Perception, Multi-Barrier, Spatial Manipulation, Intimidation]
[Unique Skills: Analyst (Thought Acceleration, Analysis Appraisal, Chant Cancellation, Law Manipulation), Creator (Material Transformation, Fusion, Separation)]
[Special Skill: Magic Solidification]
[Resistances: Omitted]
"Everyone gained Magic Solidification, converting Magicules into physical prowess."
"Benimaru's a battle mage, Shion's a berserker, Souei's an assassin, and Shuna's a mage."
What surprised Damien most was Shuna awakening two Unique Skills at once.
Analyst and Creator were god-tier magic skills, their potential rivaling Damien's Learner.
"All their Magicules reached 12,000 points."
This meant the four would collectively grant Damien 24,000 Magicules in feedback.
After deducting the 5,400 points spent naming them, Damien had roughly 36,000 Magicules left.
This surpassed even Ogerpon's current Magicule count.
"So strong!"
"Young master and the others have become so powerful!"
The Ogre tribe cast envious glances at Benimaru, Shuna, and the others.
The desire to evolve was a monster's instinct.
The simplest way to break through their life's limits was to receive a name from a powerful being.
"Lord Damien~~"
Before the Ogres could act, Shion, with Damien's permission, stood and swiftly embraced him.
"Huh?"
Damien felt his arm brush against something soft.
"Lord Damien's aura! Oh, what an enchanting scent!"
Shion's movement was too quick for Damien to react.
Yet, he sensed no danger, only an overwhelming sense of closeness and dependence... Shion's instinctive desire to be near him.
As their master, Damien was like family to his subordinates, who subconsciously craved closeness with him.
Of course, male subordinates like Benimaru and Souei wouldn't act like Shion.
"Ugh, Shion's so sneaky!"
"I want to stay close to Lord Damien too."
The pink-haired Kijin princess didn't hesitate, rushing to Damien's side and clinging tightly to his other arm.
"Bwoh?"
Ogerpon tilted her head, confused by the situation.
Fortunately, Ogerpon wasn't the jealous type.
The girl glanced at Shion, then Shuna, before diving into Damien's arms.
Damien's embrace belonged to Ogerpon!
"Ahem, uh, let go a bit..."
It took considerable effort for Damien to free his arms from Shuna and Shion's grasp.
Being close to two beautiful, elf-like girls was both thrilling and challenging for Damien.
In private, he wouldn't mind.
But in public...
"Hm?"
Damien noticed the Ogres below didn't seem to mind Shion and Shuna's behavior.
This wasn't the human world, after all.
Monsters revered the strong.
Moreover, Damien was the one who personally named Shion and Shuna.
"Father, you've seen Lord Damien's greatness."
Benimaru decisively approached the Red Ogre leader. "Please entrust the Ogre tribe's future to us!"
This was tantamount to a coup.
But in the monster world, might made right.
Benimaru's intent was clear: he wanted his father to step down gracefully.
Nearby, Souei watched Hakurou warily, ready to intervene if the elder made an unwise move.
"Well, well."
Hakurou noticed, giving Damien a deep look before shaking his head helplessly. "Chief, since the young master has decided, what choice do we have?"
"Very well."
The Red Ogre leader wasn't attached to power.
The Ogre tribe was small.
If it could grow stronger, he had no reason to refuse.
"Sorry, Father."
"No."
The Red Ogre leader didn't mind his son's actions, instead approving. "You made the right choice."
He raised his hand, gesturing for Benimaru to look at the other tribesmen.
"This is..."
Benimaru saw it... the burning desire for strength in the Ogres' eyes.
They didn't expect Damien to name them.
But by following Damien and uplifting the Ogre tribe, they might earn the Voice of the World's recognition, evolving into Kijin together.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 39 39: [TP] 39: Oath of Loyalty
chapters.content:
"Lord Damien!"
Benimaru eagerly shared the good news with Damien, "My father has decided to lead the Ogre tribe in pledging loyalty to you."
"Well done, Benimaru."
Having overheard Benimaru's conversation with the Red Ogre leader, Damien smiled. "There's no need to be so tense. I'm not a tyrant."
"I'm not skilled at managing villages."
"So, the task of governing the village will still fall to you."
Under Benimaru's surprised gaze, Damien summoned the Red Ogre leader and Hakurou, granting them names: "From now on, Chief, you'll be called Akahiko, and Elder, you'll be Hakurou."
The two hadn't expected Damien to name them.
As a portion of Damien's Magicules vanished, a surge of magical energy erupted from Akahiko and Hakurou.
Soon, like Benimaru and the others, they completed their evolution from Ogres to Kijin.
However, perhaps due to their age, their potential was less than Benimaru's group.
Though Kijin, neither Akahiko nor Hakurou awakened unique skills.
Still, their combat strength was formidable.
The extra skills inherited from Damien were powerful, significantly boosting a monster's fighting capability.
"Thank you for your naming!"
Akahiko, resembling a more mature and dignified Benimaru, spoke: "Benimaru was right. Your magnanimity is astonishing!"
Everyone knew naming came at a great cost to the namer.
Yet Damien willingly shared his power with them.
First Benimaru's group, now these two elders... Damien's sincerity and regard for the Ogre tribe left them deeply honored.
"Willing to name an old man half in his grave like me."
Now a Kijin, Hakurou's demeanor radiated warmth as he stroked his beard. "You're quite reckless, my lord."
"Please take care of yourself, Lord Damien."
"No need to worry. This burden is nothing to me."
After naming the two, Damien's Magicules didn't decrease.
Like the others, Akahiko and Hakurou advanced slightly beyond 10,000 Magicules, reaching 11,000 each.
"After gaining a few hundred Magicules, I now have 37,000."
"Subtracting the base 10,000, I have 27,000 Magicules left to name more Ogres."
Damien planned to use this reserve to enhance the Ogre tribe's strength, evolving as many into Kijin as possible.
Hearing Damien intended to name more Ogres, Benimaru and the others were stunned.
They urged him to prioritize his health, not to make such immense sacrifices for them.
There was no notion of unfair distribution here.
Communal monsters were a collective.
The successful evolution of Benimaru, Akahiko, and the others meant the entire Ogre tribe's strength had risen.
With their leadership and protection, the tribe would prosper, benefiting the whole group.
This differed vastly from Damien naming and taking Kijin away, abandoning the village.
Leaving would drain the village's vitality.
Staying provided shelter.
If Damien had a favorability system, his standing among the Ogres would be at worship.
Powerful, generous, benevolent.
How fortunate the village was to have such an exceptional leader!
"It's fine. My situation is unique."
"Naming part of the Ogre tribe won't affect me much."
Damien didn't mention his unique skill, Leader, which allowed named subordinates and followers to return a portion of Magicules.
This meant his actual Magicule loss was less than expected.
"But before that, there's one task I need you to handle."
Damien then shared his desire for the entire Ogre tribe's loyalty with the six present.
"I'll gather everyone immediately!"
Hearing it was such a simple matter, Akahiko stood, ready to organize a swearing-in ceremony to make Damien the village's true lord.
'Excellent!'
Damien had calculated that the entire Ogre village's submission would yield around 30,000 Magicules.
Added to his current 37,000, Damien's Magicule count alone would rank him as high-tier A-rank.
"Unable to break through to Special A-rank at once, keeping these Magicules serves little purpose."
Naming feedback wasn't a waste but a way to store Magicules elsewhere.
"It's finally over!"
The loyalty ceremony lasted from day to night.
Throughout, Damien wore an ornate ceremonial robe, seated at the forefront, as Ogre families approached to pay homage and pledge allegiance.
It must be said, the Ogre tribe was indeed simple and earnest.
Damien had estimated ordinary followers would provide 1% of their Magicules, which was already generous.
After all, being recognized as a follower by his Leader skill required genuine loyalty.
This, to Damien, wasn't easy.
Yet, the Ogres exceeded his expectations. Despite their fierce appearances, their hearts were remarkably tender.
Damien's earlier actions had thoroughly won them over.
The Magicules they returned averaged the maximum 3% for followers, even from underage Ogre children.
Ogre children, not yet fully grown, had low Magicule counts, averaging C-rank, around 4,000.
The tribe totaled 254 members, with 20 away on missions and over 20 lost to the insect monster disaster.
"Phew~~"
Recalling the Ogres' loyalty pledges, Damien checked his attribute panel.
[84,000 EP]
Nearly 85,000 Magicules... an impressive sight that filled him with pride.
"Benimaru, Souei, Shuna, Shion."
Damien turned to the four: "Have you found elites worthy of my naming?"
"We have!"
This time, Damien planned to use 64,000 Magicules.
With named individuals providing 15% Magicule feedback, Ogres with over 8,500 Magicules would balance the cost.
But in the entire village, only Akahiko and Hakurou exceeded 8,000 Magicules.
Even top warriors like Benimaru, Souei, and Shion had only 7,000+.
So, Damien set the naming threshold at 6,500–7,000.
Most adult Ogre warriors had just over 6,000 Magicules, early B-rank.
In this regard, the brute-strength Ogres held a low ecological niche among B-rank monsters.
Ogres with over 6,500 Magicules were the village's elite.
Damien allocated ten naming slots each to Benimaru and Souei to form the Red Ogre Corps and the Shadow Guard.
The Red Ogre Corps, led by Benimaru, would organize the remaining Ogres into squads for hunting and patrolling.
The Shadow Guard, akin to a ninja unit, would handle reconnaissance and protection.
Additionally, Shion and Shuna each received five slots.
The women planned to select female Ogres to form the Purple Corps and Priestess Maidens.
The Purple Corps would protect Damien closely.
The Priestess Maidens would also manage Damien's daily needs, serving as his personal maids.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 40 40: [TP] 40: Never Vanish
chapters.content:
Naming the thirty Ogres consumed over 50,000 of Damien's Magicules.
With the remaining 14,000, on Hakurou and Akahiko's recommendations, Damien named five special talents in the village.
These were Shirayuki, skilled in medicine; Kurobei, the surviving blacksmith from the original story; Kintsume, a calculating male; Yuki, a highly learned female; and Akahime, from the same Red Ogre lineage as Akahiko and Benimaru, confident in her culinary skills.
Perhaps reflecting their natures, the extra skills these five gained after Damien's naming aligned with their talents.
[Damien]
[Magicules: 26,000 EP]
Twenty-six thousand... this was Damien's remaining Magicule count after the first wave of naming.
Less, yet not truly diminished.
"My Magicules haven't vanished. They've merely taken another form, staying by my side."
This wasn't like spending money on virtual companions. Beyond Benimaru and Souei, Shuna and Shion were genuine, charming allies.
Especially Shion, who, since becoming Damien's guard captain, stuck to him like glue.
Shuna felt a twinge of jealousy but couldn't afford to be as carefree as Shion.
As a Priestess Maiden, she not only served Damien closely but also relayed his decisions to the Ogre tribe.
After taking charge of the Ogre village, Damien began reforms.
First, he restructured the village from a mercenary-based system to one of greater self-sufficiency.
Next, he ordered the clearing of new land to expand the village's area.
Every Ogre was a humanoid excavator, even the children contributing their strength.
"The village center will be a plaza, with four zones divided in a cross pattern."
In a quaint, traditional courtyard, Damien sat under the eaves, Ogerpon... a delicate, fairy-like girl... resting on his lap.
Ogerpon curled up, nuzzling into Damien's chest, her nose gently sniffing his scent, murmuring contentedly.
"Residential zone, work zone, entertainment zone, and farming zone."
"Then, along the cross roads, set up shops to create a market street."
Damien patted Ogerpon's back, lulling her to sleep, while calmly assigning tasks.
Scribble, scribble.
Shuna meticulously recorded Damien's instructions, listening intently and occasionally asking key questions.
"Mhm, I see…"
Shion, too, was scribbling nearby.
Damien sneaked a glance at Shion's notes, finding boxes of various sizes.
As for words…
He could only say it was very Shion.
Completely illegible.
Thankfully, Shuna was there. The Ogre tribe's Priestess Maiden was brilliant, with a knack for governance.
"The residential zone is nearly complete, but isn't it a bit too large?"
Following Damien's orders, Shuna had the Ogres clear a forest for housing.
The number of houses far exceeded the tribe's needs.
With fewer than 250 members, even including the 30 away on mercenary missions, the residential zone's houses were less than half occupied.
This was impossible otherwise.
The Ogres lived in family units, totaling just over 80 households, far fewer than the number of houses.
"It's for future plans."
Damien thought of Rimuru's village in the original story, planning to emulate it by recruiting more monster races.
This would not only bring new Magicules but also lay the groundwork for establishing a nation.
To become a Demon Lord, he couldn't stand alone.
Vassals, armies, and citizens were essential.
"Your meaning is?"
"The Jura Forest isn't home to just the Ogre tribe."
Damien said, "Lizardmen, Goblins, Insect Monsters, Tengu, Orcs…"
"I need their strength."
As his subordinates, Shuna and the others could now know some of Damien's secrets.
"If we can subdue them all, even at 1%, each providing 10 Magicules, that's millions."
Shuna's face flushed as she spoke of millions, resembling a wife thrilled at her husband's million-dollar salary.
"1% is just the start."
Damien was confident his benevolent policies would increase the Magicule contribution rate.
This Magicule feedback wasn't a one-time deal.
Once they became his followers, named, or subordinates, their every improvement would grant Damien 1%–3% of their Magicule growth.
When the time came, Damien would use those Magicules to name them.
This raised their contribution from 3% to 15%.
It seemed like a loss, as Damien spent Magicules to evolve them.
But was it truly a loss?
Take the Ogre tribe: were Benimaru, Shion, and the others, at 12,000 Magicules, at their limit?
Clearly not!
They would grow stronger.
Their additional Magicules, unrelated to Damien, were returns on his investment.
Thus, with his unique skill Leader, naming wasn't wasteful but a strategic investment.
'Leader is powerful, but it has limits.'
Over time, Damien had gauged Leader's cap: 'Its limit is 1 million Magicules. Beyond that, it can't interfere.'
This wasn't surprising.
Leader was just a unique skill, not capable of infinite Magicule growth.
Fortunately, Damien could use these Magicules to strengthen his subordinates.
'As long as I spend them before hitting 1 million, Leader can keep generating Magicules.'
This cycle would elevate both Damien and his named monsters.
Thus, Damien wouldn't harm the forest's intelligent races but would offer them a better future.
'You're all my precious experience packs!'
No killing, just submission, for a steady Magicule stream... what could be more delightful?
"Let me go, Lord Damien!"
Shion eagerly volunteered. "I'll beat them all into submission!"
"I've already sent Souei and the Shadow Guard to scout."
Damien wasn't rushing to attack. "Once he returns with intel on nearby races, I'll make arrangements."
"Ugh…"
Shion pouted, itching to fight.
"Don't worry, you'll get your chance."
"Really?!"
Shion was easy to please.
The straightforward girl, much like Ogerpon, wasn't the sharpest.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 41 41: [TP] 41: Max
chapters.content:
"Phew~~"
After settling matters in the Cardinal World, Damien returned with Ogerpon to the Konosubaverse.
His purpose here was to convert his newly gained 100,000 Magicules into a million experience points.
"A million experience points... enough to raise my level to 100."
Damien wasn't sure of the level cap in the original Konosuba novel.
But in this real Konosubaverse, the maximum adventurer level was 100.
Adventurers had a level cap.
Theoretically, 100 was possible.
As for whether anyone had ever reached it…
When Damien asked Luna at the guild, she replied, "I've never heard of anyone pushing their level to the limit."
Barring surprises, Damien was about to become the Konosubaverse's first max-level adventurer.
[Experience Points Conversion Successful]
Damien glanced at his unchanged 100,000+ Magicules and the million experience points newly added to his character card.
Without hesitation, he leveled up.
The next moment, as a flood of experience points was consumed, Damien gained a massive number of skill points.
This was the true reason for his return to the Konosubaverse!
Yes, skill points!
Damien intended to max out all his mastered skills.
"Explosion Magic? Add points!"
"Martial Artist class skills? Add points!"
"Resurrection? Add points! More points!"
"…"
Damien's skill points far exceeded his expectations.
As mentioned before, skill points gained from leveling depended on class rank.
The earlier one unlocked an advanced class, the more skill points they'd gain at max level.
But Damien was on another level.
Like Aqua, returning to the Konosubaverse... even without changes to level or stats... granted him a huge influx of skill points.
If Aqua was a goddess descended, Damien was a Demon Lord from another world!
"Phew~~~"
After nearly fifteen minutes, Damien finally maxed out his chosen skills.
Even then, he had skill points to spare.
"Whatever, I'll save them."
"Maybe I'll copy new skills later."
Damien wasn't stingy with skill points.
Konosuba was just one world; he had grander horizons and no need to hoard here.
Even if he missed rarer skills, he wouldn't regret it.
"Still, I don't feel much stronger."
Damien clenched his fist, sensing his body's changes.
"Maybe I'm already too strong."
As an A-rank Upper Majin with Magic Solidification boosting his stats, the attribute gains from Konosuba's level 100 were likely a fraction of his true power.
"Damien, you got a tiny bit stronger."
"You noticed?"
"Yeah."
Ogerpon gestured with her fingers. "About this much."
"…"
Damien shrugged.
Ogerpon's descriptions were, as always, abstract.
He was used to it.
"I'll get accustomed first."
Damien treated his Konosuba travels as a vacation.
Here, he wouldn't flaunt excessive power.
"Let's see what level 100 stats look like."
Damien appraised passing adventurers, using their stats to devise a new attribute system.
In the Konosubaverse, each adventurer's attribute limits varied.
Take Intelligence, for example.
A note like "Intelligence: 10 (max)" meant that no matter how much they leveled, that adventurer's Intelligence wouldn't increase.
It was their talent's limit.
This explained why, in the original story, Kazuma pitied Aqua after seeing her maxed-out, yet still low, Intelligence.
"So, no matter how much she levels, her Intelligence won't improve?"
Aqua's low Intelligence was permanent.
Truly living up to her reputation as the dim-witted goddess.
Back to Damien.
All his attributes reached the Konosubaverse's cap.
Not his personal limit, but the adventurer card's limit.
In numbers, that was 999.
This conclusion came from Damien's Magic Perception, analyzing all adventurers in Axel.
Even the reclusive lich Wiz only reached around 800 for her highest stat.
Of course, Damien's Strength, Agility, and Vitality far exceeded a mere 999.
His true stats had long surpassed Konosuba's framework.
"But in this world, I'd better stick to the allowed limits."
That meant all attributes at 999. As long as Damien didn't exceed this, the world's will wouldn't expel him.
"You too, Ogerpon."
Damien shared this red line with Ogerpon: "Keep your power within 999, got it?"
"Mhm!"
Ogerpon nodded obediently.
"By the way, Damien."
Ogerpon tugged at his clothes, asking, "You leveled up and used your skill points. Are we heading back now?"
To avoid trouble, Ogerpon had reverted to her Pokémon form.
She didn't mind.
In fact, her Pokémon form felt more comfortable than her human guise.
"No rush."
Damien patted Ogerpon's head, smiling. "You've worked hard helping the Ogre tribe with their construction."
"Ogerpon doesn't mind hard work!"
"I know, I know."
Damien gently ruffled her head. "But you still need to relax."
"Don't you think this world is perfect for unwinding and living leisurely?"
Damien came here to level up and allocate points.
With that done, he could return.
But he had no such plans.
"Let's stay a couple of days and relax."
Damien's suggestion instantly won Ogerpon's approval.
Ogerpon loved the Konosubaverse.
The food was delicious, and the guild members were friendly, playing with her.
The little one adored the world's vibe.
"Let's head to the guild!"
Damien wasn't short on money, and now at max level, he had no need for quests.
The Konosubaverse was his vacation spot.
No constant fighting or scheming here.
Just a bunch of quirky adventurers and a dim-witted goddess dragged into mortal life.
"Huff! Huff~"
"Put some muscle into it! Get those supplies up here!"
On their way, Damien and Ogerpon passed a construction site.
They glanced over instinctively.
Among shirtless workers, a boy in a white short-sleeved shirt and green sweatpants was sweating buckets.
"Well, well…"
Damien paused at the sight. "A classic scene."
"What's up, Damien?"
Ogerpon followed his gaze, spotting Kazuma. "Is something wrong with that boy? Why are you watching him?"
"Do you know him?"
"No."
Damien said, "First time seeing him."
"But I know of him."
As he spoke, Ogerpon pointed at a blue-haired girl sitting on a wall, plastering cement onto bricks. "That one! She's…"
Ogerpon remembered her!
She was the self-proclaimed goddess they met during their last trip here!
Ogerpon didn't quite get what a goddess was.
But it sounded impressive.
So why was such an impressive person laying bricks?
Was she, like Ogerpon, here to relax in this world?
***

chapters.title: Chapter 42 42: [TP] 42: Darkness
chapters.content:
"Damien, Damien, is that the same…?"
"It's probably her."
Though Damien often teased Aqua in private, calling her a dim-witted goddess, he didn't dislike her.
After all, when he first arrived in the Konosubaverse, she granted him the overpowered Copy skill.
"Is Damien going to make her our companion?"
Seeing Damien stare at Aqua, Ogerpon seemed to catch on.
"Huh?"
Damien blinked, then looked at Ogerpon with horror. "No way, Ogerpon, how could you have such a terrifying idea?"
"Bwoh?"
Ogerpon tilted her head, her eyes full of innocent confusion.
She didn't understand what was so scary about her thought.
"Ogerpon, you mustn't get too close to Aqua!"
Gratitude aside, Damien would look out for Aqua in the Konosubaverse.
But making her a subordinate?
Leaving aside whether Damien could even capture a goddess like Aqua, the mere thought of her joining the team made his scalp tingle.
That girl was a walking disaster.
Recruiting Aqua could turn his fledgling enterprise into chaos.
So…
'Stay away, dummy! Scram, airhead! Begone, brainless!'
"So scary!!"
Ogerpon didn't get it, but if Damien said so, it must be true.
Already not the brightest, she trembled at the idea that Aqua could lower others' intelligence.
"Ahem."
Damien took Ogerpon's hand. "Let's not meet her yet."
"She's a goddess, after all. Being seen in such an embarrassing state by someone she knows would be mortifying."
Not ready to interact with Aqua and Kazuma, Damien pretended not to notice and headed straight for the guild.
"Hm?"
"Mr. Damien, and Ogerpon?"
As soon as he entered, Luna spotted him.
The well-endowed blonde approached, asking with concern, "It's been a while. Did you leave Axel?"
"Yeah, I took a private commission that sent me far off."
When Damien traveled between worlds, their time flows synchronized.
He'd spent about a week in the Cardinal World, so seven days had passed here too.
"Yo, Damien, my man!"
"Long time no see!"
"Haha, you're as lively as ever... great to see!"
"…"
After his last banquet, most adventurers in the guild had warmed up to Damien.
Guys bond over drinks, after all.
Especially since Damien single-handedly outdrank everyone.
That kind of drinking prowess made him a true powerhouse in their eyes.
"Running low on cash? Don't expect me to treat you again."
"No way we'd mooch off you every time!"
"Yeah, we're not that shameless!"
They meant it. Damien's previous generosity had already thrilled them, showing his warmth and friendliness.
You can't be too greedy... you've got to know when to be content.
"Two guild special meals."
"Three servings each of pudding and cream ice cream."
"And some sparkling wine."
"Right away, sir."
After ordering from the waitress, Damien led Ogerpon to a corner table by the window.
He scanned the guild hall, searching for new classes or skills he hadn't seen last time.
Shortly after they sat, a figure in armor caught his eye.
Golden hair pinned up with a clip, the tall, curvaceous girl exuded femininity. Her emerald-green eyes were calm yet faintly cold, perfectly embodying the image of a haughty, elegant Crusader.
'This girl… could she be…'
Damien didn't need to guess. Her appearance matched the anime perfectly: 'Darkness?'
Darkness, one of Konosuba's heroines, was the tank of Kazuma's party, with attacks that never hit but unmatched defense and vitality.
Plus, she was an extreme masochist.
"First Kazuma and Aqua, now Darkness."
"Just missing Megumin, and the original quartet's complete."
Though he'd spotted another canon character, Damien had no intention of approaching.
It wasn't that he disliked Darkness.
Compared to the dim-witted Aqua or the chuunibyou Megumin, Darkness's quirks were, at most, a bit risqué.
A Crusader with a touch of perversion? Pretty normal, right?
At least in the anime, Damien never saw Darkness flaunting her tendencies toward anyone but Kazuma.
All in all, if he could train Darkness to direct her masochism solely at him, it'd be quite amusing.
"Too bad."
"Bwoh?"
Ogerpon looked up curiously, unsure what Damien was lamenting.
"I mean, subordinate slots are limited. I can't use them carelessly."
Damien explained to Ogerpon, "Even if I like a character, I need to judge their worth first."
Unlike protagonists who could freely bring companions across worlds, Damien's Planeswalker skill was less flexible.
To take Darkness, he'd need to make her a subordinate.
But that was the issue.
Subordinate slots were finite, and using one on Darkness wasn't cost-effective.
'Sorry, my preferences.'
With no spare slots, Damien could only silently apologize to his desires.
But while he had no plans to approach Darkness, that didn't mean she'd ignore him.
As she spoke with Luna, the girl suddenly turned her gaze toward Damien and Ogerpon.
"!!!"
Their eyes met.
"Uh…"
Caught staring, Damien felt a bit embarrassed.
Before he could look away, a spark of excitement flashed in Darkness's eyes.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 43 43: [TP] 43: The Crusader
chapters.content:
"What's going on? Is she looking for me?"
Damien didn't recall any prior interaction with Darkness.
"Hello, are you Mr. Damien?"
Darkness stood by the table, keeping a polite distance. "I'm Darkness, a Crusader."
"Oh, hello."
Damien pretended not to know her. "Is there something you need?"
"W-Well, p-please, please allow me to join your party!"
"Sorry, I'll have to decline!"
"Huh?!"
Darkness hadn't expected such an abrupt rejection, leaving her momentarily stunned.
"Why?!"
"I-I'm an advanced class. I saw you all bloody and sticky before…"
"Ugh! What happened to end up like that?"
"Just thinking I could end up the same way, I-I…"
"Guu~~"
"…"
The once cool and haughty Crusader now had watery eyes and flushed cheeks, fidgeting excitedly. Ogerpon's chopsticks dropped her beef onto the table with a plop.
'This woman is scary!!'
Ogerpon's danger radar was flashing wildly.
She glanced at Damien, who seemed to have anticipated this.
'As expected of Damien!'
Her Damien stayed calm no matter what!
'Mhm.'
Ogerpon decided to empty her mind, leaving all thinking to Damien.
"Alright, calm down first."
Damien gestured for Darkness to sit and ordered her an iced juice.
"Thank you."
The juice arrived quickly, and after a polite thank you, Darkness looked at Damien expectantly. "I'm confident in my strength and endurance, though my movements aren't very agile."
"My attacks never hit enemies, but as a shield, you can use me however you want, no need to care about my feelings!"
"Even if you break me, it's fine!"
In fact, the thought of being broken made Darkness's breathing quicken, her every cell trembling with excitement.
"Okay, calm down."
Damien pointed to the drink, urging her to cool off.
"My situation is unique. My party doesn't lack a frontline."
"Aw…"
Rejected again, Darkness wasn't discouraged but rather delighted.
"However…"
Damien paused to think.
He had to admit, Darkness was stunning.
Golden hair, emerald eyes, a curvaceous figure, and noble aura.
As long as she kept quiet and didn't show her perverse tendencies, she perfectly matched Damien's tastes.
Unlike Aqua and Megumin, Darkness was manageable.
Aqua was too chaotic, likely to cause trouble.
Megumin's daily Explosion Magic urges were a hassle Damien didn't want to deal with.
He knew Darkness well enough.
Her full name was Dustiness Ford Lalatina, the daughter of the noble Dustiness family in the Belzerg Kingdom.
Losing her mother young, she barely remembered her face.
As an only child without a mother's love, her father Ignis spoiled her and rarely disciplined her, leading to her craving strict guidance and becoming an irredeemable masochist.
In other words, what Darkness wanted was firm discipline.
For Damien, that was easy.
"Alright, I'll let you join."
Damien had his reasons for allowing Darkness into the party.
First, he wasn't planning to use a subordinate slot to make her one.
Second, he wanted to explore ways to bring someone to the Cardinal World without a subordinate contract.
Darkness was a good candidate.
As for forming a party in Konosuba?
Damien had decided to play the role of a level 100 Martial Artist here.
As long as he didn't reveal secrets beyond this scope, he could share them with Darkness without worrying about leaking other worlds' information.
"Really?!"
Darkness hadn't expected Damien to accept her.
She knew he could see her quirks.
"S-So, so, are you willing to discipline me?"
"It's fine!"
"No matter how perverse the demands, I-I'll endure them for you!!"
"…"
Damien was starting to regret agreeing.
Her voice was too loud.
Didn't she see the adventurers glancing over?
Hey, what's with those looks?
He wasn't some creep who enjoyed tormenting Crusader girls, okay?
But this made one thing clear.
Hardly anyone in the guild knew about Darkness's tendencies.
This was likely her first time exposing her quirks to others.
Normally, though a clumsy fighter who couldn't hit monsters, Darkness maintained a positive image.
"Ahem, we're just friends."
Damien nudged Darkness, signaling her to explain.
Thankfully, she didn't make it awkward, announcing she'd joined Damien's party and apologizing for speaking too loudly.
"What, just a couple's game?"
"As expected of Damien, snagging the aloof Crusader so fast."
"Darkness, huh… Hope Damien can handle her."
"What? Is there gossip?"
"Nah, I partied with Darkness before. She's so clumsy, she can't hit a thing."
"…"
Learning it was just Damien and Darkness's business, not a dispute, everyone turned back to their own matters.
"Looks like we need some ground rules."
Damien said, "Unless you agree, I won't accept you."
"It's starting already?"
"Doing this and that, and that and this to me."
Darkness grew more excited, but Damien raised a hand to stop her. "Wait, wait, calm down."
"I agree!"
Darkness declared, "As long as I can be your teammate, I'll do anything!"
***

chapters.title: Chapter 44 44: [TP] 44: Party
chapters.content:
"…"
Damien sighed, glancing at the stunned Ogerpon. "Don't copy her, Ogerpon, got it?"
"Bwoh!"
Ogerpon nodded earnestly.
"First, I'll let you join the party, and I can understand your… peculiar tastes."
"P-Peculiar, ugh…"
It was a simple word, but Damien's calm delivery made Darkness feel like a bug under scrutiny.
This forced agreement thrilled her, confirming she'd chosen the right person.
Sticking with this man would surely bring her endless delight!
"Though I can't quite grasp it…"
"Whatever."
Damien rubbed his forehead, continuing, "Rule one: you can only indulge your discipline fantasies alone in private. If you get… excited with others, I'll punish you harshly!"
He dropped the pretense, laying it all bare.
Since Darkness was throwing herself at him, Damien wouldn't pass up such a beauty.
But he was possessive. He wouldn't allow Darkness to...
"E-Excited…"
"I understand. I'll behave."
"This is my first time saying this to anyone. I've always hidden it well."
Darkness was fully prepared.
She didn't find anything odd about Damien's serious words.
Yes, this was it!
Treat her like an irredeemable woman and ravage her thoroughly!
"Rule two!"
Considering his situation, Damien said, "Ogerpon and I have our own matters to attend to. We'll only be here two days a week."
Every seven days, he'd relax in the Konosubaverse... that was the plan.
"For the rest of the time, you're free to act as you wish."
"My only demand is that you don't reveal your true nature to others!"
At this, Damien emitted a faint aura of intimidation.
Instantly, Darkness felt an unimaginable pressure.
Her pupils shrank, her vision blurring.
The harmless young man beside her transformed into a terrifying abyss.
But this pressure didn't scare her.
Quite the opposite... it thrilled her more!
"Not in front of others, ooh, is this… possessiveness?"
"I understand."
Darkness found Damien's demand reasonable.
If she wanted his discipline, she could only have one master.
This differed from the original Darkness.
Perhaps due to Damien's overwhelming presence, she began embracing this duality... cool on the surface, wild in private.
"Ahem!"
Seeing Darkness lost in her fantasies, Damien felt a pang of frustration.
'I released such intense pressure.'
'Why aren't you scared? Why are you getting more into it?'
He'd expected her physical and magical resistance to be high.
But this mental resilience overturned his earlier judgment of her limited potential.
'With that willpower…'
Damien thought if Darkness went to the Cardinal World, she'd have a high chance of becoming an Awakened Hero or Saint.
"Rule three, the final one."
"Our relationship stays private. In public, we're just teammates."
Damien wasn't really going to train her into some frenzied state.
As a bit of fun, he wouldn't mind.
But treating her as less than human? He couldn't do that.
"This…"
Darkness hadn't expected this condition.
Her restless heart calmed.
"Damien, you're a good person."
Before, she'd been wary of him.
Even if she accepted that dynamic, she'd refuse at critical moments.
She loved being disciplined but wasn't truly depraved.
Her chastity, Darkness would never surrender.
Now, she felt a spark of fondness for Damien.
If this grew, she might genuinely fall, letting him have his way.
"No need for the good guy card."
Damien placed a pile of Eris coins on the table, calling Ogerpon and Darkness.
"Let's go, Ogerpon."
"And you, Darkness."
He stood, leading them out of the guild. "Let's talk somewhere else."
"Bwoh!"
"Okay, I-I'm ready!"
"…"
Damien's lip twitched. He didn't need to ask to know she thought he was taking her to an inn.
"Whatever, enjoy your imagination."
Ignoring her fantasies, Damien led them out of the guild to Axel's real estate agency.
"What's this place?"
Seeing the agency's sign, Darkness asked, "Are you buying a house, Damien?"
"Something like that."
Damien had clarified with Darkness.
Normally, they were proper teammates.
Only when she needed it would she call him Lord Damien.
Then, he'd become the strictest master, disciplining her thoroughly.
But now wasn't the time for that.
"Staying at inns is too costly."
Damien said, "So I'm planning to buy a villa in Axel."
Yes, a villa.
Ordinary houses didn't interest him.
He had plenty of money.
Even without quests, selling materials from the Cardinal World could make him richer than kings.
Adventuring was, at best, a hobby like fishing.
"I'm not great with this stuff."
Damien asked, "Can you help me out, Darkness?"
"No problem, leave it to me!"
As a noble, Darkness was well-versed in such matters.
With her help, they toured several properties.
In the end, they settled on a sprawling estate... thousands of square meters, with a main building, two side buildings, and a vast courtyard.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 45 45: [TP] 45: Father!
chapters.content:
"This will be our base in Axel from now on."
With this villa, Damien could bring Shuna and Shion along next time.
"Bwoh!!!"
Ogerpon didn't quite understand, but if Damien was happy, so was she.
Darkness didn't mind.
As a noble, her family estate was far grander.
Still, she was curious about Damien's background.
A villa like this cost millions of Eris at least.
Yet Damien bought it without batting an eye.
His nonchalant attitude toward money made Darkness suspect he, like her, was a noble scion out experiencing life.
"Darkness, pick any room you like."
"Huh?"
Darkness almost said she had a place at the inn.
But wasn't this the perfect setup for her desired play?
"Y-You're already eager to ravage me?"
Darkness recalled Damien's orders.
She'd checked... there was no one else around.
So…
"Ooh~~"
"Alright, I understand."
Darkness's breathing quickened. "Even if I refuse, you'll force me to stay, right?"
"…"
Damien and Ogerpon exchanged a glance.
Thankfully, they were used to Darkness's odd fetish.
"Now then…"
Damien slowly raised his hand, then brought it down sharply.
A crisp slap echoed, mixed with the girl's pained yet faintly excited moan, resonating through the villa's courtyard.
"Your room's next to mine."
"U-Understood."
Darkness nodded obediently, not daring to defy Damien's arrangements.
Per their agreement, she was now his to command, and he could do as he pleased.
Of course, Damien wouldn't go too far.
At most, he'd discipline her strictly, letting her experience the thrill of being dominated.
"Bwoh…"
Ogerpon was at a loss for words.
Honestly, Darkness's presence was an eye-opener.
Someone actually enjoyed being mistreated?
Ogerpon couldn't fathom it.
Meanwhile, Damien showed Ogerpon around their new home while subjecting Darkness to various embarrassing plays.
Elsewhere, at an Axel construction site, Kazuma and Aqua finished a grueling day of bricklaying.
"Good work, everyone!"
"That's it for today!"
The foreman handed out wages. "Here's your daily pay."
"Thank you."
"Great job, boss!"
"Hard work!"
As the foreman called it a day, Kazuma and Aqua took their pay, bowing in thanks.
"See you all!"
"Great work! Come back tomorrow!"
Kazuma greeted the seniors, Aqua following suit.
Hearing their replies, the two left the site.
"Man, another full day of work."
Kazuma could hardly believe that, not long ago, he was a shut-in NEET.
Clutching their earnings, they headed to the public bathhouse.
The bathhouse was much like those in Japan.
Though pricier than Japan's with average wages, post-work bathing was a habit they couldn't break.
"Ahh~ I'm alive again~"
Kazuma soaked up to his shoulders, easing the day's fatigue.
This medieval-like world made him think bathing would be a luxury, but that was just his misconception.
"Grateful, grateful."
Musing, Kazuma left the bath, meeting Aqua at the entrance.
Taking longer than a girl might seem odd, but Japanese people loved their baths.
"What's for dinner?"
Aqua, devoid of goddess-like awareness, was embracing this life. "I want a smoked lizard burger patty and ice-cold Crimson Neroide!"
"I'm craving meat too."
Kazuma said, "Let's hit the guild for two smoked lizard burger patty meals."
"Agreed!"
Aqua raised both hands. "And sparkling wine! A burger patty without it has no soul!"
For the past week, they'd been working on expanding the town's outer walls.
In other words, construction labor.
Far from the adventurer life Kazuma sought.
'Why is Aqua so unquestioningly okay with this life?'
'You're a goddess, aren't you?'
As if hearing his inner complaints, Aqua said matter-of-factly, "Duh, no work, no food!"
"You don't like labor? Geez, NEETs are so picky."
"There's always shop clerk jobs on the main street!"
"No, that's not it!"
Kazuma was exasperated by Aqua's earnestness. "I want thrilling battles against monsters! That kind of life!"
"Besides, where's this world's Demon King invasion or crisis?"
"It's so peaceful it's like a fairy-tale village!"
That was Kazuma's biggest gripe. Axel was absurdly tranquil, with no sign of a Demon King.
Chatting, they reached the Adventurer's Guild.
Inside, loud cheers erupted.
"All hail Damien!!"
"Sparkling wine forever!!"
"Damien! Damien! Damien!!"
"…"
Aqua quickly learned the situation.
"A rich guy's footing the bill?"
"Free sparkling wine and a meal for everyone?"
"Ahh!!!"
"All hail!"
"Damien forever!!"
Unable to resist, Aqua pulled out her fan, casting her party magic.
"Flower, Bird, Wind, Moon!!"
"Woohoo!"
The atmosphere grew livelier.
Why was Damien splashing cash again?
Because he was thrilled!
Recruiting Darkness and buying a new home... how could he not celebrate?
Money was no issue in the Konosubaverse.
He could buy all of Axel if he wanted.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 46 46: [TP] 46: New World
chapters.content:
"What's that?"
"There's an adventurer like this in the guild?"
Kazuma was stunned. Still toiling at the construction site, he couldn't fathom the wealth needed to reserve the entire guild.
But what did it matter?
He was the one being treated.
"Give me the most deluxe meal!!"
Kazuma had no shame. Whoever treated was his benefactor.
"Damien! Damien! Damien!"
Though he didn't know who Damien was, it didn't stop him from cheering.
As for Aqua…
You couldn't expect a dimwit to remember Damien's name.
Damien didn't linger, avoiding an encounter with Aqua and Kazuma.
Over the next two days, he indulged Darkness's various perverse requests, running through every play she desired.
"Can't I come with you?"
That morning, Darkness watched Damien and Ogerpon prepare to leave, curious about their destination.
"Not yet."
This time, Damien had fully satisfied Darkness's needs.
At least while he was gone, she could maintain her cool Crusader persona, free from masochistic thoughts.
In a way, she needed time to process the intense stimulation Damien provided.
Over these two days, their bond had grown closer.
Hearing Damien was leaving without her, Darkness panicked.
'Am I being abandoned again?'
'Of course, useless as I am, I can't help Damien and only drag him down…'
Snap!
"Ow~~"
"What are you thinking?"
Damien flicked her forehead, breaking her spiral. "Ogerpon and I have business to attend to. Think of it as… collecting debts."
"Debts?"
Darkness asked, "Like collecting rent?"
"Something like that."
Damien likened himself to a landlord with vast fields, checking on them periodically.
That explained why he could only be an adventurer two days a week.
"I see!"
Darkness wasn't foolish; she knew he was brushing her off.
But what did it matter?
His willingness to explain meant he wasn't abandoning her.
They were still teammates.
"For the next few days, you can do your own thing, Darkness."
Damien tossed her a set of keys. "Also, help look after this place."
"Got it."
Darkness nodded, watching them depart.
As for herself…
She decided to find Chris, the human form of the goddess Eris, a Thief-class adventurer.
They were close friends.
If Darkness proposed teaming up, Chris wouldn't refuse.
Conveniently, Chris, like Damien, disappeared periodically, unable to party long-term.
So, when Damien was gone, Darkness could team with Chris.
When Chris was away, Darkness could rest a day or two before rejoining Damien.
Adventuring with a friend, indulging her quirks, and having rest days... what a perfect life!
"Ready, Ogerpon?"
"Bwoh!"
Unaware of Darkness's thoughts, Damien and Ogerpon used Planeswalker to return to the Cardinal World.
"Lord Damien!"
Sensing their return, Shion burst in. "And Ogerpon-nee! You're finally back!"
"Bwoh…"
Hugged by Shion, especially feeling the weight on her head, Ogerpon looked utterly defeated.
"You're back?"
Shuna arrived a step behind, not as idle as Shion, busy with her duties.
"Yeah."
Damien nodded. "Anything happen in the village while I was gone?"
"No, the village is stable."
Shuna reported, "Everyone's strength is steadily improving, and we're following your expansion plans."
"Good."
"You've worked hard."
Back from Konosuba, Damien wasn't planning to rest.
He was ready to open the gates to a new world.
The delay was to consolidate his recent power surge.
New worlds were enticing, but biting off more than he could chew was unwise.
Without mastering his current strength, adding new systems would muddle his future plans.
He needed a clear path to growth, not aimless wandering.
After this period of reflection, Damien felt he'd fully grasped his powers, ready for a new adventure.
Due to the cooldown, the next trip was set for two days later.
This time, he planned to bring Shuna and Shion along.
[Planeswalker (Cooldown: 0:59)]
"Almost time."
On the third day, watching the one-minute countdown, Damien turned to the girls. "This time, I'm taking Ogerpon, you, and Shion."
"Really?"
"Awesome!!"
Shion couldn't hide her excitement, bouncing with joy at being included.
Her movement drew Damien's eyes to her ample chest.
"Ahem!"
Damien coughed, looking away.
Shuna noticed, inwardly grumbling about Shion's figure.
Why, as fellow Kijin, was she only petite and cute?
"What about Onii-sama and Souei?"
Shuna asked, "For a new world, is just Shion safe enough?"
"Isn't Ogerpon-nee there?"
Though stronger, Shion still revered Ogerpon as Damien's top fighter, her big sister.
Age-wise, it made sense.
In the Pokémonverse, Ogerpon was centuries old.
She might even outdate Hakurou, so Shion's title wasn't misplaced.
"Ugh, troubling you again, Ogerpon."
Damien patted her head, smoothing her messy hair and putting on her hood.
"Mhm!"
Ogerpon raised her hand, full of energy. "Ogerpon will smash all Damien's enemies!"
"I'll protect Lord Damien too!"
"Me too!"
Shion and Shuna, not to be outdone, each grabbed an arm, making Damien both exasperated and secretly pleased.
Planeswalker couldn't bring outsiders.
But subordinates weren't outsiders... they were part of his power.
If he wished, Damien could bring five A-rank or higher fighters to explore other worlds.
"Everything ready?"
"All checked!"
For world-hopping, Damien's spatial storage held ample supplies.
"Good."
Using the subordinate link, Damien informed Benimaru and Souei he'd be gone, tasking them with managing the village.
"Yes, my lord!"
"Rest assured, Lord Damien."
Benimaru and Souei replied almost simultaneously.
They were used to his occasional absences.
This time was no different... some subordinates went, others stayed, each with their roles.
Benimaru also privately messaged Shuna, urging her to care for Damien and ensure he didn't suffer.
"Leave it to me, Onii-sama!"
Shuna, ever meticulous, looked after not just Damien but Ogerpon and Shion, acting as his steward and head maid.
With Planeswalker's activation, the four vanished before Benimaru and the Kijin.
Their vision blurred momentarily.
When they regained focus, they were met with biting cold winds and the endless expanse of a northern ice plain.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 47 47: [TP] 47: A Fragile World
chapters.content:
"Hiss~!"
"What's going on?"
"Where did I end up?"
As space rippled, Damien landed and was hit by a biting cold wind.
"Whoo~ Whoo~"
Snow swirled in a blizzard, the world blanketed in white, with gusts sweeping snowflakes like towering waves.
In the distance, massive icebergs stood like ancient fortresses, towering over the snowy expanse.
Bathed in sunlight, they gleamed brilliantly, but their shadowed sides were dark and frigid, evoking an eerie, mysterious aura.
[Travel Complete]
[Analyzing Rules…]
The Voice of the World echoed in Damien's ears, a first for him.
'Rule analysis?'
Damien realized this wasn't a physical arrival or a temporary insertion like in Konosuba.
It was a third type... a new mode of travel.
"Bwoh?"
Ogerpon glanced around, clutching her Ivy Cudgel, alert for danger.
"It's so cold here."
The four stood with Damien at the center, Ogerpon in front, Shion and Shuna behind their lord.
"But it's weird. Why does my body feel so light?"
Shion gave a light hop, and her body shot up hundreds of meters, like a human on the moon.
The ground trembled beneath them.
Looking at Shion, they saw the earth where she'd stood had caved in, leaving a massive crater. The trio now stood in the collapsed pit.
No doubt, this was the result of Shion's jump.
"What's with this world?"
Shion, startled by her own impact, grew cautious, fearing another crater. "Is the ground made of cookies?"
"This world's rules are off."
Damien soon noticed the issue, bending down to pick up a frozen rock.
Crunch!
The rock crumbled effortlessly in his hand. "The materials are too brittle!"
"Shion, Ogerpon!"
Realizing something, Damien warned, "Control your strength. This world is far weaker than the Cardinal World!"
"Your every move could cause unimaginable destruction."
Without a reference for comparison, Damien couldn't gauge the exact gap between worlds.
But the ground beneath them felt so fragile that a slight push could shatter it.
"I'll be careful."
"Bwoh!"
Shion and Ogerpon immediately became cautious.
They sensed it too.
This world's physical rules were bizarre.
Simply put, compared to the Magicule-saturated Cardinal World, everything here... plants, trees... was like foam to Shion, breaking with a poke.
Shion, an A-rank, could unleash S-rank destruction here.
Yes, S-rank, comparable to an True Demon Lord.
And that was a conservative estimate.
In the Cardinal World, a Special A-rank's full strike neared a nuclear blast.
At S-rank, a casual move could destroy a nation.
Higher still, Special S-rank could pierce the sky or sink continents, truly affecting the Cardinal World's stability.
In the original story, Milim in a rampage could annihilate star systems or even universes.
Destroying the Cardinal World was akin to obliterating the Tensuraverse.
"The air contains unique energy particles."
"This energy is far weaker than Magicules, even less than Spiritrons."
A group of A-rank Majin, their bodies forged from refined Magicules.
In a world with energy weaker than Spiritrons, the destruction they could cause was staggering.
Forget Shion... Ogerpon could likely shatter this planet.
"The gap between worlds is just too vast, isn't it?"
Damien genuinely feared the three might accidentally destroy this world.
If that happened, he'd likely be forcibly expelled by the world's will, blacklisted, and barred from returning.
"For now, everyone, control your strength."
"Limit it to one percent... no, one-thousandth."
Unsure of the new world's specifics, Damien didn't return immediately. Instead, he led the three to wander the icy landscape.
All four had resistances, unfazed by the cold.
The initial chill was just their bodies adjusting; Damien could ignore such temperatures if needed.
Resistances were passive but adjustable.
Otherwise, how could they enjoy hot soup or ice pops?
Rumble!
"Hm?"
Shortly after climbing out of the pit, the ground shook again.
"Shion?"
"It's not me, Lord Damien!"
"Then…"
Before Damien could ask, a monstrous head burst from the snow.
A 20-meter-long centipede, covered in white crystals, exhaled icy breath, its violent blue eyes fixed on the 'humans' causing the commotion.
"Hm?"
Seeing the ice crystal centipede's hostility, Ogerpon raised an eyebrow, ready to summon her Ivy Cudgel to teach it a lesson.
"Wait, hold on!"
"Let me handle it!"
"Ogerpon-nee, leave it to me!"
Spotting such a massive beast, Shion stepped forward eagerly, itching to prove herself.
"Well…"
Damien didn't mind letting Shion act. "But I think we should try communicating with it."
"Oh!"
"As expected of Lord Damien, I understand."
Shion stepped forward, shouting, "Hey!! Can you understand us?"
With the Voice of the World's influence, language barriers didn't exist.
Even for beasts or monsters, Shion could convey her thoughts if needed.
"We're travelers who ended up here by mistake. We mean no harm!!"
She turned to Damien, checking if she'd said it right.
"Good job!"
Damien gave her a thumbs-up. She'd remembered his earlier advice.
In a new world, don't be too aggressive.
They weren't invaders but travelers, and basic courtesy was key.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 48 48: [TP] 48: Instinct
chapters.content:
"Skreee~~"
The ice crystal centipede ignored their attempts at communication, lunging forward with its massive jaws to devour the group.
"No way…"
This thing was impossible to reason with.
Boom!!
Instinctively, Shion slapped the centipede's head.
Even with her strength restrained, the terrifying force unleashed a deafening sonic boom.
Crash!!
The centipede's body was sent flying, smashing into a distant glacier without resistance, buried completely.
"…"
Shion's eyes widened, her face full of panic. "Th-That, Lord Damien, I-I swear I controlled my strength!!"
"Sigh~~"
Seeing Shion on the verge of tears, Damien sighed. "It's not your fault, Shion."
She had indeed held back.
Otherwise, that slap would've sent the centipede into outer space.
"Then?"
"I'm sighing because this world's natives are too hostile."
As Damien spoke, more monsters surged toward them.
"Tch!"
Even the usually mild-mannered Shuna showed impatience. "Let me deal with them."
"No need."
They'd caused the commotion, and Damien didn't want to create too much bloodshed in this world.
"Let's move elsewhere."
Damien raised his hand, tearing open the world's space-time.
"Bwoh!"
Ogerpon hopped forward eagerly. "The vanguard is Ogerpon!"
"Let's go."
Damien and the girls entered the spatial passage.
After they left, a swarm of bizarre monsters appeared nearby.
Faced with an empty, ruined ice plain, they lingered briefly before dispersing, finding no targets.
"Shuna, sense the surroundings."
Emerging from the passage, Damien and the three appeared in another part of the ice plain, over a hundred kilometers from their starting point.
"Yes!"
Shuna, specialized in magic, had the widest and sharpest perception among them.
Clap!
The pink-haired girl clasped her hands, sending invisible magic rippling outward.
"This is a vast frozen plain. The farther north, the colder it gets; the south is warmer."
"There are many strange monsters around." Shuna reported, eyes closed, relaying her findings. "Their auras are weak... F-rank at the lowest, D-rank at the strongest."
"Shion, capture a few monsters. They must be alive."
Damien instructed, "And control your strength. One-thousandth isn't enough... use one-ten-thousandth!"
He wasn't worried about anything in this world threatening Shion.
If a strong enemy appeared, they could reach her in an instant.
"Leave it to me."
Shion's magic perception was less acute than Shuna's but still formidable.
Ignoring the blinding snow, she quickly locked onto the nearest monsters.
A herd of yak-like creatures with thick fur spotted Shion and, terrified, stampeded away.
Her A-rank Majin aura was overwhelming, even restrained.
"I pick you!"
Shion chose a yak monster, forgoing her custom greatsword and forming a hand blade.
Whoosh~
Her figure vanished.
She reappeared in front of the yak.
Thud!!
Her delicate hand descended with unstoppable force, stopping just above the yak's head.
The air pressure from her hand blade formed an invisible hammer, striking the yak and knocking it out instantly.
A ten-meter crater formed beneath it.
"Oh no, I used too much force again!"
Shion rushed forward. "Good, it's still alive. Phew, I thought I killed it."
Normally, such a terrifying blow, shattering the ground, would've reduced the yak to pulp.
But Shion used close-combat techniques from Damien, like striking through a barrier.
Most of the force didn't hit the yak directly.
Even so, this was with her power restrained.
If unleashed, her casual hand strike could devastate dozens of kilometers like a nuclear blast.
"Lord Damien, will this do?"
Shion returned with the yak monster, crossing space to stand before Damien and Shuna.
"Hm, let me see."
Damien examined the ice-blue yak. "Strange creature. It contains energy similar to magic, but much weaker."
If Spiritrons were a measure, the Cardinal World's magic held over 5 million per unit.
This monster's energy, per unit, was only about 100... a 50,000-fold gap.
"In such a weak world, is there really power you need, Lord Damien?"
Shion couldn't understand. To her, nothing here could make Damien stronger, so it seemed a waste of time.
"Don't rush, Shion."
Shuna said, "Lord Damien seeks new perspectives, not just raw power."
"The Pokémonverse seems weak to us too."
"Yet Lady Ogerpon is stronger than us."
Shuna added, "Though individuals here are weak, we can't assume there are no strong beings."
"Shuna's right." Damien praised. "A weak world's systems can still have value."
"Monsters in the Cardinal World are strong but start too high, making precise control difficult."
Weak worlds had advantages... likely birthing techniques unimaginable to Cardinal World monsters.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 49 49: [TP] 49: Successful Stowaway
chapters.content:
"I understand."
Shion nodded obediently, looking at the yak. "Should I wake it?"
"Go ahead."
Soul-searching could harm the creature.
"Yes!"
Shion focused her aura, condensing it into a pinpoint and directing it at the yak.
"Moo!!!"
The sudden jolt instantly roused the unconscious yak.
It scrambled to its feet, ready to flee, but froze upon seeing Shion, Damien, and the others, looking utterly terrified.
"Hm?"
"Not a beast, but an intelligent creature capable of communication?"
Damien tried to communicate with the yak, but the results were lackluster. "It has intelligence, but not much."
The yak wasn't an uncommunicative monster but a normal creature with a mind.
This was fundamentally different from the monsters in the Jura Forest.
Those beasts, driven by instinct, lacked sentience.
Born from Magicule corruption, not nature, they could be wiped out, only to respawn later.
[Rule Analysis Complete]
[Planeswalker (Exceptional) has adjusted to this world]
[Connection established, individual 'Damien' performance balanced]
[Individuals 'Shuna,' 'Shion,' 'Ogerpon' adjustment initiated…]
[Adjustment complete, performance balance achieved]
"Finally done."
"Huh?"
"Lord Damien, why did my strength drop so much?"
"Me too."
The three girls noticed the change.
"No worries, it's the world's rules limiting us."
Damien explained Planeswalker and performance balance to Shuna and Shion.
Ogerpon, not new to traveling, remained calm. "As long as you don't use power beyond your performance limit, you'll be fine."
"What happens if we do?"
Shion felt uneasy. "My power isn't sealed; I can still use it."
"Don't!"
Ogerpon warned quickly. "Use too much, Shion, and you'll be forcibly ejected."
"Ejected?"
"Sent back to the Cardinal World."
Ogerpon, experienced, explained patiently. "We're linked. If you're kicked out, we all are, and returning to this world will be nearly impossible."
"Eh?"
"Really?"
Shion grew cautious, even softening her voice.
"Haha, it's not that extreme."
Damien added, "Ogerpon's right, but this time, we four aren't bound together."
"Even if one gets sent back, it won't affect the others."
"Is that so?"
Ogerpon looked puzzled, not grasping the difference.
"Let me explain."
Damien patted Ogerpon's head. "My Planeswalker ability opens doors to different worlds."
"Once open, we travel, and the Voice of the World assigns us identities."
"There are three types of travel."
Damien had opened three world gates so far.
In the Pokémonverse, he'd received a similar prompt: [The supreme will of this universe has acquiesced].
From his knowledge of Pokémon, this likely referred to Arceus, the Creation God... Sinnoh's Great Revered.
The Pokémonverse had countless parallel universes, and Damien had entered one.
With Arceus's scope, as long as Damien wasn't out to destroy the world and acted as a regular trainer, it wouldn't care.
"That sounds dangerous!"
Supreme wills and creation gods were beyond Shion and Shuna's understanding, but they sounded formidable and untouchable.
"Don't worry, the Voice of the World isn't foolish."
If a world was too dangerous, the Voice would fail negotiations, unable to open the gate.
It would first secure an agreement with the world's supreme will, ensuring Damien's safety and freedom before connecting the worlds.
"That's why Ogerpon and I couldn't bring you to the Pokémonverse."
The first type was managed worlds, where Damien couldn't bring extra beings beyond Ogerpon, a native.
He entered the Pokémonverse physically.
Only he and Ogerpon, a local, could go.
So, except for the first trip, Damien preferred Konosuba for supplies.
Having Arceus watching was too intimidating.
"The second type is like Aqua's, integrating within the world's rules."
Damien said, "For example, I became a reincarnator under Aqua's charge, seen as part of the world's rules... legitimate."
"That's why Ogerpon said if she messed up, I'd be expelled too."
"In the second type, only I'm truly recognized by the world, while Ogerpon arrives as my summoned beast."
If Ogerpon broke the rules, as part of Damien's power, they'd both be ejected.
"But this world is different!"
Damien added, "This world has no supreme will!"
"It has rules, but they're managed by something like a program, not a powerful god."
"So, not just me... you three now have independent identities."
Their subordinate bond remained, but they'd gained three IDs, allowing free movement like Damien.
"The only thing to note is your power is balanced."
Balance meant performance.
In the Cardinal World, an A-rank Majin could split rivers, shatter earth, or strike with nuclear force.
Here, the three were reduced to roughly that level.
***
