chapters.title: Chapter 50 50: [TP] 50: 1200 Years Old?
chapters.content:
"Let's see if the ice is as hard as back home."
Damien picked up another ice rock. The earlier fragility was gone; it felt identical to the Cardinal World's.
"Wow, it really is!"
"Tch, getting weakened like this? This world's rules are annoying."
Unlike Shuna's excitement, Shion crossed her arms, frustrated by the restrictions.
Not for herself, but for her lord being shackled.
If she could, Shion wanted to conquer this world. "What if Lord Damien became its ruler?"
"Well…"
"If I ruled this world, the Cardinal World would benefit, growing larger."
"It's a win-win!"
The Cardinal World would gain, and Damien would grow stronger.
"For now, let's check this monster's details."
Damien cast Appraisal on the yak.
[Ice Plain Yak]
Type: Otherworld Monster
Lifespan: 1208 years
Rank: F
Performance: D-
Innate Abilities: Cold Resistance, Ice Consumption, Ice Element Manipulation, Brute Strength
"What the heck?"
"This cow is over 1200 years old?!"
"1200 years, seriously?"
Appraisal wasn't omniscient.
The same went for Dragon's Eye.
Results depended on Damien's understanding of the world.
But basic energy levels and special abilities were clear.
Seeing the yak's 1200-year lifespan, even Damien couldn't help but exclaim.
"No way, a monster that lives 1200 years has only D- performance?"
This was D-rank in this world.
F-rank Magicules, D-rank performance.
Here, F-rank meant its equivalent in the Cardinal World.
Think a Jura Forest goblin... weaker than a child there.
D-rank was roughly a fully armed adventurer team.
"Unbelievable!"
Shuna, Shion, and Ogerpon, also with Appraisal, checked the yak's stats.
All three were stunned by its age.
1200 years? Even a frog would become a Majin by then!
So why?
Why was this cow so weak?!
"It makes no sense, absolutely no sense!"
Damien muttered, "In any world, lifespan ties to life level. Higher levels mean longer lives."
But this monster defied that logic.
"And 1200 years isn't even its limit."
Imagine a monster with near-infinite lifespan.
Why?
How could it live so long?
Its existence was utterly illogical!
"Wait, Shion, didn't you say there are lots of these cows?"
"Yeah, hundreds. Should I grab them all?"
"Take me to them!"
Following Shion, they quickly found the herd.
Along the way, Damien appraised other creatures, all showing similar stats to the first yak.
He racked his memory for worlds with matching settings: "Snowy wasteland, odd monsters, near-infinite lifespans, but combat power doesn't match their longevity."
"Douluo Dalu?"
Damien thought, "Soul beasts living thousands or tens of thousands of years, yet so weak."
In other worlds, a ten-thousand-year creature would be a Demon Lord, moving mountains and seas.
In Douluo Continent, a ten-thousand-year soul beast matched a human Soul King.
And a Soul King's performance?
At best, a second-rate martial artist in a martial arts novel, killable by crossbows.
D-rank performance aligned with that.
"Ten thousand years of cultivation for second-rate martial art strength."
The more Damien thought, the more this felt like Douluo Dalu.
To confirm, he killed a tiger-like monster that ambushed them.
"Sure enough!"
A purple energy ring rose from the corpse. "Soul beasts produce soul rings upon death. This is Douluo Dalu!"
"With Douluo Continent's low spiritual energy, it makes sense."
Damien recalled Douluo Continent's bizarre physical rules, even the "hydrogen human" jest.
Exaggerated, sure, but the low strength was real.
"Douluo Dalu, icy wasteland... so this is the Far North?"
"No idea which timeline, though."
"Is it Douluo Continent 1's Tang San era, Douluo Continent 2, Douluo Continent 3, or an unwritten transition period?"
If possible, Damien preferred Douluo Continent 1's time.
After Tang San's ascension, Douluo Continent became Tang's domain.
Damien had no interest in tangling with Tang San.
"Let's find someone to ask."
His senses picked up a human presence to the north.
"Shuna!"
"Yes!"
Having mapped the planet's space, Shuna raised her hand, teleporting the group near the sensed human.
Whoosh!
In the blizzard, an old man sped south.
White-haired and bearded, he looked over seventy, clad in thick silver-gray armor, travel-worn.
He held a strange metal device containing restless ice-blue energy, struggling to break free.
"Who's there?!"
Sensing them, the old man halted, his face grave.
"No need to be tense, sir."
Damien stepped forward, softening his tone. "We're adventurers exploring the Far North. May we ask you a few questions?"
"…"
The white-haired man stopped, looking up at the sudden group with surprise.
He didn't speak, silently studying Damien.
A faint golden-blue glow flickered in his eyes, catching Damien off-guard.
Damien sensed an energy in the man, distinct from soul power.
If soul power was low-density magic from sparse Spiritrons, this energy rivaled normal magic in quality.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 51 51: [TP] 51: Snow Empress
chapters.content:
'Douluo Dalu, an energy surpassing soul power in quality.'
'Could it be… divine power?'
The thought startled Damien. 'How is that possible? Someone in the Far North during this era with divine power…'
His knowledge of Douluo Dalu wasn't deep enough to pinpoint the old man's identity.
"A transformed soul beast?"
Meanwhile, the old man scrutinized Damien and the three girls beside him.
To him, Damien seemed human, with no distinguishing traits.
But the horns on Ogerpon, Shuna, and Shion were clearly non-human.
"When did the Far North gain hundred-thousand-year soul beasts like you?"
The golden-blue glow in the old man's eyes intensified, his unease growing at their sudden appearance, as if his plans were slipping out of control.
"Fine, I'll subdue you first, then interrogate you."
"Huh?!"
The old man's words stunned Damien.
What the heck?
After a brief exchange, they were labeled as transformed soul beasts?
In Douluo Continent, soul beasts over 200,000 years could take human form.
This wasn't like reborn soul beasts abandoning cultivation but a superficial change, living as humans.
The old man clearly mistook them for such.
"Tch."
Shion bristled at his tone. "My lord, can I take him out?"
"…"
This time, Damien didn't stop her.
Even he was annoyed by the old man's attitude.
That smug, superior demeanor was grating.
"Insolent!"
Enraged by Shion's words, the old man fumed. A mere soul beast daring to speak to him like that was audacious!
Boom!
In a flash, he appeared before Shion.
A massive hammer crackling with blue lightning swung with overwhelming force, aiming to crush her.
Clang!
But Shion's counter was no less fierce.
Drawing the greatsword from her back, she blocked the furious strike with ease.
"What?"
Not only did the blow fail to kill Shion, the old man felt an unstoppable force surge back, forcing him to retreat.
"Hah!"
Shion's eyes narrowed. Charging with her sword, she clashed with the old man.
Neither used special techniques, relying purely on physical strength, shattering glaciers and carving ravines into the earth.
The commotion echoed far, alarming countless powerful soul beasts in the Far North.
"Such immense power."
"Who is it?!"
Beneath a distant glacier, a jade-green, emerald-like giant scorpion turned its head.
It was the Ice Jade Emperor Scorpion, second of the Far North's three great ferocious beasts... Ice Empress!
"Not a soul beast's aura…"
"Damn it! Humans!"
If not a soul beast, it was a soul master.
The thought of soul masters invading the Far North's core, causing such a ruckus, was unbearable. Ice Empress rushed from its lair toward the battle.
To soul beasts, humans were mortal enemies.
Now, fighting brazenly in its territory wasn't just provocation... it was a declaration of war.
Even to defend its domain and dignity, Ice Empress had to bury these reckless intruders.
"A hammer with lightning?"
"Could it be the Clear Sky Hammer?"
"Someone from the Clear Sky Clan?"
The old man's strength surpassed ordinary Titled Douluo Continent.
Damien estimated that Shion, bound by this world's rules, could unleash nuclear-level destruction.
That exceeded a Limit Douluo Continent, reaching demi-god status in this world.
And that was with her power sealed.
If Shion ignored the world's rejection and unleashed her full strength, even a Rank 1 God would fall to her blade.
"To fight Shion to this degree, he's at least a demi-god soul master."
"But does the Clear Sky Clan have such a powerhouse?"
"Tang Chen from Douluo Continent 1? Or Da Ming and Er Ming from Douluo Continent 2?"
Damien speculated but decided Appraisal was the best approach.
He'd held off earlier out of courtesy.
Appraisal wasn't subtle; if detected, it could be seen as provocation, sparking conflict.
But with the old man fighting Shion, Damien had no reservations.
"Appraisal!"
[Appraisal Failed]
[Reason: Interference by special mental energy]
'Interference?'
The feedback surprised Damien. He activated the stronger Dragon's Eye for another scan.
[Detection Initiated]
[Interference broken, true name acquired: 'Tang San']
"Tang San?!"
Damien's pupils shrank, his mind reeling. "No way, Tang San looks like this? Are you sure this is Douluo Dalu?"
"No!"
"Something's off!"
Using Dragon's Eye again, Damien spotted the anomaly.
"Not Tang San himself!"
The old man was strong but only a Level 99 Limit Douluo Continent, not a demi-god.
He seemed more like a controlled puppet.
A stronger consciousness manipulated him, the source of the divine power.
"Dragon's Eye!"
Damien appraised the soul tool in the old man's left hand.
[Level 9 Soul Tool: God-Sealing Platform]
[Hundred-Thousand-Year Soul Beast Embryo (Snow Empress)]
"Well, damn!"
The pieces clicked for Damien. "This is Douluo Dalu 2, the Unrivaled Tang Sect era. Snow Empress transformed but was discovered by human soul masters, captured with a Level 9 God-Sealing Platform."
This matched the auction plot where Huo Yuhao encountered the Snow Empress.
"So Tang San's behind this?"
Reading the novel, Damien found this plot illogical.
Snow Empress transformed in the Far North's core, a safe zone she'd chosen.
Yet a soul master just happened to be nearby, with a God-Sealing Platform capable of capturing a hundred-thousand-year soul beast.
Level 9 soul tools like the God-Sealing Platform were crafted only by the Sun Moon Empire's top soul engineers.
A powerful soul master, perfectly timed at Snow Empress's transformation, in her safe zone, with a Level 9 soul tool?
Even more absurd, he didn't use it himself but sold the Snow Empress's embryo.
A hundred-thousand-year embryo could grant a second martial soul.
Or at least a hundred-thousand-year soul bone.
Who would sell such a treasure?
And conveniently, it was offered to the Sun Moon Empire's Mingde Hall, practically screaming there was a traitor.
Though it sparked conflict between the Ontology Sect and Mingde Hall, the cost for a mere fight seemed excessive.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 52 52: [TP] 52: Dragon God
chapters.content:
"Tch!"
"So Tang San orchestrated this."
If that was the case, all the inconsistencies made sense.
As Tang San, ruler of Douluo Continent's backyard, what could escape his notice?
No wonder Tang San reacted so strongly to Shion and the others.
Their appearance was unforeseen, a destabilizing factor outside his millennia-long plans, demanding elimination.
"But…"
"Can you even beat my Shion?"
Damien had a grasp on Tang San's capabilities. His true form was a God King.
Though Douluo Continent's rules were weak... its Dragon God roughly equal to an True Demon Lord in the Cardinal World... that was still an True Demon Lord.
Tang San, currently, was likely on par with Clayman.
Unless Damien let Ogerpon risk expulsion by unleashing her full power, defeating God King Tang San was possible.
But that would get Ogerpon ejected quickly and blacklisted.
Weighing the cost, Damien hesitated.
"Hm?"
While he pondered, Tang San sensed Damien probing the God-Sealing Platform and stored it in a soul tool for living creatures.
Snow Empress was a soul beast, but Douluo Continent was Tang San's domain.
Every blade of grass, every soul beast, was his property.
A ferocious beast like Snow Empress was too valuable to waste... perfect for nurturing a chosen one.
"Shuna, help Shion and grab that ring."
"Steal it?"
Shuna didn't question the God-Sealing Platform's nature; she obeyed Damien unconditionally.
Following Shion's close-combat prowess, Shuna, master of elemental control, assisted while seeking an opening, launching magical attacks on the old man possessed by Tang San's divine sense.
Their fighting style defied soul master norms.
Soul skills, like hotkeys, had intervals and cooldowns.
But the girls faced no such limits.
Shion's attacks were brutal, each swing rivaling a demi-god's full force.
Infused with dark magic, even Tang San had to dodge.
Shuna was another story.
As a mage, a powerhouse beyond the original story, she stood behind Shion, an endless artillery of firepower, soon leaving Tang San's puppet battered and scrambling.
"Damn it!"
"Where did these women come from?!"
In the God Realm, Tang San's divine sense monitored the Far North battle.
Watched by the God King of Destruction, he couldn't intervene directly.
Splitting off a sliver of divine sense to control the old man, pushing him to demi-god strength, was his limit.
But Shuna and Shion, even sealed, matched or surpassed demi-gods.
Two against one, Tang San's puppet was on the brink.
"These people can't be Douluo Continent's soul masters or soul beasts!"
Tang San knew Douluo Continent like the back of his hand, even aware of the Silver Dragon King hidden beneath Star Dou Forest, plotting to seize the Dragon God's power.
But Damien's group were undeniable outsiders.
"Chance!"
As Tang San's focus slipped, Shuna seized the moment, using spatial manipulation to sever the hand wearing the storage soul tool.
"Ah!!"
The pain of the severed hand, linked by divine sense, struck Tang San in the God Realm.
"Damn it!!"
"Martial Soul True Body!"
"Ring Explosion!!"
Seeing his puppet falter, Tang San stopped holding back, detonating all the soul power stored in the old man.
Black, black, black, black, black, black, black, red, red... nine soul rings emerged behind him.
"Got it."
Shuna teleported the storage soul tool to Damien, who ignored space to retrieve the God-Sealing Platform.
To prevent Tang San from destroying it in desperation, Damien had taken the long route.
"Finish him, Ogerpon."
"Bwoh!"
Instantly, Ogerpon vanished from Damien's side.
A mere demi-god was beneath Damien's notice.
Only a fool would wait for an enemy to power up.
Ring Explosion was strong, but would Damien give Tang San the chance?
"Ah!!!"
In the God Realm, Tang San, preparing his Clear Sky Hammer's Martial Soul True Body and about to shatter his soul rings, felt a sharp pain in his head.
On the battlefield, Ogerpon held her blood-dripping Ivy Cudgel.
Behind her lay a headless corpse in a pool of blood... the demi-god old man controlled by Tang San.
If Shion and Shuna were like Rank 1 Gods limited to demi-god power, Ogerpon was a restricted God King in Douluo Continent.
Her unleashed power surpassed even Di Tian.
Killing a mere demi-god was effortless.
"Lord Damien."
Shion and Shuna felt no resentment over Ogerpon stealing their opponent. The three returned to Damien, eyeing the God-Sealing Platform.
"What's this?"
"Our prize."
Damien had considered what he could gain in Douluo Continent.
Awaken a martial soul? Gain soul rings or bones? Or some rare treasure?
None of that.
His path was clear: capture powerful beings, make them subordinates, and bring them to the Cardinal World.
The Cardinal World would reward them based on soul strength and uniqueness, granting race, Magicules, and unique skills.
In Douluo Continent, only ferocious beasts caught Damien's eye.
Soul masters or gods? He wasn't interested.
Humans in the Cardinal World remained human, with limited growth potential.
But the hundred-thousand-year embryo in his hand held one of Douluo Continent's top soul beasts.
No, calling the Snow Empress a soul beast was debatable.
Damien saw her more like the Cardinal World's Greater Elemental.
Similar to Rimuru's Ifrit, the Titan of Flame, second only to the Elemental Lord among fire spirits.
"Let's talk to her."
Damien was confident about recruiting Snow Empress.
Probing the God-Sealing Platform with his mind, he saw a tall girl curled up in a golden cage-like space.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 53 53: [TP] 53: Logic
chapters.content:
"Who are you?"
Long, snow-white hair cascaded to her feet. Sensing an outsider's presence, the girl opened her eyes.
Her ice-blue eyes were ethereal, as if piercing through all worldly things.
Her flawless, slender figure, clad in a plain white gown without adornment, exuded purity and stunning beauty.
"I'm Damien, the one who saved you from an evil God King."
"Evil… God King?"
Though sealed, Snow Empress couldn't easily sense the outside world.
But the fierce battle between Tang San, Shuna, and Shion was so intense that even in her sealed state, she felt the disturbance.
She didn't doubt Damien's words.
She just didn't understand what he meant by God King.
"Remember the soul masters who ascended to the God Realm ten thousand years ago?"
Damien quickly explained Tang San, his treatment of Douluo Continent as his personal domain, and his scheme to use her as a pawn.
"Grr~~"
The more Snow Empress heard, the harder it was to suppress her fury.
Though in a mental space, her power seeped out, spreading ice crystals and cracking the space itself.
She didn't suspect Damien of lying.
Firstly, he wasn't human... a critical point.
Unlike Douluo Continent's soul beasts, Cardinal World monsters were distinct. Snow Empress was certain Damien wasn't her kind.
But equally, he wasn't human.
That was enough.
To her, non-humans weren't automatic enemies.
The enemy of her enemy was a friend.
Snow Empress's logic was simple.
"Thank you."
The Ice Snow Maiden, ruler of the Far North for hundreds of thousands of years, thanking Damien would shock countless soul beasts if word spread.
But Damien earned that gratitude.
"If you really want to thank me, how about coming with me?"
"With you?"
Snow Empress didn't grasp his meaning. Did he want her to serve him, like a subordinate?
In the soul beast world, might ruled.
She valued her dignity and would never bow to another.
But…
Damien had saved her life.
Repaying him by helping with tasks wasn't unacceptable.
"I won't submit to anyone."
She quickly added, "But if you need help with something, I'm willing."
This was her way of saying she'd work for him to repay her debt.
"And in my current state, please wait until I complete my transformation."
She was helpless about transforming.
Unable to survive the 700,000-year tribulation, she chose transformation to pursue godhood.
Suddenly, she wondered if her strength could truly help Damien.
"No, not work for me."
As she puzzled, Damien said, "Come with me, leave this world, and explore a broader universe!"
"Leave this world?"
His words exceeded her expectations. "You can take me out of this world?"
"Exactly."
Having read the original story, Damien knew Douluo Continent was a cage for soul beasts.
Snow Empress's lifespan was nearly spent, forcing her to transform for a shot at godhood.
But Damien offered a ready solution.
Leave Douluo Continent, and she'd break free from her shackles, gaining a new future.
The question was: could Damien take her across worlds?
No.
Without becoming his subordinate, she couldn't leave Douluo Continent. To depart, she'd have to join him.
"So, you want me to be your subordinate, like those who fought Tang San?"
"Exactly."
Damien said, "Don't worry, I won't force you to do anything against your will."
"Our bond is a shared fate. Your strength boosts mine."
"And as I grow stronger, you gain more!"
In this era of Douluo Continent, soul spirits and intelligent soul rings weren't concepts yet, at least not to Snow Empress.
Following Damien was far better than becoming someone's soul ring, soul bone, or dying in a tribulation.
But Snow Empress had her pride.
She believed transforming, becoming a god like Tang San, and ascending was a viable path.
"Ascend to godhood? Hah, forget it!"
Damien doused her hopes. "You really think anyone can ascend from Douluo Continent under Tang San's watch?"
No ruler would allow an uncontrolled resource to rise.
Unless Snow Empress served Tang San, he'd never permit such a powerhouse to emerge.
"Tang! San!!!"
Snow Empress was aloof but not foolish.
She fully grasped Damien's meaning.
With Tang San overhead, no matter her confidence or talent, she'd be schemed to death.
Like the Dragon God's shackles... whatever their original intent... under the God Realm's machinations, they doomed countless soul beasts and blocked her path to ascension.
"So, leave Douluo Continent, and the tribulation binding you will vanish."
"If you don't want to follow me, I can take you to another plane to break through."
Damien was serious.
Even if Snow Empress ascended in another plane, he could still recruit her as a subordinate.
But that would leave her owing him a massive debt.
Her cold, proud nature didn't mean she was emotionless or ungrateful.
"Besides, following me has to be better than someone like Tang San, right?"
Damien had that confidence. Unlike Tang San's two-faced ways, he was straightforward.
He was generous to his own.
If he had a bite, his people wouldn't go hungry.
"Right, right, Damien's great."
Ogerpon's consciousness joined, forming a cute girl's silhouette beside him.
"Exactly."
"Shion and I were just ordinary Kijin from the forest, but Lord Damien granted us immense power."
Shuna appeared too, ready to persuade the new ally to join.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 54 54: [TP] 54: Bad Time
chapters.content:
"What's the point of such a weak world?"
"Follow the boss, and you'll face tons of strong opponents." Shion's words struck a chord with Snow Empress. "Fight them, keep getting stronger... isn't that way better than being trapped in a tiny world?"
She was right.
The trio's genuine gratitude and affection for Damien couldn't be faked.
Most importantly, following Damien meant growing stronger.
That alone left Snow Empress with no reason to refuse.
"I can agree to join you."
"But I have conditions. If you can promise them, I'll fight by your side and never betray you!"
Snow Empress was steadfast.
Once decided, she wouldn't waver.
Damien had shown her immense respect.
In her embryo state, with their strength, he could've enslaved her without all this talk.
Self-destruction only worked when strengths were close.
But Damien's group?
Snow Empress sensed he could forcibly dominate her.
He didn't, because he wanted her loyalty, not a resentful servant.
That alone sparked considerable fondness in her.
"Go ahead."
"First, you can't force me to do anything against my will."
"No problem."
"Second, I want to return to this world someday…"
Her voice carried a chill. "To take revenge on Tang San and those lofty gods!"
Being captured like a toy.
Such humiliation was unbearable!
She'd grow stronger, return to Douluo Continent, and make those gods... especially Tang San... pay!
"Even if you didn't say it, I'd help you."
As his subordinate, she'd be family.
Her grudges, Damien would share.
Besides that, if the chance arose, he wouldn't mind conquering the Douluoverse, making it part of the Cardinal World.
"Good!"
Relieved by Damien's agreement, Snow Empress grew more satisfied with her new lord. "What do I need to do to become your subordinate?"
"Just relax."
Seeing her consent, Damien didn't hesitate, activating his Capturer ability.
"What's this?!"
Snow Empress faintly heard a query, asking if she'd become Damien's subordinate.
Capturer could forcibly bind or gently ask, as now.
"I agree."
Having decided, she wouldn't second-guess. She chose to trust Damien.
If betrayed, it'd be her fault for being naive.
"You won't regret it."
The conversion was smooth. With no resistance, their bond formed naturally.
"Rest in my mental space for now."
Damien opened the God-Sealing Platform, releasing Snow Empress, using magic to stabilize her form.
Pale blue magic flowed like a gentle stream, healing the damage from her interrupted transformation.
Full conversion required returning to the Cardinal World, using its rules.
"Thank you."
Without hesitation, Snow Empress entered Damien's body.
The subordinate contract let Damien trust her, and she learned of his origins and intentions through it.
He hadn't lied.
The bond was like family, sharing honor and disgrace.
He wouldn't harm or enslave her.
She'd protect and fight for him wholeheartedly.
"Lord Damien, where to next?"
Shuna asked, "Keep exploring this world?"
"No."
Damien looked up, his tone heavy. "We can't return here for a while."
Before the girls could ask why, an intangible pressure descended from the sky, enveloping them.
"What's this?!"
In sheer magnitude, the pressure rivaled a Special A-rank monster, though its quality was lacking.
"It's Tang San!"
In the mental space, Snow Empress's voice rang out. "He's been watching this world!"
The evidence was undeniable, erasing her doubts.
Without Damien, she'd have been schemed to death by Tang San.
"Let's go back."
Damien wasn't keen on clashing with Tang San directly.
One Tang San was fine, but facing the five God Kings together would be troublesome.
Revenge could wait. This trip was a massive win.
Killing the old man meant Tang San lost a direct puppet, reducing his influence over Douluo Continent.
Taking Snow Empress gave Damien a subordinate with potential rivaling or surpassing Ogerpon.
"Planeswalker…"
Boom!!
"Damn humans!!"
As Damien prepared to activate Planeswalker, a massive jade-green figure burst from the ice, unleashing a chilling torrent toward them.
Thud!!
Ogerpon moved swiftly, appearing before Damien.
"Bwoh!"
Raising both hands, she tore through the icy torrent, blocking Ice Empress's long-charged strike with raw strength.
"What?!"
Ice Empress's gem-like eyes widened, stunned that her attack was so easily deflected.
"Ice!"
Snow Empress instantly recognized the jade scorpion... her rare friend in the Far North, Ice Empress.
"Tch, talk about bad timing."
Tang San's divine pressure had masked Ice Empress's approach.
This put Damien in an awkward spot.
He needed to return.
But what about Ice Empress?
Leave her here?
If Tang San lost their trail, he'd likely take it out on her.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 55 55: [TP] 55: Insectar
chapters.content:
"My lord!"
Snow Empress, now aware of the subordinate and Planeswalker dynamics, realized the issue. "Can we take Ice with us?"
Her voice, though cool, carried a hint of pleading.
Given their bond, she couldn't leave Ice Empress to face Tang San's wrath alone.
This left Damien with one option: forcibly capture Ice Empress and bring her to the Cardinal World.
"Fine."
Damien didn't see Ice Empress as a wasted subordinate slot.
Snow Empress, Ice Empress, or any ferocious beast could aid him.
Ice Empress's potential might not match Snow Empress's, but it wouldn't be a loss.
"Ogerpon, restrain her!"
"Bwoh!"
At Damien's command, Ogerpon summoned her Ivy Cudgel and, before Ice Empress could react, smashed it down on her head.
Thud!!
Terrifying force crashed like a mountain, overwhelming Ice Empress. The world seemed to collapse, and she fainted instantly.
"Capturer, activate!!"
For an incapacitated target, Capturer needed no preparation.
A flash of light, and the massive Ice Jade Emperor Scorpion vanished into the crater, along with Damien and his group.
"Impossible!!"
In the God Realm, Tang San sat on his God King throne.
A screen floated before him, showing the spot where Damien's group had stood.
Now, it was empty.
"Where are they?"
"Spatial transfer? Or aura concealment?"
Tang San's divine sense poured into the image, scouring the Far North and beyond in a carpet search.
"Tang San!!"
His actions were soon noticed.
The God King of Destruction stormed in, glaring. "What are you doing? Gods can't interfere in the mortal world. As the God of Judgement, are you breaking your own rules?!"
"Destruction…"
Damien's disruption had left Tang San fuming.
And now, the God King of Destruction was questioning him.
This motherfucker!
But Tang San hadn't fully mastered the Asura God's power and couldn't defeat this veteran God King.
With no choice, he feigned compliance.
"You're saying evil gods from another plane invaded Douluo Continent?"
"Exactly."
Ever the pure and noble man, Tang San painted Damien's group as malevolent intruders in a few words.
They coveted Douluo Continent, and he'd merely tried to stop them.
"…"
The God King of Destruction stared at Tang San, his compassionate facade almost too convincing.
Even the Goddess of Life, his companion for eons, began defending him.
Leaving aside the cosmic politics and Tang San's schemes with Destruction, Damien successfully returned to the Cardinal World with his new subordinates, Ice Empress and Snow Empress, alongside Ogerpon, Shuna, and Shion.
[Subordinate Conversion Initiated]
[Conversion Complete: Individual 'Snow Empress' granted race 'Greater Elementals of Ice']
[Individual 'Ice Empress' granted race 'Ice Scorpion Insectar']
[New Rules Detected, Analysis Initiated]
[Analysis Complete: Gained Extra Skill 'Ultimate Attribute']
[Intrinsic Skill 'Flame Body' Enhanced, Added New Elemental Types]
[New Energy Detected, Analysis Initiated]
[Analysis Complete: Gained New Magic Variant]
[Naming Initiated]
[Naming Complete: Gained 'Soul Power']
[Gained 'Divine Power']
[Soul Power and Divine Power Linked to Soul Master System, Skills Merging]
[Merge Complete: Gained Special Skill 'Ring of Divinity']
…
[Discovered Unique Skill 'Sword Saint']
[Discovered Unique Skill 'Nature's Realm']
[Discovered Unique Skill 'Extreme Cold Prison']
[Acquired 'Soul Master' Class, Meets Conditions for Unique Skill 'Spirit Tamer']
[Individual 'Damien' Successfully Gained Unique Skill 'Spirit Tamer']
…
"Ah!! Where is this?!"
"Damn human, what did you do to me?!"
In a boundless white world, a chibi Ice Empress raged.
She recalled attacking human soul masters, only to be struck by a green cudgel.
What happened next, she didn't know.
"Ice, calm down."
A cool, feminine voice came from behind. Turning, Ice Empress saw a stunning woman in an ice-blue gown.
"Snow Empress!!"
Joy turned to despair. "Even you were captured by that wretched human?!"
"How did this happen?"
Ice Empress misunderstood, but Snow Empress shook her head, soothing her friend while explaining.
Learning Tang San monitored Douluo Continent, scheming against her and Snow Empress, Ice Empress cursed his despicability.
What followed stunned her.
Monsters from another world, a unique subordinate bond, escaping Douluo Continent, and the chance to grow stronger…
It was all unbelievable.
"So, Snow Empress, you're now that human... Damien's... subordinate?"
The top ferocious beast of the Far North, a subordinate? Ice Empress struggled to accept it.
Subordinate sounded nice, but wasn't it just servitude?
"Snow Empress, are you really going to serve this Damien?"
"Yes, I've decided."
Snow Empress's tone was cold but resolute. Unlike humans with their tangled motives, her choice to follow Damien was final, a lifelong commitment.
"Also, Ice, you're his subordinate now too."
"What?!"
Ice Empress's eyes widened.
Her chibi form, with its shocked expression, was utterly adorable.
Even Snow Empress felt an urge to hug and dote on her.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 56 56: [TP] 56: Ring of Divinity
chapters.content:
"Damien's Capturer can forcibly convert those weaker than him into subordinates."
In theory, both Snow Empress and Ice Empress were far weaker than Damien.
If he were ruthless, he could have enslaved them with harsh contracts.
Instead, Snow Empress's bond only required protecting Damien, fighting for him, and never betraying him, while allowing her to refuse unreasonable demands.
Ice Empress, however, was different.
Due to the urgency, Damien had forcibly captured her.
This resulted in the harshest contract.
She couldn't resist Damien and had to obey all his commands.
Even if he demanded she become his rage outlet, she'd have no choice.
"This… this is too unfair, isn't it?"
Ice Empress was on the verge of tears, grasping the situation.
Damien wasn't a human soul master and bore no malice toward soul beasts.
Snow Empress's contract was proof.
She could have had a similar bond, becoming family, not a servant bound by life and death.
"Sorry, it was an emergency. You'll have to bear it for a while, Ice Empress."
Damien appeared beside the sisters, unbothered by her sudden attack.
Soul beasts attacking humans and humans hunting soul beasts were Douluo Continent's norm... nothing to dwell on.
But with Ice Empress as his third otherworld subordinate under such a strict contract, Damien felt conflicted.
The contract's power was absolute; he couldn't alter it yet.
Once he broke through to True Demon Lord, his Unique Skills would evolve, letting him master the contract and convert her servitude into a fair subordinate bond.
Servitude contracts were useful but flawed.
Forced enslavement bred resentment between subordinate and master.
This hindered future growth.
Fortunately, Damien wasn't that kind of person and wouldn't exploit Ice Empress.
"You… you're Damien?"
Seeing him, Ice Empress's first instinct wasn't to accuse or curse.
The tiny chibi Ice Empress stepped back, then, feeling unsafe, hid behind Snow Empress, peeking out timidly.
"Uh…"
Damien understood her state.
The servitude contract made defiance impossible.
To her, he was like a cruel slavemaster with a whip, his mere presence instilling fear.
Bargaining or pride? Laughable now.
'I… I'm afraid of this guy.'
'What a humiliation!'
She tried to resist the trembling, but the contract crushed any rebellious thoughts.
"It's okay, Ice. Damien's not like that. He won't bully you."
"Let's get along, Ice Empress."
Damien smiled gently, beckoning her to his side.
He didn't use the contract's power, so she could refuse.
But would Ice Empress succumb to fear?
She'd face the abyss!
When her small hand met Damien's, she felt his genuine warmth and welcome.
The sudden conversion had caught him off-guard too.
But it happened, and Damien saw it as their fate.
"Want to check your new powers?"
He patted her soft head, smiling. "Ice is way stronger now."
"Huh?!"
Caught up in the shock, she hadn't noticed.
At Damien's prompt, Ice Empress discovered her transformation.
She shifted from chibi scorpion to a girl with jade-green hair.
"What's happening?"
"Subordinate contract? Cardinal World? Skills?"
"I get it now!"
The sudden joy overwhelmed her. Happiness came so fast.
The surging energy in her... magic.
In quality, soul power couldn't compare!
"Magic rivals the God Realm's divine power…"
"No wonder it's so strong."
A thought struck her. "Does this mean I'm basically a god now?"
"You're not wrong."
Damien glanced at Snow Empress, who was also sensing her changes. "If you return to Douluo Continent, you might not beat Tang San, but regular gods? No match for you!"
Together, the sisters could dominate!
With that, Damien opened Ice Empress's status panel.
[Ice Empress]
[Race: Ice Scorpion Insectar]
[Magicules: 34,000 (Mid-tier A-rank)]
[Common Skills: Ice Magic, Ice and Bug-type Pokémon Magic]
[Intrinsic Skills: Ultimate Attribute, Ice Body, All Melee Mastery, Magic Amplification, Super Regeneration]
[Extra Skills: Thought Acceleration, Universal Sense, Ice and Snow Domination, Spatial Manipulation, Multi-Barrier]
[Unique Skill: Extreme Cold Prison (Creates a domain to freely control material flow speed)]
[Exclusive Skill: Twin Martial Soul: Eternal Night Radiant Sun (Linked with Snow Empress as Damien's martial souls, bound by life and death, enables martial soul fusion)]
[Special Skill: Magicule Solidification, Ring of Divinity (Stores power in advance to forge up to ten divine rings, each releasing a pre-prepared skill instantly in battle)]
[Resistances: Physical Attack Immunity, Status Effect Immunity, Mental Attack Immunity, Natural Effect Immunity, Holy-Demonic Attack Resistance]
"Insectar?"
In the Cardinal World, Insectars weren't true insects but an variant beings.
Or rather, a product of fallen elementals.
Similar races included Kijin, Elves, and even Goblins.
Ice Empress was classified as a Ice Scorpion Insectar.
"34,000 Magicules, close to Ogerpon's, at mid-tier A-rank."
A-rank Magicules: 10,000–30,000 (Low-tier), 30,000–60,000 (Mid-tier), 60,000–90,000 (High-tier), 90,000–100,000 (Peak, near Special A/Disaster).
Ice Empress's potential matched Ogerpon's.
She could evolve into a Insectoid.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 57 57: [TP] 57: Twin Martial Soul
chapters.content:
[Common Skills]: Ice Magic, Ice and Bug-type Pokémon Magic
"Ice Magic likely blends Ice Empress's soul beast abilities with elemental magic from me."
"Ice and Bug-type Pokémon Magic."
Damien wasn't surprised. His subordinates could awaken Pokémon moves based on their elemental affinities.
Here, they're called Pokémon Magic.
Different name, same essence.
[Intrinsic Skills]: Ultimate Attribute, Ice Body, All Melee Mastery, Magic Amplification, Super Regeneration
The latter three Intrinsic Skills came from Damien.
"Ultimate Attribute. The Voice of the World mentioned new rules earlier."
Damien recalled Douluo Continent's Ultimate Attribute, signifying peak mastery of an element, a mark of talent.
In the Cardinal World, it evolved into a passive that amplified same-element attacks and heavily countered others.
Nice, but not groundbreaking.
"Compared to Ultimate Attribute, Ice Body is more intriguing."
Simply put, Ice Empress's Ice Body resembled Kuzan's Freeze-Freeze Fruit from One Piece, granting elementalization.
This made her immune to most Common Skills and highly resistant to physical Extra Skills.
Defeating her required magic or rule-based Extra Skills.
Otherwise, with Ice Body's near-bug-level elementalization, she was nearly invincible.
Of course, raw power could overwhelm.
Like Milim's world-destroying Drago Nova... Ice Body or not, Ice Empress would be obliterated.
In the Cardinal World, Magicules weren't everything, but they were dominant.
Brute force trumped all.
[Extra Skills]: Thought Acceleration, Universal Sense, Ice and Snow Domination, Spatial Manipulation, Multi-Barrier
"Most abilities carried over, plus Ice and Snow Domination."
What Damien anticipated most was Ice Empress's Unique Skill.
Extreme Cold Prison reminded him of Ciel's Infinite Prison, the skill sealing Veldora.
Hers was a lesser version.
"In purity, Extreme Cold Prison is a lower-rarity Unique Skill."
"But this ability…"
Damien saw its strength and potential, rivaling Ciel's Infinite Prison.
Both were sealing, binding, control-type skills.
When used, they enabled cross-tier challenges.
[Exclusive Skill]: Twin Martial Soul: Eternal Night Radiant Sun
[Special Skills]: Magicule Solidification (Inheritable), Ring of Divinity (Non-Inheritable)
"Twin Martial Soul? Fusion technique?"
"No, not a fusion technique!"
Damien analyzed the Exclusive Skill.
Unique, Exclusive, and Special Skills couldn't be copied or stolen, highly distinct.
They were all Unique Skills, just categorized more precisely by the Voice of the World.
"Twin Martial Soul: Eternal Night Radiant Sun has two uses."
"First, Ice and Snow Empresss resonate, with Ice Empress leading, unleashing a Demon Lord-level strike."
Demon Lord-level destruction was terrifying.
But the second use intrigued Damien more.
It let Ice and Snow Empresss possess Damien, temporarily boosting him a full realm for battle.
"So, a transformation skill? Like martial soul possession?"
As expected from Douluo Continent's system, it had that world's flavor.
"No wonder it's called Twin Martial Soul."
Technically, Damien was a soul master now, with Ice Jade Emperor Scorpion and Ice Snow Maiden as his martial souls.
Finally, Damien focused on Ice Empress's Special Skill.
Special Skills stood out because they diverged from the Cardinal World.
They were fragments from other worlds, integrated into the skill system via Damien.
Stardust Manipulation was the Cardinal World's root.
Magicule Solidification was Konosubaverse's skill tree refined.
Now, Ring of Divinity followed suit.
Douluo Continent's hallmark: soul masters had soul rings, gods had divine rings.
Soul rings aside, divine rings maxed at nine for Supreme God Kings.
But Damien's Ring of Divinity allowed ten.
He could pre-store ten skills, releasing them instantly in battle without cooldowns.
"A godly skill!"
"Ring of Divinity is a game-changer!"
Its storage limit tied to Damien's capacity.
Like the maxed-out Explosion Magic used against the insect monster, he could prepare ten in advance.
Whenever free, he could stockpile.
Moreover, divine rings could store magic and any energy Damien controlled.
"Skills, energy…"
Damien was at a loss for words. This Special Skill was a combat masterpiece.
The catch? Ring of Divinity seemed exclusive to Douluo Continent subordinates.
He couldn't pass it to Ogerpon or other named monsters.
But Magicule Solidification?
"The ultimate utility, Magicule Solidification... I crown you the workhorse!"
As a Special Skill, it couldn't be mimicked or copied, ensuring exclusivity.
Yet, Damien could share it among his followers.
From subordinates to named monsters.
This vastly boosted their overall strength.
Magicules equated to physical and mental power; enhancing them meant comprehensive growth.
"Magicule Solidification seems unremarkable but creates stat freaks."
With enough Magicules, it could negate most mechanics.
Because Magicules themselves were a skill.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 58 - 58: [TP] 58: Sword Saint
chapters.content:
"Honing oneself to the peak and reaching mastery?"
Damien realized Special Skills were his greatest gain from crossing worlds, his capital for challenging the Cardinal World and beyond.
"What are these?"
"So… so strong!"
Ice Empress was stunned by her status panel. She never imagined becoming a subordinate would bring such a massive boost.
Pride and freedom were relative.
In the soul beast world, might ruled, and survival was king.
In the original Douluo Dalu 2, Ice Empress, to survive, accepted Skydream Iceworm's persuasion and became Huo Yuhao's second martial soul.
Now, facing an impending tribulation and certain death, she was in the same predicament.
In such times, becoming a subordinate to survive wasn't a big deal, was it?
In the end, both she and Snow Empress became Huo Yuhao's divine beasts.
Seemingly grand, but still pets of human gods, with no control over their fate.
"Sorry, I misjudged you, Master."
Ice Empress's "Master" carried no resentment.
If word spread that becoming Damien's subordinate brought such transformation, countless Douluo Continent soul beasts would fight for the chance.
She'd paid with her freedom.
But compared to a bright future and survival, what was that cost?
It all depended on choosing the right master.
For now, Ice and Snow Empresss were lucky, meeting a generous, humane master.
"Master, huh?"
Snow Empress nodded, viewing her own status panel. "Calling our lord by name isn't proper. I'll use Master too."
"Uh, no need for that…"
Damien wanted them to just call him Damien, but seeing their resolve, he let it go.
Subordinate and master.
It was a transaction.
Yet Ice and Snow Empresss had won big.
Some might say Damien benefited too.
But to them, he had endless choices, while they had only this one shot to follow him.
They were luckier than any other Douluo Continent soul beast.
"Please, let Ice and me serve at your side to repay your kindness."
"Mm-hmm!"
Ice Empress nodded obediently. If her sister said so, she'd follow.
"Alright."
Damien turned to Snow Empress. "How do you feel?"
"Very strong!"
A rare smile, like melting winter snow, crossed her cool, stunning face. "Perhaps I'm now the strongest under Master's command."
[Snow Empress]
[Race: Greater Elementals of Ice]
[Magicules: 86,000 (High-tier A-rank)]
[Common Skills: Ice Magic, Ice and Fairy-type Pokémon Magic]
[Intrinsic Skills: Ice and Snow Body, All Sword Mastery, All Melee Mastery, Magic Amplification, Super Regeneration]
[Extra Skills: Ultimate Attribute, Thought Acceleration, Universal Sense, Ice and Snow Domination, Spatial Manipulation, Multi-Barrier]
[Unique Skills: Sword Saint (Mastery of swordsmanship and martial arts), Nature's Realm (Absorbs external Magicules to create and transform natural substances)]
[Exclusive Skill: Twin Martial Soul: Frost Desolation Empress (Linked with Ice Empress as Damien's martial souls, bound as twins, enables martial soul fusion)]
[Special Skills: Magicule Solidification, Ring of Divinity]
[Resistances: Physical Attack Immunity, Status Effect Immunity, Mental Attack Immunity, Natural Effect Immunity, Holy-Demonic Attack Resistance]
"86,000 Magicules."
"Sword Saint and Nature's Realm, two Unique Skills."
"Also has the Exclusive Skill 'Twin Martial Soul,' just with a different name."
When Snow Empress leads, fusing Ice Empress's power, she ascends to Frost Desolation Empress, breaking through a major realm.
This transformation heavily drains her Magicules, suitable only for brief bursts.
When Damien undergoes martial soul possession, he can enter this state too.
In truth, both Exclusive Skills are identical.
Snow Empress leads for Frost Desolation Empress.
Ice Empress leads for Eternal Night Radiant Sun.
When Damien uses it, he transforms into Frost Desolation Sovereign, gaining the ability to unleash Eternal Night Radiant Sun's ultimate destruction.
"Whether Snow or Ice Empress, their fused power has flaws."
"Only by fusing with me can this Exclusive Skill's true strength shine."
During martial soul possession, their Magicules stack.
Without qualitative change, it's pure numerical beauty.
Currently, the trio's combined Magicules could exceed 200,000 with possession.
That's Demon Lord Seed level.
In other words, Damien now had the strength to rival a Demon Lord Seed!
"Your Sword Saint Unique Skill…"
Damien asked, "You know swordsmanship?"
"Not just swordsmanship!"
Before Snow Empress could reply, Ice Empress, proud of her sister's innate Snowstorm Saint Body, exclaimed, "Snow Empress excels in sword and palm techniques, the pride of the Far North!"
"Indeed."
Snow Empress didn't feign modesty, nodding naturally.
Douluo Continent soul masters used soul skills; soul beasts were similar, limited to a few moves.
But Snow Empress forged her own path, creating the Snow Empress's Three Absolutes.
Emperor Sword: Peerless Ice, Emperor Palm: Great Cold Snowless, Emperor Frost Heaven: Snowdance Radiant Sun.
Sword technique, palm strike, and domain.
The Cardinal World's Sword Saint wasn't just about swords... it encompassed swordsmanship, bladework, spearmanship, and close-combat fighting.
The Sword Saint Unique Skill was granted to those who reached martial mastery.
Snow Empress lived 700,000 years.
That timespan, though inflated, was real. She'd spent those eons perfecting her craft.
Imagine a master honing their art for 700,000 years in the Cardinal World.
Per the Voice of the World, who could compete for the Sword Saint title?
No one!
Thus, Snow Empress claimed it effortlessly, earning the Unique Skill [Sword Saint].
***

chapters.title: Chapter 59 - 59: [TP] 59: Clayman
chapters.content:
"No wonder you're Snow Empress."
Damien marveled at her prowess. "What's this Nature's Realm?"
"A skill that converts magic into existing materials."
It resembled Rimuru's Analysis and Creation but differed.
The key distinction: Snow Empress's creations weren't transformations but akin to conjuring from nothing.
For example, Rimuru consumed minerals or herbs to craft weapons or potions.
Snow Empress could do that too.
Beyond that, she could use magic to create minerals and plants.
As her mastery of Nature's Realm grew, she could even synthesize life, like monsters or magical beasts.
"Isn't that like being a Creator?"
"There's a difference."
Snow Empress shook her head. "This skill can't create souls."
For life, plants were best, followed by low-intelligence animals like pigs or cows.
Creating monsters required external souls, with their potential tied to soul strength.
In the Cardinal World, potential and aptitude hinged on soul strength.
Stronger souls supported higher skill ceilings.
"I see."
Damien praised, "Still impressive. With you, we'll never lack resources."
Magic equaled resources, and resources fueled growth.
No wonder it was called Nature's Realm.
Snow Empress alone could sustain Damien's entire crew, with a bright future ahead.
[Damien]
[Race: Dragonoid (Pseudo)]
[Rank: High-tier A-rank (87,000 EP)]
[Class: Mage]
[Common Skills: Lifestyle Magic, Healing Magic, Elemental Magic, Pokémon Magic, etc.]
[Intrinsic Skills: Adaptability, All-Class Mastery]
[Extra Skills: Dragon's Eye, Explosion Magic, Soul Summoning, Human-Soul Union]
[Unique Skills: Planeswalker [Exceptional], Leader, Capturer, Learner, Spirit Tamer (Converts subordinates into soul spirits and grants soul spirit space)]
[Special Skills: Magicule Solidification (Inheritable), Stardust Manipulation (Non-Inheritable), Ring of Divinity (Non-Inheritable)]
[Exclusive Skill: Twin Martial Soul: Frost Desolation Sovereign (Possesses Snow Empress and Ice Empress martial souls, can summon or possess)]
[Familliars: Ogerpon, Snow Empress, Ice Empress (3/6); Benimaru, Shuna, Shion, Souei (4/6)]
[Marked Worlds: Pokémonverse(On Cooldown), Konosubaverse(On Cooldown), Douluoverse(Locked)]
"Spirit Tamer, a new Unique Skill."
Damien was thrilled to gain another.
Spirit Tamer let him convert subordinates into soul spirits, living in a soul spirit space.
He already had an Spirit Space.
But Spirit Space and soul spirit space were fundamentally different.
Soul spirit space, based on mental energy, let Damien materialize anything, ensuring subordinates' comfort.
Spirit Space stored materials and bodies but was cramped and barren.
"Could these skills merge?"
Combining matter and consciousness could create a portable mini-world.
But it was a tough challenge, and Damien had no leads.
As for the Douluoverse's lock, he wasn't surprised.
Tang San, Douluo Continent's God of Judgement, wielded significant authority, triggering world rules to bar entry. It made sense.
Damien didn't care.
Douluo Continent was in the Unrivaled Tang Sect era; Tang San's growth was limited.
Damien's progress was beyond Tang San's imagination.
Once he could break Douluo Continent's lock, he'd confront Tang San about today.
Meanwhile, east of the Jura Forest, a castle perched on a cliff, radiating an eerie aura.
"The plan failed."
"Failed, failed~~"
Laplace, the pleasure-seeking clown, reported the latest forest intel.
Nearby, a girl named Tear spun circles, giggling as she echoed Laplace.
"Hmph!"
Footman snorted, "Those bugs were useless."
"Just failed experiments. No expectations anyway, right?"
On the throne sat a tall man.
Silver-white hair, red eyes, golden-edged forehead, and a wicked smile made him strikingly sinister.
This was Clayman, one of the Ten Demon Lords, the Marionette Master.
He was the mastermind behind the forest's insect monster chaos.
"But having my plan ruined is annoying."
Clayman glanced at Laplace. "Any leads on who did it?"
"Some new guy named Damien."
"Damien?"
Clayman swirled his wine glass, sipping casually. "Never heard of him. Probably some nobody from a backwater."
"Don't underestimate him, Clayman."
Laplace's tone grew serious. "He's odd. Not only did he crush your modified bugs, but he tamed the forest's Kijin."
"He tamed those Kijin?"
Tear chirped, "Impressive!"
"Kijin?"
Clayman scoffed. "Just muscle-brained brutes."
Mere B-rank Kijin, only 300 strong, weren't worth his attention.
"I'll have Gelmud push the Orcs toward the Kijin village."
To Clayman, the Special A-rank Orc Lord could steamroll anything in the Jura Forest.
"The Orc Lord?"
"That guy feels scary."
"With him, this new guy will be crushed soon, right?"
"Poor thing, just got the Kijin and now he's doomed."
"…"
To the clowns, a Kijin village couldn't stop the Orc Lord.
"We'll keep watching the forest, Clayman."
"Yeah, it's on you."
As the clowns left, Clayman downed his wine.
In the Jura Forest matter, he couldn't act directly.
It was Veldora's territory.
Other Demon Lords avoided it unless necessary.
Clayman's plan was to send Gelmud to name forest monsters, gradually eroding Veldora's domain through hierarchies.
What he didn't expect was the rare Orc Lord emerging among the Orcs!
The Orc Lord could devour anything, rapidly boosting Magicules through consumption.
If he became a Demon Lord, paired with Clayman, their combined power would surpass the other Ten Demon Lords!
Clayman didn't grasp the vast gap between Demon Lord Seeds and True Demon Lords.
To him, even the ancient Demon Lords like Guy or Milim weren't much stronger.
One Demon Lord might not suffice, but two?
Two against one... couldn't they claim a top spot?
"Some random newcomer…"
Standing, Clayman approached the window, smirking at his reflection. "Enjoy your brief moment. Soon, you'll learn this world's cruelty…"
***

chapters.title: Chapter 60 - 60: [TP] 60: Punch!
chapters.content:
The sun set, casting golden rays over the rural village, blending with the fresh green of the fields to form a serene, harmonious scene.
Smoke curled from wooden cabins, merging with the dimming sky, a natural bridge between earth and heaven.
"Bwoh bwoh~ Bwoh hmm!"
A girl in a straw hat, pants rolled up, waded through the muddy paddy, planting rice seedlings.
Ogerpon hummed an incomprehensible tune, releasing a green Grassy Terrain from her body, nourishing the soil and seedlings with Grass-type magic for robust growth.
Beside her, sturdy Kijin worked in unison, planting seedlings.
They cultivated not just rice but vegetables and fruits too.
The Cardinal World boasted diverse crops, including unique otherworld varieties and Earth seeds.
With skills, creating crops, altering genes, and breeding varieties was far simpler than on Earth.
This made the Cardinal World's biodiversity far richer than in the original story.
Splash~~
Before the cabin, a small river, about four or five meters wide, flowed gently, its clear ripples echoing the distant sounds of fieldwork, crafting a tranquil pastoral life.
The stream was dug by Benimaru and his crew.
The Kijin planted cherry and peach trees along its banks. A breeze sent pink and white petals drifting like snow, turning the village into a hidden paradise in the Jura Forest.
"How's it feel?"
Damien sat by the river, fishing rod in hand, leisurely awaiting a bite.
"It's nice. I like this world."
Snow Empress stood behind him, glancing at Ice Empress playing with Kijin children nearby. "I haven't seen Ice this happy in ages."
Ice Empress seemed aloof but had a childlike streak, much like Ogerpon.
Ogerpon, a kind soul, hit it off with her quickly.
Oh, and Shion too.
The trio, like mischievous tomboys, followed Shion's lead to wreak havoc on the forest's dim-witted magical beasts.
That was a good thing.
Magical beasts were endless.
As long as Magicules existed, new ones would spawn after each cull.
Unlike soul beasts, magical beasts were resources in the Cardinal World.
Monsters and human adventurers alike hunted them.
Magical Beasts: When can we rise?
Sadly, never.
They lacked souls, essential for evolution.
Damien didn't recruit them because they couldn't provide Magicules.
"I've been learning management from Shuna."
Snow Empress saw herself as Damien's deputy.
To excel, she needed both intellect and strength.
She disliked being second to anyone but refused to leave Damien, choosing the deputy role.
Seeing a new world, failing to grow stronger would waste his kindness.
This hard-won chance, she wouldn't let slip.
"Also, Benimaru's swordsmanship has been enlightening."
Back in the Cardinal World, Snow Empress established her authority.
Like Ogerpon, she first subdued the Kijin, including Benimaru and Shion.
Under Damien, only Ogerpon and Ice Empress could challenge her.
Even Ogerpon, facing Snow Empress's unleashed Frost Desolation Empress, had to evade and stall.
But Snow Empress gave no such openings.
Initially, unfamiliar with Ogerpon's abilities, she took losses.
After that, Ogerpon never gained the upper hand again.
Damien could only say the Sword Saint Unique Skill gave Snow Empress a massive edge.
"And Ogerpon's been improving fast."
Half a month had passed since returning.
The Kijin village thrived, with clansmen returning from mercenary missions.
New members brought more Magicules.
Ogerpon's growth remained Damien's top Magicule source, unmatched.
But at A-rank, she needed B-rank or higher foes for experience.
B-rank magical beasts were scarce in the Jura Forest, mostly in Veldora's sealed labyrinth.
Damien wasn't ready to deal with Veldora.
His Dragonoid race urged low-profile growth to avoid dragonkin scrutiny.
This slowed Ogerpon's experience gains.
In half a month, her Magicules barely hit 48,000.
Thanks to her boost, Damien's Magicules broke 90,000, reaching peak A-rank.
"Let's go, Snow."
Damien stored his gear in his space and called to Snow Empress. "Time for today's training."
"Mm."
She followed, daily honing his combat skills and power familiarity.
Damien's Magicules were vast, his stats high.
But his skill synergy and improvisation were lacking.
With such power, he barely used 5%.
Snow Empress saw he wasn't bad at fighting.
He had combat talent.
What he lacked was experience.
Soon, they returned to their cabin.
They skipped the village's arena.
No need.
With the soul spirit space, they could simulate battles mentally.
"Hm?"
Ice Empress, heading to play with Ogerpon, paused. "Starting again?"
"Good. Let's see Master's progress."
She split her consciousness, sending a sliver to control her body toward the fields, focusing most on the soul spirit space battle.
Shion, Shuna, and others did the same.
Besides Ice and Snow Empresss' constant presence, other subordinates, with Damien's permission, could enter as soul spirits.
The space was a perfect combat stage, loved by all for sparring.
Over time, they created a power ranking.
Among the seven subordinates, Snow Empress topped the list.
Ogerpon was second.
Shion and Ice Empress were close, trading wins daily.
Benimaru, with legion-focused Unique Skills, lagged slightly.
Souei, an assassin, and Shuna, a priestess, couldn't match the combat fanatics head-on.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 61 - 61: [TP] 61: Freezes Time
chapters.content:
"Is Lord Damien sparring with Miss Snow Empress again?"
Souei and Benimaru were busy, missing the fight.
Shuna and the others stayed in the village, their split consciousness not disrupting daily tasks.
"I wonder how long Lord Damien will last this time."
Shion respected Snow Empress but wouldn't back down from a challenge.
She'd never easily relinquish her spot as Damien's closest subordinate.
"Lord Damien's working hard and getting stronger each time."
Shuna cheered him on. "Plus, he's not even using his full strength."
In these mock battles, Damien pitted his weaknesses against Snow Empress's strengths.
In real combat, he'd be a backline artillery.
Under absolute firepower, fancy techniques were irrelevant.
Of course, for training, Damien used every ability he had.
Only through constant practice could he refine and perfect himself.
"Go, Damien~~"
True to her role as Damien's loyal supporter, Ogerpon, now in a new outfit, waved a "Damien Will Win" Sign, cheering loudly.
The soul spirit space was ideal... everything was simulated.
"Go, Snow!! Beat him up!!"
"???"
Ogerpon thought Ice Empress was getting too wild lately.
Damien didn't mind.
After all, Ice Empress was forcibly captured.
This guilt made him extra lenient, treating her like a playful younger sister.
"Let this old man referee."
Benimaru's mentor, Hakurou, stepped forward, stroking his beard, standing at the arena's edge.
"Thanks again, Hakurou."
"No trouble at all. Watching such thrilling battles is a joy for me."
As he spoke, a vertical eye opened on his forehead... his Heavenly Eye, the key to his refereeing.
"Ready, Master?"
Snow Empress was an excellent teacher, adept at both feeding moves and pinpointing Damien's flaws with professionalism.
Damien felt fortunate to have such a remarkable subordinate.
"Let's do this, Snow."
"I'll try to last longer this time."
His response pleased her. She raised her hand, gathering ice elements around her.
Both restrained their power for a pure test of skill.
"Emperor Palm: Great Cold Snowless!"
"Starting with a big move?"
Damien watched Snow Empress lift her hand, pushing forward lightly.
Her movement was slow, yet to onlookers, it was blindingly fast, completed in a blink.
"She's improved again?"
Hakurou, observing, raised an eyebrow, awed by her prodigious talent.
"No way, I can't dodge!"
The palm seemed ordinary but wove multiple abilities.
An invisible membrane enveloped the space, halting all movement and change with extreme cold.
The principle resembled Esdeath's Mahapadma from Akame ga Kill, indirectly freezing time by freezing matter.
"The flaw of Emperor Palm is it needs to hit the target."
Fortunately, Damien's transcendent mind persisted despite frozen matter, allowing thought.
And thought meant his skills weren't sealed.
"There's still a fight!"
But as he prepared to counter, an invisible force gently struck his chest.
A chilling sensation spread from his heart.
Due to their master-servant bond, Snow Empress couldn't harm him.
On anyone else, this move would've been lethal or crippling.
"Snow Empress wins!!"
Hakurou promptly declared the result.
"Huh?"
Damien blinked, then lit up, turning to Snow Empress. "Your Great Cold Snowless doesn't need contact anymore?"
In such a short time, she'd perfected her Three Absolutes.
Great Cold Snowless, once limited to close range, now worked without touch.
This gave her a new, unexpected killing move, boosting her combat prowess.
"Amazing, no chance to fight back."
In the Cardinal World, Magicules weren't everything.
Some monsters, with mere tens of thousands of Magicules, could battle foes with hundreds of thousands.
Hakurou was a prime example from the original story.
As for Snow Empress, she was Damien's strongest asset.
Even Ogerpon, one-on-one, could only match her with berserker tactics, aiming for mutual destruction.
"Snow did great!!"
"Hit him, keep hitting him!!"
The spectators, though confused, were awestruck.
Especially a certain green-haired girl, shouting herself hoarse, itching to jump in and punch Damien herself.
"Ice Empress, that little…"
Damien's lip twitched, resolving to give her a playful spanking after training.
"Don't mess around, Ice."
Snow Empress glanced at her, exasperated.
Being forcibly captured, Ice Empress, though accepting Damien, was still defiant in words.
Snow Empress worried Damien might snap and turn her into a rage outlet.
"You're getting stronger so fast, Snow."
"In such a short time, you've adapted to the Cardinal World's system and developed new moves."
Losing to her didn't discourage Damien.
He'd lost dozens, maybe hundreds, of times already and was used to it.
"You're progressing faster than I expected too, Master."
Snow Empress cared about his pride, comforting him. "At first, when I froze time, you couldn't react."
"Now, after training, you can handle similar situations with ease."
She meant not just her moves but sudden assassination tactics like time freezes.
Early on, Damien would've been caught off-guard.
Now, she was confident he could react instantly to any surprise.
That was her true goal.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 62 - 62: [TP] 62: Conquest
chapters.content:
"Snow Empress, your dedication is remarkable."
Hakurou sighed. "Our lord lacks not in combat power but in self-preservation."
With Snow Empress, Ice Empress, and Ogerpon as powerful subordinates, Damien was never short on firepower.
Any one of them was like unleashing a ultimate move.
They were his strength; he didn't need to fight personally to prove himself.
"Thanks, Snow."
"No need for thanks between us."
Snow Empress replied, "Let's continue our training."
Giving Damien self-preservation was her priority.
Beyond that, she aimed to unlock his combat potential, making him not a liability but the team's strongest.
As her master, how could he be weaker than her?
Having a sword and choosing not to use it was different from having none.
Damien didn't need to fight, but that didn't mean he couldn't.
When enemies finally broke through Snow Empress and Ogerpon to reach him, they'd find him the strongest.
That was her ultimate goal in training his skills and instincts.
"Alright."
Damien didn't refuse, unwilling to waste her efforts.
The spar ended with another loss to Snow Empress.
He didn't mind.
Ogerpon had always outshone him, and now Snow Empress joined her. No difference.
He wasn't a masochist.
Why struggle when he could rely on his team?
"You worked hard, Lord Damien."
Shuna brought a lunchbox filled with dishes she'd crafted.
Using forest game and delicacies, her cooking was divine, loved even by Ice and Snow Empresss, who weren't fond of human food.
"Bwoh~~"
Ogerpon bounded over from the fields.
Fresh from the paddies, her steps left muddy prints.
"Ahh!"
"Wait, Ogerpon, stop!"
"Bwoh?"
"You can't go inside all dirty!"
Shuna rushed forward, summoning water to clean Ogerpon's hands and feet.
After time together, the Kijin knew Ogerpon's kind, innocent nature.
She was unmatched in strength among them but treated as the tribe's mascot.
Especially by Shuna, who saw her like a sister.
"This foot too, and here... ah, feels nice~~"
Ogerpon didn't mind being babied, treating the nurturing Shuna as an older sister. "Thanks, Shuna."
"Moo~~"
"Be more careful next time, always so reckless."
Shuna fondly patted Ogerpon's head, handing her a specially made sandwich.
Ogerpon took a bite, eyes sparkling. "Delicious!!"
"This rice ball's great too."
Ogerpon added, "But I love curry rice best."
"Got it, I'll make it next time."
"Woohoo!"
The basket held plenty: some Japanese-style, some other cuisines.
Shuna loved experimenting, especially with Damien's preferences.
In the original story, despite her modest strength, Shuna was Rimuru's second-in-command for a reason.
Her logistical and coordination skills ensured stability, even without Damien.
Gulp, gulp.
After eating, Damien sipped Shuna's fresh juice, gazing at the bustling village, his heart calm.
The Jura Forest was vast, with many scenic spots.
The Kijin village, nestled by mountains and rivers, rarely clashed with outsiders.
Peaceful and serene, it was perfect for retirement.
'Without Planeswalker, living here long-term would dull my fighting spirit.'
'But I can explore other worlds.'
Adventure abroad, then return to this village to recuperate.
"Lord Damien, here's the village's development plan for your review."
Mornings were for training with Snow Empress; afternoons, for administrative duties.
The tasks weren't complex: resource usage, construction plans, and expansion goals.
Damien didn't handle details.
He set the direction.
"Tell me more, Shuna."
"Of course."
Shuna clasped her hands at her waist, reporting the village's changes over the past half-month.
"First, Ogerpon has cleared all magical beasts within a 50-kilometer radius."
"Remaining monsters have some intelligence."
"Per your orders, intelligent monsters who don't attack can live here."
Shuna didn't fully understand but supported Damien's philosophy.
Everyone had a right to survive; strength didn't justify exterminating the weak.
Magical beasts were culled because they were mindless, impossible to reason with.
If they could understand the Kijin, peace was possible.
Even low-intelligence monsters followed basic rules.
This created a new ecosystem across the village and surrounding 50 kilometers.
"But the village has reached its growth limit."
Shuna spread a map before Damien. "Our Kijin are the region's strongest monster group."
"Beyond, there are scattered Goblin villages and other intelligent monsters."
Today's topic was these Goblins.
"How to handle the Goblins?"
Damien recalled Rimuru in the original story, who first tamed the forest's Goblins, granting them names.
Rimuru's Magicules, backed by Veldora, recovered quickly.
Damien lacked that luxury.
His Magicules were finite, so he'd only name the most promising monsters.
Still, it was inevitable.
Named monsters returned more Magicules.
Those willing to join him as subjects would eventually receive names.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 63 - 63: [TP] 63: Thrived
chapters.content:
"How many Goblins can we recruit nearby?"
"Well…"
Shuna replied, "The closest Goblin village has maybe a few dozen."
"That's it?"
"Sorry, Lord Damien."
Shuna explained, "We're too few, and the forest's too vast for a thorough search."
In the original story, the Jura Forest seemed small.
But living here, Damien realized its true scale.
More than a forest, it was a diverse landscape of grasslands, swamps, lakes, and hills.
These regions, divided by dense woods, formed the Jura Forest's monster ecosystem.
"No worries, you've done your best."
Damien wouldn't fault the loyal Kijin.
"I know about the Goblins."
As Damien pondered better ways to scout the forest's tribes, a figure emerged... Treyni, the Dryad.
"Miss Treyni!"
Nearly a month had passed since Treyni witnessed Damien's Explosion Magic.
She'd kept tabs on him, occasionally visiting.
Damien warmly invited her to sample the village's cuisine.
Dryads were the forest's guardians.
Their presence ensured its vitality.
Befriending Treyni was only beneficial.
"Here's our new potato chips, Miss Treyni."
Shuna presented a bowl of freshly fried chips, instantly capturing Treyni's attention. "Then, I won't hold back."
Crunch!
Treyni held a chip, hand on cheek, eyes gleaming with delight. "Ah, these potato chips are divine."
"…"
Damien didn't quite get Treyni's chip obsession.
But knowing her potato fixation from the original story, he used chips to win her over.
The effect was undeniable... Treyni was hooked.
Damien figured with time, he could make her a subordinate.
Yes, a subordinate.
Treyni and her sisters guarded the Jura Forest.
In the original story, she followed Ramiris.
That hadn't happened yet.
Damien had a chance to win her, gaining oversight of the forest.
'Not yet, though.'
Winning Treyni's favor wasn't hard.
Even now, he had a shot at making her a subordinate.
The issue? Her monster rank surpassed his.
Don't underestimate Treyni.
That woman seemed unassuming, but her Magicules exceeded 100,000.
Capturer couldn't convert beings stronger than Damien, a major flaw.
"Miss Treyni, would you help us recruit the forest's Goblin tribes?"
"I'm always treated so well here; I'd like to repay you."
Treyni saw potential in Damien to unify the Jura Forest.
Veldora, the forest's lord, was sealed in the labyrinth, rarely involved.
A strong monster uniting the forest's creatures would ease Treyni's worries about external threats.
"That's a huge help, Miss Treyni."
Shuna asked, "How many Goblins live in the forest now?"
"Goblins breed quickly."
"When I was young, there was a Goblin calamity... over five million rampaging through the forest."
"How many?!"
Damien was stunned. Classic Goblins.
But something didn't add up.
He didn't recall Rimuru having that many Goblins.
In the original story, Rimuru tamed one Goblin village, maybe sixty or seventy strong.
Even with later recruits, they never exceeded 2,000.
Yet Shuna suggested Goblins could form a nation.
"Indeed, that happened."
Treyni, listening, recalled, "Back then, Goblins were everywhere, flooding the forest."
"They expanded recklessly, drawing human adventurers' mass culls."
"That event slashed their numbers. Many fled east."
"East is safer?"
Damien assumed Goblins migrated, explaining Rimuru's small numbers.
Common fantasy Goblins, outnumbered by Orcs? Laughable.
"No."
Treyni shook her head. "The eastern Goblins mostly died out."
"Uh…"
Shuna soon clarified.
The Jura Forest, nominally Veldora's domain, was recognized by the Demon Lords, Western Nations, and Eastern Empire.
The forest teemed with magical beasts and monsters, often culled by nearby nations.
During the Goblin surge, the Eastern Empire and Western Nations drove them back.
They thought escaping humans ensured safety.
But Milim, Carrion, and Dagruel, unimpressed by weak Goblins, purged them.
"Now, only the forest's core has Goblins, maybe 30,000 at most."
Normally, the Jura Forest's Goblins wouldn't be as few as in the original story.
Otherwise, adventurers would lack Goblin-hunting quests.
But the situation was unique.
With Veldora's aura gone, forest monsters, unchecked, devoured each other.
Weak Goblins dropping from tens of thousands to 2,000 wasn't surprising.
"Won't Goblins go extinct?"
"No."
Treyni said, "Monsters are hard to truly eradicate."
Monster factors persisted despite a race's extinction.
Even if all Goblins died, new ones could emerge.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 64 - 64: [TP] 64: Factors and Magicules
chapters.content:
"The Voice of the World maintains balance." Treyni said. "When a species nears extinction, all Goblins worldwide receive a blessing."
This blessing wasn't location-specific; Goblins globally would rise simultaneously.
"Weak monsters multiply during Magicule tides."
"Strong ones birth rare kings."
Treyni popped the last potato chip into her mouth, her face beaming with bliss.
"Perhaps that's the world's mercy."
Sipping tea, the Dryad mused, "When a race hits rock bottom, hope for resurgence emerges."
"So, Goblins are perfect for farming!"
If their numbers swelled, Damien could dominate millions, reaping unimaginable Magicules... a fortune.
But Treyni, seeing through him, doused his dreams. "Soul totals are finite."
As a Dryad, little in the forest escaped her.
Damien's rapid rise was no secret to her.
Still, she didn't dislike him.
Her duty was to protect the forest's ecosystem, and an allied leader could strengthen the Jura Forest's unity.
"Are soul totals tied to race?"
"Exactly."
Treyni explained, "All monsters have an invisible racial existence value."
Racial potential stemmed from souls. Damien's Leader skill shared followers' soul energy, fueling his growth.
But Goblins had a capped existence value.
The more numerous, the lower each Goblin's quality.
Thus, Rimuru's approach... taming a few thousand Goblins... allowed them to evolve into Hobgoblins.
Millions, even tens of millions, of racial blessing condensed into thousands.
Each became one-in-a-thousand, or one-in-ten-thousand.
"The more of a race, the lower their individual potential."
"Your Kijin, at around 300, are well-balanced." Treyni noted. "If their numbers grow, they'll lose their status as the forest's strongest."
"What?!"
Shuna, Shion, and the Kijin gasped at this revelation.
"So, each race's ceiling is predetermined?"
"Yes and no."
Treyni paused, giving Damien a look.
He caught on, signaling for more chips.
Satisfied, she thought him a perceptive leader.
Her early investment wasn't wasted.
"Racial existence value caps at A-rank."
Treyni crunched a chip. "Beyond that, it's about individuals."
Once an individual transcended, their race took pride in them, not vice versa.
"When a monster race births a Demon Lord Seed, its existence value rises."
If the Voice of the World was the heavens, breaking racial limits to become a Demon Lord Seed was a path to ascension.
Pioneers paved the way, easing the journey for others.
"But weak monsters like Goblins have never produced a Demon Lord Seed."
This made it nearly impossible for Goblins to evolve that far.
They lacked a reference, forced to forge their own path.
"That's why Goblins are so weak."
A thriving Goblin population meant lower individual potential.
To become a king, a Goblin would first need to cull its kin.
Quantity versus individual strength.
This highlighted the edge of rare races.
"So, naming is a superior uplifting the weak?"
"Exactly."
Treyni nodded. "No path exists, but a strong hand can make it simple."
The strong set the rules.
In the original story, Rimuru turned thousands of Goblins into Hobgoblins, boosting their racial existence value.
Those Hobgoblins diverged from other Goblins, no longer sharing the same value.
"How many Goblins are in the western forest near us?"
Damien couldn't cross the forest to recruit scattered southern or northern villages.
He'd start with the west.
"About 8,000."
"Not bad."
Damien liked that number.
He wasn't fond of weak Goblins, but Hobgoblins, akin to World of Warcraft's green-skinned Orcs, were more appealing.
"Miss Treyni, can you guide us to their camps?"
Shuna offered another bag of chips as thanks.
"Of course."
Treyni, softened by gifts, was firmly in Shuna's grasp.
The expedition team was small: Treyni as guide, plus a few named Kijin.
Leading was Sakurako, a gentle priestess.
Trained by Shuna in diplomacy, she was joined by a ninja and two melee-focused Red Ogres.
Four A-rank Kijin warriors.
Before Damien's arrival, this force could've conquered the western forest, not just recruited Goblins.
Benimaru and Hakurou's teams also set out, targeting the Tengu mountains to deliver Damien's goodwill.
If possible, he wanted the Tengu to bolster his air forces.
Two days passed.
"Lord Damien."
That night, Souei contacted him.
"You're there, Souei?"
Damien asked, "How's it looking?"
"It's bad."
Souei was sent to scout the Orcs.
In the original story, the Orcs, starving, saw their leader... later the Orc Lord... seek hope elsewhere.
Notably, the Orc leader had the Unique Skill Hungerer before Gelmud named him.
Hungerer, like a curse, spiked the docile Orcs' appetites, exhausting food stores and driving them to cannibalism.
***
