chapters.title: Chapter 65 - 65: [TP] 65: Orc Lord
chapters.content:
"As you suspected."
Souei stood on a cliff, gazing at the barren land under the scorching sun, devoid of grass or trees. "Everything's gone... plants, trees, all of it."
"So, Hungerer has awakened."
This confirmed Damien's timeline estimate.
'Rimuru took months to leave the labyrinth after reincarnating.'
'He then tamed Goblins, Direwolves, met Benimaru's group after the Moderate Harlequin Alliance wiped out their village, and soon faced the Orc invasion.'
Damien pegged the current time as roughly six months before the main plot, with Veldora still around.
But the insect monsters, absent from the original story, made him wary of relying on it entirely.
The real world had butterfly effects.
Damien doubted events would unfold exactly as written.
"Souei."
"Here, my lord!"
"Go to the Lizardmen's territory, inform them of the Orcs' changes, and propose an alliance."
Damien aimed to unite all the forest's monsters, each a vital Magicule source, not to be lost like in the original story.
"As you command!"
Souei, ever efficient, headed to the Lizardmen's stronghold.
'This is tricky.'
Realizing the timeline, Damien felt a twinge of concern, which Snow Empress noticed.
"Master, what's wrong?"
After a moment, Damien shared his intel. "Someone's plotting behind the scenes, with strong foes lurking. It's unsettling."
Rimuru's early antagonist, a minor villain turned power benchmark, was Clayman, one of the Ten Demon Lords.
Despite his poor showing in the original story, easily defeated by Rimuru, Clayman was still a Demon Lord.
Here, "Demon Lord" meant a Demon Lord Seed with a territory and army, claiming the title.
At a Demon Lord meeting, if unopposed, you were a Demon Lord.
"Clayman and the Demon Lords... are they strong?"
Eager for a challenge, Snow Empress itched to test herself against them.
"Seven of the Ten Demon Lords are True Demon Lords."
"The other three are between Demon Lord Seed and True Demon Lord, with Clayman the weakest."
"His Magicules are probably around 400,000."
Magicules weren't everything, so even now, Damien could potentially face Clayman.
Snow Empress and Ogerpon, both A+, could outmatch typical Special A-ranks.
But that wasn't enough.
"I'm not worried about Clayman, but the Moderate Harlequin Alliance behind him."
"Clayman's the weakest member of the Alliance."
"Every other member matches a Demon Lord's power."
Frankly, Damien would be crushed by any Harlequin.
Fortunately, they stayed hidden.
A conflict's commotion would draw other Demon Lords' attention.
Yuuki Kagurazaka wouldn't reveal himself now.
"Each one has Demon Lord-level power?"
Snow Empress was shocked, increasingly convinced following Damien was her best decision. "Intriguing!"
"There'll be a chance."
Damien said, "If things go south, I'll use Planeswalker to take us to another world."
With Planeswalker as a fallback, the worst case was retreating to grow stronger and return for revenge.
"Time to explore a new world after settling things here."
Being targeted felt awful, and Damien loathed schemers in the shadows. "Even if they're not after us specifically, if they're destined enemies, there's nothing to discuss."
Walking Rimuru's path meant facing Rimuru's foes.
"The Orcs' intel is secured."
"Treyni's guiding the Goblin recruitment."
Damien wasn't worried about Sakurako's team with the Goblins.
Treyni could summon the Elementals Lord of Wind; even if Harlequins were in the forest, they wouldn't dare provoke her.
"How are Benimaru and Hakurou doing?"
Damien knew little about this world's Tengu.
"Tengu?"
Snow and Ice Empresss perked up. "What are those? Some spirit?"
"No."
Damien clarified, "They're more like winged angels."
Long ago, angelic spirits merged with mutated Mountain Wolves, birthing the Tengu.
Not literally long-nosed, they wore red long-nose masks, with white or black wings, dubbed Tengu for their arrogance.
Three hundred years ago, the Tengu chief, Kaede, trained under Hakurou's master, Byakuya Araki, alongside Hakurou.
They fell in love, conceiving a daughter, Momiji, from the original story.
Tengu pregnancies were long; Kaede took three hundred years to birth Momiji, passing most of her Magicules to her.
Stronger monsters rarely reproduced, as it harmed them.
Offspring inherited significant parental power, even felling the Star Dragon King.
With Hakurou's ties to the Tengu and Benimaru's potential for a marriage alliance like the original story, Damien saw a strong chance to win their loyalty.
If needed, he'd take on their feud with Frey.
Frey might outmatch Clayman but not the Harlequins.
Damien was confident he'd grow too strong for Frey to challenge before any conflict arose.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 66 - 66: [TP] 66: Goblins
chapters.content:
"The Tengu's territory is near Demon Lord Frey's nation."
Snow Empress memorized the Cardinal World's map. "Hakurou and the others will take a while."
"Then we'll wait until the Goblins submit."
Damien used the time to study his Planeswalker skill.
He discovered opening otherworld gates wasn't entirely random; there was some control.
Instead of using Planeswalker directly, he could disperse Magicules to sense world gates in the void.
This let him glimpse fragments of the target world, gauging its nature.
Best of all, it didn't consume Planeswalker's travel charges.
He didn't need to worry about being unable to escape danger.
"Let's see what the next world looks like."
Damien closed his eyes, focusing entirely on Planeswalker.
Images flashed rapidly in his mind... worlds teeming with monsters, universes twisted by bizarre rules.
A flood of information overwhelmed him, forcing him to cut the connection.
"Huff! Huff! Huff!"
Eyes open, Damien panted, sweat beading on his forehead.
"You okay?"
Snow Empress rushed to check on him.
His distress was felt keenly by Ice Empress, Ogerpon, and other subordinates, but he reassured them he was training.
"I'm fine."
Damien smiled at Snow Empress. "Got lucky... caught an interesting world."
"Interesting world?"
"Not sure yet."
This new world was unique. "It has a strong barrier. I can't enter as easily as before."
Contacting or entering it directly was impossible.
When Planeswalker touched it, the world's will resisted fiercely.
It wanted no outsiders, content to exist in isolation.
"Forcing entry won't work either."
"That world is vast."
Damien couldn't gauge its full scope, but it rivaled the Cardinal World in scale.
Sneaking in like he did with Douluo Continent was tough.
"Then the second method?"
"No."
Damien shook his head. "If it's as I suspect, entering in person is too risky."
"So, we use the second method, but safer."
"Safer?"
Snow Empress received Damien's shared intel on the new world.
Like him, she recognized its vastness and danger.
"What's the plan?"
"Remote projection."
In other worlds, projection wouldn't work.
But with this world, Planeswalker might exploit a loophole.
"I need to prepare."
"Not just me... you, Ice Empress, Ogerpon, Shuna, everyone."
Damien declared, "We're all fighting this battle together!"
"Sounds fun."
Snow Empress grinned, catching his intent. "That world likely has abilities perfect for you."
"Yeah."
Damien said, "We wait patiently for our chance to descend."
While Damien and Snow Empress planned for the new world, the Kijin team with Treyni reached a Goblin village.
The Goblin settlement wasn't far from the Kijin's.
At A-rank Kijin speed, a day and night could cross half the Jura Forest, let alone this short trip.
They left at noon and arrived by evening.
"So scary."
"Why are such strong Majin here?"
"Is our village doomed?"
In the village, Goblins... child-sized, clutching short sticks and rusty blades... stared at Sakurako and her team in terror.
"Who are you?!"
Despite trembling, an elderly Goblin spoke. "Please don't hurt us! We have nothing, but we'll give up our food!"
"This is the Goblins' state now?"
"So pathetic."
Sakurako was disappointed.
The silver-haired girl brushed her locks, stepping forward despite her discontent. "I am an envoy of the Kijin, here to convey my lord's will!"
"Submit to my lord, and you'll gain protection and food!"
"Huh?"
The Goblin chief thought he misheard, turning to his scrawny son. "What did she say? Submit?"
"Yes, Father."
The young Goblin's voice held excitement. "She said they'll give us food and protection!"
"Is that true?"
"Someone would protect us?"
"The Kijin are super strong monsters!"
"…"
Submitting to the strong came naturally to Goblins.
They'd never refuse an offer.
Sadly, no one valued Goblins.
At the bottom of the monster hierarchy, their existence value barely reached 1,000.
During their peak, individual Goblin existence values hit E-rank, over 1,000.
That was their last glory.
Now, the forest's 8,000 Goblins had at most 500 Magicules... solid F-rank.
A farmer could thrash four or five barehanded.
Such weak creatures, useful only for wasting food?
"Too weak."
"For Lord Damien to shelter them shows his mercy."
The three Kijin with Sakurako marveled at his kindness, recruiting even Goblins.
"Enough!"
Sakurako cut them off, warning, "Don't question our lord's decisions!"
"Yes."
The three bowed, apologizing.
Sakurako led the team.
Their mission: protect her and escort the Goblins safely back.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 67 - 67: [TP] 67: Descendants
chapters.content:
"Miss Treyni, please vouch for us."
"Of course."
The Dryad, hidden until now, revealed herself, sparking chaos among the Goblins.
Every monster in the Jura Forest knew the legend of the forest's guardian Dryads.
Seeing one in person was overwhelming, like a mountain god appearing before believers.
"Don't doubt, Goblins."
Treyni stepped forward. "The Kijin mean no harm. They genuinely seek your loyalty."
"A powerful Majin has risen in the forest."
"He aims to rule it, offering protection to its inhabitants."
"Have no fear... join them boldly."
"I swear on my honor as the Jura Forest's steward, this is no lie!"
Already inclined to serve the strong, the Goblins, backed by Treyni's guarantee, erupted in excitement.
"Amazing!"
"We'll have protectors too?"
"No more fearing monsters in the wild!"
"Please, enter our village, Kijin lords!"
The Jura Forest's Goblins, unlike their cunning, evil depictions elsewhere, were simple, almost naively so.
In the Cardinal World, Goblins were a failed creation of the Divine Ancestral, Twilight Valentine.
They were a fallen beings from Sprites.
Earth Sprites became Dwarves, Fire Spirites becames Kijin, Water Sprites became Merfolk, and Wind Sprites became Elves.
And Goblins were degraded from Fire Sprites, were the lowest-tier being than Orgres.
Their great surge exhausted their racial blessing, leading to their current state.
"Primitive, poor, backward…"
Entering the Goblin village, Sakurako saw only desolation.
Among demi-humans, Goblins lived the worst.
The chief offered food to their Kijin guests.
It was bland, unsalted, with only fruits palatable.
But as future allies, they politely ate some.
Damien's travels to the Pokémonverse and Konosubaverse brought resources that improved Kijin life.
Before, their quality of life barely surpassed the Goblins'.
At most, they had more food.
Sakurako's team didn't scorn the Goblins' hospitality.
Their good life came from Damien, not their own efforts.
Once Goblins joined him, they'd share the benefits in time.
"Here are gifts for the Goblins. Please accept them."
Sakurako produced supplies from her storage space for the Goblins.
The gesture stunned them.
Tasty food, seasonings, clothes, and shoes sized for Goblins... carefully prepared by the Kijin.
The source was simple.
Shuna's Analyst skill manipulated materials, easily crafting daily goods.
"Pack your things and gather your people."
"We'll visit other villages to unite everyone."
With 8,000 Goblins across roughly 80 villages of 100 each, visiting them all would take a full day.
Fortunately, the villages were close.
Some, on good terms, could relay messages.
The Goblins moved swiftly, eager to join a protector.
They packed quickly, ready to depart.
Sakurako disdained their messy villages. Though the area was Rimuru's future capital in the original story, it was unremarkable now.
Rimuru built it from scratch.
The future capital lay in the Kijin village.
Now, needing population, 8,000 Goblins would speed its growth to a town.
"Please, Kijin lords, wait a bit. We'll prepare our supplies."
"Hurry, don't keep them waiting!"
"We're on it!"
The Goblin villages reacted similarly.
From wariness and doubt to excitement over gifts and joy at being accepted.
Soon, under their chiefs' lead, masses of Goblins gathered on a designated plain.
"These should be all the nearby Goblin villages."
"Let's move."
At Sakurako's command, the vast Goblin procession, guarded by Kijin, headed toward the Kijin village.
With so many, the half-day trip stretched to three days.
Sakurako's team protected the Goblins.
Nearly 10,000 strong, their small size still formed a dense mass.
To keep them safe, the Kijin stayed vigilant, using Magicule perception to guard against forest beasts.
"Oh my, oh my!"
"Quite the sight!"
"Spectacular Spectacular"
Three hidden figures in the forest watched.
They were Moderate Harlequin Alliance members: Laplace the Pleasure Clown, Footman the Angry Clown, and Tear the Crying Clown.
They'd been in the forest for a while.
Clayman led the Jura Forest scheme, with them assisting.
"The bugs were crushed."
"Now even the forest's guardian helps him."
"He's becoming someone big."
A Majin rising in a month to this level alarmed Laplace, unlike Clayman's nonchalance.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 68 - 68: [TP] 68: Direwolf Pack
chapters.content:
"Should we intervene?"
Laplace twirled, eyes glinting with cunning. "Those monsters around that guy look tough."
"They tamed the Kijin, now the Goblins."
Footman, the Angry Clown, wasn't as volatile as his title suggested. "Feels like they're planning something."
"No intervention?"
"This'll ruin Clayman's plans."
Footman wanted to test Damien's depths; Tear urged caution.
"Too conspicuous."
Tear fidgeted with her sleeves, hesitant. "The Demon Lords will notice, right?"
The four Kijin were already formidable.
A fight would cause a ruckus.
With Treyni the Dryad present, they dared not provoke her.
"Report to Clayman and let him handle it."
The trio preferred to stay out, as Clayman led the Jura Forest scheme.
If anyone should worry, it was him.
"Then let's find Clayman."
"Wonder how he'll deal with this intruder."
The clowns lurked in the shadows, watching the group.
Sakurako's team, unaware, had caught a Demon Lord's eye.
Swish, swish, swish~~
Moonlight bathed the vast grassland, silver glow weaving with dark green into a mystic calm.
A gentle night breeze rustled the grass, whispering the plain's secrets.
Dozens of giant wolves dashed across, their forms flickering like lunar phantoms.
The Goblins' mass movement drew not only the clowns but other forest monsters.
Among them were the Direwolves, who, in the original story, attacked Goblin villages for forest dominance.
Howl~~
On a hill, a massive Direwolf howled.
Behind it, hundreds awaited their alpha's orders on attacking the migrating Goblins.
"Father!"
A young Direwolf, the alpha's heir and strongest of its generation, returned from scouting.
"Did you learn why the Goblins left?"
"I smelled Kijin!"
"Kijin?"
The alpha recalled the forest's Kijin, B-rank Majin far beyond their C-rank.
Despite numerical advantage, facing them made the alpha hesitate.
"The Goblins submitted to the Kijin?"
"We can't let them reach their village!"
If they did, the Kijin's strength, bolstered by Goblin soldiers, would hinder the Direwolves' rise.
Veldora's presence still lingered, and the forest's monsters hadn't begun their brutal infighting.
The clowns, at Clayman's behest, were stirring chaos.
But it hadn't fully started.
The Direwolves numbered 1,000, more than in the original story.
With coordination, they could challenge the Kijin village.
They'd likely lose, though.
"If the Kijin lose their numbers disadvantage, no tribe could rival them!"
The alpha, decided, declared, "Attack the Goblins now!"
"But, Father, if the Kijin find out?"
"We'll flee east!"
The alpha saw clearly: killing Goblins would boost their existence value.
Migrating east, where Kijin weren't adept trackers, would keep them safe.
Now was the perfect time.
Each Goblin killed yielded Magicules.
For intelligent forest monsters, conquest was the best way to raise existence value.
Race versus race warfare.
The victor reigned; the loser fell to dust.
Unlike Ogerpon's instantaneous Growth skill, racial conquest took time.
Months at least, years at most.
Leading its pack to wipe out the Goblins, the alpha believed it could gain a powerful skill.
An Extra Skill was guaranteed; a Unique Skill wasn't impossible.
In the original story, Goblins dwindled to a couple thousand due to attacks from Direwolves and others.
'This chance can't be missed!'
The alpha saw it as a golden opportunity.
Goblins roaming freely could be culled without breaking monster codes.
"Feel that?"
A masked Kijin ninja, Sounin, trained alongside Souei since childhood.
Using thought communication, the four could share intel and decide swiftly.
"Yes."
Sakurako nodded. "Three kilometers back, a group of C-rank-plus monsters is gathering fast."
"Numbers…"
"At least 500."
"What are they?"
Sakurako rarely left the village, knowing little of the outside.
Sounin, having done mercenary work, recognized them. "Direwolves."
"The largest Direwolf pack in the forest."
The Jura Forest hosted multiple Direwolf tribes, from 50 to a few hundred.
This pack, led by the alpha, was the biggest.
"What do they want?"
"Likely targeting our Goblins."
Hidden in darkness, Sounin observed the forest's hunters.
A single Direwolf was C-rank.
In a pack, their strength scaled with numbers.
Over 500 together reached C+ on average.
If the alpha unified the Direwolves and culled the Goblins, they might form a 2,000–3,000-strong B-rank army.
Even the Kijin village would struggle, risking collapse.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 69 - 69: [TP] 69: Kijin Strike
chapters.content:
"Hm?"
Sakurako's senses picked up the Direwolf pack splitting to both sides. "Are they trying to flank us?"
"Akahi, Akatsuki!"
"Leave it to us."
Akahi and Akatsuki, siblings from the Red Ogres, were Benimaru's cousins, early members of his Red Ogre crew.
Howl~~
Wolf howls echoed from all directions, terrifying the traveling Goblins.
The elderly Goblin chief, trembling, tried to calm his people. "Don't fear!"
"It's Direwolves!"
The chief's son glimpsed figures darting in the dark, his body gripped by primal fear of the beasts.
"Don't panic!"
Their village, closest to Veldora's cave, made the chief the eldest Goblin. First to pledge to Sakurako, he was named temporary leader.
"Everyone, grab weapons! Protect the women and children behind us!"
His voice quavered, but his orders were sound.
Soon, the Goblins formed a circle, shielding the vulnerable, gripping tattered weapons, ready to fight.
'Even weak Goblins will fight for survival.'
Sakurako nodded, gaining some respect for them.
"Direwolves, halt now, don't think our lack of action is a weakness."
Akahi and Akatsuki amplified their voices with Magicules, warning the wolves. "Come closer, and you war with the Kijin!"
Howl~~
But the Direwolves wouldn't abandon such a feast.
So many Goblins in one place saved them the trouble of raiding.
Devouring them would yield vast Magicules, letting the Direwolves rise in the perilous forest.
"Tch."
Sounin, blending with the night, tracked their movements, communicating, "Strike. They've chosen to be our enemies."
"They underestimate us."
The siblings exchanged a glance, releasing their suppressed Magicules.
Instantly, the concealed A-rank aura surged like a tsunami, overwhelming all creatures on the plain.
Goblins and Direwolves alike froze under the terrifying pressure.
"What?!"
The Direwolf alpha's fur bristled, eyes wide with disbelief. "This Magicule level!!"
"No, impossible, how?!"
"Why are the Kijin this strong?!"
"You're not Kijin!"
The alpha, limited in knowledge, had never seen true Kijin.
In the Jura Forest, excluding Dryads like Treyni, B+ was the monster peak.
A-rank upper Majin were named monsters only!
In other words, the two red-haired Kijin were named.
No!
Not just them!
Sakurako, and Sounin, who appeared behind, cutting off the wolves' retreat.
"Four… four upper Majin Kijin!"
The alpha regretted its choice, realizing the hunters had become the hunted.
"Retreat!!"
Without hesitation, it howled the order.
It miscalculated.
It thought these were ordinary Kijin leading Goblins.
But true Kijin…
Even one was beyond them.
Recall Benimaru in the original story, incinerating hundreds of Orcs with Black Flame Prison.
Akahi and Akatsuki were no weaker than that Benimaru.
Wiping out 500 Direwolves would take minutes.
Howl~~
Instinctively, the wolves scattered in all directions.
"Stop them!"
"Not one escapes!"
Sakurako ordered Sounin, who spread his arms, casting crystalline threads, enveloping the battlefield.
[Interstice Crystal Threads]
An Extra Skill inherited from Damien's spatial element.
It could sever space, drawing fine threads.
These spatial threads bound enemies and cut like divine blades.
"Space Manipulation: Thread the Needle!"
A streak shot from Sounin's palm, flickering through space, linking the crystal threads.
Clap!
Sakurako clapped, forming an invisible barrier around the Direwolves.
The circular network Sounin wove glowed with prismatic light, like a translucent kaleidoscope.
Swish, swish, swish…
Direwolves charging forward saw fleeting glimmers in the dark.
Ignoring them, they collided.
And then…
Whine?
The leading wolves vanished, reappearing elsewhere, now facing Sakurako's group.
"???"
The Direwolves were baffled.
"What's happening?"
The alpha realized things were beyond its grasp.
The Kijin had sealed the space.
The transparent, ring-like mirrors teleported the wolves back, trapping them within the barrier.
"What now?"
Sounin, watching the frantic wolves, joined Sakurako, asking how to handle them.
"Lord Damien likely needs them."
Damien favored recruiting and taming monsters.
Roar!!
Dozens of Direwolves, unable to escape, lunged at the Goblins.
But Akahi and Akatsuki, locked on, wouldn't let them.
Smack!
Akatsuki flicked her hand, sending ten lion-sized wolves flying like sacks.
Whimper…
Despite holding back, her Kijin strength nearly killed them.
"Akatsuki!"
Seeing the scene, Sakurako shouted, "Don't kill them!"
"Oh, oops!"
Akatsuki hadn't meant to. She didn't expect the Direwolves to be so fragile.
She barely used force.
Why were they collapsing?
"Healing Art!"
With no choice, Sakurako cast a healing spell on the barely breathing Direwolves, saving their lives.
"Let me handle this."
Seeing his sister struggle to control her strength under the Direwolves' attacks, Akahi shook his head.
Boom!
The red-haired youth lifted his foot, stomping hard.
Terrifying force shook the earth, sending shockwaves outward, knocking Goblins and charging Direwolves to the ground.
"Lord Damien's martial artist skills are incredible."
Akahi's control far surpassed his sister's, incapacitating without harming.
"Now…"
His eyes flashed with sharp intent.
Clenching his fist, he swung toward the Direwolf alpha.
Boom!!
Crack~~~
A horrifying sight unfolded before the Goblins and Direwolves.
The earth split, dirt and stone flying.
A deep trench stretched from Akahi, stopping just before the alpha, hundreds of meters away.
Whine…
The alpha's ambitions shattered with that single punch.
"Do you see the gap between us now?"
Akahi and Akatsuki faced the alpha.
With their and Sounin's display, the alpha knew it had hit a wall.
A-rank was a divide.
Below A-rank, numbers could overwhelm.
But past A-rank, Magicule recovery was monstrous. Unless Kijin recklessly used high-power skills, they'd never run dry.
Even if outmatched, escaping was easy.
Once enmity was set, it wouldn't end until one side yielded.
The alpha regretted its choice to the core.
It shouldn't have targeted these Goblins.
Had it known the Kijin were this terrifying, wouldn't surrender have been better?
Now, four A-rank Majin had it in their sights.
Recalling Akahi and Sounin's power, three or four more strikes could wipe out the Star Wolves.
"What now?"
Seeing the alpha cower, Akatsuki messaged Sakurako for guidance.
They hadn't killed a single Direwolf.
Despite confronting the alpha, the siblings were at a loss.
This power wasn't earned through their training.
Defeating the Direwolves brought no pride.
Only deeper reverence for Damien.
Look!
This was their lord's gift!
Such power, with mere punches and kicks, struck fear into Goblins and Direwolves alike!
"Let Lord Damien decide."
"Lord Damien?!"
Catching Sakurako's message, the siblings understood. "Summon the lord?"
"Hold the Direwolves. I'll contact Lord Damien."
Sakurako used the Corridor of Souls to reach Damien.
Stalling the Direwolves was easy.
Akatsuki and Akahi just stood, radiating Magicules, pressuring the wolves.
They weren't the brightest.
But posing? That they could do.
"Is something wrong, Sakurako?"
The request connected quickly, Damien's voice in her ear.
"Lord Damien, here's the situation…"
Sakurako explained briefly. "We're unsure what to do, so we seek your guidance."
"500 Direwolves?"
"Perfect! I'm coming now!"
Damien's voice carried delight, unexpected fortune thrilling him.
Named monsters, closer than regular subordinates, were his 'kin'.
Through the Corridor of Souls, he sensed their positions and states.
"Ogerpon, Snow Empress, Ice Empress, come with me."
With his strongest subordinates, Damien raised a hand, tearing open a spatial rift.
Rip~~
Space beside Sakurako parted.
"My lord!"
"And Ogerpon-nee, Snow Empress, and Ice Empress!"
Sakurako bowed as the four arrived.
"Ugh, Kijin etiquette is too much."
Ice Empress disliked Sakurako's formal shift.
In the Iceborn Scorpion clan, weaker members saw her as family or elder.
Snow Empress, aloof, cared little for hierarchy.
"Bwoh~~"
Ogerpon, used to it, cheerfully greeted Sakurako and Sounin.
"These are Goblins?"
Damien eyed the tide of small figures nearby. "Degraded fire Sprites. No wonder they differ from my image of Goblins."
His mental image: cunning, vile, sharp-toothed, monkey-faced.
But these Cardinal World Goblins, while not pretty, resembled trembling beggars, not the sleazy creatures he expected.
"Different worlds, different monster settings?"
"Makes sense."
"These Goblins, though called that, are more like Impkin."
Pondering, Damien glanced at the Direwolves. "As in the original, pack-based monsters."
"What's going on here?"
Cracked earth, scattered Direwolves... Damien pieced it together quickly.
Roar~~
Sensing new presences, the Direwolves growled instinctively, trying to intimidate.
The ancient, primal aura from Ice Empress and Snow Empress triggered their fight-or-flight.
"Tch, so noisy!"
Ice Empress, annoyed at the growling, unleashed a piercing chill.
Her control was precise.
Nearby Goblins felt only a cool breeze.
But the distant Direwolves froze, shivering as if plunged into an icy abyss.
The grass beyond the circle frosted over instantly, and even the three hidden clowns felt a chill.
"Terrifying ice Magicules."
Laplace's heart raced.
He'd seen ice magic before.
But such potent, penetrating cold was unheard of.
"Brr, so cold!"
Tear hugged herself. "This Magicule quality is unreal!"
"Unique Skill, it has to be!"
Normal skills wouldn't affect them with their resistances.
An Extra Skill might pierce their defenses.
But this was a wide-area effect, not even targeting them, yet so intense.
Only a Unique Skill could explain it.
"Another named monster with a Unique Skill."
Laplace couldn't fathom how Damien gathered such powerful followers.
"Hm?"
Snow Empress, watching Damien speak with the Goblin chief, sensed something.
Her gaze shifted to the dark forest.
It was silent, but she felt prying eyes.
"What's wrong, Snow Empress?"
Damien, inviting the Goblins to join him, grew wary at her reaction.
"Not sure."
Her eyes narrowed. "But I feel watched."
"Watched…"
Damien's mind raced to a possibility: The Moderate Harlequin Alliance?
[Detect Pursuit]
He cast an anti-surveillance skill.
[Notice: No surveillance detected]
"…"
Damien stared at the feedback, speechless.
He didn't think Snow Empress was mistaken.
'In the Jura Forest, something spying on us that even Snow Empress can't pinpoint…'
Aside from Treyni and her Dryads, only Laplace, Footman, and Tear from the Harlequins fit.
Dryads were out.
Treyni had appeared among the Goblins since Damien's arrival.
Other Dryads would greet her, not lurk and stare.
"Treyni, can you set a barrier to block all external probing?"
Damien and Snow Empress lacked strong counter-surveillance.
Sakurako's barrier was physical.
It was weak against specialized intel-gathering skills.
But they had Treyni!
As a Dryad, spying on forest life and hiding her presence was second nature.
And if she could hide, she could block.
"No problem!"
Initially unaware, Treyni reacted to Damien's words.
She probed the distant forest.
Nothing... likely the clowns sensed exposure and fled.
Hum~~
Treyni raised an invisible barrier, shielding the Goblins and Damien's group.
"Akahi, bring the Direwolf alpha to me."
"Yes, my lord!"
Akahi's eyes sharpened.
He crossed hundreds of meters instantly, grabbing the alpha by the scruff before it could react, and brought it to Damien.
Whimper…
The alpha had never faced such humiliation.
It wanted to resist, but Akahi's strength pinned it down, unable to lift its head.
It could only whine, suppressing fear and unease.
"My lord, the enemy leader is here for your judgment!"
Akahi knelt, pressing the alpha's head to force submission.
"Hm, let it go for now."
"Yes!"
Akahi and the others had no concern the alpha could harm Damien.
A sub-B-rank monster couldn't touch their lord.
Not under their watch.
If it did, they'd have no face to live... better to end it themselves.
"Wolf or dog?"
"Wolf, probably."
Ice Empress crouched, inspecting the prostrate alpha, poking its nose.
Whine…
The alpha was terrified.
Ice Empress's Magicules were only around 30,000.
But her 400,000-year beastly aura, preserved by the Voice of the World, remained.
In plain terms: killing intent!
Over eons, she'd slain countless humans, beasts, and soul creatures.
That accumulated ferocity was beyond this world's ordinary monsters.
Normally, she restrained it.
To the Kijin, she was just a tsundere twin-tailed girl, more cute than scary.
But the alpha, a beast, had keen instincts.
It sensed the ancient terror standing atop a mountain of corpses and blood.
"Stay put until my lord handles his business, then we'll deal with you!"
The alpha didn't dare snap at Ice Empress, nodding fervently to show compliance.
No choice... the gap was too wide.
Four A-rank Kijin were bad enough.
Then came these powerhouses!
Especially this human-like monster, utterly horrifying.
Worse, she served a master!
Too much!
The alpha wanted to cry.
If regret was a medicine, it'd slap its past self and tell it to abandon dreams of dominance.
The Jura Forest's waters were too deep... it couldn't navigate them!
***
If you want to read up to 50 chapters ahead, don't hesitate to visit our patron: pat reon . com / XElenea (remove space)

chapters.title: Chapter 70 - 70: [TP] 70: Complete Awakening
chapters.content:
"Are you… Are you the lord that Lady Sakurako spoke of?"
On the other side, the one chosen by the goblins to serve as their temporary clan leader was none other than the elderly goblin from the original story.
He wore a dusty brown cloak, leaning on a cane, his frail body looking as though a gust of wind could knock him over.
"Yes, my name is Damien."
Damien wasted no words and declared, "My purpose has already been conveyed to you by Sakurako and the others."
"Under the witness of Miss Treyni, I will accept your allegiance and grant you my protection."
"From this day forward, you will be my people, obeying my commands."
"I make this promise to you."
Damien said seriously, "As long as you remain loyal to me, I will protect your lives and possessions from any who would harm you!"
"Are you willing?"
The goblins didn't fully grasp the weight of Damien's words.
All they knew was that they, weak goblins, were about to receive the protection of a powerful being.
In the world of monsters, the strong reign supreme.
Living in the forest, where survival was never guaranteed, having someone willing to protect them in exchange for their freedom and loyalty was only natural!
In fact, Damien was being remarkably merciful.
"We're willing! We're willing!"
"Praise to you, great master!"
And so, the goblins gathered before Damien fell to their knees like dominoes, pledging their loyalty.
[Acquired 8600 Goblin Followers]
[Calculating Total Magicules]
[Calculation Complete: Goblins Total Magicules: 258860 EP]
[Unique Skill 'Leader' Begins Consolidating Magicules]
[Consolidation Complete]
[Acquired 78000 EP Magicules]
"Ugh!"
The sudden surge of magicules overwhelmed Damien for a moment, catching him off guard.
His magic capacity expanded, triggering a cascade of reactions.
Boom!
With Damien at the center, his magic power erupted as a shockwave, spreading in all directions. A brilliant blue pillar of magical energy, shimmering with star-like particles, shot into the sky.
If not for Treyni's quick reaction, alongside the Snow Empress standing nearby, shielding the goblins from Damien's overwhelming magical pressure, the closest goblins would likely have been knocked unconscious by the force alone.
"Such… such terrifying presence!"
"Is this the power of our lord?"
"How fearsome…"
Even with the Snow Empress's protection, the goblins still felt the weight of their new master's power.
It was a vast magical force beyond their comprehension.
In that moment, countless goblins were both awestruck and overjoyed.
To think such a powerful being would accept their service.
"Damien…"
The Ice Empress and Ogerpon noticed the change in Damien.
But the two women didn't act rashly. Instead, they stayed in place, assisting Treyni in maintaining the stability of the anti-detection barrier.
With the Snow Empress by Damien's side, nothing would go wrong.
After all, in terms of combat ability, the Snow Empress was the strongest among them.
Whimper…
As for the remaining Direwolves, they were utterly stunned.
What kind of monster had they been opposing?
At the same time, the Direwolves envied the goblins for earning the favor of such a powerful Majin.
'If only… if only that lord would accept our allegiance as well.'
Unbidden, the thought arose in the Direwolves leader's mind.
Even the Ice Empress alone made resistance seem futile.
Submitting to the strong was not shameful.
To preserve their race and continue their bloodline, following a leader with a brighter future was the wisest choice.
The Direwolves was a pack species, with its own social structure.
The alpha led, followed by the main fighting force of the pack, with the elderly wolves and cubs holding the lowest status.
But Damien had no time to recruit the Direwolves.
His mind was flooded with a torrent of information, his body caught in a tempest as it underwent transformation from the massive influx of magicules.
[Detected Magicules Exceeding 100,000, Evolution Conditions Met]
[Initiating Evolution… Evolution Failed]
[Attempting Again]
[Evolution Failed]
[…]
The repetitive messages looped countless times.
Finally, when Damien was growing weary of the cycle, a fragment resembling a miniature cosmos appeared before his eyes within the core of the Cardinal World.
[Discovered Fragment of Star Dragon King Veldanava's Power. Fuse?]
[Upon Fusion, Individual Will Fully Awaken as 'Dragonoid' and Gain the Dragon Species 'Star Dragon King' Evolution Path]
"Fuse!"
Damien hadn't expected that evolving from A-rank to Special A-rank would lead to such an event.
In the original story, Rimuru's extraordinary evolution speed... reaching Veldanava level in just a few years... was speculated to stem from his identity and the Unique Skill 'Great Sage.'
Regarding Rimuru's origins, one theory held that Rimuru was the reincarnation of the Star Dragon King Veldanava, with Great Sage being Lucia, Veldanava's wife.
But Damien believed Rimuru wasn't truly the Star Dragon King.
Rather, the Star Dragon King had long since fallen, and like Rudra, the emperor of the Eastern Empire, had split his soul into countless fragments.
One of the larger fragments had landed in Satoru Mikami, who then reincarnated as Rimuru.
Damien's situation, however, was different.
What he received wasn't a soul fragment of the Star Dragon King but a fragment of his power.
More precisely, it was the authority the Star Dragon King had left in the Cardinal World.
[Notice: Individual 'Damien' Has Successfully Evolved into Dragonoid]
[Acquired Unique Skill 'Voice of the World']
[Unique Skill 'Leader' Evolved into 'Unity of All Spirits']
[Unique Skill 'Planeswalker (Exceptional)' Evolved into 'Gate of the Void']
[Acquired Special Skill 'Dragonoid Transformation']
Phew…
The evolution complete, Damien remained in a daze.
He could feel the magic power within him, now several times greater than before.
More astonishingly, through the special skill of magicule solidification, his physical capabilities had also increased exponentially.
"Power!"
"Unprecedented strength!"
Damien clenched his fist, looking at his hand to find his once-human palm had transformed into sharp dragon claws.
And behind him, a pair of ethereal, azure dragon wings... hovering between reality and illusion... slowly unfurled.
***
If you want to read up to 50 chapters ahead, don't hesitate to visit our patron: pat reon . com / XElenea (remove space)

chapters.title: Chapter 71 - 71: [TP] 71: Voice of the World
chapters.content:
"Is this the form of my fully awakened Dragonoid bloodline?"
Damien had no complaints about his current appearance, as it wasn't permanent.
Whenever he wished, he could retract his draconic features and return to a human form.
This was similar to Milim, one of the Demon Lords.
Moreover, Damien possessed a dragon transformation ability that even Milim lacked.
[Dragonoid Transformation]
Description: Fully unleashes the magicules within, constructing a dragon species body. This process consumes a vast amount of magicules, and each use leaves the user in a weakened state for a time.
"Dragonoid Transformation, consuming a large amount of magicules…"
"It sounds like a transformation skill."
Damien mused to himself, "I wonder how much it boosts my magicules and how much stronger it makes me?"
[Notice: In Dragonoid Transformation, magicules will be ten times greater than in the semi-dragon state.]
"What?"
Damien was thrilled at first but quickly reacted, "Who are you? Great Sage?"
[Notice: This entity is the Unique Skill 'Voice of the World,' not 'Great Sage.']
"???"
Damien paused, then realized something and asked, "Are you the new ability I just acquired?"
[Notice: Yes.]
[Unique Skill 'Voice of the World': An advanced replacement for the Unique Skill Great Sage, possessing the following abilities]
Thought Acceleration: Increases perception speed by a thousandfold.
Analysis and Appraisal: Analyzes and appraises target objects.
Parallel Processing: Separates the subject of analysis from thought processes for computation.
Chant Cancellation: Allows the use of magic and skills without incantations.
All of Creation: Gathers unshielded information from this world.
These abilities were very similar to Rimuru's Great Sage.
However, Damien's Voice of the World possessed additional capabilities that Great Sage lacked.
For instance, 'Core Connection,' which could analyze different rules, store them, and extract them.
There were also abilities like 'Gate Management,' 'Spacetime Stabilization,' 'Anchor Inscription,' and 'Stellar Projection,' among others.
"Where did you come from?"
Damien glanced over the various abilities of Voice of the World.
More than that, he wanted to know its origin and whether it could harm him.
[Notice: This entity was born from the essence of the individual 'Damien,' fused with the voice of the Cardinal World's rules, manifesting as a new embodiment of those rules.]
In simple terms, this Voice of the World was distinct from the embodiment of the Cardinal World's rules.
The Cardinal World was created by the Star Dragon King Veldanava, who infused his wife Lucia's voice into it, turning it into something akin to a world's will.
However, the true Voice of the World lacked a soul or self-awareness, existing as a pure tool.
"Do you have your own consciousness?"
[Notice: Yes.]
The newborn Voice of the World originated from Damien's soul essence.
As Damien traveled through the Pokemonverse, Konosubaverse, and Douluoverse, the Voice of the World continuously absorbed new rules.
Ultimately, it gathered enough power of laws and, with Damien's breakthrough to Special A-rank, successfully came into being.
"So, you were born because I kept traveling between worlds?"
[Notice: Yes.]
"This is really…"
Damien hadn't expected things to unfold this way.
The Cardinal World was a chaotic world created by the Star Dragon King.
As a world, it lacked self-awareness or emotions, merely executing preprogrammed directives mechanically.
In the original story, Great Sage essentially hijacked the authority of the Voice of the World.
Eventually, it subtly replaced the will of the Cardinal World.
When Rimuru became a Supreme Deity, Ciel naturally became the will of the Cardinal World.
"What's your purpose?"
Damien couldn't quite describe his feelings toward the Voice of the World.
First, there was a sense of closeness, like a bond of shared blood.
Second was trust and absolute control.
As one of Damien's abilities, the Voice of the World was an extension of his power.
If he wished, Damien could easily erase its consciousness, turning it into a program that only followed predetermined commands.
[Notice: Purpose One: Assist the individual 'Damien' in achieving greater growth.]
[Notice: Purpose Two: Perfect myself and gain control over the Cardinal World.]
"I understand the first part, but perfecting yourself and controlling the Cardinal World... is that what I think it means?"
Damien asked, "You want to become the 'Supreme Will' of the Cardinal World?"
[Notice: Yes.]
Without Damien, the Voice of the World couldn't have absorbed the rules of the Pokemonverse, Konosubaverse, and Douluoverse, thus gaining consciousness.
As for their relationship, the Voice of the World and Damien were of the same origin, with Damien as the primary.
If Damien were to fall, the Voice of the World would vanish alongside him.
Thus, the Voice of the World would never harm Damien, only striving to assist and protect him.
"But would the Cardinal World allow that?"
The Cardinal World had previously helped Damien negotiate with the Great Arceus of the Sinnoh region.
Both parties had tacitly agreed to cooperate and grow together.
However, faced with such immense stakes, Damien found it hard to decide.
On one side was his own ability; on the other was an external entity.
If the Voice of the World could become the Supreme Will of the Cardinal World, Damien would effectively be the master of the world.
If Ciel in the original story could achieve it, why couldn't Damien's Voice of the World?
Rather than letting Rimuru claim it in the future, why not let Damien seize it first?
[Notice: The rules of the Cardinal World are not as the host believes.]
"Hm?"
Damien asked, "What do you mean?"
[Notice: The Cardinal World will never develop self-awareness. This was programmed into its core by the Star Dragon King at creation, unchangeable by anyone.]
"Then what was the world's will that helped me traverse worlds?"
[Notice: The world's instinct!]
In the Voice of the World's words, if the world were a living entity, its instincts would be to grow, strengthen itself, and ascend dimensions.
"That makes it sound…"
Damien quipped, "like I'm some kind of probiotic, and the Cardinal World instinctively chose to coexist with me."
[Notice: That is the truth.]
"To what extent can you act?"
Damien asked, "Can you replace the Cardinal World's will and govern its rules?"
[Notice: In my nascent state, I am very weak and cannot significantly interfere with reality.]
[Notice: I can only perform limited rule modifications.]
"Uh…"
Damien understood.
The Star Dragon King had established the Cardinal World's rules.
Though the Voice of the World had gained consciousness, it couldn't defy Veldanava's will.
Things were as they always had been.
The Voice of the World couldn't openly cheat for Damien, only offer him backdoor advantages.
***
If you want to read up to 50 chapters ahead, don't hesitate to visit our patron: pat reon . com / XElenea (remove space)

chapters.title: Chapter 72 - 72: [TP] 72: World Spirit
chapters.content:
"How long will it take to fully control the Cardinal World?"
[Notice: The gap between the Creator and the Star Dragon King is too vast. Currently, it is impossible to interfere with his lingering will.]
"Is there a specific rank required?"
[Notice: When the Creator breaks through to Special S-rank, they may attempt to seize full control of the Cardinal World.]
[Notice: Special S-rank only grants eligibility to vie for control, so it is not recommended.]
In theory, if Damien's strength surpassed that of the Star Dragon King, the Voice of the World could overtake the original rules.
To put it simply:
If the Cardinal World were a company, Damien would be a shareholder, and the Voice of the World would be the CEO.
Yes, the CEO.
Currently, the Voice of the World was the only consciousness in the Cardinal World with the qualifications to vie for authority.
This CEO held significant power but could only follow the company's rules, unable to modify or create new ones.
"So, I need to visit other worlds, gather resources, and invest them into the company to increase my shareholding."
"Once my shares exceed those of the Star Dragon King, the company will be entirely under my control."
Damien asked, "Is that the idea?"
[Notice: Yes.]
Moreover, the Voice of the World would manage the Cardinal World, making it a solid foundation for Damien.
The Cardinal World was like Damien's stronghold.
With it as his base, Damien could boldly explore other worlds.
"Expand resources and reinvest in growth."
"What affects one affects all."
Most crucially, the Voice of the World was merely a manager, not the owner.
Once, this world belonged to the Star Dragon King. In the future, it would belong to Damien.
The Voice of the World was like a steward, managing Damien's assets and ensuring the health of his resources.
"I see…"
"Then, I look forward to working with you, Voice of the World."
[Notice: I eagerly anticipate our journey together, Creator.]
"But what should I call you?"
"Just 'Voice of the World'?"
"That feels a bit odd."
Damien thought for a moment and said, "How about I give you a name, like I do for monsters?"
[Notice: This will consume a significant amount of the Creator's magicules.]
"Do you need it?"
[Notice: Not supported, but anticipated.]
"I understand…"
Damien was intrigued by the idea of naming the Voice of the World.
As for the risks, if it would truly harm him, the Voice of the World would have firmly refused rather than casually stating 'not supported.'
The Voice of the World had become Damien's companion spirit, capable of assisting in combat and thought, yet wholly subservient to him.
"How about Violet?"
Violet, inspired by the heroine of Violet Evergarden, meaning 'violet.'
Damien wasn't referring to the specific character but felt that if the Voice of the World ever took human form, it might resemble her.
Emotionless, with a hidden yearning beneath a cold exterior, perfectly matching the nascent Voice of the World.
[Notice: Fusing the Creator's wish, initiating integration.]
[Integration complete.]
[Unique Skill 'Voice of the World' evolved into 'World Spirit Violet.']
[Greetings, Creator. World Spirit Violet is at your service.]
"Whoa!"
Damien ignored the loss of nearly half his magicules.
His instincts had been right.
Though Violet was connected to the Cardinal World's roots, possessing all known knowledge, she hadn't yet developed human-like emotions.
How Violet would evolve depended on Damien's guidance.
Through this naming, the Voice of the World had fused with the image of Violet from Damien's memories.
Of course, this didn't mean Violet would be identical to the character.
The image was merely a template; the World Spirit remained the same Voice of the World.
Damien chose Violet because the Voice of the World was newly born.
Picking a more whimsical character might have caused a personality conflict, leading to a failed naming.
"Loyal, calm, pure... she's a lot like you, isn't she?"
"I don't understand."
Violet's voice had changed, aligning perfectly with the Violet from Damien's memories.
"But don't you dare mimic Rimuru's Ciel. I'm not about to become a henpecked husband like the Slime King!"
This was another reason Damien chose 'Violet' for his Voice of the World.
Compared to an overbearing steward, Damien preferred the absolutely obedient Violet, his ideal partner template.
"Creator, greedy."
"That's definitely not something Violet would say!"
"No, I am Violet."
"…"
Damien didn't expect a single naming to completely reshape Violet's identity.
The current Violet was a blend of the original Voice of the World and the Violet from his imagination.
"Fine, this works too."
Damien didn't mind having a companion to talk and banter with. "I'll make sure you gain your freedom soon, Violet."
"…"
"Yes, let's work together, Creator."
[Violet]
[Race: World Spirit]
[Magicules: 200,000 EP (Possesses an avatar at Demon Lord Seed level)]
[Unique Skills: Omniscience and Omnipotence (Narrow) (Analyzes and manipulates all things), World Creation (Unawakened), World Avatar (Possesses an avatar that can return to peak condition over time, even if magicules are depleted)]
This was Violet's status panel.
Her race, World Spirit, was a unique existence born from the original Voice of the World fused with Damien's magicules.
Her essence was tied to the Cardinal World, but her consciousness could act alongside Damien.
Violet had three Unique Skills. Omniscience and Omnipotence allowed her to analyze and manipulate various rules, a superior version of Rimuru's Great Sage.
The second, World Creation, though unawakened, was still accessible to Damien.
[World Creation]
Description: Entrusts one's essence to the Cardinal World, granting immortality as long as the world exists.
"This ability…"
Damien asked, "Why is it unawakened?"
"Because I have not yet fully mastered the Cardinal World."
Damien understood that his soul and Violet's were one.
When Violet fully integrated with the Cardinal World, it would mean Damien had gained control over it.
And as long as the Cardinal World existed, Damien would not truly perish.
He could revive through the Cardinal World time and again.
And as long as Damien lived, Violet would not vanish.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC
***

chapters.title: Chapter 73 - 73: [TP] 73: Familia Contract
chapters.content:
"It's a complete closed loop!"
Damien asked, "What about the last one? What's the ability of World Avatar like?"
"Creator."
As Damien spoke, a beautiful figure appeared before him, bearing the exact likeness of Violet Evergarden from his memories.
"Thanks to the magicules you granted me, I can accompany you in this form."
"Additionally, this body can return its magicules to you."
Fearing Damien might misunderstand, Violet clarified, "Returning the magicules does not mean my regression."
"Once the magicules are returned, this body will collapse."
"But it's only temporary." Violet continued. "Over time, I can absorb magicules from the Cardinal World until this body reaches its magicule storage limit."
"Oh?"
Hearing this, Damien felt a sense of déjà vu. "Isn't that like…"
"Yes, similar to the Storm Dragon within Rimuru."
As a World Spirit born from Damien's essence, Violet possessed all the knowledge her Creator had, including the anime and novels he'd experienced.
"You can treat these magicules as a recoverable reserve."
Violet explained, "It takes roughly half a month to replenish from zero to 200,000."
"So…"
"Yes."
Violet confirmed, "This means you can draw an additional 200,000 magicules from me each month."
"…"
From just this information, Damien could already think of several ways to use these magicules.
For instance, he could use them for naming monsters.
Or, in battle, merge with Violet, combining their magicules for greater effect.
"Is 200,000 the limit?"
"No."
Violet shook her head slightly. "Both the upper limit and recovery speed are only at the current stage."
"Limited by my strength, my World Avatar cannot yet compare to the infinite magicule regeneration of a dragon species."
The magicule recovery speed of dragon species in the Cardinal World was practically a cheat.
In the original story, Rimuru named 200,000 orcs at once, rested for a while, and then returned to peak condition.
That was 200,000! Even with a high dilution ratio between high and low-grade magicules, naming 200,000 orcs was no small feat.
To put it bluntly, even if each orc consumed only 1,000 magicules, that would be a staggering 200 million expenditure!
200 million magicules... what kind of concept was that?
Even late-story Rimuru, fused with two dragon species, barely reached that level.
How could a mere Demon Lord Seed-level Rimuru have that many magicules?
The only explanation was the Storm Dragon.
"Rimuru has the Storm Dragon, and I have Violet!"
Though she couldn't compare yet, Violet would continue to grow, which was the true strength of the World Avatar ability.
"Will using these magicules have any negative effects on you, Violet?"
"No."
Violet wouldn't fall into slumber if the 200,000 magicules were depleted; she'd only lose her avatar temporarily.
At most, it would take half a month for her to recover.
"In fact, as long as no more than half the magicules are consumed at once, the avatar can function normally."
"That's good."
Damien naturally wanted Violet to live alongside him like a person.
If he used up her magicules every time they were available, she'd never be able to maintain her form.
That wasn't something Damien would do.
It was already somewhat shameless to rely on her resources; doing so without restraint would make him no better than a freeloader living off his partner's income.
"These magicules should definitely be used for naming."
Damien wasn't one to make unprofitable deals. Naming was an investment.
There had to be a return for it to be worthwhile.
[Damien]
[Race: Dragonoid]
[Rank: Special A Demon Lord Seed (Calamity Class)]
[Magicules: 205,000 EP (Cannot include Violet's 200,000, as those belong to Damien)]
[Class: Mage]
[General Skills: Domestic Magic, Healing Magic, Elemental Magic, Pokémon Magic, etc.]
[Inherent Skills: Adaptability, All-Class Mastery, etc.]
[Extra Skills: Dragon's Eye, Explosion Magic, Soul Summoning, Human-Soul Unity, Demon Lord Aura]
[Unique Skills: Gate of the Void [Exceptional], World Spirit, Unity of All Spirits, Capturer, Learner, Spirit Tamer]
[Special Skills: Magicule Solidification (Inheritable), Stardust Manipulation (Non-Inheritable), Ring of Divinity (Non-Inheritable), Dragonoid Transformation (Non-Inheritable)]
[Exclusive Skill: Twin Martial Soul – Frost Sovereign]
[Primary Familiar: Violet]
[Familiars: Ogerpon, Snow Empress, Ice Empress, Benimaru, Shuna, Shion, Souei (7/24)]
[Familia: (0/3)]
[Marked Worlds: Pokémonverse(Anchorable), Konosubaverse(Anchorable), Douluoverse(Sealed)]
"My attributes are getting more impressive."
Damien's attention fell on the magicule count: "205,000 magicules."
"Exceeding 200,000 magicules grants the title of Demon Lord Seed."
"In the original story, Clayman, Carrion, and Queen Frey were roughly between 300,000 and 400,000."
In other words, Damien's current strength rivaled the bottom three of the Ten Great Demon Lords.
"And that's without counting the Direwolves."
Damien had no intention of letting the Direwolves go.
The Direwolves had a unique trait: 'the whole is the individual.' Naming one was equivalent to naming the entire pack.
Of course, this naming method differed from individual naming.
For one, it consumed far fewer magicules.
It's worth noting the difference between Damien's new Unique Skill, 'Unity of All Spirits,' and the previous 'Leader.'
Unity of All Spirits didn't increase the proportion of magicules provided by different tiers of followers.
Followers provided 1–3%, named monsters 15%, and familiars 50%.
This remained unchanged despite the skill's upgrade.
However, between the wide gap of named monsters and familiars, Unity of All Spirits introduced a new tier.
Familia!
Positioned between named monsters and familiars, a Familia could provide 30% of their total magicules to Damien.
Familia targets needed to be selected and bound by Damien himself.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC
***

chapters.title: Chapter 74 - 74: [TP] 74: Discount Coupon
chapters.content:
The Familia limit was three.
This meant that, at present, Damien could have up to three monster races as his Familia.
As for where Familia came from, they had to be related to his Familiars.
In other words, only monsters of the same race as his Familiars could be converted into Familia by Damien.
"So…"
Damien considered his current Familiars. "Only the Ogre qualifies for this?"
Shaking his head, Damien set the thought aside for now and turned his attention to the Direwolves before him.
"Surrender or die?"
Damien looked at the Direwolves leader, who had been obediently prostrating itself since earlier.
"Woof!"
Feeling Damien's gaze, the Direwolves leader shrank back, its voice trembling. "I-I am willing to surrender to you, great Demon Lord Majesty!"
The overwhelming pressure from that moment earlier was undoubtedly far beyond that of a mere Majin.
The only thing the Direwolves leader could think of that surpassed an upper Majin was a Demon Lord!
As mentioned before, the Cardinal World didn't clearly distinguish between Demon Lord Seed and True Demon Lord.
To most, 'Demon Lord' was just a title, not a combat rank.
This confusion existed even among the Ten Great Demon Lords.
The bottom three... Clayman, Carrion, and Queen Frey... were unaware of the gap between themselves and the others.
Demon Lord Seed, True Demon Lord, and True Demon Lord with Ultimate Skills.
The power gap between these tiers could only be described as crushing.
So, while the Direwolves leader called Damien a Demon Lord, he was actually at the weakest tier.
"Let's skip the Demon Lord title. I have no intention of becoming one just yet."
Claiming the title of Demon Lord could trigger a Walpurgis Banquet.
Other Demon Lords might not care, but Clayman, that troublemaker, would definitely stir up problems.
While Damien wasn't afraid, he didn't want the hassle.
With his rate of growth, he'd eventually crush Clayman anyway, so there was no need to rush.
"Yes."
The Direwolves leader didn't know Damien's thoughts.
A Demon Lord's mind wasn't something it could fathom. For now, it would keep its head as low as possible.
"Bring your pack here."
"Yes!"
The Direwolves leader didn't dare defy him and let out a long howl, summoning its pack.
Soon, nearly 500 Direwolves gathered before Damien.
Massive in size, each stood nearly a meter tall, proper large wolves.
"Submit to me, and you'll be my people."
In the original story, Rimuru killed the Direwolves leader, yet its son, Ranga, still chose to follow him, leading to the meme of 'a mere father's death.'
In contrast, Damien had no real conflict with the Direwolves.
"Select the eighteen most outstanding wolves from your pack, and I'll grant them names."
"!!!"
Damien's words stunned the Direwolves leader.
It looked at him in disbelief, wondering if it had misheard. "Y-You mean you'll name us?"
"What?"
Damien teased, "Don't want it?"
"No!"
"Thank you for your grace!"
The Direwolves leader trembled with excitement. "We, the Direwolves, swear to follow you for generations, defending your authority with our lives!"
As the leader's words fell, the Direwolves behind it knelt one after another.
They pledged their loyalty to their great and generous master.
"And the goblins."
Damien didn't forget the weaker ones. "Select 100 of your kind, and I'll grant you names."
"R-Really?"
Hearing that Damien was willing to name even weak goblins like them, the goblins were deeply moved, many female goblins even shedding tears.
"What a merciful lord."
"To think you'd shelter even weaklings like us."
The elderly goblin village chief had thought that being under Damien's protection was already a great fortune.
Who could have imagined that the goblins would be so lucky as to encounter such a lord?
"Come forward and line up."
Damien waved, signaling the village chief to bring the 100 goblins forward.
"You stay too."
As the village chief turned to leave, Damien stopped him. "At your age, without a name, you probably won't last long."
"From now on, you'll be Rigurd, leader of the Goblins, serving me."
These words moved the village chief to tears again.
Damien even felt that if he ordered Rigurd to 'end himself,' the goblin would unhesitatingly obey on the spot.
As for the name Rigurd, at this point in time, the Majin Gelmud hadn't yet visited the goblin village or named Rigurd's eldest son.
"For you two, the older brother will be Rirud, the younger Rigud."
"And the rest of you…"
For the goblins, beyond the initial father and sons, Damien named them more casually: "Gobta, Gobna, Gobya…"
The naming process was quick. Damien checked his magicule consumption, which had dropped by about 60,000.
With over 200,000 magicules, losing 60,000 brought him below 200,000.
Yet, his Demon Lord Seed status remained intact.
In fact, even if Damien depleted all his magicules, he'd still be a Demon Lord Seed.
The Demon Lord Seed title was the Cardinal World's recognition of a monster's potential to reach True Demon Lord status.
"I used 100,000 magicules and got 40,000 back from the goblins, so a net loss of 60,000."
Normally, elevating an E-rank goblin to a C-rank hobgoblin would require around 2,000 magicules.
For 100 goblins, that would be 200,000.
But Damien had someone upstairs. Violet pulled some strings, giving him a fifty-percent discount, so it only cost 100,000 magicules.
'Not bad, Violet…'
Damien mentally gave Violet a thumbs-up. His trusty partner was already saving him resources right after joining.
Magicules: 205,000 → 145,000
With the goblin naming complete, the Direwolves had also selected those worthy of receiving names…

chapters.title: Chapter 75 - 75: [TP] 75: Collective Equals Individual
chapters.content:
"Master."
"These are the finest among our pack's younger generation!"
After careful selection, the Direwolves leader presented eighteen of the strongest and youngest wolves to Damien.
Among them was Ranga from the original story, along with others not named in the novels.
Interestingly, the eighteen wolves consisted of nine males and nine females.
Damien had no intention of pairing them up.
Once monsters evolved, reproduction became difficult and could even endanger the parents' lives.
Of course, Damien wouldn't interfere with their freedom of choice.
They could pair up or remain single... it was up to the wolves.
"Including you, that's nineteen Direwolves."
Damien had his own plans. Unlike Rimuru's collective naming approach for the Direwolves, he chose a different method.
The eighteen wolves would represent the eighteen Pokémon types.
Each would inherit one type, forming their own tribes.
The Direwolves leader would serve as the overarching leader of the pack.
"From now on, you'll be called Hoshiga!"
Besides the leader, Hoshiga, the other eighteen Direwolves were named.
Males: Ranga, Shiroga, Iwaga, Hagane, Chiga, Raiga, Ryuga, Akuga, Tataga.
Females: Honooga, Haruga, Mega, Yureiga, Kokoroga, Koriga, Tsukiga, Hikaga, Dokuga.
Among them, Hoshiga inherited some of Damien's traits as a Star Dragon King descendant.
While unable to manipulate Stardusts, Hoshiga gained control over spacetime and starlight power.
With Hoshiga as the namesake, the entire Direwolves evolved into the StarDirewolves.
Beneath them, eighteen tribes were formed, named after their leaders, such as Star Ranga Wolves and Star FlameDirewolves.
"Hmm…"
After the naming, Damien immediately felt a massive drain of magicules.
For the first time, he experienced dizziness.
This was the consequence of rapid magicule depletion.
"Looks like I'll need to rest for a bit."
Damien hadn't expected to share Rimuru's experience. He quickly summoned Violet. "I'll leave the rest to you, Violet."
"Please rest well."
Without needing further words, Violet, in sync with Damien's thoughts, caught him as he collapsed into her arms.
"…"
This scene, however, sparked an inexplicable dissatisfaction in the Snow Empress.
She didn't understand what this feeling meant.
It was simply an irrepressible irritation in her heart.
"Who are you?"
The Snow Empress stepped forward, wary of the sudden appearance of this girl.
"Violet."
Violet replied calmly, "I am Damien's other half."
"!!!"
This sudden declaration left the Snow Empress and the nearby Ogres dumbfounded.
"Other half?"
"Isn't that the mistress?"
"What a bold claim."
"…"
"Nonsense!"
The Snow Empress snapped coldly, "I wasn't aware he had someone like you by his side."
Normally, the Snow Empress wasn't one to get angry easily.
But when it came to Damien's safety and some unfamiliar emotion she couldn't name, she couldn't tolerate Violet's reckless words.
"You can ask Damien about that."
"For now, shouldn't we focus on protecting him rather than arguing?"
Violet's words left the Snow Empress with no rebuttal.
With no choice, the Snow Empress stood guard nearby.
She protected Damien while keeping an eye on Violet, speculating about her identity.
Leaving aside the silent vigil of the Snow Empress and Violet, the changes in the Direwolves drew the attention of the hobgoblins, goblins, and Ogres.
The once-ordinary giant wolves, only slightly larger than typical beasts, now radiated bursts of colorful light.
Red, blue, green.
In an instant, the moonlit grasslands transformed into a dazzling stage under neon lights, leaving Sakurako and the others in awe.
[Individual evolution successful. Calculating total magicules of followers.]
[Calculation complete. As the namer, 15% of magicules are shared.]
[Acquired 900 magicules.]
[Individual evolution successful…]
[Acquired 950 magicules.]
[Acquired 1100 magicules.]
[Acquired…]
As the Direwolves evolved into the StarDirewolves, the power of the eighteen tribal leaders radiated outward.
The 500 wolves evolved into their corresponding tribes based on their affinities.
This naming had nearly depleted all of Damien's magicules.
A full 200,000 magicules were consumed in an instant.
In return, the nineteen wolves, including Hoshiga, evolved simultaneously.
Hoshiga gained the most, receiving over 50,000 magicules from Damien.
Even with Violet's backdoor discount, it still cost Damien 25,000 magicules.
Combined with his existing magicules, Hoshiga, the pack leader, leaped from C+ rank to high-tier A rank.
The remaining eighteen wolves each surpassed 14,000 magicules, becoming true A-rank monsters.
That was 180,000 magicules in total, reduced to 90,000 after the discount.
Due to their racial traits, the StarDirewolves was now classified as beastmen rather than mere wolves.
In the Cardinal World, beastmen could shift between beast and humanoid forms.
Hoshiga and the other eighteen leaders gained this ability.
Humanoid form, werewolf form, and their original giant wolf form.
They could freely choose their preferred lifestyle among these three states.
By this point, Damien's magicules had dropped from 145,000 to 30,000.
As for the remaining wolves, they were originally C-rank monsters, only reaching B- rank strength when acting as a pack due to their inherent traits.
Collective equals individual; individual equals collective.
This didn't mean 500 wolves could team up to defeat a single B- rank monster.
Rather, as their numbers grew, each wolf's strength increased from C-rank to B- rank.
Yes, 500 B- rank monsters.
That was the true terror of the Direwolves.
***
[1] Star Fang: Hoshiga, Storm Fang: Ranga, White Fang: Shiroga, Rock Fang: Iwaga, Steel Fang: Hagane, Earth Fang: Chiga, Thunder Fang: Raiga, Dragon Fang: Ryuga, Vile Fang: Akuga, Fight Fang: Tataga, Flame Fang: Honooga, Spring Fang: Haruga, Sprout Fang: Mega, Ghost Fang: Yureiga, Mind Fang: Kokoroga, Ice Fang: Koriga, Moon Fang: Tsukiga, Glow Fang: Hikaga, Veno Fang: Dokuga
***

chapters.title: Chapter 76 - 76: [TP] 76: Astral Body
chapters.content:
In theory, with sufficient numbers, the Direwolves' inherent trait could push them to A- rank, equivalent to 9,000 magicules.
Imagine thousands of A- rank Direwolves surging like a tidal wave.
The mere thought was chilling.
Of course, A- rank was the Direwolves's limit.
After all, this was just an inherent skill (Extra Skill), not a Unique Skill capable of granting them Demon Lord Seed qualifications.
Moreover, thanks to their 'collective equals individual' trait, when Damien named the eighteen tribal leaders, a significant portion of magicules was distributed to the remaining Direwolves.
For 500 wolves, each with an average of 3,000 magicules, reaching B-rank at 6,000 magicules would require at least 1.5 million magicules.
Such a massive amount was beyond Damien's reach, even if he included Violet's 200,000 magicules and doubled it, equating to only 460,000 naming magicules (with Violet's discount, the effect was doubled).
460,000 compared to 1.5 million was a drop in the bucket.
But the beauty of the Direwolves's trait was that it drastically reduced the cost of naming the entire group.
Instead of 1.5 million, only a fifth... 300,000 magicules... was needed to evolve the entire pack into Star Wolves.
"Our master's magicules are recovering rapidly!"
On the other side, the Snow Empress noticed the swift rise in Damien's magicules and looked at Violet in surprise.
"After the naming, our magicule reserves were down to 80,000."
80,000 magicules was a dangerously low number for both Violet and Damien.
For a monster, depleting magicules meant the end of existence.
However, Damien wasn't just spending recklessly; he was investing.
"An investment means returns."
The first return came from Hoshiga, with 55,000 magicules.
As a named monster, Hoshiga returned 15% of his total magicules to Damien, equaling 8,250 EP.
The other eighteen wolves followed suit: 15,000 × 15% × 18, yielding 40,500.
Including Hoshiga's, that was roughly 50,000 magicules.
But this was only from the nineteen leaders.
What truly thrilled Violet was the remaining 500 Star Wolves.
Due to their pack trait, these wolves skipped the follower tier and reached the named monster tier under [Unity of All Spirits].
Yes, all 500 Star Wolves were classified as named monsters.
Thus, with an average of over 6,000 magicules each, reaching B-rank:
500 × 6,000 × 15% amounted to a staggering 3 million magicules!
This was why Damien went all-in, exhausting his magicules to name the entire Direwolves!
He admitted there was an element of gambling.
But he won the bet!
The once-ordinary C-rank Direwolves had become Damien's greatest source of magicule returns.
Forget Direwolves... they were his treasure trove!
Talk about striking it rich!
"What a pity."
Violet looked at Damien, whose magicule reserves had reached 990,000.
Of course, the additional 2 million-plus magicules weren't gone; they were stored with Violet.
"What?"
The Snow Empress, confused, didn't understand what Violet meant by 'pity.'
"He can't yet challenge the True Demon Lord awakening ritual."
"Why not?"
The Snow Empress recalled Damien mentioning that a Demon Lord Seed needed only enough souls to awaken as a True Demon Lord.
Souls were easy enough.
Couldn't a war yield plenty?
"No, it's not that simple."
Violet explained, "To acquire souls, one must break through the Astral Body encasing them."
Absorbing souls wasn't as straightforward as imagined.
Souls were protected by a special energy called the Astral Body, shielding them from external interference... one of the Cardinal World's most mysterious, fundamental principles.
"Breaking the Astral Body can't be done with magicules. It requires sheer willpower to force through."
Violet didn't know how Rimuru in the original story managed it.
She could only say that the remnants of the Star Dragon King and Lucia's souls helped Rimuru cheat his way across that chasm.
"But if that's the case, why did so many awaken as True Demon Lords later?"
The Snow Empress remembered Damien saying that Benimaru, Shion, and others had the potential to become True Demon Lords.
In the original story, they awakened by absorbing enough souls with Rimuru's help.
"Souls and the Astral Body are distinct concepts."
If it were just souls, direct absorption would suffice.
If Damien could obtain 100,000 souls, he could awaken as a True Demon Lord on the spot.
"But where would we find 100,000 unprotected souls?"
Such a vast number of souls was something only an ancient Demon Lord like Guy might have stored.
Souls followed the cycle of reincarnation.
Except for those with Ultimate Skills, no one could interfere with their destination.
Moreover, these weren't souls from killing 100,000 ordinary people.
The souls of common folk were too weak.
In the original story, during the Falmuth Kingdom's attack on the Jura Tempest Federation, the kingdom's forces were elite humans.
Only souls of that caliber could meet the conditions for a Demon Lord's awakening.
"Once an ordinary person dies, their soul can't linger in the material world. It immediately moves to the other side and reincarnates."
"Only those with C-rank or higher combat strength can briefly linger, allowing a Demon Lord Seed to absorb them."
"And during this process, soul loss is significant."
If 100,000 people died, a Demon Lord Seed might absorb only 30–40% at best.
The rest would be drawn away by the reincarnation cycle, vanishing without a trace.
"So, to awaken as a True Demon Lord, Damien must face 100,000 souls wrapped in Star Soul Bodies and forcibly absorb them?"
"Yes."
Violet added, "Leaving aside whether this act would cause him mental distress, withstanding the impact of the Star Soul Bodies is a major issue."
Could Damien's ordinary human willpower endure the onslaught of so many Star Soul Bodies?
The Astral Body wasn't just anything... it was the emotions and memories accumulated through each soul's reincarnations.
Forcing through was possible for Damien.
But what would be the result?
With so many memories and emotions piled together, could Damien maintain his sense of self, or would he become someone else entirely?
***
