chapters.title: Chapter 77 - 77: [TP] 77: First
chapters.content:
"Even if he remains himself, what's the point of growing stronger if his personality changes drastically?"
Because she knew Damien so well, Violet was certain of his character.
He would never take the risk of facing 100,000 Star Soul Bodies.
"Then what should we do?"
The Snow Empress, unfamiliar with these matters, could only turn to Violet for answers.
If it were her instead of Damien, a mere 100,000 Star Soul Bodies wouldn't shake her resolve.
With 700,000 years of an ice-clear mind, the Snow Empress's willpower was beyond what the Cardinal World's Demon Lord Seeds could fathom.
However, due to the Familiar contract, she couldn't become a True Demon Lord before Damien.
"No."
Violet shook her head. "Damien will definitely awaken; it's just a matter of time."
Leaving aside the fact that Damien possessed remnants of the Star Dragon King's authority, the mere existence of Gate of the Void gave him limitless growth potential.
"You mean traveling to other worlds can make Damien stronger?"
"Not just in strength, but in willpower too."
Violet spoke frankly. "In fact, each time we acquire the rules of a new world, it strengthens us further."
Those Unique Skills were the best proof.
"Unique Skills are manifestations of soul power."
"As long as Damien has enough Unique Skills, they'll form an impregnable wall around his soul."
With such a defensive barrier, Damien could withstand the onslaught of 100,000 Star Soul Bodies, preserving his identity and completing his awakening as a True Demon Lord.
"How many worlds would he need to visit?"
"I don't know."
Violet said, "If we're lucky and encounter a powerful world, one might be enough."
It depended on the world's quality.
Worlds with entirely new rules and power systems would provide the greatest benefit to building Damien's willpower barrier.
"Let's head back to the village for now."
Violet glanced at the distant forest.
The presence there couldn't escape her senses.
However, she had no intention of clashing with the Moderate Harlequin Alliance.
It wasn't that they couldn't win, but it was unnecessary.
With their current reserve of 3 million magicules, Damien could hold his own even against an awakened True Demon Lord.
The top Demon Lords aside, the Moderate Harlequin Alliance and their backer, Yuuki Kagurazaka, no longer posed a threat.
With Violet's assistance, Damien could use Stardust Manipulation to enter dragon form.
His strength would reach an extraordinary level.
"I'll maintain the spatial passage."
The Snow Empress felt her role overlapping with Violet's, sparking a sense of crisis.
So, she stepped forward, opening a spatial rift.
"Transporting so many at once... can you handle it?"
Violet looked at the Snow Empress, who didn't respond, instead silently tearing open a spatial crack.
On the other side was the Kijin village.
"Fine."
Violet genuinely had no desire to compete with the Snow Empress for the title of Damien's strongest ally.
Her place was as the woman behind Damien.
Watching him grow stronger was enough to satisfy her.
"Everyone, line up and don't scatter."
"That's the village where we'll live from now on."
"Once there, don't wander. Wait patiently for the Ogre to assign housing."
For this day, the Ogre had undertaken massive construction, expanding the village several times over with countless new houses and facilities.
There was no need to worry about the new wolves and goblins lacking homes.
While the Ogre's engineering and forging skills weren't on par with the dwarves, they were leagues ahead of the primitive goblins.
The wolves and goblins cooperated well, quickly adapting to their new lives.
"Ugh…"
Damien didn't know how much time had passed.
When he opened his eyes, he was met with Ogerpon's adorable face.
"You're finally awake!!"
Seeing Damien stir, Ogerpon instinctively threw herself into his arms, her starry eyes brimming with tears. "Thank goodness!"
"Sorry for worrying you."
Damien didn't feel the weakness typical of waking from a faint.
On the contrary, he felt exceptional, almost too good.
"This feeling of overflowing power... even without checking my status, I know how much stronger I've become."
Damien mused, "The current me could probably one-shot the old me."
Opening his status panel and seeing the 999,999 magicule count, he nodded to himself. As expected.
For Damien, magicules weren't just energy.
The special skill Magicule Solidification allowed his physical attributes to scale with his magicule count, automatically boosting his base stats.
"Master!"
"My lord, you're awake?"
"Thank goodness."
As the commotion in the room spread, Damien's Familiars rushed in.
Shion was the most excited.
Without regard for propriety, she threw herself at Damien, enveloping him in an overwhelming embrace.
What could Damien say? It was both painful and blissful.
"Ahem, let go for now, Shion."
With no other choice, Damien gently pushed Shion away, his gaze sweeping over the group.
The Ice Empress and Snow Empress stood calmly by his bedside, as usual.
Benimaru and Souei were out on missions, so they weren't present.
"And you are?"
A few unfamiliar faces caught Damien off guard.
"My lord, it's me, Rigurd!"
Rigurd, the former elderly goblin village chief.
Unlike his previous frail, wind-swept appearance, after Damien's naming, Rigurd had evolved from an E-rank goblin to a C+ rank hobgoblin.
His towering, muscular frame, over two meters tall, blocked the light streaming through the window like a wall.
"Whoa, that's quite a transformation."
Damien recalled the original story, where Rimuru's naming had similarly transformed Rigurd.
Next to Rigurd were two green-skinned youths... his sons, Rirud and Rigud.
"Thanks to your grace, these old bones feel young again."
Rigurd struck a few bodybuilding poses, his chiseled muscles sharply defined.
'Young again? This is a whole new species.'
Damien didn't know how to react. 'Whatever, as long as he evolved, it's fine.'
***

chapters.title: Chapter 78 - 78: [TP] 78: Beast Girls
chapters.content:
With that thought, Damien turned his attention to the other figures in the room.
His room was spacious, nearly a hundred square meters, larger than most living rooms, easily accommodating a crowd.
Aside from the familiar faces... Snow Empress, Ice Empress, Ogerpon, Shion, and the expected Rigurd and his sons... the remaining figures caught Damien by surprise.
Near the door stood nearly twenty individuals, all kneeling on one knee, respectfully awaiting Damien's inspection.
Leading them was a rugged middle-aged man draped in a beast pelt coat, his body covered in thick fur, giving off the vibe of a Viking warrior.
Fortunately, not everyone shared his aesthetic.
Among the eighteen others were young men, teenagers, mature women, young girls, and even a cute girl with a moe charm.
Without exception, they all had beast ears and tails.
Their hair colors varied... red, blue, green, pink... but didn't feel garish like a punk style.
Instead, the colors complemented their auras and appearances, highlighting each one's unique traits perfectly.
"The Direwolves?"
Damien sensed the soul bond between them, guessing their identity.
"Yes, my lord!"
Hearing Damien recognize them, Hoshiga lifted his head excitedly, eyes gleaming with joy.
As for how his subordinates addressed him:
Those closest, like Ogerpon, Snow Empress, and Violet, called him by name.
Shuna, Shion, and others preferred "my lord." Treating him like a feudal ruler, forming a lord-vassal bond.
This was common among humanoid monsters like the Ogre and goblins, who saw themselves as Damien's subjects.
As for "master." Damien wasn't fond of it... it felt too much like slavery.
Thus, the title "my lord" became the norm.
Those calling him "my lord" were mostly non-human races, like the Star Wolves.
Compared to humans, they saw themselves more as Damien's pets, viewing him as the "master" of their pack.
The title "Lord Damien" was universal, except for the Ice Empress.
She preferred "master" as a sarcastic jab at Damien's forceful contract.
"Your transformations are even more dramatic than Rigurd's."
Though he'd anticipated it, seeing a pack of giant wolves turn into beastmen was still astonishing.
Especially the fluffy beast ear girls... Damien's gaze lingered on them for a few seconds before reluctantly moving away.
Of course, it wasn't their beauty he coveted.
More than their looks, he wanted to touch their ears and tails. 'The texture must be amazing.'
"Lord Damien."
Shuna brought over washing supplies, followed by two shrine maidens carrying trays of delicious dishes she'd prepared herself.
As expected, Shuna knew him best.
After his slumber, Damien indeed felt hungry.
It wasn't a true need for food, but a habit of maintaining a regular three-meal routine.
"Snow Empress, Shuna, stay."
After washing up, Damien dismissed the others. "Ogerpon, you and Ice Empress go have fun. I'm fine now."
Damien remained in bed, and Shuna naturally took the tray from the shrine maidens, serving him the food.
"…"
The indulgent scene made the Snow Empress chuckle. "Should I join in?"
"Ahem."
Damien caught the teasing in her tone.
"Get me a portion too."
The Snow Empress smiled, shaking her head, and casually took a dish from the tray.
Together with Shuna, one on each side, they attended to Damien.
'This heavenly life feels like a dream…'
Having two beautiful women care for him... could there be anything more fulfilling?
"Snow Empress, I can handle this." Shuna said.
"It's fine."
The Snow Empress didn't mind. "Caring for our master is what we Familiars are supposed to do."
Among Damien's Familiars, Ogerpon was like a daughter, Ice Empress a rebellious teen, Shion a goofy older sister, and Shuna a caring younger sister.
The Snow Empress's relationship with Damien leaned toward that of an older sister and younger brother.
Taking care of her "little brother" made her happy.
'Hmph!'
With that thought, she glanced at a certain empty spot. 'A mere latecomer, hmph!'
"Alright, I'll eat on my own."
Damien halted their affectionate gestures, taking the food himself. "Violet, come out too."
"I was planning to appear after you finished eating."
Violet materialized at the foot of the bed. "Would you like a status report?"
"Yes."
Damien was getting used to Violet's personality.
Much like the template of an automatic writing doll, she was cool and detached, a meticulous secretary awaiting her master's orders.
"We currently have a total of 3.02 million magicules."
Violet continued, "Of those, 2.02 million are stored with me, available for your use at any time."
"Additionally, your forces now consist of 270 Ogres, 8,200 goblins, and 560 StarDirewolves beastmen."
For convenience, Violet referred to them as the Star Wolves.
"StarDirewolves beastmen, huh?"
"Yes."
Violet explained, "They've collectively evolved into beastmen, gaining the ability to shift freely between giant wolf and humanoid beast forms."
Hence, she used "560 individuals" rather than "560 heads" To describe them.
"That's an unexpected bonus."
Pairing goblins with wolves to form cavalry, like in the original story, was a good idea.
But Damien felt the goblins' potential was limited.
Aside from exceptions like Gobta and Gobya, the Goblins hadn't produced any remarkable figures.
Rather than making them combatants, they'd serve better as logistical support.
With their large population, even if their reproduction rate dropped due to evolution, they could maintain C- rank.
"However…"
Violet added, "The Star Wolves isn't accustomed to human lifestyles."
"Some, especially the males, prefer their original forms over human living habits."
"Is that so…"
Damien asked, "What's the split?"
"Most males prefer their original form, while females tend to favor their beastman form."
"Hm."
Damien didn't mind their preferences. They could live as they pleased... he wouldn't force Hoshiga and the others to stay in beastman form.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 79 - 79: [TP] 79: Surging Magicules
chapters.content:
"In that case, have them be mindful."
"Keep their sizes in check in the village to avoid causing damage."
"It's already been arranged."
Damien didn't need to worry about such matters; the Snow Empress had already taken care of them.
'As expected of my future Tempest steward.'
Damien had little to add. Anything he could think of, the Snow Empress and Violet would have already considered.
He didn't need to handle management tasks.
What he truly needed to focus on was how to utilize this vast pool of magicules.
"Snow Empress, inform everyone that I'll be naming them."
With 3 million magicules, minus the 100,000 needed to sustain Violet and the 990,000 for his own strength, the remaining 2 million were surplus.
Without breaking through to S-rank to awaken as a True Demon Lord, his magicules couldn't undergo a qualitative change.
If these magicules weren't spent quickly, Violet's daily magicule recovery would be stalled.
No recovery meant waste... a losing proposition.
Even with 3 million magicules, Damien was still fixated on the 200,000 magicules Violet could provide every half month.
'Invest! I must invest heavily!!'
2 million magicules used for naming equated to 4 million with Violet's discount.
Once again, he thanked Violet's 50% off deal, effectively doubling his assets.
"Am I living off Violet's generosity?"
The thought crossed his mind, but Damien brushed it aside. "Generosity or not, being able to benefit from it is the real skill!"
Others might want such benefits but have no access to them.
"I'm coming too!"
Seeing the Snow Empress leave, Shion hurriedly followed, leaving Shuna to stay by Damien's side.
As for Violet, she preferred residing in Damien's soul, quietly observing everything around her.
Additionally, Violet periodically connected to the world's core.
She monitored the Cardinal World's information, keeping tabs on potential threats to Damien.
"What is Lord Damien planning to do?"
Shuna helped Damien dress, then voiced her curiosity.
"Naming."
"Hm?"
Shuna paused, then realized what he meant, her face lighting up with disbelief. "You mean…?"
"I plan to make everyone named monsters."
"This!!"
Shuna was stunned by Damien's decision. "But that will consume a massive amount of your magicules, and…"
"Don't worry, Shuna."
Damien gently patted her head, smiling calmly. "My Leader skill has evolved, allowing me to designate a monster race as my Familia."
"And I've chosen the Ogres."
Once the Ogre were selected as Familia, Damien could gain 30% of their magicules from those not already Familiars, like Shuna or Benimaru.
Compared to the previous 15%, this was double the return.
"But to make the Ogre a Familia, they must first become named monsters."
This was critical and the reason Damien planned to name everyone.
"What about the goblins?"
"That's the interesting part."
Damien grinned. "Goblins are a monster race descended from fire spirites that degenerated into this current form."
"The Ogre are the same."
"In other words, Goblins and Ogres can be considered part of the same race."
"Oh…"
Shuna nearly protested that goblins couldn't possibly be distant kin to the Ogre.
But this was Lord Damien's judgment, so it had to be correct.
"Of course, if it were just goblins, my Leader skill couldn't merge them with the Ogre into one race."
"But!"
Damien continued, "Hobgoblins are different."
Hobgoblins were C-rank, while Ogre were B-rank... just one tier apart.
In the original story, Gobwa evolved from a weak goblin to a Goblena (female hobgoblin), then to Ogre, Kijin, and finally Oni.
This clearly showed a defined evolution path from goblin to Kijin.
Damien had consulted Violet, who confirmed this.
"As long as all goblins evolve into hobgoblins…"
"I can incorporate them into the Ogres." Damien said. "Then, they'll all become my Familia!"
Damien had three Familia slots.
The Ogre were his strongest followers at the moment.
Strengthening their bond with him could only bring benefits.
"So, this naming won't just avoid losses... it might even yield a huge profit?"
Shuna and the other Familiars were Damien's most trusted confidants, incapable of betraying him.
However, secrets like the magicule gains from Leader were kept from others.
This wasn't deceit but a ruler's need to maintain an air of mystery.
"The Goblins has over 8,000 members. With an average of 300 magicules, evolving them to C-rank hobgoblins would require at least 2,700 magicules each."
Shuna noted, "That's no small number."
8,000 × 2,700 equaled a staggering 21.6 million magicules.
Even with Violet's 50% discount, that was 10.8 million... a massive expense.
No ordinary person could afford that, but Damien had a plan.
He could start by naming the Ogres.
"If we name the Ogre first, there are about 250 unnamed Ogre left."
250 individuals, averaging 6,000 magicules.
Evolving them required 4,000 magicules each, totaling 1 million.
With the discount, that was just 500,000.
That was manageable... Damien could cover it in one go.
Then, the 270 Ogres with over 10,000 magicules each, as Familia, would provide 30% of their magicules.
That amounted to 8.1 million magicules.
Adding Damien's existing 1.5 million, he'd have 9.6 million.
With 9.6 million magicules for naming, doubled to 19.2 million with the discount, he wouldn't need to name all 8,000 goblins at once.
He could name 4,000 first, then integrate them into the Familia system as hobgoblins.
"Precise magicule expenditure and returns calculated."
Violet's voice echoed in Damien and Shuna's minds. "Naming the Ogres consumes 500,000 actual magicules and yields 8.1 million."
"Naming the goblins requires 10.8 million actual magicules and yields 7.2 million."
"Final calculation: net gain of 4 million magicules!"
"…"
A 4 million magicule profit, plus Damien's existing 3 million, brought his total to 7 million.
Not only did his magicule count not decrease... it more than doubled.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 80 - 80: [TP] 80: Lizardmen
chapters.content:
"Uh…"
Looking at the calculated results, not only Damien but even Shuna was stunned.
What was going on?
Naming monsters didn't just avoid losses... it made him stronger?
Truly, a billion here, a billion there, a fortune impossible to spend in a lifetime.
"As expected of Lord Damien!!"
What else could Shuna say? At this moment, admiration was enough!
"Ahem!"
Damien hadn't expected a day when he'd want to spend magicules but couldn't exhaust them. "Anyway, everyone getting stronger is definitely a good thing."
"Mm-hmm!"
Shuna nodded eagerly, already envisioning the village's skyrocketing strength.
Of the 270 Kijin, excluding minors, at least 200 could be deployed as combatants.
The Ogre had no concept of weak females.
They were all warriors.
If not for the reluctance to send children to battle, every single one would fight for Damien.
Then there were the 8,000 hobgoblins, easily forming a 5,000-strong army.
5,000 soldiers, 200 elites.
Add in paired male and female wolves to create StarDirewolves cavalry.
With that, an elite force, cavalry, and regular soldiers formed a nearly 6,000-strong monster army.
"Before I knew it, I've amassed enough to form an army."
Soon, the Snow Empress and Shion completed gathering everyone.
When they learned Damien had called them for universal naming, the monsters erupted in deafening cheers and praise.
No need for words... Damien was already accustomed to their simple, heartfelt devotion.
"Everyone, line up orderly, one at a time, no rushing."
Seated at the head, Damien faced a long queue of monsters eagerly awaiting their names.
Naming around 8,500 monsters at once was a massive undertaking.
It wasn't the magicule consumption that bothered him... Damien was used to that.
The real headache was figuring out what names to give them.
"Um…"
Damien started, "You, you'll be Cyanwave."
"For you, a female from the Red Orges, how about Blooddance?"
Honestly, Damien hadn't anticipated that the greatest challenge in naming wasn't the magicule cost but the 8,500 names themselves.
It was fine at first, but by the end, he'd completely run out of creative ideas.
With no other choice, he resorted to Rimuru's approach, throwing out names like "Gobeast." "Gobwest." "Gobnorth" To get by.
Fortunately, the monsters didn't mind.
Any name from Damien was cherished from the heart, never failing his expectations.
'Honestly, I had no expectations.'
Luckily, Damien could remember every monster he named.
This spared him the embarrassment of forgetting their names in person.
"Phew~~"
The naming process lasted nearly an hour.
Exhausted, Damien sprawled on the bed in a starfish pose, longing for a good nap.
"So tiring."
"Who knew naming monsters was such hard work?"
"Violet, don't you have an auto-naming function?"
To Damien's question, Violet replied, "It's simple to generate names, but naming monsters involves establishing a soul corridor, so shortcuts won't work."
Not only could Violet not assist, but even flipping through a dictionary wouldn't do.
The best method was brief thought followed by an instinctive name.
"Naming... fated names, huh?"
To Damien, it was just a casual remark.
But to the monsters, a name from him was a lifelong treasure.
"Fine."
Even so, the thought of potentially naming tens of thousands of Lizardmen or hundreds of thousands of Orcs in the future sent shivers down his spine.
200,000 names... pure torture!
He felt he should get a dictionary early, just in case.
"Forget it, future problems are for future me."
Dictionaries were useless anyway.
Violet had made it clear: names had to come from a spur-of-the-moment inspiration to carry the soul corridor.
Naming while flipping through a dictionary wouldn't work.
"No choice but to leave it to future me to stress over."
For now, after a hard day's work, Damien just wanted to slack off.
Two days passed since subduing the goblins and wolves.
That noon, while savoring Shuna's latest culinary creation, Damien received a telepathic message from Souei.
"Lord Damien."
Souei reported, "Regarding the Lizardmen's stance."
"Go ahead."
Damien wiped his mouth with a napkin. "What did they say?"
"The Lizardmen rejected our alliance proposal."
"Is that so?"
Damien wasn't particularly surprised.
Regarding subduing the monster tribes in the Jura Forest, his plan was to start with cooperation, showing goodwill.
When the Orc Lord's crisis arrived, he'd integrate them.
Of course, the simplest method was sending a team of A-rank Kijin to the Lizardmen's tribe.
Subjugation boiled down to martial intimidation and incentives.
"What do you think of the Lizardmen, Souei? Can they be recruited?"
"Well…"
Souei hesitated. "The Lizardmen are… peculiar."
Damien sensed Souei's reluctance, wondering if he'd run into trouble.
With 7 million magicules, Kijin, hobgoblins, and Star Wolves as three elite forces, Damien lacked neither magicules nor strong followers.
The Lizardmen, frankly, were somewhat redundant to him.
In fact, he'd rather recruit the Tengu.
Their ability to fly made them a natural air force, something he lacked.
Unfortunately, the Tengu's region was too far from the Kijin village, and Benimaru and Hakurou hadn't yet made contact.
"What do you mean?"
"It's hard to describe."
Souei sighed. "If I had to, I'd say the Lizardmen lack awareness of facing stronger beings."
To Souei, most Lizardmen seemed… not quite right in the head.
And far too fearless.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 81 - 81: [TP] 81: Their Loss
chapters.content:
"I think I get what you mean."
Damien recalled Gabiru from the original story... a rather foolish character.
Not all Lizardmen were self-important fools like Gabiru; some, like the Lizardman chieftain and the future follower of Souei, Princess Souka, were quite intelligent.
But such individuals were the minority.
The Lizardmen's general attitude reminded Damien of a certain arrogance from his past life's world, full of self-assuredness.
On reflection, it wasn't surprising.
The Jura Forest had three dominant races: the Ogres, Orcs, and Lizardmen.
The Orcs numbered in the hundreds of thousands but lacked individual strength.
The Ogres were strong but too few in number.
The Lizardmen, with tens of thousands and individual strength above C-rank... some even reaching C+ or B... saw themselves as the forest's protectors, inherently superior to other races.
"Forget it."
Damien decided to ignore the Lizardmen for now. "Souei, come back."
"Yes, my lord!"
The Lizardmen had rejected his alliance proposal.
Damien wasn't petty enough to hold a grudge over it.
Alliances were their choice to make.
He wouldn't force his will on others, demanding they follow his plans or face consequences.
"Lord Damien?"
Shuna noticed Damien set down his utensils, wondering if her cooking wasn't to his taste.
"It's fine, it's not about your food, Shuna."
Damien shared Souei's report about the Lizardmen with Shuna, Snow Empress, and the others present.
"What ungrateful creatures these Lizardmen are!"
Shion was the first to speak, indignant. "Should I go teach them a lesson, Lord Damien?"
"Just a lesson?"
The Ice Empress was far more ruthless. "If they won't submit, just wipe them out!"
"Uh…"
Even Shion was taken aback by her extremism. "That's a bit much, Ice Empress."
"Is it?"
The Ice Empress didn't think so.
In the world of soul beasts, it was kill or be killed.
In the Jura Forest, Damien was undeniably the strongest, and by a wide margin.
Not declaring war on the Lizardmen and allowing them to live in the forest was already merciful.
Yet they still refused.
If it were her, she'd have stormed their tribe and scattered their ashes long ago.
"Enough, Ice."
The Snow Empress intervened. "This isn't the Far North, and the Lizardmen aren't mindless beasts."
"They have their own culture and customs, like the Ogres."
The Snow Empress had studied the Ogres's traditions, centered on a code akin to bushido.
Without Damien's great favor and Ogerpon's presence as a superior kin, subduing the Ogre would've been difficult.
In the original story, even the Majin Gelmud's attempt to name the Ogre was refused.
The Ogre would rather face extinction than compromise their principles.
This showed how hard it was to subdue the Jura Forest's monster tribes.
The more civilized they were, the harder it was to suppress them with force alone.
The Ogres, Lizardmen, Orcs, and Tengu were more human than monster.
Yet, they differed from humans.
They were too stubborn.
"Sometimes, dignity outweighs life."
Shuna noted, "The wolves submitted because their entire pack was defeated."
This wasn't to say the wolves lacked integrity or were cowardly.
Rather, as beasts, they didn't prioritize dignity and freedom above all.
You wouldn't expect a dog to refuse food offered in disdain, would you?
That would be absurd.
Moreover, as the wolves evolved into beastmen, they shed their beastly instincts, gaining a pack trait: canine loyalty to their master.
"Let's leave it at that for now."
Damien said, "We don't need the Lizardmen's strength anyway."
Subduing nearly 30,000 Lizardmen at once would yield a terrifying amount of magicules.
Even at a 3% return from naming, that'd be close to 5 million magicules.
But for Damien, the difference between 7 million and 12 million magicules wasn't significant.
Naming them was another matter.
For the Ogres, goblins, and wolves, naming was a blessing.
But for the Lizardmen?
Begging to name them would be demeaning.
Did he look like he had magicules to burn?
"Your naming is a transformative opportunity for them." Snow Empress said.
"It's the Lizardmen who fail to appreciate it."
Her words earned unanimous agreement.
"Exactly, it's their loss for not seizing this chance." Shuna added.
Shion snorted, "They're just blind!"
"We'll discuss it when Souei returns."
Damien estimated that with Souei's speed, he'd be back from the Lizardmen's wetlands in a few hours.
Sure enough, Souei soon appeared before him.
Kneeling on one knee, head bowed, he seemed to be apologizing for the Lizardmen issue.
"Rise, Souei."
Damien said, "Good work."
"It's my honor to serve you, my lord."
Souei's tone was calm, but his words were heartfelt.
Having received such favor from Damien, he longed to repay him.
"You did well investigating the Orcs."
Damien continued, "As for the Lizardmen…"
"What exactly happened?"
"Didn't you demonstrate the Kijin's strength to them?"
"I did, but…"
Recalling the situation, Souei still found it bizarre. "They didn't believe it."
"What?"
Shion shot up, furious. "What do you mean, 'didn't believe'?"
You could say they weren't scared... that Shion could understand.
But not believing?
What kind of nonsense was that?
"Exactly what it sounds like."
As Souei spoke, he projected the events using shadow magic.
In the shadowy images, Souei overwhelmed hundreds of Lizardmen with ease.
Even their trident-wielding leader was defeated in a single move.
Of course, Souei hadn't killed them.
He'd merely taught the arrogant Lizardmen a lesson.
"That's perfect, isn't it?"
The Ice Empress, propping her chin, approved. "That's exactly what those fools needed."
***

chapters.title: Chapter 82 - 82: [TP] 82: Clowns
chapters.content:
"No use."
Damien shook his head. "Some people's logic defies common sense."
As expected, the Lizardmen's reaction to Souei's overwhelming strength caught the Ice Empress and Snow Empress off guard.
'What kind of trick did you use?!'
'To defeat Gabiru-sama, you resorted to a sneak attack!'
'Are you all okay?'
The tall Lizardman named Gabiru glanced at his comrades, noting they were unharmed.
Their earlier collapse seemed more like they'd fallen under an illusion.
'I see!'
'Illusion magic, is it?!'
'No injuries, yet we passed out.'
'That guy must have cast an illusion on us!!'
"What's going on?"
Even the Ice Empress stood up, staring dumbfounded at the projection where Gabiru and the other Lizardmen charged at Souei again.
"Are they dumb?"
"Can't they see Souei went easy on them?"
To the Ice Empress, even a fool should understand this.
Souei had the power to knock them all out instantly and spared their lives, clearly showing goodwill.
His actions demonstrated strength while giving them face.
But why?
Why would they recklessly attack again?
'Argh!!'
Once more, Gabiru and the Lizardmen were knocked down by Souei.
This time, Souei used a bit more force, causing injuries but nothing fatal.
'Damn it!'
'Everyone, are you okay?'
'We're fine, Gabiru-sama! We can still fight!'
'No, you're no match for him.'
In the projection, Gabiru, leaning on his trident, shakily stood. 'Go back and bring more of our people!'
'But what about you, Gabiru-sama?'
'Fools!'
With a tone of resolute sacrifice, Gabiru shouted, 'I'm your leader! How could I abandon my men and flee?'
'Go now!'
'I'll hold him off!'
'Even if it costs my life, I won't let him pursue you!'
'Gabiru-sama!!'
The Lizardmen were moved to tears by Gabiru's heroic stand.
The scene left Souei at the time... and everyone watching now... utterly speechless.
"Hey, hey, hey!"
"What's that?"
"Hold on, let me process this."
"Why is this plot getting harder to follow?"
Not just the Ice Empress, but even the Snow Empress and Ogerpon were baffled.
Good grief!
Who's the villain here?
Were they putting on a stage play?
And the Lizardmen were way too dramatic.
"Souei's face is twitching."
Shion whispered to Shuna beside her.
"Don't say that, poor Souei."
Shuna felt sympathy for him, stuck dealing with such bizarre, brainless Lizardmen.
Souei had held back, only knocking them out.
The Lizardmen thought he was bluffing, all show and no substance.
So, Souei hit harder.
Then the Lizardmen turned it into a melodramatic lone-hero act.
As for the others?
Every single one, shouting about friendship and bonds, rushed forward heedless of their lives.
With no other choice, Souei left.
"Good work, Souei."
Damien patted his shoulder, consoling him. "Rest up and try to forget this unpleasant experience."
"I'm sorry, I failed your task."
"Tch!"
Damien waved away the projection, unable to stomach the endless chants of 'Gabiru! Gabiru!'
"Should I go take that guy out?"
The Ice Empress saw it clearly: Gabiru held high esteem among the Lizardmen.
As long as he was around, they'd follow his judgment.
But Gabiru was clueless, unable to read the situation, and full of himself.
Even if there were sensible Lizardmen, they likely couldn't override his influence to make the right call.
In that case!
A faint icy blue aura emanated from the Ice Empress. "If we kill this guy, the Lizardmen will fall in line, right?"
"For once, Ice, you're right."
The Snow Empress agreed that eliminating this fool named Gabiru was the way to go.
"No need."
Damien, however, waved it off nonchalantly, sipping from his teacup.
"That guy's already been named."
Damien added, "Which means Clayman is likely keeping an eye on the Lizardmen."
"Clayman, one of the Ten Great Demon Lords?"
It was Souei's first time hearing this, his expression tightening as he considered how to gather intel or plan an assassination against a Demon Lord.
"Yeah."
Damien nodded. "The Moderate Harlequin Alliance... those guys are pretty strong."
"Among us, only me, Violet, Snow Empress, and Ogerpon could take them on."
Damien and Violet were obvious, with Demon Lord Seed-level magicules and a slew of skills.
Even if they couldn't defeat the Harlequins, they could hold their ground without needing Gate of the Void as a trump card.
As for the Snow Empress, her magicules hadn't yet reached 100,000, but that was recent.
Once she broke through to Special A-rank, her combat power would soar.
Damien had confidence she could handle Demon Lord-level opponents.
Ogerpon was different.
She was a pure stat monster.
With the Star Wolves's addition, her Unique Skill, Growth, gained new fuel.
The Ogre's evolution and full attribute refresh gave her another chance to farm experience from them.
As a result, Ogerpon's magicules surged, breaking past the Special A-rank bottleneck.
Combined with abilities inherited from Damien and her own Unique Skills, she could stand toe-to-toe with the Harlequins, even if she couldn't win.
"Huh?"
"What about me?"
The Ice Empress pouted, dissatisfied. "Am I not good enough?"
"Ice, you really might not cut it."
Damien didn't sugarcoat it, worried she'd impulsively challenge the Harlequins head-on.
Every one of those guys had magicules in the millions.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 83 - 83: [TP] 83: New World
chapters.content:
"And Ogerpon, if you encounter the Harlequins, try to avoid fighting them."
"Pone pone!"
Ogerpon opened her little mouth, looking eager for an explanation.
"I'm worried they'll trick you."
Ogerpon's childlike innocence made her vulnerable to someone as cunning as Yuuki Kagurazaka.
"Pone!"
Fortunately, Ogerpon never caused Damien worry.
She was obedient, always taking his warnings to heart.
"Of course, if you do run into them, the simplest solution is to contact me."
Damien added, "I'll decide whether to fight or flee."
"Tch!"
The Ice Empress bristled at being underestimated.
But she didn't dare defy Damien's words.
"In fact, I have a plan that will require all of your strength soon."
"So for now, keep a low profile whenever possible."
Damien referred to his and the Snow Empress's ongoing plan regarding a new otherworld.
Originally, their calculations suggested it would take at least half a month to open that gate.
But with Violet's emergence, the process had accelerated significantly.
"Barring any surprises, it'll be in the next few days."
Damien said, "Once we confirm the new world's details, I'll take you all with me!"
"A new world?"
"All of us together?"
"Won't transporting so many put too much strain?"
Shion and Shuna had traveled with Damien to the Douluoverse.
The Snow Empress and Ice Empress, as martial souls, had also joined him in the Pokémonverse.
Thus, the women were well aware of the limitations of Damien's world-traveling.
Sometimes it was a headcount limit, sometimes a power cap, or even a need to align with the target world's rules.
"What kind is it this time?"
The Ice Empress was eager, craving battle and growth.
A new world meant new opportunities.
She couldn't wait to clash with strong opponents!
"None of those."
Damien shook his head. "This crossing is unlike any before."
"Violet, explain it to everyone."
"Yes."
Violet materialized before the group.
With a wave of her hand, magicules traced an image in the air.
It was a tree.
No!
It was a cosmos... a vast universe encompassing numerous parallel worlds and timelines!
"I've completed partial analysis of that world's laws."
"These laws are sufficient for us Familiars to enter that world."
Violet's voice rang out. "However, for safety, we won't enter with our true bodies this time."
"Not our real bodies?"
Souei was the only Familiar who hadn't experienced world-crossing.
But as a Familiar, he was entitled to know Damien's secrets.
"Yes."
Damien explained, "This time, we'll descend as projections."
"This projection mode is somewhat similar to the second type of crossing, like in Konosubaverse."
"I'm the anchor, and you're linked to me."
"Ogerpon knows this!"
Ogerpon raised her hand. "In the Konosubaverse, if Ogerpon broke the rules, it'd drag Damien down, and we'd both get kicked out."
"Exactly, that's the second type."
"Then there's the Douluoverse, where you and Ice were, which is the third type."
In that mode, everyone Damien brought was independent.
If someone broke the rules, only they would be ejected, not affecting others.
For third-type crossings, Damien could use his Familiars like disposable bombs.
Facing tough enemies, he could send out a Familiar to unleash their full power.
They'd erupt, defeat the enemy, and get kicked out.
While this meant the Familiar would be sidelined, watching others continue, for someone like Ice, suppressing her power was worse than a single, exhilarating fight.
"This descent isn't quite the second or third type."
"It's somewhere in between."
"Through this descent, I'll have a projection with a legitimate identity in that world."
"The projection's power will be limited by that world's rules."
Damien wasn't sure how severe the restrictions would be, but he could guarantee the safety of this descent.
Compared to safety, a bit of weakening was negligible.
"Alright, gather everyone."
Damien instructed the Snow Empress to assemble all combat-ready forces in the village.
"5,000 hobgoblins."
"200 Kijin."
"400 wolves, forming 200 cavalry!"
At the village square, Damien looked at the dense crowd, grateful for the recent expansion.
Otherwise, there'd be no space for so many.
"Violet, take it from here."
"Understood."
Violet appeared beside Damien, activating the soul corridor, pulling everyone's souls into it.
Simultaneously, they gained a second perspective.
It was like controlling a game character with a remote... their real body and the character's body.
Every monster in the soul corridor received their own game avatar.
"My head… it's spinning."
"Ugh, controlling two bodies at once feels awful."
"Close your eyes and don't move your body."
"Oh, oh, that's much better!"
In the unknown space, avatars identical to them were moving animatedly.
Unlike them, Shuna, Shion, Hoshiga, and the Kijin handled it effortlessly.
For those with Thought Acceleration and Parallel Processing, an extra body was no burden.
Even dozens of avatars wouldn't faze them.
"Are these the bodies we'll use to descend into the other world?"
"Correct."
Damien explained, "Our true bodies won't enter. We'll send remotely controlled puppets."
"Those without Parallel Processing, prepare to rest."
Like a virtual dive, the hobgoblins and wolves needed to lie down somewhere, focusing all their energy on the other body.
"Benimaru, Hakurou, you're not joining this descent."
Damien continued, "You'll lead the remaining 50 Kijin to protect the village."
***

chapters.title: Chapter 84 - 84: [TP] 84: Holy Grail War
chapters.content:
"The village's protective barrier has been set up."
Benimaru said, "But how long will this descent last?"
With supplies brought back from the Konosubaverse, the villagers could sustain themselves within the barrier for half a year without worrying about food.
"No worries."
Damien smiled. "Seven days at most, and the descent ritual will conclude."
"Seven days…"
Benimaru was surprised, not by the length but by how short it was.
That Damien could complete a world invasion in such a brief time was astonishing.
'As expected of Lord Damien.'
'To achieve his goals in so little time.'
"Alright, you're dismissed."
"Snow Empress, Ice Empress, Ogerpon, Violet."
"Shuna, Shion, Souei."
"Rigurd, you stay too."
"Hoshiga, you as well."
With that, Damien led his most loyal Familiars and the goblin and Star Wolves leaders to the meeting hall to assign their tasks.
"Ready?"
After settling everything, Damien lay on a bed. "Let's begin, Violet."
[Gate of the Void activated]
[Descent mode selected: Projection]
[Projection complete]
Neon lights flickered, bathing the district in a kaleidoscope of colors.
Skyscrapers lined the streets, their glass facades reflecting star-like glints in the night, resembling a futuristic steel forest.
"It worked."
From a skyscraper's rooftop, Damien overlooked the modern city, his voice low. "Fuyuki City, the Fourth Holy Grail War!"
Yes, after the Pokémonverse, Konosubaverse, and Douluoverse, the new world Damien had found was the Nasuverse.
But the Nasuverse was far more dangerous than the others.
Entering recklessly posed too great a risk.
"This pre-summoned Heroic Spirit body, though…"
Damien assessed its power. "It's too weak."
[Damien]
[Class: Voyager/Traveler]
[Strength: B]
[Endurance: A]
[Agility: C]
[Mana: A]
[Luck: C]
[Noble Phantasm: Monster Kingdom of Another World (EX)]
[Mana Reserve: 1000/1000]
These stats weren't based on the Cardinal World's monster ranks but on the Nasuverse's unique system.
Put simply?
With Fuyuki City's material composition, an A-rank Kijin could easily destroy a nation.
As for Damien?
Obliterating a planet would be effortless.
But the Nasuverse was deep, with countless parallel worlds. Who knew if some powerhouse might emerge and knock him back? And the planet in this world is not just a large rock floating in space, but a Celestial Being.
To avoid that, Damien chose to participate in the Holy Grail War to gain benefits from this world.
"Voyager... or Traveler."
Damien was fairly satisfied with his class.
Two A-ranks, and an EX Noble Phantasm.
This was the result of his preparations.
As for actual strength…
Compared to his true body, this Heroic Spirit form was negligible.
"The outcome of the Holy Grail War doesn't matter to me."
What Damien truly sought was to use his Learner skill to acquire new rules from the Nasuverse.
"Gilgamesh's Gate of Babylon."
"Iskandar's Ionioi Hetairoi."
"The Noble Phantasms of Heroic Spirits…"
These were what Damien needed most.
He'd customized his stats and designed his Noble Phantasm.
As for Magic Resistance or other inherent skills, Damien hadn't bothered wasting Violet's computing power on such trivialities.
"I need to find a suitable Master first."
Glancing at his mana reserve, Damien felt a slight urgency. "Otherwise, this body won't last long."
A Heroic Spirit needed a Master. Damien had exploited a loophole in the Nasuverse to descend as a Voyager.
But basic rules still applied.
'Is this the new world?'
'It feels so strange.'
'The houses are so tall... what are those shiny lights?'
'Is this what the human world looks like?'
Hearing his Familiars and Familia's awed exclamations, Damien smiled. "I'm counting on you all next."
'Ohhh!'
'Leave it to me!'
That voice could only be Shion's.
Whoosh!
A night breeze swept through, and the figure on the rooftop vanished into the flickering neon lights.
'Where are we going?'
The Snow Empress noticed Damien heading in a specific direction, clearly with purpose.
'To find those Heroic Spirits and take them down, obviously!'
'Ice, the Holy Grail War isn't just about fighting.'
The Snow Empress sighed. 'Besides, Damien just said we need a stable mana source.'
'A Master.'
Shuna added, 'We need a Master, or once Lord Damien's mana runs out, our war is over.'
'So, where's the Master?'
'…'
Damien hadn't shared much about the Nasuverse, as its information was vast and he wasn't fully familiar with it himself.
"We're here."
As the group discussed the sights and speculated about Heroic Spirits' strength, Damien stopped.
Before him stood a Taisho-style mansion.
This was the Matou residence.
And his chosen Master was none other than Sakura Matou, a key figure in the Fourth Holy Grail War!
Inside the Matou mansion, an elderly man in a kimono, hunched over, led a five- or six-year-old girl down a staircase to the basement.
The old man was Zouken Matou, head of one of Fuyuki City's two great magus families.
The girl, originally Tohsaka Sakura, had been adopted by the Matou family and renamed Sakura Matou.
But…
As the staircase grew darker, Sakura felt afraid.
She instinctively clutched the old man's sleeve.
Despite his terrifying appearance, in such a moment, the girl sought comfort by instinct.
"Grandfather, I'm cold."
"The Fourth Holy Grail War is about to begin."
Zouken Matou murmured, ignoring Sakura's plea, lost in his own thoughts. "Every sixty years, this city hosts a secret magical ritual unknown to ordinary people."
"Seven pairs of Masters and Servants fight to the death, offering the defeated as sacrifices to summon the legendary Holy Grail."
***

chapters.title: Chapter 85 - 85: [TP] 85: Must Die
chapters.content:
For the Fourth Holy Grail War, Zouken Matou held little hope.
The Matou family, or rather the Zolgen family, had settled in Fuyuki City as outsiders.
But magic was deeply tied to the environment, and after centuries of change, the family faced adaptation issues.
Their magic circuits began to regress.
This was only natural.
After all, who could have foreseen that over hundreds of years, the Holy Grail ritual had never once been truly completed?
After such a long time, the family's magus bloodline was nearing extinction.
In the generation following Zouken's son, magic circuits were blocked from birth, preventing them from becoming magus.
Thus, for the Fourth Holy Grail War, the Matou family had no new pawns to field and couldn't participate.
However, unexpectedly, the Tohsaka family... another of the three founding magus families of the ritual... produced promising heirs.
Both of Tokiomi Tohsaka's daughters were highly talented magus.
Unfortunately, the Tohsaka family's magic crest could only be inherited by one.
To avoid wasting his daughter's potential, and with the Matou bloodline fading, Tokiomi sent his daughter Sakura to be adopted by Zouken Matou.
No, she was now Sakura Matou.
"Such fine blood, Sakura."
"If it's you, winning the Fifth Holy Grail War shouldn't be difficult, right?"
"Isn't that so, Sakura?"
The old man, his appearance twisted and grotesque, paused.
He looked down, scrutinizing the little girl beside him, satisfaction glinting in his eyes.
Due to this world's laws, mystery attracted mystery, and Sakura's exceptional talent meant she could never escape its grasp.
But as a young girl, Sakura couldn't comprehend this.
She could only follow Zouken fearfully, abandoned by her parents.
"Tch tch tch, don't be afraid, Sakura. From today, you're my granddaughter."
"You'll come to like your new name, Sakura Matou."
"It sounds much better than Sakura Tohsaka."
"But first, we need to perform a little ritual."
Zouken let out a creepy chuckle, pulling Sakura deeper into the Matou mansion.
At his words, Sakura's small frame trembled.
She shrank back instinctively, but her timid nature, coupled with overwhelming unease and fear, froze her in place, head bowed.
But did Zouken care about Sakura's feelings?
With his strong grip, painful enough to make her wince, he forced her to continue.
In the end, Sakura completed the journey.
Zouken's rough demeanor only heightened her anxiety.
"G-Grandfather, where are we going?"
"We're here, Sakura. No need to fear."
Zouken's eerie tone offered no comfort, only intensifying her dread.
When she saw the scene at the bottom of the stairs, her eyes widened, fear spilling over uncontrollably.
No explanation was needed... anyone who saw it could guess what was coming.
Thousands of worms.
All kinds... twisted, crawling, writhing... formed a pool so repulsive it defied human tolerance.
Disgusting?
It went beyond mere disgust.
A single glance could drive an ordinary person to madness.
"Go on, Sakura. Down you go."
What?
Sakura thought she'd misheard.
That place, those terrifying worms…
"No, no!"
"Waaah~~"
Unable to bear her fear, Sakura turned to flee toward the stairs.
But Zouken grabbed her hand.
"Heh tch tch tch~~"
Ignoring her cries, he dragged her toward the worm swarm. "It'll be over soon. If you have talent, tch tch tch…"
"No!!"
"Mommy~ Daddy~"
"I want to go home, waaah…"
As the worm pit drew closer, the girl, already lonely from abandonment, broke down, sobbing desperately, hoping someone... anyone... would appear.
Her parents, her sister, anyone!
Please, save me!!
Tap!
Tap tap tap!
Suddenly, the basement's sounds seemed muffled, as if veiled by a hazy curtain.
The worms' hissing, the old man's creepy laughter, the girl's cries... all fell silent.
The only clear sound was footsteps, growing louder from an unknown source.
"Looks like I'm not too late."
"What a nauseating sight."
An ethereal voice, as if from the heavens, echoed in the dim, cavernous basement.
"Hm?"
Wisps of cold air drifted through the room. Zouken's pupils narrowed as he looked down, realizing the girl he'd been holding was gone.
'What's happening?!'
'Magic?'
Zouken's mind raced as he turned to face a young man standing there.
Beside him was his newly adopted granddaughter, Sakura Matou.
'When?'
Silently, without him noticing, the youth had taken Sakura.
Unease stirred in Zouken, but he maintained a calm facade.
"It's over, Sakura."
A warm hand rested on the girl's head, gently stroking. Damien knelt, wiping the tears from her face.
"Waaah~~"
Sakura didn't know who Damien was, nor did she care.
All she knew was that in her moment of despair, this man appeared before her!
"There, there."
Damien pulled her into his arms, his gentle expression vanishing as he looked up, replaced by icy resolve. "Kill him, then destroy this place, Ice."
"You!"
Zouken hadn't expected such decisiveness. He tried to cast a spell.
But a terrifying chill seemed to freeze time and space in the basement.
His magic circuits stalled instantly, rendering him unable to use any magic.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 86 - 86: [TP] 86: Save
chapters.content:
The worms skittered ominously.
"What a revolting old man."
Ice spread rapidly, its extreme cold instantly encasing the repulsive crest worms in frost.
The Ice Empress stared at the zombie-like old man, now covered in absolute zero ice, the stench of decay wafting from him.
"Wait!"
"Who are you…"
Damien had no patience for Zouken Matou's words. Taking Sakura's hand, he vanished from the Matou family's basement.
In his place, a beautiful girl, ethereal as a spirit, emerged from the void.
Her aura, fierce as an ancient beast, enveloped Zouken Matou in an instant.
Not only his body and magic but even his soul trembled under the overwhelming pressure.
[Ice Empress]
Type: Anti-Fortress Noble Phantasm
Combat Strength: A++
'This thing!!'
Zouken Matou shook, but he wasn't afraid.
With his core crest worm intact, losing this body was merely losing a puppet.
Having lived for centuries, Zouken's survival skills were maxed out!
"Pointless tricks!"
The Ice Empress already knew his thoughts. Expressionless, she raised her hand and clenched it tightly. "Ice Burst!!"
"It's alright now, Sakura."
Damien set the girl down. Behind him, the Matou mansion had transformed into a crystalline ice palace.
Crack~~
The next moment, a sharp sound rang out as countless fissures appeared in the ice.
Whoosh~~
The Matou mansion began to shatter.
Glimmering ice shards were swept into the sky by an unseen gust.
"So beautiful…"
Sakura gazed at the breathtaking scene, momentarily forgetting to breathe.
From within the dreamlike sea of ice crystals, a figure approached... the Ice Empress.
"It's done. That old worm is gone."
The Ice Empress had controlled her power precisely, focusing Ice Burst's might to annihilate everything at absolute zero.
That included the old worm.
Soul or crest worm, it didn't matter.
Before Damien, a Demon Lord Seed, they were meaningless.
From the start, he had sealed all of Zouken's escape routes, even expending a large portion of his stored mana to summon the Ice Empress as his trump card.
"Just to deal with a guy like that, was it really necessary to summon me?"
As a soul beast, the Ice Empress didn't understand human behavior.
Even seeing Zouken about to push Sakura into the worm pit didn't stir her much.
Using a trump card like Ice Burst right away had consumed about a fifth of her mana (100).
Without a Master to provide a steady mana supply, this was quite wasteful.
"I wanted to calculate how much mana it takes to summon you all."
"I see."
The Ice Empress nodded. "Summoning me cost half your mana. What does that mean?"
"Your power is equivalent to an A+-rank Noble Phantasm's full strike."
Damien explained, "So, 500 mana is roughly equal to an A++-rank Noble Phantasm's maximum output."
Ice Burst wasn't even her strongest move.
Using it on Zouken was like swatting a mosquito with a cannon.
If she unleashed her full mana, her power could surpass Saber's Excalibur at maximum output.
"Don't worry about the mana issue."
"Besides, that old worm was an unstable factor. Eliminating him early benefits us."
Damien's descent wasn't impulsive; he'd planned for months to maximize gains in this war.
Finding Sakura to serve as his Master was the first step.
Killing Zouken was another part of the plan.
"Onii-san, thank you for saving Sakura."
Sakura clung tightly to Damien's hand, terrified her savior might disappear.
"Don't be afraid. I'll take you somewhere safe."
Damien didn't bother with nonsense about sending her home.
Given her attitude, whether she'd even want to return to the family that abandoned her was uncertain.
Being cast into a pit of horrors by her own parents... any child would feel resentment.
Never mind claims of magical inheritance.
Perhaps Tokiomi meant well, but Sakura didn't understand.
All she knew was she'd nearly been devoured by those disgusting worms!
"Sakura will be good!"
Sakura was obedient.
To her, Damien was a hero descended from the heavens.
Whatever he asked, she'd do, as long as he didn't abandon her like her parents had.
"Poor child."
Hearing her thoughts, Damien sighed inwardly. 'As expected, it's all Tokiomi's fault.'
Damien took Sakura to Fuyuki City's most luxurious hotel.
Yes, the same one where Kirei Kotomine and Kiritsugu Emiya had their showdown in the original story.
Damien had no identity in this world, and Sakura was just a child.
But that didn't matter.
"Here's your room key."
The receptionist handed over the key. Damien carried the sleeping Sakura to the elevator.
Charm.
A simple mental manipulation.
"Sakurako, Akahime."
Two figures appeared beside Damien, bowing respectfully. "Your orders, my lord."
"Protect Sakura well."
"Yes!"
[Monster Kingdom of Another World]
This was the Noble Phantasm Damien had poured immense effort into crafting for victory.
Its effect was akin to Iskandar's Ionioi Hetairoi, using Damien's spirit space to create a small domain.
With mana, he could shape Servant bodies for the Cardinal World's monsters prepared for descent.
Like Sakurako and Akahime.
Both were high-ranking Kijin. If their true bodies entered this world, they'd likely trigger the planet's rejection.
For reference, an A-rank upper Majin was comparable to a Counter Guardian in the Nasuverse view... a cataclysmic threat to the Counter Force.
But Damien wouldn't underestimate any world with parallel universes.
Descending in his true body was too risky.
So, he compromised.
Using the Servant summoning ritual, he transformed his hundreds of Kijin, five thousand goblins, and wolves into Servant-like existences.
This weakened their strength significantly but ensured safety.
As long as they stayed in the Kijin village, controlling their avatars like a game, they could join Damien in exploring the new world.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 87 - 87: [TP] 87: Invade
chapters.content:
[Sakurako]
Type: Anti-Army Noble Phantasm
Combat Strength: A
Summoning Cost: 50 Mana
[Akahime]
Type: Anti-Army Noble Phantasm
Combat Strength: A
Summoning Cost: 50 Mana
In this world, the two women were akin to Servants with all attributes averaging A-rank, lacking a Noble Phantasm.
If their nature as living beings was ignored, the power Sakurako and Akahime could unleash was comparable to an Anti-Army Noble Phantasm.
"Kijin require 50 mana to manifest."
Damien considered the 200 Kijin in his Monster Kingdom space. "10,000 mana to manifest 200 A-rank Servants."
In some ways, Damien's [Monster Kingdom of Another World] resembled Gilgamesh's Gate of Babylon.
From the weakest hobgoblins to the mid-tier wolves and the high-end Kijin, they corresponded to Gilgamesh's C-rank, B-rank, and A-rank treasures.
"By this calculation, 5,000 hobgoblins need 5,000 mana, 400 wolves at 5 mana each total 2,000, and 200 Kijin add another 2,000, making 9,000 mana."
"And above that, we have A+-rank Shuna, Shion, and Souei, A++-rank Ice Empress, and the even stronger Ogerpon and Snow Empress."
"To manifest everyone as Servants, I'd need at least 25,000 mana."
Mana collection aside, how to utilize his subordinates' power would be key to winning this Holy Grail War!
"Sakura, Sakura."
Damien gently woke the girl. She opened her eyes, dazed at first, then leapt into his arms like a frightened rabbit.
"Don't be afraid, Sakura."
After calming her, Damien said, "Go take a bath and get some rest."
"Onii-san, where are we?"
Only then did Sakura notice the change in surroundings and the presence of Sakurako and Akahime.
"We're at a hotel."
Damien didn't explain further, urging her to bathe and rest.
At her most vulnerable, Sakura instinctively obeyed.
With Sakurako and Akahime's help, she bathed and changed into pajamas Shuna had bought for her.
After a night's rest, Sakura's spirits improved significantly.
Damien took the chance to explain his origins and the current situation.
"Holy Grail War."
"Servants and Masters."
"An early-arriving Voyager."
The information was beyond Sakura's comprehension.
But that was fine.
She only needed to understand one thing.
"Whatever Damien-nii asks, Sakura will do!"
She agreed without hesitation to Damien becoming her Servant.
No, it was perfect!
Servants stayed by their Masters, meaning they'd never part.
Clutching Damien's hand, Sakura felt an overwhelming sense of security.
"Girls shouldn't say things like that."
Damien lightly tapped her nose.
Sakura nodded as if acknowledging a mistake, though whether she truly understood was unclear.
"Alright, Sakura, I'm starting."
Damien linked his mana to her, establishing a Servant contract per the Nasuverse's rules.
"Ah!!"
As the contract formed, Sakura let out a pained cry.
"What's wrong?"
"My hand!"
Sakura looked at her hand. "It hurts."
On her delicate hand, a strange red tattoo slowly appeared... the Command Seals, symbolizing her role as a Master.
"It's okay. These are Command Seals, a sign of our bond."
"Really?"
Hearing this, Sakura's pain vanished, replaced by deep affection and care.
In her simple mind, as long as the Command Seals remained, her Damien-nii would never leave her.
"Hm?"
Damien paused, then looked up sharply.
A faint smirk curved his lips.
"The rules… they're changing?"
He didn't know the cause or consequences of this shift.
But as an invader, any change in the Nasuverse due to his actions would yield rule fragments.
These were prime fuel for Violet, the building blocks of his soul barrier... his Unique Skills.
"Violet, what do these changes mean?"
[Analyzing]
Violet immediately reported the changes in the Holy Grail system to Damien.
[Analysis complete]
[Due to your early descent, the Holy Grail War has started ahead of schedule]
"Ahead of schedule?"
"The Holy Grail War can start early?"
Damien was surprised. He hadn't expected his actions to cause such a massive shift in the world line.
"Unexpected."
"But…"
"It saves us some trouble!"
Originally, Damien planned to exploit the 2.5-type descent loophole.
Violet would manipulate the timeline, fast-forwarding to a year later when the Holy Grail War began.
Now, that was unnecessary.
"With the Holy Grail War starting early, what happens to the original Masters and their Servants?"
[No need to worry]
[History has inertia. Alaya will handle any issues]
[Even if they don't intervene, I'll subtly ensure everything aligns with our needs]
"Impressive, Violet."
In the Kijin village, Damien's true body gave Violet a thumbs-up.
The girl remained expressionless, but inwardly, she was quite pleased.
'See that?'
Violet glanced smugly at the Snow Empress, standing close to Damien. 'That's the power of Lady Violet!'
Tch…
Though Violet said nothing, the Snow Empress felt her provocation.
As for Damien, he ignored their friendly rivalry.
"Good, the lineup hasn't changed."
Damien's goal in this Holy Grail War was none other than Gilgamesh and Iskandar.
The former's Noble Phantasm and the latter's Reality Marble were powers he urgently needed to analyze.
It didn't matter if other Servants changed, but these two had to stay.
Saber?
Damien certainly liked the King of Knights.
If he could take her with him, he wouldn't refuse.
If not…
Well, it didn't matter.
The Nasuverse wasn't going anywhere.
If he could enter once, he could do it again, and eventually, he'd claim those Heroic Spirit girls!
***

chapters.title: Chapter 88 - 88: [TP] 88: Shock
chapters.content:
[Damien]
[Mana Reserve: 400/1000]
[Recovery Rate: 10/hour]
A recovery of 10 mana per hour... that was the extent of what young Sakura could currently provide Damien.
This didn't mean Sakura's mana was vast.
In fact, most of a Servant's mana came from the Holy Grail system.
The Master's role was more like a faucet.
The higher the Master's aptitude, the greater the flow, and the more mana the Grail could supply to the Servant.
Sakura's aptitude was undeniable.
Across the Fourth and Fifth Holy Grail Wars, aside from Illyasviel, the Tohsaka sisters had the highest mana aptitude.
"With 10 mana per hour, that's 240 a day."
With about five days until the Holy Grail War began, plus the seven-day war, that totaled twelve days.
"In twelve days, Sakura can provide 2,880 mana. Adding what I have left, that's 3,280."
"Snow Empress and Ogerpon, equivalent to EX-rank Noble Phantasms, require 2,000 mana to summon."
"Shuna, Shion, and Souei, slightly below Ice Empress, need 250."
"5,000 C-rank Servants require 5,000 mana."
"400 B-rank Servants need 4,000 mana."
"200 A-rank Servants require 10,000 mana."
"Three A+-rank Servants need 750 mana."
"One A++-rank Servant needs 500 mana."
If focusing only on peak combat power, Damien could summon just the A-rank and above Servants.
Even so, he'd still need 13,000 mana.
Clearly, Sakura's mana alone wouldn't suffice.
"Shuna."
Once his mana had recovered sufficiently, Damien summoned Shuna.
[Shuna]
Type: Anti-Fortress Noble Phantasm
Combat Rating: A+
Summoning Cost: 250
"Lord Damien."
"Go to that mountain over there. There's a temple on it."
Damien pointed in a direction, instructing, "Occupy it and set up a mana-draining array."
Ryuudou Temple!
One of Fuyuki City's spiritual leyline hubs.
Through the leyline, Damien could quickly gather mana, allowing [Monster Kingdom of Another World] to unleash its true potential.
"Three nights ago, the Matou residence was attacked by an unknown force. The entire mansion vanished, leaving only ice shards."
At the Tohsaka residence, Tokiomi Tohsaka listened to his disciple Kirei Kotomine's report, his heart filled with unease.
The Matou family, one of Fuyuki City's two great magus families alongside the Tohsakas, was no less powerful.
Especially Zouken Matou.
Even Tokiomi couldn't see through that old man.
Yet, the Matou family had vanished overnight, as if erased from existence.
The thought sent chills through Tokiomi.
"Sakura…"
Tokiomi also felt a throbbing headache, unsure how to explain this to his wife.
He had personally handed Sakura to the Matou family.
Now, this had happened.
For the first time, Tokiomi regretted his decision.
"Any news of Sakura?"
Though hope was slim, he wished she was alive.
If so, she could inherit the Matou family's magic circuits early.
That would be a boon for her magical path.
"Can we determine what kind of magecraft caused it?"
"The Church's investigators examined it but found no similar cases."
Kirei recalled the mana fluctuations at the Matou residence.
A bone-chilling cold lingered days later... was that truly magecraft?
"And last night." Kirei continued, "Byakuya Matou, the current Matou heir, sold off the family's assets at breakneck speed and fled overseas with his only son."
The event was so sudden, almost absurd.
What force could have turned the Matou residence into that state before anyone could react?
"Did they flee out of fear of the enemy?"
Tokiomi could think of no other explanation.
For now, he could only prepare for the worst and await the Matou family's next move.
Who attacked them, and why?
Had Clock Tower magus discovered some taboo of the Matou family and issued a Sealing Designation?
With his thoughts in disarray, Tokiomi couldn't make a clear judgment.
"And, Kirei, you're aware of that matter, right?"
"Yes."
Kirei raised his hand, revealing the Command Seals... the mark of a Holy Grail War Master.
"The Matou incident might be tied to the early start of the Holy Grail War."
"You mean a Servant?"
"It's possible."
Tokiomi was merely speculating.
A pre-summoned Servant destroying the Matou family seemed too far-fetched.
After all, the Matou family was one of the three founding families of the Holy Grail system.
No one knew the war better than they did.
Being destroyed by their own creation was laughable.
"With the Holy Grail War starting early, the relic you prepared…"
"No need to worry, Kirei."
Compared to his daughter's safety, Tokiomi cared more about his magus's ambition... the pursuit of the Root.
Any sacrifice was worth reaching the Root.
Besides, neither Sakura's nor Zouken's body had been found, so nothing was certain.
Perhaps they were alive, just hiding.
"The relic is secured."
Tokiomi's recent agitation stemmed from the war's imminent start while the relic to summon the most ancient king was still en route.
But just recently, it had safely reached him.
"With that king summoned, victory in this Holy Grail War is ours!"
Tokiomi was brimming with confidence. The Tohsaka family had awaited this day for so long.
Finally, it was here!!
Meanwhile, at the former Matou residence, a black-haired young man stood outside the caution tape, his face grim as he surveyed the ruins.
Upon learning Tokiomi had given Sakura to the Matou family, Kariya Matou's hatred for him peaked.
Knowing what the Matou family was, he understood how despairing it was for Sakura to fall into Zouken's hands.
And Tokiomi, who had pushed his daughter into that pit?
That man didn't deserve to be a father!
***

chapters.title: Chapter 89 - 89: [TP] 89: Command Seals
chapters.content:
"What the hell happened here?"
Kariya Matou stood bewildered.
He had no idea what had occurred.
His so-called father, that centuries-old zombie, Zouken... where had he taken Sakura?
The possibility of Zouken being dead never crossed Kariya's mind.
That monster couldn't die so easily.
"Damn it!"
"Was I too late?"
Kicking a nearby lamppost, Kariya muttered, "Sakura, where are you?"
The thought of that innocent girl enduring torment filled him with guilt and self-blame.
"No, I still have a chance."
"If I can summon a powerful Servant, I'll definitely bring Sakura back!"
He glanced at the blood-red marks on his hand... the proof of being chosen by the Holy Grail.
Before, Kariya, who despised magecraft, wouldn't have cared for such trivial things.
But now, these Command Seals were his last lifeline!
"Excuse me, are you Mr. Kariya?"
As Kariya pondered how to tap into the Matou family's legacy for enough mana to join the Holy Grail War, a figure appeared behind him.
"Who?!"
Kariya spun around in a panic, his pupils shrinking.
"You…"
Before him stood a girl in a miko outfit... a Kijin named Shuna!
"Horns?"
"You're not human?"
Kariya knew of Japan's oni legends, and with the Holy Grail War looming, he connected the dots. "Are you the Servant who destroyed the Matou residence?"
Not human, appearing here, and radiating danger... these clues led Kariya to one conclusion: she was the early-arrived Servant the Grail system had hinted at!
And now, she stood before him.
Kariya's mind raced to a grim possibility... she was here to silence him!
"A Servant?"
"Something like that."
"But please, don't misunderstand. I mean you no harm, Mr. Kariya."
Shuna smiled faintly, gesturing invitingly. "I'm here on my lord's orders to invite you to meet him."
"Your lord?"
"Who is he?"
Kariya wanted to refuse, but Shuna's next words shattered his composure.
"If you want to see Sakura, come with me."
"Sakura?!"
Kariya's voice rose. "Where is she? What have you done to her?"
"Don't worry, she's safe now."
"Take me to her!"
As the Fourth War's purest devotee to love, Kariya's tragedy was real, but his care for Sakura was genuine.
To save her, he'd do anything.
"Please don't resist."
Shuna cast a spatial spell, instantly transporting Kariya to the villa where Damien now resided.
Yes, a villa.
For Sakura's comfort, Damien had moved out of the hotel the next day.
Using magic, he easily acquired ownership of the villa.
Rest assured, he paid for it... triple the market price, in full.
"Where is this?"
"My lord and Sakura are waiting in the study."
Led by Shuna, Kariya crossed the courtyard and reached a study door.
"Come in."
The door opened automatically, revealing a spacious study over a hundred square meters.
Inside, Damien sat, playing a board game with a beautiful girl with snow-white hair.
Nearby, Sakura hugged a plush toy, surrounded by various toys.
She wasn't alone... a cute, hooded kimono-clad girl, about twelve or thirteen, played with her.
"Sakura!!"
Seeing her safe, Kariya exhaled in relief, calling out excitedly.
"…"
Noticing a stranger, Sakura instinctively hid behind Ogerpon.
She recognized the man... Kariya-jiisan, whom she used to like.
But that was before.
Now, her heart was filled with Damien, leaving no room for others.
"Sakura…"
Seeing her reaction, Kariya froze mid-step.
Clearly, she had suffered inhumane torment at the Matou residence.
'If I'd returned sooner, maybe Sakura wouldn't…'
Imagining her tortured by those vile worms, Kariya's heart ached.
He wanted to take her home.
But before he could speak, Sakura, as if sensing his intent, darted to Damien, clutching his sleeve.
"I don't want to go back!"
"Damien-nii, don't abandon Sakura…"
Under Damien's care, Sakura had recovered well these past few days.
The trauma from the crest worms wasn't something that could be erased quickly.
And Damien had promised not to leave her.
'If my plan succeeds, I can break the limit that only Familiars can cross worlds.'
Even if it failed, Damien had prepared a fallback for Sakura.
This villa, plus a bank account he'd set up, would ensure she lived comfortably if he left.
"Please, sit, Mr. Kariya."
Damien stood, facing Kariya, and spoke. "You've seen the Matou residence's state. Yes, that was my doing."
"The reason? Let's say I couldn't stand that old worm bullying an innocent girl."
He gently patted Sakura's head, letting her sit beside him.
"Thank you for saving Sakura."
Seeing her reliance on Damien, Kariya was mostly convinced. "So, you're a participant in the Holy Grail War?"
"Correct."
A Servant was indeed a participant.
"Thank you again for saving her!"
Kariya asked, "So, Mr. Damien, why did you summon me?"
"I want your Command Seals."
Damien didn't beat around the bush, stating his goal outright.
"Command Seals?"
Kariya glanced at the red marks on his hand, then nodded. "Fine. As payment for saving Sakura, you can have them."
His sole reason for joining the war was to save her.
Now, with Zouken "defeated" by Damien (Kariya didn't believe he was dead) and Sakura safe, the Command Seals were meaningless.
They were a fair price to pay.
"No."
Damien shook his head. "You do owe me, but not for Sakura. It's because I killed that old worm!"
"What?!"
Kariya shot to his feet. "Impossible! How could you kill him?!"
If he could, Kariya would've ended Zouken himself.
Having grown up in the Matou family, he knew how terrifying the old man was.
"Is it because of the crest worms?"
Damien revealed the secret of Zouken's immortality. "Don't worry. I locked onto his soul and destroyed all his backups."
"…"
How to kill Zouken was something even Kariya didn't know.
Yet, in Damien's words, it sounded no harder than squashing an ant.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 90 - 90: [TP] 90: Heroic Spirit
chapters.content:
"Even if you still harbor doubts."
"In the future, whenever that old worm appears, I will strike it down."
With this, Kariya Matou was completely free of his worries.
"Transferring Command Seals requires a specific spiritual medium surgery..."
"No need for such trouble."
Damien raised his hand, and the Command Seals originally belonging to Kariya Matou glowed with a dazzling red light.
When the light faded, Kariya's Command Seals began to vanish.
In their place, a red tattoo emerged on the back of Damien's hand... the three-stroke Command Seal he had just acquired from Kariya.
"This!"
Though Kariya had long left the world of magecraft, he still understood its basic principles.
Command Seals are bound to a magus's Magic Circuits.
To strip them away is a process akin to a medical surgery.
But Damien?
In a mere instant, he had taken Kariya's Command Seals.
Yes, taken, not transferred!
This meant Damien had no need to waste words with him; he could have seized the Command Seals the moment they met.
"Why?"
Kariya asked, "If you have a way to forcibly take the Command Seals, why bother talking to me so much?"
"Because, of course, I am a man who follows the rules."
Damien shook his head, offering no further explanation.
Kariya Matou was not a bad person by nature, but his life was steeped in tragedy.
A repulsive family, a childhood sweetheart who married another, and the daughter of the woman he loved thrown into a pit of despair.
He chose to sacrifice himself to save Sakura.
Yet, in the end, through Kirei Kotomine's machinations, he was misunderstood by Aoi Tohsaka.
"You've never truly cared for anyone, have you?"
When Aoi Tohsaka spoke those words to him, Kariya's entire existence was negated.
To join the Holy Grail War, he had only three months left to live. He gave everything to protect the woman he loved, yet she never understood why he did it.
Pat! Pat!
Damien clapped Kariya's shoulder, thinking to himself, Is this what they call a simp who ends up with nothing?
Kariya wasn't entirely wrong; it was all a matter of timing.
"Just consider it my dislike for tragedies."
By taking Kariya's Command Seals, Damien ensured he could no longer participate in the Holy Grail War. "Since you've already left the world of magi, don't look back."
"As for Sakura, you needn't worry. I'll take good care of her."
"And, of course, when Sakura wishes to return home, I'll make sure she does."
Though his words carried no guarantees, Kariya felt Damien's sincerity.
It was a strange sensation.
Yet Kariya was certain the man before him was not lying.
"Shuna, please escort Mr. Kariya out."
"Yes."
Knowing Sakura was safe and relied so heavily on Damien, Kariya departed.
No matter what, Sakura was better off with Damien than staying with the Matou family.
As for Tokiomi Tohsaka?
That man could hardly care about his daughter's fate.
In his eyes, there was only magecraft and the Root.
With these thoughts, Kariya took one last look at the villa before turning to leave.
"Damien-nii, do you know Kariya-jiisan?"
"No, it was our first meeting."
Damien smiled and patted Sakura's head. "He's not suited to be a magus. Staying away from the mystical side is best for him."
In that final moment, Damien used a mental suggestion on Kariya Matou.
It would keep him far from the turmoil of the magical world, allowing him to live a peaceful life.
"Alright, Onii-san won't abandon Sakura."
"Mm!"
As expected, Sakura's question about Kariya was really about whether Damien would send her back.
With his renewed assurance, Sakura finally felt at ease.
"So, Sakura, would you like to see a Heroic Spirit summoning?"
"Heroic Spirit summoning?"
Sakura looked at Damien curiously. As far as she knew, Damien himself was a Heroic Spirit and had formed a contract with her.
"Is it for Sakura to summon another Heroic Spirit?"
"No, that would be too great a burden for you."
Supporting one Damien was already the limit for young Sakura.
Another would be more than she could bear.
Moreover, to unleash Damien's full power, Sakura's strength alone wasn't enough.
His true goal was Ryudou Temple, the site of Fuyuki City's spiritual leyline.
By claiming that location, Damien could establish a massive magic absorption array, providing him with the magical energy needed for the upcoming Holy Grail War.
Soon, the day after Damien acquired Kariya's Command Seals arrived.
It was night, with the full moon hanging high.
Carrying Sakura, Damien ascended the final step to Ryudou Temple.
Swish!
Souei appeared before Damien, kneeling on one knee to report. "As per your orders, everyone in the temple has been moved to a safe location."
"They've been placed under Shuna's sleeping spell and will not awaken during the Holy Grail War."
Using specialized sorcery, the temple's occupants had been relocated.
They were placed in a deep slumber.
This sleep would cause no harm to their bodies, and they would recover swiftly upon waking.
"Well done." Damien praised, then opened his status panel.
[Damien]
[Stored Magical Energy: 20,177/1,000]
[Recovery Rate: 100/hour]
A recovery rate of 100 magical energy points per hour.
Over three full days... 72 hours... Damien had recovered 7,200 points of magical energy.
This was how he could summon entities like the Snow Empress and Ogerpon.
First, manifest the strongest units, then gradually build up the army.
"Lord Damien."
Shuna approached gracefully. "The ritual magic circle for the Heroic Spirit summoning is complete. You may begin the summoning at any time."
"Sakura, go stay with Shuna-nee for a bit, okay?"
"Mm!"
Sakura nodded obediently, running to Shuna's side as soon as she was set down, then quietly watching as Damien approached the magic circle engraved in the temple courtyard.
"Heroic Spirit summoning… intriguing."
"How does it compare to Ramiris's spirit summoning or Rimuru's daemon summoning?"
As Damien traced the magic circle, he contemplated the summoning rituals of his own world.
The Cardinal World also had Heroic Spirits.
But those were surely different from the ones in the Nasuverse.
Through this Heroic Spirit summoning, Damien aimed to analyze the fundamental laws of the Holy Grail system and, with Violet's power, claim it as his own.
This was precisely why he had dealt with the old worm and made contact with Kariya Matou.
***
