chapters.title: Chapter 91 - 91: [TP] 91: Berseker
chapters.content:
In Damien's original plan, if the Holy Grail War hadn't started early, he would have exploited a loophole in the world's rules to manipulate its timeline, accelerating it to a year later.
However, the war began ahead of schedule, and the Holy Grail swiftly selected its Masters.
Fortunately, Kariya Matou was still chosen as one of the seven Masters.
"I've never had such a favorable start." Damien thought to himself before asking, "Are you ready, Violet?"
[It can begin.]
Hearing Violet's response, Damien raised his hand, channeling his magical energy through the Command Seals on his hand and connecting to the Holy Grail system enveloping Fuyuki City via its spiritual leyline.
"Fill, fill, fill…"
"I declare your body serves under me, my fate is entrusted to your sword; heed the call of the Holy Grail. If you abide by this will and reason, then answer."
"I am the embodiment of all that is good in the world; I am the conduit for all that is evil."
"You, clad in the three great words of seven heavens, come forth through the wheel of restraint, Guardian of the Scales!"
Boom!
The once-dim magic circle erupted in brilliant light under Damien's incantation, its intense magical fluctuations sending waves of air rippling outward.
"Not a bad magical reaction." The Snow Empress remarked, arms crossed as she stood to the side. "I wonder what kind of Heroic Spirit Damien will summon."
"Isn't it that dark one?" Ogerpon asked curiously, tilting her head. Damien had previously shared details about the seven Heroic Spirits of the Fourth Holy Grail War.
Kariya Matou's summoned Servant was Lancelot, of the Berserker class.
"No, it won't be Lancelot." The Snow Empress said, shaking her head. "Our lord didn't use a corresponding Saint Relic, as this allows a stronger connection to the Root, giving Violet a chance to siphon more of its rules."
"So, it's a random summoning?" The Ice Empress asked, grasping the idea. Damien was taking a chance, summoning whatever came.
"Not entirely random. At least the class is fixed." The Snow Empress clarified. "The other classes are mostly locked, leaving only Caster and Berserker."
These two classes were up to chance; Damien could summon either one.
"It's here!"
Finally, Damien sensed a presence emerging from the center of the magic circle.
A strikingly beautiful girl appeared, with short, pink hair and pale green eyes. She wore a flowing white dress resembling a wedding gown, adorned with metallic accessories at her waist and ears. A golden horn at her forehead faintly glimmered with emerald arcs of electricity as she raised her head.
"Frankenstein."
The moment the girl was summoned, Damien received her complete information.
[Name: Frankenstein]
[Class: Berserker]
[Parameters:
[Strength C]
[Endurance B]
[Agility D]
[Mana D]
[Luck B]
[Noble Phantasm C]
[Inherent Skills:
- Galvanism (Rank B): Automatically accumulates magical energy, significantly reducing the Master's burden.
- Overload (Rank C): At the cost of self-damage, enhances the power of her Noble Phantasm.
[Noble Phantasms:
[Bridal Chest]
[Rank: C]
[Type: Anti-Unit]
[Range: 1]
[Maximum Targets: 1]
[Blasted Tree]
[Rank: DB+]
[Type: Anti-Army]
[Range: 110]
[Maximum Targets: 30]
"It's Fran." Damien mused, surprised to have summoned Frankenstein.
"Ah, Ma… Master…" Fran stammered.
"Yes, I'm your Master."
Damien stepped forward, gently brushing Fran's hair without hesitation, showing no fear of her Berserker class or the massive hammer named Bridal Chest.
"???"
Fran had never experienced such a thing.
She was a monster created by her father, reviled for her ugliness and abandoned.
In her 'life,' no one had ever held expectations for her.
No, more accurately, the idea of someone having expectations for her was nothing short of a miracle to Fran.
"Pretty average attributes." The Ice Empress remarked bluntly, offering no courtesy. "And that's with the Mad Enhancement boost. Her base stats are probably just on par with a C-rank Heroic Spirit."
In other words, Damien's summoning had produced a Heroic Spirit only slightly stronger than a lone Shadow Guard.
What kind of terrible luck was this?
"Aaah!"
Hearing the Ice Empress's criticism, Fran raised her hammer in anger, ready to strike.
But Damien stopped her with a single hand.
"Huh?"
Fran stared in shock at Damien, who had effortlessly restrained her with one hand, her heart filled with awe.
"Don't make trouble, Ice." Damien said with a sigh, his tone carrying a hint of reproach.
"Got it." The Ice Empress replied, chastened.
Her sharp tongue had been instinctive.
Since Fran was summoned by Damien, she was a comrade.
Damien's group had few rules.
But one taboo was absolute: betrayal of a comrade.
The Ice Empress's disdain for Fran wasn't a big deal, far from a serious offense.
Damien didn't expect all his subordinates to get along perfectly... that was unrealistic.
But in his presence, he would quash such conflicts.
Differences breed competition.
And as long as it was healthy competition, Damien wouldn't intervene.
There was no need for him to say more.
"Ice…" The Snow Empress's expression was enough to make the Ice Empress lower her head, avoiding her gaze.
Looking down on a comrade was wrong.
At least, that's how it was for them.
In truth, they were merely soul beasts from the Douluoverse, having lived for hundreds of thousands of years.
Without Damien bringing them out and granting them power, what right did they have to scorn others?
This applied not just to the Snow Empress and Ice Empress, but to the Shadow Guards, Goblins, and Star Wolves as well.
They were once weak, only rising to their current state through Damien's favor.
Fran might be weaker now.
But that was only temporary.
Who could say that, once Damien brought Fran back to the Cardinal World, she wouldn't receive more blessings and surpass the Ice Empress?
At that moment, Damien and the Snow Empress exchanged a glance, sharing a silent understanding.
Damien's reprimand of the Ice Empress wasn't just for Fran's sake... it was also for Ice's benefit.
As the Snow Empress thought, Damien couldn't predict the potential of Fran or future newcomers from other worlds.
If the Ice Empress made an enemy of someone weak now, it could lead to trouble later.
The Ice Empress was Damien's twin martial soul, closer than a mere vassal... a trusted confidante.
---
Hi guys, Elenea here! I just want to announce that starting now I'll be trying to focus on my own original fanfic, which I've been thinking about for the past few days (lol I really mulled this over briefly for a few days and decided I'm going to make it a full novel).
If you want to read it, feel free to stop by and leave a five-star and that power stone.
[Worse Than the Devil (DxD)]
Synopsis:
Devil.
An evil and chaotic creatures born from hell who often blamed by humans for the mistakes they themselves commit.
"The devil made me do it."
A phrase always uttered by humans after committing crimes, casting blame and responsibility for their wrongdoings onto the devil.
But not all humans are like that, for there is one man who would gleefully commit atrocities that would be condemned by all of human history and accept the blame and responsibility for those wrongs with open arms.
His name is Michael, but in stark contrast to the meaning of his name 'Who is like God' he is not a devout man who draws near to God's embrace. Instead… he is the one who sends lost sheep to meet God's embrace much faster.
---
Don't forget to stop by, otherwise I'll actually slap you online lol.
Btw, a quick note before you decide to read, if you have a heart as pure as glass, I suggest you don't read this because it REALLY gets dark to early. The first chapter will give you a little idea of what I might explore later on in this fanservice harem-themed world like DxD.
Adios!

chapters.title: Chapter 92 - 92: [TP] 92: Power Bank
chapters.content:
"Make friends in humble beginnings, and never underestimate the potential of youth."
Damien's words echoed in the Ice Empress's ears.
Clearly, this was the true lesson Damien wished to impart to her.
"I understand." The Ice Empress said, her mood lifting considerably.
Realizing that Damien's defense of Fran was also an expression of his high expectations for her, the Ice Empress's earlier frustration dissipated. She gained a clearer understanding of her role under Damien's command.
"Sorry, I shouldn't have said that about you." The Ice Empress apologized to Fran, who responded with a few soft "ahh" Sounds before turning her attention back to her Master.
"So, will Fran become one of Damien's vassals too?" Ogerpon asked, nibbling her finger and glancing innocently between the Snow Empress, the Ice Empress, and Damien.
As a simple Pokémon, she couldn't grasp the complexities of their thoughts.
"No." Damien replied, checking his status panel with a regretful shake of his head. "Unfortunately, Heroic Spirit summoning doesn't exploit the loophole of the Unity of All Spirits."
"Fran is just my Heroic Spirit, not a vassal."
One of Damien's goals in performing the Heroic Spirit summoning was to test whether it could expand his vassal quota.
Now, it seemed that plan had failed.
"But it's not all bad news."
Through this summoning, Violet had gathered some critical information.
One key point was that Damien could retain the souls of the Heroic Spirits he summoned.
Take Fran, for example.
If Damien chose, he could extract her soul and, in the Cardinal World, craft a new body for her.
This way, Damien could effectively "steal" Heroic Spirits from this world.
Once Fran entered the Cardinal World, Violet could secure her a "green card." granting her the blessings of the World's Voice.
With her Heroic Spirit form, substantial magicule, and various skills, Violet estimated that Fran's potential in the Cardinal World would rival that of Shion and Shuna... a seed for high-tier combat strength.
"And don't underestimate Fran." Damien added. "Her inherent skill, Galvanism, is exactly the power we need."
Damien's Heroic Spirit form was anchored to Sakura.
His existence constantly drained her magical energy.
Despite Sakura's remarkable aptitude and higher-than-average magical reserves for a magus, a six-year-old girl could not sustain Damien at full power.
But now, things were different.
With the magical energy provided by Ryudou Temple, Damien could fully unleash his Heroic Spirit template.
As for Fran, she was the type who could fight independently once fully "charged." requiring no further effort from Damien.
Her power source was the ambient magical energy in the air.
With Ryudou Temple's leyline, Fran could recharge in the shortest time possible.
Most importantly, even when Fran's magical energy was full, she could still absorb ambient magic, though she couldn't store it.
"Could it be?!"
In that moment, everyone realized Fran's significance to the group.
Name: Frankenstein
Magical Energy Recovery: 40/hour
"A combatant who doesn't need constant support and can boost our magical energy recovery... isn't that a good deal?" Damien asked.
Truth be told, compared to the Knight of the Lake, Damien preferred Fran.
The Knight of the Lake consumed too much magical energy.
Supplying him would be less efficient than supporting Shion or Ogerpon, who were no less capable.
Fran, on the other hand, was essentially free labor.
Not only did she require no upkeep, but she also added 40 points to the magical energy recovery, on top of Sakura's 10 points and the leyline's 100 points.
"But 40 points... isn't that a bit much?" The Snow Empress asked curiously. Despite Fran's modest strength, her ability to draw magical energy from the Greater Grail was four times that of Sakura's, which seemed remarkable.
"It's because of this place." Damien said, pointing to the ground beneath them. "Fran's Galvanism absorbs ambient magical energy."
"And what we're doing now is releasing the magical energy accumulated in Ryudou Temple's leyline over centuries."
This release required a corresponding magic absorption array.
However, no matter the array, there was always significant waste... around 60 points of magical energy dissipated for every 100 points Damien extracted from the leyline.
"Fran can repurpose that wasted energy."
As a result, Damien's magical energy recovery efficiency had risen from zero to 150 points per hour.
In just 100 hours... five days... Damien would be able to fully unleash the power of [The Monster Kingdom of Another World].
At that point, no elaborate plans would be necessary.
He could simply charge in and dominate the Holy Grail War!
"Kirei Kotomine's Heroic Spirit is still the same Assassin."
"Tokiomi Tohsaka's Goldie remains unchanged as well."
On the first night of the Holy Grail War, the day after summoning Fran, Damien, stationed at Ryudou Temple, received word that Assassin had infiltrated the Tohsaka residence and was decisively obliterated by Gilgamesh.
This scene played out exactly as in the original story, a clear act of Tokiomi Tohsaka and Kirei Kotomine's orchestration.
"Aside from the yet-to-be-identified Caster and Lancer, the identities of the other Heroic Spirits have been confirmed." Souei reported, kneeling before Damien. The Shadow Guard had gathered intelligence across the city. "This morning, a white-haired beauty accompanied by a blonde woman dressed as a butler was spotted at Fuyuki City's shopping district."
"A young man named Waver was also seen with a towering red-haired warrior."
"Artoria and Iskandar."
"The King of Knights and the King of Conqueror have arrived."
Knowing these three had successfully joined the Holy Grail War, Damien's lingering concerns vanished. "Excellent. Our main targets are accounted for. The remaining Caster and Lancer are inconsequential."
Damien's goals were the Gate of Babylon and the Reality Marble.
"Hm?"
Suddenly, Damien and Souei, seated in the room, sensed an unmistakable wave of battle intent emanating from the void.
"This brazen fighting spirit is almost too bold." The Ice Empress said, arms crossed as she appeared behind Damien, her expression displeased. "Shall I go take him out?"
"I agree with Lady Ice Empress." Shion chimed in eagerly. "Let me go... I'll tear that guy to shreds!"
"Don't be so impulsive, you two." Damien said, rising slowly. He instructed Shuna to look after Sakura before heading toward the source of the battle intent. "If I'm not mistaken, this should be the scene of Diarmuid and Saber's first clash."
"Let's go join the excitement!"
Meanwhile, at the container yard by Fuyuki City's river, a warrior wielding dual spears faced off against a knight clad in blue-and-white armor, their figures locked in a fierce exchange of blows.

chapters.title: Chapter 93 - 93: [TP] 93: Caster?
chapters.content:
Bang! Bang! Bang!
Boom!
The two combatants moved swiftly, their every strike showcasing the pinnacle of swordsmanship and spearmanship.
Damien's figure appeared atop a vantage point, his gaze sweeping the area, quickly pinpointing everyone present.
On the distant bridge stood the Rider Master and Servant, while an Assassin lurked high above, observing the scene. Irisviel watched anxiously from afar, and Kayneth hid somewhere nearby.
Of course, Damien didn't miss Maiya and Kiritsugu, positioned with sniper rifles, ready to take out a Master at the first opportunity.
"How's it looking?" Damien asked.
"In terms of martial skill alone, they've reached the peak of human capability." The Snow Empress replied, noticing the figures concealed in the shadows. "Those rats... should we deal with them?"
"No, tonight we're just here to observe."
Damien let his legs dangle, sitting casually on a container.
His targets weren't these two, but the yet-to-engage King of Conqueror and Goldie.
"Wait!"
Suddenly, Kiritsugu's heart skipped a beat. He shifted his sniper rifle. "That's…?!"
"A new Master?"
Through the scope, Kiritsugu caught sight of Damien.
"What?"
"White hair, heterochromatic eyes, about sixteen or seventeen, dressed in modern casual clothing, and a beauty that seems almost inhuman."
It wasn't just Kiritsugu. Through Assassin's eyes, Kirei Kotomine also saw Damien and relayed his appearance to Tokiomi Tohsaka.
"???"
Tokiomi was utterly baffled.
Kirei had already described a similar appearance earlier... that of Irisviel.
Tokiomi's judgment was that she was an Einzbern homunculus.
But what was Damien's deal?
A second homunculus?
"A Heroic Spirit?"
"Or another Master?"
No further guesses were needed.
As if sensing the prying eyes, Damien slowly raised his right hand, revealing the blood-red Command Seals etched on its back.
"Command Seals?!"
"A Master!!"
That was everyone's first thought, but they were soon shocked by Damien's audacity.
As a Master, he didn't hide but instead exposed himself openly.
Kayneth was concealed in the shadows, Irisviel was a decoy thrown out by Kiritsugu, and Kirei and Tokiomi were observing remotely.
Only Damien appeared without reservation in their line of sight.
"Is he a fool, or does he have some kind of backing?"
"To so brazenly reveal his position like that."
"Should we take him out?"
Maiya had already aimed at Damien, ready to shoot him in the head. "At this distance…"
"Yes, at this distance!"
"!!!"
Suddenly, Maiya's hand froze mid-motion.
A gleaming blade hovered at her throat, ready to slit it at any moment.
When?
A bead of cold sweat slid down Maiya's forehead as she felt the killing intent from behind.
The specter of death had never been so clear.
"Maiya?!"
Having fought alongside Maiya for years, Kiritsugu immediately sensed the change in her tone.
Something had happened to Maiya!
And if she was compromised, so was he.
"Shall I kill her, my lord?"
A low, weathered voice came through the earpiece, and Kiritsugu realized he, too, had been exposed.
Step! Step! Step!
"Behind me? Since when?!"
Startled by the sound of footsteps, Kiritsugu moved to react.
But a hand landed on his shoulder faster.
"!!"
In that moment, Kiritsugu felt as if an invisible force had pinned him in place.
A single hand, exerting little effort, held him immobile, unable to rise.
"Do you think I should kill her?" Damien's figure vanished from everyone's sight. He lightly patted Kiritsugu's shoulder. "Saber's true Master, Kiritsugu Emiya?"
As he spoke, Damien casually sat beside Kiritsugu, continuing to watch the battle below.
As for Kiritsugu, completely restrained, he couldn't counterattack, let alone use a Command Seal to recall Saber.
This guy!
He's definitely not a magus!
No magus could wield such methods.
It wasn't just Kiritsugu.
At that moment, Kirei Kotomine and Tokiomi Tohsaka were also searching for Damien's figure.
"Gone?"
"Yes." Kirei said. "Like an illusion. Assassin blinked, and he lost track of him."
"How is that possible?"
It might be understandable if they lost sight of Damien.
But this was Assassin.
The Servant most adept at assassination and concealment!
To evade his eyes and vanish without a trace... no magus, not even a Heroic Spirit in the Holy Grail War, should be capable of that.
Yet Damien was indeed gone!
"An invisibility spell, or an illusion?"
There was another possibility: spatial magecraft.
But that was too terrifying to consider.
If a magus of that caliber was participating in this Holy Grail War, Tokiomi could imagine the immense pressure it would bring.
"Perhaps we've misjudged." Tokiomi said, his expression grim. "That white-haired youth…"
"He's not a Master!"
Of the remaining unconfirmed classes, only three were left: Rider, Caster, and Berserker.
Someone with such composure couldn't be a Berserker.
"Caster?"
Kiritsugu reached a similar conclusion.
The man exhaled deeply, his mind racing as he forced himself to stay calm. "So, what does the great Caster want with me?"
"Ho?"
Damien was mildly surprised that Kiritsugu could still converse calmly. He released his hold on him.
"You speak as if we're the ones with intentions." Damien said. "Hiding in the shadows, aiming dangerous weapons for a sneak attack."
"Pretty underhanded, Mr. Kiritsugu."
Damien calmly outlined their conflict. "Give me an explanation, or that woman will pay the price for her actions."
Though Maiya hadn't actually fired, aiming a sniper rifle was something Damien could tolerate... but his vassals could not.
Had Damien not intervened, the Ice Empress would have already unleashed an Ice Burst.
If that happened, all eyes would have turned to Damien.
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC
1000 Power Stones = 5 BC
***
If you want to read up to 50 chapters ahead, don't hesitate to visit our patron: pat reon . com / XElenea (remove space)

chapters.title: Chapter 94 - 94: [TP] 94: Time Alter
chapters.content:
"What kind of explanation do you want?"
Though Kiritsugu Emiya's tone was calm, his heart was racing with tension.
"Your magecraft."
Damien stated his demand plainly: "Time Alter!"
"This…"
Kiritsugu's shock was beyond words.
He hadn't expected this person to know his abilities so thoroughly.
Has someone betrayed my information?
Who?
Maiya? Irisviel? Or perhaps the Einzberns?
In an instant, Kiritsugu's mind raced through countless possibilities.
"Didn't you call me Caster?" Damien said. "As a magus from the Age of Gods, is it so hard to believe I can see through modern magecraft at a glance?"
Of course, it was hard to believe!
Kiritsugu hadn't even used the spell.
To see through his trump card like that... was this the caliber of a Caster?
Yet, no matter how turbulent Kiritsugu's thoughts were, he was a fish on the chopping block. He had no choice.
"Fine, but the essence of this magecraft requires a Magic Crest…"
Though Time Alter was the culmination of generations of Emiya family effort, Kiritsugu didn't hold it in high regard.
As long as he could achieve his dream of world peace, a mere magecraft was insignificant.
However, this magecraft was no simple feat.
Its essence was a Reality Marble, a miracle known as a 'Great Magecraft.'
It separated the interior of a specific space from the external 'flow of time,' allowing the user to manipulate time at will.
This magecraft consumed immense magical energy and required complex preparations and rituals, designed as a technique for performing Great Magecraft.
"No need for complications." Damien interrupted Kiritsugu's explanation. "As long as you don't resist, I can analyze a mere magecraft in no time."
He wasn't worried about revealing his capabilities to Kiritsugu.
Damien's true trump cards were the Snow Empress, Ogerpon, and the others.
As long as these forces remained hidden, no one could counter him.
"Alright."
Kiritsugu had no choice.
With Maiya under Damien's control and himself in his grasp, Kiritsugu had no confidence in escaping a Heroic Spirit like Damien.
Caster?
Who is this guy, really?
Following Damien's instructions, Kiritsugu relaxed his body, though his mind continued to race to that white haired gold and silver heterochromatic eyes man.
His apperance was so Otherworldy.
No matter how much Kiritsugu searched his memory, he couldn't find any Heroic Spirit matching that description.
Wait!
Suddenly, Kiritsugu realized something.
If the Damien beside him was a Heroic Spirit summoned as a Caster, then who was holding Maiya hostage?
Recalling the deep, weathered voice from the earpiece... distinctly different from Damien's... Kiritsugu wondered, Their Master?
But that was too bizarre.
What kind of Master followed a Heroic Spirit's orders to take hostages?
A complete reversal of roles?!
Especially with the Command Seals on Damien's hand... undoubtedly genuine.
Kiritsugu felt his mind going numb: What kind of rule-breaking Heroic Spirit is this?
[Rule fragment detected. Beginning analysis…]
[Analysis in progress…]
The Learner skill in the Nasuverse wasn't as effective as in the Konosubaverse.
In Konosubaverse, Damien could use his appraisal skill to instantly copy an adventurer's class skills.
Here, replicating another's abilities required not only sufficient analysis time but also the condition that the target either use the skill or be within a certain distance.
Right now, Kiritsugu was close enough to Damien.
Even without using the magecraft, Violet could rapidly analyze Time Alter without the Nasuverse's rules detecting it.
"Done."
Damien signaled Souei to release Maiya. "Until the magecraft analysis is complete, let's enjoy this knightly duel."
Though he said this, the situation clearly showed Saber at a disadvantage.
Diarmuid had unleashed his Noble Phantasms, first using Gáe Dearg to bypass the King's armor, then Gáe Buidhe to sever the tendons in one of her hands with its cursed strike.
"Irisviel, use healing on me too!" Artoria called, seeing Diarmuid's wounds heal rapidly under Kayneth's magical energy.
"I did!" Irisviel replied in a panic. "I used it… why isn't it…?"
"The healing should have taken effect, Saber. You should be healed by now."
Yet Artoria's wrist continued to bleed.
Clearly, this wasn't Irisviel's fault but something Diarmuid had done.
"You were clever to see that armor is useless against Gáe Dearg." Diarmuid said. "But abandoning your armor was too hasty. Otherwise, you could have blocked Gáe Buidhe!"
"I see." Artoria realized, identifying her opponent. "The red spear that severs magic, the yellow spear that curses wounds to never heal, and the tear-shaped mole that enchants maidens... the Fianna Knights' greatest warrior, 'Shining Face' Diarmuid."
Likewise, Diarmuid recognized Artoria's identity as the legendary King Arthur through her sword.
"Saber's lost." a voice said behind Damien. Kiritsugu turned to see a cold, ice-blue maiden.
"Hmph!" The Ice Empress scoffed at Kiritsugu's gaze. "This guy's an enemy Master, right? Should we take him out?"
Her words carried a tangible killing intent that enveloped Kiritsugu.
True to her nature as a 400,000-year-old beast under Damien's command, her first instinct was to kill.
"He's already paid the price." Damien said.
As a man of principle, since Kiritsugu had offered compensation, Damien honored his word and forgave the offense.
"But there won't be a next time, Kiritsugu Emiya."
Each word from Damien struck Kiritsugu's heart like a hammer, leaving him drenched in sweat.
Monster!
That was Kiritsugu's first impression of Damien.
A terrifying, incomprehensible monster!
Absolutely…
I cannot afford to make an enemy of this man!
Though reason dictated the wisest course, Damien knew well that, as a champion of justice, Kiritsugu would not abandon his resolve to challenge him.
---
Hi guys, Elenea here! I just want to announce that starting now I'll be trying to focus on my own original fanfic, which I've been thinking about for the past few days (lol I really mulled this over briefly for a few days and decided I'm going to make it a full novel).
[Worse Than the Devil (DxD)]
Synopsis:
Devil.
An evil and chaotic creature, born from hell, which are often a scapegoat for humans. Blamed for the atrocities they themselves commit.
"The devil made me do it."
A phrase always uttered by humans after committing crimes, casting blame and responsibility for their wrongdoings onto the devil.
But not all humans are like that, for there is one man who would gleefully commit atrocities that would be condemned by all of human history and accept the blame and responsibility for those wrongs with open arms.
His name is Michael, but in stark contrast to the meaning of his name 'Who is like God' he is not a devout man who draws near to God's embrace. Instead… he is the one who sends lost sheep to meet God's embrace much faster.
---
Btw, a quick note before you decide to read, if you have a heart as pure as glass, I suggest you don't read this because it REALLY gets dark to early. The first chapter will give you a little idea of what I might explore later on in this fanservice harem-themed world like DxD.
Adios!

chapters.title: Chapter 95 - 95: [TP] 95: Solomon?
chapters.content:
Boom!
Zzt! Zzt!
A sudden burst of lightning and thunder drew everyone's attention.
With a bolt of lightning descending from the sky, Artoria and Diarmuid were forcibly interrupted, their gazes fixed warily on the red-haired giant riding a thunderous ox-drawn chariot.
His arrival gave the disadvantaged Artoria a moment to catch her breath.
"My name is Iskandar, the King of Conqueror!" He declared, arms spread wide, announcing his presence to the two Heroic Spirits. "In this Holy Grail War, I descend as Rider!"
"Another one's shown up." The Ice Empress noted, recognizing the burly man as one of the two main targets Damien sought in this Holy Grail War.
"Saber's hand is injured; she can't wield her holy sword anymore." The Ice Empress observed, having watched Artoria and Diarmuid's duel. She now had a clear grasp of her own strength.
Without using special magic, her body... rated A++... surpassed even Diarmuid when he used his Noble Phantasms.
But Saber's light cannon? Even if the Ice Empress could withstand it, her magical energy would likely be drained completely.
"If we act now, we could take all three of them down." She suggested.
"Not yet." Damien replied, deeming the timing poor. "There are other Heroic Spirits lurking in the shadows. If Gilgamesh launches a sneak attack while we're engaged, it'll be trouble."
"Fine." The Ice Empress conceded, tempted to ask why he didn't send the Snow Empress to intercept Gilgamesh. But since Damien wasn't ready to end the Holy Grail War tonight, she held her tongue.
Vassals had the right to offer counsel, but the final decision rested with Damien.
"???"
Meanwhile, Kiritsugu Emiya had been observing the Ice Empress.
The girl, radiating terrifying magical energy and an icy aura, didn't seem human at all.
The only possibility was that she was a Heroic Spirit.
But that was absurd.
The one holding Maiya hostage was a Heroic Spirit, and Damien, despite bearing Command Seals, seemed to be one too.
And now, this third one appeared.
In just moments, three Heroic Spirits had emerged.
What baffled Kiritsugu even more was that these two clearly deferred to Damien.
An alliance?
No, no alliance works like this.
A historical figure flashed through Kiritsugu's mind: A Caster with the ability to summon powerful pseudo-Heroic Spirits…
No way.
Kiritsugu was startled by his own theory. If it really is that figure, just how chaotic will this Holy Grail War become?
"Hm?" Damien sensed Kiritsugu's mental storm but ignored it.
No matter what Kiritsugu guessed, he'd never imagine that Damien and his group came from another world.
It wasn't about plausibility... no one would consider that the Holy Grail War could summon Servants from other worlds.
"Though fate pits us against each other for the Holy Grail, I have one question first!" Iskandar proclaimed. "Will you join me and yield the Grail to me? If so, I shall treat you as friends, and we'll share the joy of conquering the world together!"
"Huh?"
"What kind of joke is this?"
Unsurprisingly, Iskandar's bold declaration left everyone speechless.
Those present, whether Masters or Servants, had their own desires. How could they simply hand over the Grail?
Submitting to a fellow Heroic Spirit like Iskandar was an outright challenge to their spiritual dignity.
"This guy…" Kiritsugu muttered. "The world was nearly conquered by such a fool?"
"Pretty interesting, isn't it?" Damien said, resting his chin on his hand. "Honestly, if I could, I'd like to be like him."
"What?"
"I'm not interested in the Grail." Damien admitted. "Rather than the Grail, I'd prefer the loyalty of the summoned Heroic Spirits."
At that moment, Kayneth finally noticed Waver beside Iskandar.
Realizing the truth behind his stolen Saint Relic, Kayneth unleashed a barrage of merciless mockery and threats, leaving Waver trembling.
Fortunately, Iskandar, true to his reputation as a great ruler, easily reassured his young Master and countered without hesitation.
"Hey, magus!" Iskandar called out. "From what you're saying, you intended to replace this boy as my Master, didn't you? That's utterly laughable."
"A man worthy of being my Master must be a warrior who can ride into battle with me." Iskandar declared. "A coward too spineless to show himself doesn't qualify to be my Master!"
When it came to mockery, Iskandar was a professional.
Kayneth gritted his teeth, furious at being told he was inferior to Waver.
Kiritsugu remained unfazed.
As an assassin, he cared little for reputation.
Still…
Kiritsugu glanced over and immediately noticed the Ice Empress's darkened expression.
Clearly, such mockery wasn't without effect.
For someone as proud as the Ice Empress, being called a rat skulking in the shadows was intolerable.
"Fran!" Damien called, stopping the Ice Empress from acting.
"Go make an appearance."
"Aaah!"
Wielding her massive thunder hammer, Fran emerged from the void.
Boom!
With a few leaps, she bounded across the containers, crashing onto the battlefield of the three Heroic Spirits like a meteor.
Damien sent Fran out for no other reason than to introduce his official Berserker to the other Heroic Spirits.
"Another one!"
"A new Heroic Spirit?!"
While Iskandar and the others were surprised by the arrival of another Heroic Spirit, Kiritsugu was genuinely stunned by Damien's tactics.
That's the third one!
Fran?
Is that the Heroic Spirit's True Name?
Kiritsugu couldn't recall any Heroic Spirit named Fran, but his earlier suspicion grew stronger: The legendary King of Magecraft from the Tanakh, said to command seventy-two Demon God Pillars... Solomon!
"Hm?" Damien paused at Kiritsugu's sudden outburst.
"Oh, you're talking about my identity?" He said, neither confirming nor denying it.
But come to think of it…
Damien realized his situation did bear a striking resemblance to King Solomon's legend.
Especially the ability to summon seventy-two Demon God Pillars.
His [Monster Kingdom of Another World] was indeed quite similar in effect.
Even the legions controlled by those Demon God Pillars shared some parallels with his Goblin army.
---

chapters.title: Chapter 96 - 96: [TP] 96: Stand-In?
chapters.content:
Hiss…
Damien suddenly realized that if he claimed to be 'King Solomon' in this Holy Grail War, it might actually work. No one would likely call my bluff.
Good grief!
The real Solomon had somehow become his stand-in.
"It seems I guessed right." Kiritsugu said, interpreting Damien's silence as confirmation. "It's hard to imagine... this Holy Grail War with both the King of Conqueror and the King of Magecraft."
Add in his own Knight King, Arthur, and this war's 'king' quotient was absurdly high.
Zzt! Zzt!
"The little girl sparking with electricity." Iskandar remarked, rubbing his chin, unable to discern Fran's identity. "Care to introduce yourself first?"
"Aaah!"
Fran, not grasping Iskandar's intent, flared with lightning, poised to attack at any moment.
"Careful, Irisviel!" Artoria gripped her holy sword, shielding Irisviel behind her.
Diarmuid's expression grew serious, ready to fight.
"Hey, hey, hold on!" Iskandar protested. "Such a hot-tempered girl... can't you let me finish?"
His words had no effect, but Damien's command calmed Fran instantly.
As the arcs of electricity faded, Fran planted Bridal Chest beside her, awaiting Iskandar's next words.
"I thought you were one of those non-communicative types." Iskandar said, keenly sensing Fran's nature. If he wasn't mistaken, she was likely this Holy Grail War's Berserker.
"Rider?" Artoria asked. "What exactly are you after? What's your goal?"
"My goal?"
Iskandar didn't answer directly. Instead, he tilted his head back and shouted.
"Hey! There are others out there, right?!"
"You lot hiding in the shadows, spying on us!"
His voice deepened. "Surely, Saber and Lancer's clear clash of blades has drawn more than just me and this little girl."
"Come now! Heroic Spirits summoned by the Holy Grail, if you don't want to be scorned as cowards by me, Iskandar, the King of Conqueror, show yourselves!"
Heroic Spirits were renowned heroes of history, each with their own pride and legendary deeds.
Unsurprisingly, Iskandar's provocation was something few could stomach, except perhaps an Assassin.
"This is…" Tokiomi Tohsaka, watching from the shadows, felt a headache coming on. "Trouble."
Among the summoned Heroic Spirits, none would be more provoked by Iskandar's taunt than Gilgamesh.
"The Nasuverse lamppost king lives up to his name." Damien remarked, watching as Gilgamesh appeared atop a lamppost, unleashing a torrent of insults, branding everyone as worthless mongrels.
Without Lancelot present, Gilgamesh's Noble Phantasms were aimed at Iskandar, who had dared to offend him.
But then...
"Aaah!"
Whether it was a natural clash between Berserker and Gilgamesh, Fran glared at him, her body wreathed in lightning, ready to pounce.
"Hm?" Damien was surprised but quickly understood.
In a way, the term 'mongrel' wasn't just a trigger for Mordred... it struck a nerve with Fran too.
"Who permitted you to gaze upon me, mongrel?" Gilgamesh snapped, turning two Noble Phantasms toward Fran.
Boom!
Boom!
Two golden beams of light shot toward Fran on the ground.
She swung her massive hammer, deflecting the faster Durandal with force.
But the overwhelming strength from the holy sword slowed her attempt to block the second spear by a fraction.
Fran's strength, among this war's Heroic Spirits, was only slightly above Hundred-Face Hassan.
Against the overpowered Gilgamesh, victory was unlikely... surviving for long was the real question.
Still, Damien had never intended for Fran to play a major role in this Holy Grail War.
She had already provided valuable experience in Heroic Spirit summoning and a magical energy recovery buff.
"Leave it to you." Damien said calmly, unconcerned for Fran's safety, and called out, "Shion!"
"At your command!"
Without needing further instruction, a graceful, tall figure crossed space, positioning herself between Fran and the incoming Noble Phantasm spear.
Boom!
A slender, pale hand reached out, seizing the spear's tip in front of the disbelieving eyes of the Heroic Spirits, halting it with sheer force.
Buzz! Buzz!
The Noble Phantasm spear trembled in Shion's grip, emitting a low hum.
It struggled to break free.
But her hand, as if forged from steel, held firm, unscathed by the legendary weapon.
"Not a bad weapon, but…" Shion raised her head, her sharp eyes locking onto Gilgamesh atop the lamppost. With a sudden exertion...
Crack! Snap! Bang!
"How is this possible?!"
All eyes were fixed on the Noble Phantasm spear in Shion's hand, their faces filled with disbelief.
The once-gleaming golden spear was now riddled with cracks, shattered by Shion's brute strength.
"That spear!"
"No doubt, it's a Noble Phantasm!"
And not just any... at least B-rank or higher!
Yet Shion had crushed it with her bare hands.
"Keep going, Shion." Damien's voice rang in her ear. "I need that golden shiny guy to keep using his Gate of Babylon."
Getting close to Gilgamesh was no easy task.
So, the plan was to force him to fight, to keep unleashing his arsenal of Noble Phantasms.
And in the process…
[Noble Phantasm identified: Gate of Babylon]
[Analysis initiated]
[Analysis in progress…]
For Violet, there was no need to analyze abilities one at a time.
The more a target used their power in Damien's presence, the more flaws Violet could detect, hastening the analysis of its essence.
"To dare touch my treasures with those filthy hands." Gilgamesh seethed. His anger at Shion's contact with his treasures surpassed his shock at the spear's destruction.
"Do you desire death so badly, mongrel?!"
His handsome face froze with icy killing intent, devoid of expression.
The space around Gilgamesh warped like a mirage, and a divine radiance burst forth.
A new array of Noble Phantasms unfurled like a saint's halo around the golden Heroic Spirit... sixteen in total.
Not just swords and spears, but axes, hammers, and lances.
Some were strange weapons of unknown purpose or origin.
Each gleamed like a mirror, imbued with potent magical energy.
Every one was a true Noble Phantasm, without exception.
---

chapters.title: Chapter 97 - 97: [TP] 97: Furious
chapters.content:
"The cursed sword of Danish King Högni from Norse mythology, Dáinsleif."
"The scythe used by the hero Perseus to behead Medusa, Harpe, which nullifies immortality."
"From Norse mythology, the demonic solar sword of the hero Sigurd, symbolizing 'glory and ruin,' Gram."
"The thunderbolt weapon of the Indian god of thunder and rain, Indra, crafted by the artisan god Tvastar, Vajra."
As Damien listed the Noble Phantasms with the familiarity of reciting heirlooms, Kiritsugu beside him was dumbfounded.
Is this the legendary wisdom of King Solomon?
Kiritsugu grew even more convinced of Damien's identity.
Who else but the King of Magecraft, symbolizing wisdom, could identify Gilgamesh's Noble Phantasms at a glance?
He didn't suspect Damien of bluffing.
A being of such power had no need to deceive in such matters.
Of course, this was all Kiritsugu's imagination, unrelated to Damien.
While Damien lacked Solomon's wisdom, he had Violet, the Spirit of the World.
Through her power, Damien's appraisal skill was unparalleled.
Anything that appeared before him... its origin and details were instantly known.
"How is this possible?!" Waver stammered below, his voice trembling.
It wasn't just Waver; the other Heroic Spirits and Masters shared his shock.
A Heroic Spirit's Noble Phantasms weren't always singular.
Some wielded three or four superweapons akin to Noble Phantasms.
But even then, three or four was the limit.
Yet this golden-clad Archer seemed to possess an endless arsenal, drawing Noble Phantasms one after another, discarding them after use.
Counting from his earlier battle with Assassin, not a single Noble Phantasm Gilgamesh used was repeated.
"Can that sudden Heroic Spirit withstand this?" Someone wondered.
Gilgamesh's power was so overwhelming that, for a moment, everyone forgot Shion's origins.
Where did she come from, and why was she protecting Fran?
"Come!" Gilgamesh declared, giving them no time to ponder. "Let's see how long those filthy hands of yours can hold out!"
At his command, the floating array of Noble Phantasms surged toward Shion.
The booming impacts shook the air, their explosive flashes banishing the darkness and illuminating the night sky.
Unbelievable... mere thrown weapons could unleash such devastating force?
Countless Noble Phantasms rained down on the warehouse district, reducing it to rubble as if carpet-bombed, leaving only devastation.
Yet Archer's onslaught showed no signs of stopping.
The Noble Phantasms fell like thunder, as if intent on obliterating Shion and the entire district, strike after relentless strike.
The assault didn't pause... it only intensified.
The reason was clear.
Under Gilgamesh's barrage, Shion emerged unscathed, growing fiercer with each exchange.
Wielding a two-meter-long greatsword, she swung it with commanding force.
Chopping, sweeping, parrying.
Her simple movements perfectly countered Gilgamesh's attacks, one after another.
From six Noble Phantasms to twelve, then twenty-four.
Shion moved with the grace of a stroll, like a butterfly weaving through flowers, cutting her way to Gilgamesh.
"Get…"
Shion leaped, raising her arms and swinging the greatsword downward with force. "Down!!"
"Damn it…"
The heavy blade descended with unstoppable might, forcing Gilgamesh to retreat, his face darkening as he dodged Shion's slash.
Boom!
The greatsword struck the ground, its terrifying strength tearing through the warehouse district.
But it wasn't over.
Crack! Crash!
"Damn!"
"Up here, kid!"
"Irisviel!"
The warehouse district, already strained by Gilgamesh and Shion's clash, couldn't withstand her final mountain-splitting strike and collapsed.
Everyone leaped to nearby containers.
Only Shion and Gilgamesh, descending from the sky, stood on the shattered ground, locked in their standoff.
"Fun toy. That was quite a thrill." Shion said, relishing the intense battle that rekindled her long-dormant bloodlust. "Hey, shiny gold guy, got any more toys? Bring them out!"
"(?へ?╬)!!"
"Insolent fool!"
Gilgamesh's rage reached its peak.
"To force this king, who should be gazed upon from below, to stand on the same ground as you!"
A deep furrow creased his brow, twisting his handsome features into a ferocious scowl. "Such disrespect cannot be atoned for, even with your death."
"You mongrel, I'll reduce you to ashes!"
Buzz! Buzz!
Golden light flared brilliantly.
The surrounding space warped again, revealing a new forest of blades.
The next wave of Noble Phantasms numbered one hundred and eight.
The spectacle silenced not just the watching Masters but even fellow Heroic Spirits like Iskandar, Artoria, and Diarmuid.
"What is this nonsense?"
"Counting the Noble Phantasms he's already used, what's with this Heroic Spirit?"
"Are his Noble Phantasms inexhaustible?"
In that moment, everyone felt the unfairness of the Holy Grail War.
Especially Lancer.
Why was he, with his dual spears and swords, limited to just two weapons in this war?
Yet this golden figure tossed Noble Phantasms like trash!
Where was the justice?
Diarmuid admitted to himself: I'm jealous. Is the gap between Heroic Spirits really this vast?
"Heh."
From his vantage point, Damien overlooked the battle below, a pleased smile on his face. "Well done, Shion. Keep provoking him."
---

Devil.

"The devil made me do it."
A phrase always uttered by humans after committing crimes, casting blame and responsibility for their wrongdoings onto the devil.
But not all humans are like that, for there is one man who would gleefully commit atrocities that would be condemned by all of human history and accept the blame and responsibility for those wrongs with open arms.

chapters.title: Chapter 98 - 98: [TP] 98: Deification
chapters.content:
"…"
Kiritsugu Emiya's awe of Damien deepened as he heard his words.
Among Heroic Spirits, some could casually send a subordinate to observe from the sidelines.
Others... specifically Gilgamesh... were being toyed with like a monkey on a stage.
This guy is absolutely the most dangerous Heroic Spirit in this Holy Grail War!
Kiritsugu wanted to distance himself from Damien, but the Ice Empress's predatory gaze kept him pinned.
He had a feeling.
If not for Damien's restraint, the Ice Empress would have already attacked him.
Demon God Pillars?
Kiritsugu began to speculate which of the seventy-two Demon God Pillars Shion and the Ice Empress might be.
Their overwhelming killing intent and Shion's indestructible physique were striking.
Unfortunately, the lore of the seventy-two Demon God Pillars was too complex.
Kiritsugu couldn't pinpoint which ones matched the two women in such a short time.
"Gilgamesh is getting serious." Kirei Kotomine reported through a gemstone communicator, observing via Assassin's eyes. "He plans to keep unleashing Gate of Babylon."
Tokiomi Tohsaka, receiving the update, felt a growing headache.
He hadn't intended for Gilgamesh to reveal himself so early.
But now, if he didn't recall him, Gilgamesh would fight Shion to the death.
"But who is that female Heroic Spirit?"
With a horn on her forehead, an elven-like beauty, and absurdly agile combat skills.
Her battle experience, intuition, unmatched strength, and near-invulnerable body posed a massive threat to everyone present.
And indeed, they were right to feel threatened.
As three of the six vassals Damien brought to this war, Shion, Shuna, and Souei all boasted A+ stat panels.
Unlike other Monster Kingdom Servants, they possessed unique skills.
[Shion]
[Noble Phantasms: Tyrant (A+), Oni Deification (A)]
[Shuna]
[Noble Phantasms: Analyzer (A+), Creator (A+), Oni Deification (A)]
[Souei]
[Noble Phantasms: Concealer (A+), Oni Deification (A)]
Beyond the shared Oni Deification, which temporarily boosted all stats, their unique skills manifested as Noble Phantasms.
All four Noble Phantasms were of high rank, reaching A+.
In Heroic Spirit terms, Shion was akin to a top-tier Saber with one A+ and one A-rank Noble Phantasm.
Thus, unless Gilgamesh unleashed his most exceptional Noble Phantasms, even breaching Shion's defenses would be a challenge.
[Tyrant]
This Noble Phantasm's ability was similar to Twelve Labors.
While lacking resurrection, its defensive power surpassed even Heracles'.
Breaking Shion's defenses required at least an A-rank Noble Phantasm.
Yes, A-rank!
Anything below A-rank couldn't harm her.
Of course, this referred only to a weapon's raw sharpness.
Special-effect Noble Phantasms like Gáe Dearg (B-rank) with its magic-severing ability were immune to her defenses.
"I've seen through you, mongrel!" Gilgamesh declared.
Though arrogant, his insight was unmatched.
Through the earlier barrage, he noticed a pattern.
Shion didn't tank every attack.
Some Noble Phantasms she blocked with her weapon.
Others, she chose to dodge.
"The ones you avoided are all A+ rank or higher!"
"So what?" Shion retorted.
"Hahaha…" Gilgamesh laughed, recalling his thrown Noble Phantasms and summoning a new batch of blades from Gate of Babylon.
"I have as many Noble Phantasms as I need to deal with you!"
This time, all 108 summoned Noble Phantasms were A+ rank or above!
Each uniquely shaped yet exquisitely crafted weapon radiated power that made even Shion wary.
"…"
Shion fell silent.
This situation demanded her full focus.
Otherwise, she might actually get hurt.
"Is he serious?!"
Gilgamesh's self-exposure stunned everyone.
If Shion's ability to ignore A-rank Noble Phantasms was terrifying, Gilgamesh's display shattered their understanding.
A Heroic Spirit wielding over a hundred A+ Noble Phantasms? How was anyone supposed to fight that?!
"This is bad…" Tokiomi muttered, unable to stay calm.
He hadn't expected Gilgamesh to reveal such critical information.
Now, everyone would fear Gilgamesh.
Unless he was eliminated first, winning this Holy Grail War was impossible!
"Gilgamesh can't keep acting recklessly."
Making a snap decision, Tokiomi expended a Command Seal. "By the power of this Command Seal, King of Heroes, cease your anger and retreat."
"Hm?"
Gilgamesh, poised to obliterate the offending Shion, snapped his head up, his face brimming with displeasure. "You think your counsel can make me retreat, Tokiomi?"
At that moment, Gilgamesh felt a spark of killing intent toward Tokiomi.
This so-called respectful Master hadn't truly acknowledged his place.
Very well!
Tokiomi, you not gonna see sun this morning!
Unfortunately, the Command Seal's authority was absolute, even for Gilgamesh.
With a wave, he recalled all his Noble Phantasms.
"You've escaped with your life!" He spat, glaring at Shion before turning to leave. "Mongrels! Until we meet again, continue your pointless slaughter!"
"Only true heroes will face me next time!"
"Hey!" Shion taunted, unrelenting. "Running already? I thought you were some big shot. What a letdown."
"Hmph!"
Gilgamesh's fury boiled, his killing intent toward Tokiomi reaching its peak.
"It's over…"
Atop the container, Damien sat on the edge, glancing at his analysis panel.
[Time Alter]
[Analysis Progress: 100%]
[Provides: 20% Reality Marble analysis]
[Gate of Babylon]
[Analysis Progress: 15%]
The surge of A+ Noble Phantasms had significantly boosted Damien's analysis progress.
Time Alter granted him insight into temporal rules.
Additionally, it advanced Violet's research into Reality Marbles.
---

chapters.title: Chapter 99 - 99: [TP] 99: King of Conqueror
chapters.content:
"But it's still not enough!"
Time Alter was only a fragment of a Reality Marble, equivalent to about 20% of a complete one.
As for the battle between Gilgamesh and Shion, the expenditure of Gate of Babylon was still insufficient, yielding only 15% analysis progress.
Moreover, the further the analysis went, the more data was needed.
For Gilgamesh, without forcing out his Enkidu and Ea, the analysis of Gate of Babylon would never reach 100%.
"This needs a long-term strategy." Damien mused.
"Well, tonight's goals are achieved. Let's head back."
"Oh, right."
Damien stood, patting Kiritsugu's shoulder. "Thanks for your gift. See you next time, Kiritsugu Emiya."
The Ice Empress followed Damien's lead.
Before leaving, she shot Kiritsugu a chilling glance.
Her icy stare was like a blade, ready to pierce his heart at any moment.
Damien wasn't surprised by her reaction.
Kiritsugu Emiya was a dangerous man.
Even the Ice Empress, a soul beast, instinctively sensed something off about him, urging her to eliminate him.
Beastly intuition?
Kiritsugu recognized this, his heart growing heavier. It's like facing an ancient predator…
Fortunately, the one commanding these 'Demon God Pillars' was King Solomon.
And he was someone Kiritsugu could still communicate with.
Phew…
Realizing Damien had truly left and that he'd survived, Kiritsugu let out a relieved breath.
"Maiya!"
His taut nerves relaxed, and he immediately contacted her.
"I'm fine. He's gone." Maiya replied.
"Is that so?" Kiritsugu said. "It seems he doesn't consider us a threat."
Despite the slight, Kiritsugu felt no resentment... only gratitude.
As expected of the legendary King of Magecraft.
Such magnanimity was admirable.
He was also thankful for his and Maiya's insignificance.
"So, who is that Heroic Spirit…?"
"If I'm not mistaken, he's likely the king who commanded the seventy-two Demon God Pillars."
"!!!"
At the mention of the seventy-two Demon God Pillars, anyone versed in occult knowledge would know his story.
"King Solomon?" Maiya asked.
Prompted by Kiritsugu, she recalled the recent events.
The girl with the strange giant hammer, the tall purple-haired woman with a horn, the silent shadow assassin who nearly slit her throat.
And not long ago, the incident that reduced the Matou residence to icy shards.
If Damien was behind that, it made sense.
"With so many powers, if they stem from Solomon's Demon God Pillars, it's not surprising." Maiya said, fully endorsing Kiritsugu's theory. Only that identity explained why Damien was surrounded by so many powerful entities.
"Those aren't Heroic Spirits but something like magical beasts or familiars... Demon God Pillars." Kiritsugu reasoned.
Restricted by the Holy Grail War, they couldn't fully unleash their power, appearing in humanoid forms instead.
Kiritsugu's speculation convinced not only himself but Maiya as well.
It was hard to argue otherwise.
The pressure from the Ice Empress's parting glance was overwhelming.
Kiritsugu was certain she wasn't any historical Heroic Spirit.
She lacked any human traits.
Her judgment was purely that of an ancient predator hunting prey.
No other reason.
A dangerous entity had to be devoured.
That was all!
"Time to go." Shion said, approaching Fran and vanishing with her in a shimmer of golden particles.
"Hm."
Fran felt a twinge of regret.
She'd wanted to fight Gilgamesh too.
But she knew her limits and was no match for him.
"Ah, aaah~~"
"No need to thank me." Shion said, understanding Fran's cries and smiling. "We're comrades, so of course we help each other!"
"Hm."
Fran followed Shion obediently.
The girl's heroic rescue under the Noble Phantasm barrage had captivated her.
A new Master and the first comrade she'd ever met.
"Com…rade… Fran… likes…"
"Oho!" Shion laughed, slinging an arm around Fran's shoulders as they walked. "You're talking now? Haha, that's great!"
With that, the two women's figures dissolved into golden particles, fading into the distance.
Their departure didn't ease the tension among the remaining Heroic Spirits.
On the contrary, their curiosity about the duo's origins and identities intensified.
First, they were undeniably Heroic Spirits.
The others, as Heroic Spirits themselves, couldn't mistake that.
So, the question was: if the less rational Fran was the Berserker, what was Shion?
Caster?
Based on the Heroic Spirits present... Saber (Artoria), Rider (Iskandar), Archer (Gilgamesh), Lancer (Diarmuid), Berserker (Fran), and the earlier Assassin... the only remaining class was Caster.
But a Caster this combat-proficient?
With the terrifying defense and melee prowess Shion displayed against Gilgamesh, even the strongest class, Saber, wouldn't dare claim victory over her.
"Strength, Endurance, Agility... all above A-rank."
"That can't be a Caster's stats."
Had they been deceived?
Was Fran not the Berserker, and Shion was?
"Kid, did you pick up on anything?" Iskandar asked, turning to Waver for clues.
"The first one, the girl with the giant hammer, is definitely Berserker." Waver said of Fran. "But the other one, I could only see her stats, not her class."
Masters could glimpse basic information about Heroic Spirits through specific magecraft.
True Names, Noble Phantasms, and abilities, however, remained hidden.
"What do you mean?" Iskandar asked, puzzled. "You can see her stats but not her class?"
"Uh…"
As a half-baked magus, Waver could only relay what he saw.
"!!!"
Other Heroic Spirits might not grasp the significance of Waver's report, but Iskandar was different.
Is it an ability like mine?
In an instant, he considered a possibility: A subordinate Servant with stats but no class, yet able to rival other Heroic Spirits.
Wasn't that exactly like the soldiers in his Ionian Hetairoi?
The only difference was that Shion was stronger.
---

chapters.title: Chapter 100 100: [TP] 100: Seventy-Two Demon God Pillars
chapters.content:
"Irisviel?"
"Let's retreat for now, Saber."
"Alright."
Artoria kept a wary eye on Diarmuid, cautious of another attack.
"You too, Lancer. Come back."
Fortunately, Kayneth chose to recall his Servant.
What Waver could discern, Kayneth could see as well... and further.
"The Berserker, and the horned girl, likely a summon of the Caster."
Kayneth vaguely realized that the greatest variable in this Holy Grail War was the hidden Caster.
The proud Clock Tower lord, for the sake of victory, began to consider alliances.
Yet his position was awkward.
Gilgamesh's arrogance made him an unlikely ally.
Artoria's Master was Kiritsugu Emiya, the notorious magus killer.
Kayneth despised magi who dabbled in such unorthodox methods.
As for Waver... his student, the thief who stole his Saint Relic.
Kayneth would rather lose this Holy Grail War than ally with a thief.
"Tch."
Leaving the warehouse district, Kayneth sighed inwardly. "Is my only option to join Caster and Berserker?"
He could see that Caster and Berserker were already allied.
He pondered whether to join them to better counter the other Masters and Servants.
"Kiritsugu."
Meanwhile, Artoria and Irisviel met up with the retreating Kiritsugu.
"Good work, Irisviel."
Kiritsugu shifted his gaze from Saber's injured wrist, then shared what had happened and his suspicions about Damien's identity.
"A Heroic Spirit who can summon other Heroic Spirits?"
That alone was shocking enough.
But what stunned them more was Kiritsugu's revelation of Damien's true identity.
"King Solomon?!"
"…"
Artoria and Irisviel exchanged glances.
They increasingly felt this Holy Grail War was absurdly over-the-top.
Infinite Noble Phantasms from one, Demon God pillar summoning from another.
Compared to Gilgamesh and Damien, Artoria felt her King Arthur persona seemed rather plain.
"King Solomon commands seventy-two Demon God Pillars."
"How many can he summon?" Irisviel asked. "If it's all of them, that's just cheating."
The top-ranked Demon God Pillars, like Baal or Amon, transcended Heroic Spirits, bordering on divinity.
"There must be some limitation!" Kiritsugu insisted.
To claim the Holy Grail, Damien was a hurdle he had to overcome.
"Then, Kiritsugu, you and I…"
"No." Kiritsugu shook his head. "We stick to the plan. I stay in the shadows, and you maintain the facade as Saber's Master."
"But that puts you in danger…"
Damien's assassin had found Kiritsugu once; there could be a second or third time.
If Damien targeted the Saber team, assassinating Kiritsugu would secure victory.
But Kiritsugu wasn't worried.
From their brief interaction, he sensed Damien wouldn't resort to such tactics.
"The King of Magecraft, Solomon, could kill me anytime."
"Since he didn't act earlier, there's no need to worry about him going back on his word."
Kiritsugu also considered allying with other Masters to counter Damien.
"If it comes to that…" He looked at Irisviel. "Have Saber protect you both until the Holy Grail War ends."
Rather than let his wife die needlessly, he'd rather end it there.
"Lord Damien."
At Ryudou Temple, Shuna and the shrine maidens greeted Damien's return.
"How's Sakura?"
"She waited for you all evening." Shuna said with a troubled look. "But she's just a child. She couldn't hold out past 10 p.m. and fell asleep in the living room."
Having been gone all night, it was nearly 4 a.m.
Damien and his group, as Heroic Spirits, needed no sleep or food.
In all of Ryudou Temple, only Sakura had human needs.
"That girl…"
Damien was quite fond of Sakura.
Perhaps fearing abandonment again, her obedience was heart-wrenching.
"For the next two days, we'll stay at Ryudou Temple."
Damien recalled the plot of the Fourth Holy Grail War. My involvement has changed some things, but the major developments should stay the same.
This wasn't a casual judgment.
With Violet's real-time monitoring, he could track the entire war's trajectory.
Except for minor details that might be overlooked.
"Souei."
"Here!"
Souei appeared behind Damien, accompanied by other Shadow Guard.
"The serial killer I asked the Shadow Guard to investigate... any leads?"
With the Holy Grail War's timeline shifted earlier, Damien wasn't certain if the deranged killer Ryūnosuke Uryū would still appear.
"Found him!" Souei reported.
"Ho…" Damien marveled. "The world's inertia is that strong?"
Even a year early, under the world's will, Ryūnosuke had begun his killing spree.
"Should we eliminate him when he receives his Command Seals?"
Killing Ryūnosuke now offered Damien no benefit.
Souei suggested striking the moment Ryūnosuke summoned his Heroic Spirit.
That way, with the Master dead, the true Caster would vanish too.
"Hm."
Damien had little interest in the sea monster or that big blue eyes guy. "Leave it to the Shadow Guard. Handle it cleanly."
He spared Kiritsugu because a Demon Lord didn't need petty tricks.
But Ryūnosuke was different.
No method was too extreme for such a monster.
"Understood!"
Watching the figures vanish into the courtyard, Damien recalled Kiritsugu's earlier speculation. "King of Magecraft, Solomon, huh…"
"I wonder what your reactions will be when I reveal my true identity?"
A Demon Lord from another world, ruler of countless monsters, humanity's natural enemy!
Impersonating another wasn't Damien's style.
"Then, at the upcoming Banquet of Kings." Damien declared, "I'll announce my arrival!"
---

chapters.title: Chapter 101 101: [TP] 101: Death
chapters.content:
Time passed quickly, and the third day of the Holy Grail War arrived.
On the first night, Artoria's clash with Diarmuid drew the attention of all Heroic Spirits except Caster. Due to Damien's intervention, Ryūnosuke was whisked away by Souei's Shadow Guard the moment he summoned his servant, rendering the original plot irrelevant.
From the second night, the Heroic Spirits began their own maneuvers.
The fiercest conflict was between Kayneth and Kiritsugu, their enmity like fire and water, with Saber and Lancer clashing multiple times.
Perhaps because Saber's disadvantage was too great, Kiritsugu had no choice but to return her scabbard, Avalon.
"Saber, restored by some means, successfully repelled Lancer."
"Kayneth was struck by an Origin Bullet, sustaining severe injuries."
Though he survived, the Origin Bullet's destruction of his Magic Circuits left Kayneth paralyzed.
"That dual-wielding spearman is utterly incompetent." The Ice Empress remarked. "He got so caught up fighting Saber that he forgot to protect his Master."
"And worse, he charmed his lord's fiancée."
Kayneth was arguably the most pitiful Master in this Holy Grail War.
Crippled and betrayed by his fiancée, swayed by his Servant.
Though Diarmuid had no such intentions, his curse inevitably attracted married women.
One could only say Kayneth was reckless, summoning Diarmuid without fear of betrayal.
"Anything else?" Damien asked, seated in the main hall of Ryudou Temple, listening to Souei's report. "No other Heroic Spirits detected our movements?"
"The Rider team is investigating us."
"Oh?" Damien was surprised. For Souei to say this meant Waver and Iskandar had picked up some clues.
Iskandar's brash nature didn't suggest such subtlety.
"So, it's Waver?" Damien mused.
Waver's talent was undeniable.
Through some method, he'd noticed the simultaneous presence of multiple Heroic Spirits.
Not just Damien's Shadow Guard, but also Assassin, who should have been eliminated.
"My apologies, my lord." Souei said, bowing. "I should have been more cautious."
"No matter." Damien replied, shaking his head. "Finding Ryudou Temple was only a matter of time."
Over three days, Damien had amassed considerable magical energy.
24 hours x 3 days x 150 units... at least 10,800 magical energy.
After summoning the Snow Empress, Ogerpon, the Ice Empress, Shion, Shuna, and Souei, Damien had successfully summoned all his Kijin.
By tonight, even Hoshiga and the Eighteen Wolf Guards would manifest in this world.
As for the remaining wolves and goblins, their inclusion was merely for participation, not to influence the war's outcome.
"Keep waiting." Damien instructed. "As long as no one attacks us directly, we don't need to get involved in their fights."
Damien remained composed, showing no intent to reveal his strength.
That day, he took Shuna and the others to explore Fuyuki City, exuding no trace of wartime tension.
As for exposure?
With the Shadow Guard monitoring everything, there was no need to worry.
That night, Souei brought new intelligence.
"Tokiomi Tohsaka is dead?"
Yes, the notorious Tokiomi, the source of so much trouble, had died prematurely that evening.
"So soon?" Damien was genuinely surprised.
If he recalled correctly, Kirei Kotomine's betrayal of Tokiomi should have happened after Assassin's exit.
"How did he die?"
"Backstabbed by his disciple, Kirei Kotomine."
"Same old story." Damien thought. "Did Gilgamesh grow so fed up with Tokiomi that he acted early?"
Kirei's premature move meant he now controlled both Assassin and Gilgamesh.
"Can he sustain two Heroic Spirits?" The Snow Empress asked, frowning. "Or does he plan to abandon Assassin?"
"No need for that." Damien replied. "Gilgamesh has Independent Action. Unless he's fighting, he consumes minimal magical energy."
"Tokiomi was Sakura's father, wasn't he?" Ogerpon, listening to the conversation, pointed out. "Should we tell her?"
"…"
The hall fell silent.
"Shuna, bring Sakura here." Damien said.
"Lord Damien?"
"It's fine. I trust Sakura."
Damien had no intention of hiding this from her.
For others, he might craft a white lie.
But not for Sakura.
She wasn't as fragile as she seemed.
Surviving the Crest Worms' corruption into adulthood, her resilience was unquestionable.
"Damien-nii?"
Soon, Sakura appeared, running to Damien and throwing herself into his arms in front of everyone.
"Sakura."
Damien gently stroked her hair, hesitating briefly before breaking the tragic news.
"My father…"
Hearing of Tokiomi's death, Sakura couldn't process it at first.
"How could this happen?"
Her voice trembled, unable to believe that her stern, imposing father was gone.
Though she harbored resentment for the father who gave her away, this Sakura wasn't the one consumed by the Crest Worms.
She still held affection for the Tohsaka family.
"What about my sister and mother? Are they okay?!"
After shock and grief came worry for Rin and Aoi.
Sakura had learned much about the Holy Grail War's dangers from Damien and Shuna.
Her father chose to participate, so he had to accept the risk of death.
Sakura hated her father's killer but wouldn't unreasonably demand Damien avenge him.
She never forgot who saved her from her torment.
"Don't worry, Sakura. They'll be fine." Damien reassured her, promising that her mother and sister would be safe from the war's harm.
"I trust you, Damien-nii." Sakura said, tears still on her cheeks.
Damien continued, "As for Kirei Kotomine, who killed your father, I'll ensure he exits this Holy Grail War."
***

chapters.title: Chapter 102: [TP] 102: Visit
chapters.content:
Having chosen to take in Sakura, avenging her was Damien's undeniable duty.
So, for his Sakura, Kirei and Gilgamesh would have to die.
"Leave it to me, Sakura."
The girl cried in Damien's arms for a long time, until exhaustion overtook her, and she fell asleep with tear-streaked cheeks.
Morning sunlight bathed the peak of Mount Enzo.
Before Ryudou Temple, the stone steps leading down were still damp with dew.
Two figures, one tall, one short, tread on the fallen leaves blown by last night's wind, ascending the steps... Rider's team, Iskandar and Waver.
"Rider…" Waver trailed timidly behind Iskandar, like a startled rabbit. "If this really is Caster's stronghold, isn't it dangerous to just barge in?"
"True enough." Iskandar replied, showing no trace of tension as he glanced at his young Master. "But didn't you say this Caster might be the legendary King Solomon?"
Separated by roughly 600 years, Iskandar was still familiar with Solomon's legend.
After all, history recorded Alexander the Great slicing through the Gordian Knot, a tale tied to Solomon's wisdom.
"It's thrilling, isn't it? Clashing with three legendary kings at once."
The other two kings Iskandar referred to were Gilgamesh and Artoria.
Some of the most renowned kings, gathered in one place.
"Are you even listening to me?" Waver pressed. "Are you seriously planning to face King Solomon alone? He's an overpowered Heroic Spirit who controls demon god pillars!"
"I told you, I'm just here to deliver an invitation."
Iskandar paused. Unbeknownst to them, they'd reached the temple's gate.
Creak…
Before they could knock, the gate swung open.
"Eek!" Waver yelped, darting behind Iskandar, trembling.
"Hm, new faces."
A burly middle-aged man with beastly ears appeared before Iskandar... Hoshiga, the Star Wolves leader.
Iskandar studied him with interest, assessing his strength.
"By my lord's command, I've been awaiting you, King of Conqueror."
Hoshiga stepped aside, inviting Iskandar into Ryudou Temple.
"Hahaha!" Iskandar laughed. "He foresaw my arrival?"
"Well then, I'll make myself at home!"
With a hearty laugh, Iskandar crossed the threshold, his boldness befitting Alexander the Great.
"Come on, kid!" He slapped Waver's back, striding forward while observing the surroundings.
Beastmen?
Hoshiga's appearance sparked many thoughts in Iskandar.
The seventy-two demon god pillars indeed included such forms, lending credence to Waver's theory.
Still, Iskandar wouldn't jump to conclusions before meeting the man himself.
Soon, under Hoshiga's guidance, they entered the temple's main hall.
There, Iskandar and Waver finally met the enigmatic Caster... the one they believed to be the King of Magecraft.
The Berserker from that night!
And the woman who fought the golden guy!
Fran and Shion, standing by Damien's side, immediately drew their attention.
Fortunately, they'd anticipated this.
Beyond surprise, they had no other reactions.
However…
Waver cautiously scanned the hall, noting the men and women dressed as warriors lining both sides.
Judging by their auras, every one was a Servant akin to Shion!
"First meeting, King of Conqueror Iskandar."
Seated at the head, Damien raised a hand, gesturing for Iskandar to sit.
"Ho! Thanks!"
Iskandar plopped down unceremoniously, and Waver, flustered, hurriedly sat beside his Servant.
Only then did they have a moment to study Damien closely.
Damien's appearance differed greatly from his pre-reincarnation self.
He had no interest in reverting.
Having started anew, he wasn't fixated on the past.
"Please, enjoy."
Shuna, accompanied by several shrine maidens, served tea and pastries before returning to Damien's side.
"Every one of them is like an elf from fantasy."
From the moment they entered, every Servant-like figure they saw, male or female, was impossibly beautiful.
It was as if they'd stepped out of a fairy tale, almost too fantastical.
"No need to be so tense." Damien said, conveying his thoughts to Iskandar. "Attacking guests upon entry? I'm not so low as to do that."
"Haha, as expected, Caster." Iskandar replied, sipping his tea before cutting to the chase. "I came here to ask you one thing."
"Speak."
"Are you a king?"
Shedding his earlier casualness, Iskandar's tone turned solemn.
"King…"
Damien surveyed the shrine maidens and his companions in the hall, smiling. "Isn't it obvious?"
Whoosh!
As his words fell, all the Kijin, wolves, and others... including Shuna and Shion... bowed, offering their heartfelt loyalty to their Demon Lord!
No words were needed; Damien's will was their direction.
"This is…"
Iskandar's pupils trembled slightly.
He could feel it... the fervent, unwavering loyalty in their gazes, the kind only the most devoted followers showed!
Without doubt, at Damien's command, they'd offer their hearts in an instant.
"Are you the legendary King Solomon?"
"Hey, kid!"
Waver's sudden outburst startled Iskandar.
But the next moment...
Killing intent!
A chilling, tangible killing intent enveloped them both.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 103 103: [TP] 103: War Invitation
chapters.content:
"Eek!"
Overwhelmed by the killing intent, Waver stumbled, falling flat on his backside.
"Ow, ow, ow…"
"I apologize for my kid's rudeness." Iskandar said.
He had a rough sense of Damien's identity.
He didn't know who Damien was exactly.
But one thing was certain: Damien was not King Solomon!
"Disappointed?" Damien asked, not directly revealing his origins but clearly denying the Solomon connection.
"Not at all!" Iskandar lowered his head, a hearty smile spreading across his face. "If anything, it doesn't matter!"
Whether Damien was Solomon or not didn't affect Iskandar's judgment.
He was a king.
That was undeniable!
Loyal familliars willing to spill blood and sacrifice their lives.
Anyone with such followers, who declared themselves a king, was a true king!
"Tonight, I plan to hold a Banquet of Kings for a Holy Grail Q&A!" Iskandar declared. "In the name of Iskandar, the King of Conqueror, I formally invite you, unknown king, to attend!"
"Very well." Damien nodded. "Since a king invites me, I won't refuse."
"And the location?"
"Oh, that…" Iskandar scratched his head, chuckling. "My kid's place is a bit too shabby for kings like you."
Holding the banquet at Ryudou Temple, someone else's stronghold, was a step too foolish even for Iskandar.
"Let's have it there!" He said. "Saber's Master! I recall her place is spacious enough for everyone!"
"And as the host, I'll provide the drinks."
This way, Artoria offered the venue, Iskandar brought the wine, and the others just needed to show up.
"Good."
Damien appreciated Iskandar's straightforward nature.
The feeling was mutual.
Unlike Gilgamesh's venomous tongue or Saber's rigidity, Damien, despite being a Heroic Spirit, seemed well-versed in the modern world.
"If only we'd met sooner!" Iskandar said. "Shame there's not enough time."
Standing, he bid Damien farewell. "I've got preparations to make. See you tonight, Damien!"
During their talk, Damien had shared his name.
As Iskandar said, he didn't care about Damien's true identity.
Here, in this Holy Grail War, Damien was a king worthy of sharing drinks and clashing with.
Historical kings belonged to the world.
Only those raising glasses together were worthy opponents!
"Just let him leave like that?"
For once, it wasn't the Ice Empress speaking.
Since Damien's last lesson, she'd matured considerably.
"It's basic guest etiquette." Damien said, glancing at the waiting Star Wolves leaders. "He and I will clash eventually, but not now."
In their conversation, Damien had already issued a war invitation to Iskandar.
And he had accepted.
No schemes, just an open clash of forces.
"We obey your will."
"We'll deliver victory in this duel of kings!"
Over thirty kilometers west of Fuyuki City's downtown, a national highway cut through a mountainous region far from human habitation.
Along this road lay a lush, verdant forest, untouched by the encroaching tide of urban development.
This area was shrouded in mystery.
At first glance, it seemed like public land, but it was privately owned by a foreign corporation whose existence was uncertain.
Digging into the land's details yielded only odd urban legends.
Rumors spoke of a 'Dream Castle' deep within the forest.
Children exploring for fun or lost hikers would find a magnificent stone castle emerging from the fog.
The castle was said to be an eerie mansion.
Though it appeared abandoned, it was pristine, spotless, unlike any uninhabited place.
No one took the rumors seriously, save for third-rate magazines filling summer occult specials.
Only a select few magi knew the castle's true existence.
It was a mystical fortress that welcomed its master every sixty years, serving as a wartime stronghold.
Protected by illusions and bounded fields, it was nearly impossible for outsiders to find, except in rare circumstances.
Those who knew its true nature called the forest Einzbern Forest.
Just a day ago, a magical conflict had erupted here.
Kayneth had stormed the Einzbern residence, clashing with Kiritsugu, only to fall to the Origin Bullet.
A day later, many of the castle's facilities remained unrepaired.
Under the silent night, the scars of battle were still jarring.
Irisviel sighed, trying to ignore the devastation as she walked through the crumbling, near-ruined corridor.
"Kiritsugu…"
As she worried for her husband's future, a deafening roar shattered the night's silence.
"Ah!"
The strain on Irisviel's Magic Circuits nearly made her collapse.
The roar came from nearby thunder.
The magical feedback accompanying it signaled that the forest's bounded field had been breached.
Not just breached... the bounded field's very structure had been obliterated.
"They're breaking through head-on?" Irisviel felt stifled. Once, twice... it was as if anyone could waltz into the Einzbern castle.
"Are you alright, Irisviel?"
A slender yet strong hand steadied her as she swayed.
Sensing the disturbance, Artoria had rushed to her side like a gust of wind.
"I'm fine, just caught off guard." Irisviel said, regaining her composure but still wary and angry at the intruder's audacity. "I didn't expect such a rude guest."
***
