chapters.title: Chapter 104: [TP] 104: Banquet
chapters.content:
"I'll go check it out. Stay close to me."
Irisviel nodded, following Saber as she moved to confront the intruder.
She knew the safest place on the battlefield was by Artoria's side.
"That thunder and unrestrained force... it's likely the King of Conqueror." Artoria said.
They hurried through the dilapidated castle, reaching a balcony overlooking the grand hall, waiting for the intruder's arrival.
"I think so too." Irisviel agreed, recalling the power of the Noble Phantasm Gordius Wheel from the warehouse district two nights ago.
The thunder-wreathed divine bull chariot.
If such an anti-army Noble Phantasm was fully unleashed, it wouldn't be surprising for it to uproot the forest's magical array.
"Hey, King of Knights!" A voice boomed. "I came all this way for you... come out already!"
As expected, the bold voice echoing through the hall was Iskandar, the King of Conqueror.
Artoria, mid-stride, transformed her suit into silver-white armor, ready for battle.
"Yo, Saber." Iskandar greeted. "Heard you built a castle, so I came to check it out."
"Tch, tch, tch." He clicked his tongue, rubbing his chin. "Kinda disappointing. This place feels a bit… rundown."
"Still!" He added. "A castle's a castle."
"You don't mind if I borrow it for a banquet, do you?"
Iskandar's shameless words left both women struggling to keep their composure.
"Rider, you…" Artoria caught the meaning behind his words.
He wasn't here to pick a fight.
"You caused all this commotion just to say that?" She snapped, glaring at him. "And stop claiming other people's things!"
"Now, now." Iskandar said, scratching the back of his head with a toothy grin. "Since I helped clear some trees from your gate, how about lending me the place?"
"Doesn't it feel like the view's much better without those trees in the yard?"
You... !
If Artoria weren't so principled and Irisviel weren't a refined lady, they might have cursed him outright for his brazen self-praise.
"What do you want?!" Artoria demanded. "Give me a good reason, or my sword won't show mercy!"
"Idiot, idiot, idiot!" Waver poked his head out from behind Iskandar. "I told you to ask first!"
"Haha, no time for that!" Iskandar ignored Waver, hoisting a wine barrel. "Relax, relax, I'm not here to fight."
"Then what?"
"Can't you tell?" Iskandar patted the barrel, grinning. "This is tonight's wine!"
"Come on, don't just stand there... lead the way. Don't you have a garden suitable for a banquet?"
"This dusty old castle is unbearable."
Each of Iskandar's words stabbed at Irisviel's heart.
Even her gentle temperament flared with the urge to take him down with her.
This guy was too much!
"Is this a trap?"
"He doesn't seem like the type to use petty tricks."
"Is he really just here to drink?"
On the way to the courtyard, Irisviel whispered to Artoria.
Thinking back, Iskandar had publicly declared he wouldn't fight Saber until her duel with Lancer was settled.
If that was a vow made on his honor as a Heroic Spirit, a surprise attack tonight made no sense.
"Could he be trying to win your favor for a sneak attack?" Irisviel wondered.
"No, Irisviel, you don't understand." Artoria said, having seen through Iskandar's intent.
She lowered her battle stance, but her expression grew more serious.
"This is a challenge issued by a king."
"I am a king, and so is he."
Artoria continued, "If he knows our identities and still wants to drink with me, this is a 'battle' without weapons."
"Haha!" Iskandar laughed, seeing Saber catch on. "Exactly!"
"If you don't want to cross blades, then raise glasses, King of Knights!"
"Tonight, I'll test your kingly mettle. Are you ready?"
"Interesting. I accept." Artoria said resolutely, her face radiating the same valor as on the battlefield.
"This…"
Irisviel realized this wasn't a jest but the start of a true contest.
The chosen venue was the castle's central garden courtyard.
Untouched by the previous night's battle, it was a decent spot to host guests without embarrassment.
"Shall we begin?" Artoria asked, sitting cross-legged opposite Iskandar in the garden's center.
"Wait, one more guest hasn't arrived."
"Another guest?"
"This Holy Grail War has more than just you and me as kings." Iskandar said.
"Could it be?!"
The word 'king' instantly brought a name to Artoria's mind, "Solomon…"
She immediately thought of Damien, whom Kiritsugu had mentioned.
Of course, she deliberately ignored a certain arrogant lamppost king.
That guy was far too haughty.
Artoria had no interest in inviting him to her home.
"I hope I'm not late."
As Artoria reeled, Damien's figure appeared in the courtyard, unnoticed until now.
"Our first meeting, huh, Ahoge King?"
Damien took a seat facing east, closely studying Artoria's heroic demeanor.
Upon his arrival, Irisviel and Artoria's gazes locked onto him, as if trying to see through him.
This is the legendary King Solomon?
Even Irisviel, a homunculus, had to admit Damien's appearance was striking.
He seemed less human and more like a god walking among mortals.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 105: [TP] 105: Extreme Oppression
chapters.content:
"You!"
Artoria was surprised by Damien's arrival.
But his 'Ahoge King' nickname irked her. "Another Heroic Spirit like Rider?" She muttered.
"Hey, since when did 'Rider' become an insult?" Iskandar protested.
"I agree." Damien said, not sparing Iskandar's feelings. "Not at all what I expected from the King of Conqueror."
"Exactly!" Artoria nodded in rare agreement.
"That's harsh." Iskandar said, looking at Damien with mock resentment. "I thought we got along, lil bro."
"Sorry, I'm not into men." Damien replied, his gaze drifting to a certain direction.
"Hahaha, you're an interesting guy!" Iskandar laughed, cracking open the wine barrel with a knuckled fist.
Instantly, the rich aroma of red wine filled the night air of the courtyard.
Being the King of Conqueror's Master must be tough, Damien thought, glancing at Waver. That huge barrel of fine wine probably cost a fortune.
He doubted Waver was the type to use magecraft for ill-gotten gains.
"Though it's shaped oddly, this is a traditional drinking vessel of this land." Iskandar said proudly, holding up a bamboo ladle.
"That's not a decanter; it's just a tea utensil." Damien corrected, familiar with its use in Japanese tea ceremonies.
"Is that so?" Iskandar shrugged. "Eh, doesn't matter. It works fine."
He scooped a ladle of wine, ready to down it.
"Use this." Damien said, handing out cups.
"Ho, thanks!"
Iskandar accepted without fuss, filling a cup and draining it in one go.
"The legend says the Holy Grail will be granted to the worthy." He said solemnly, opening the discussion.
Though rare for him to speak so seriously, it felt oddly fitting.
"This contest in Fuyuki is the ritual to determine the worthy."
"But choosing a candidate doesn't always require bloodshed."
"If Heroic Spirits can accept each other's 'mettle,' the answer will emerge naturally."
Artoria took a cup from Damien and scooped wine from the barrel.
Despite her petite frame raising doubts about her drinking ability, she matched Iskandar's boldness, downing it with equal gusto.
Iskandar grinned, pleased.
Both turned to Damien, awaiting his response.
"You're all drinking; if I don't, won't I look out of place?"
Damien had little interest in wine, but with the mood set, he joined them, downing a cup.
"So, you want to compare 'mettle' with us, Rider?" Artoria asked, keeping her eyes on Damien.
If Iskandar was a forthright overlord, Damien was like an elegant, enigmatic saint-king.
His every move lacked Gilgamesh's arrogance, exuding a refreshing ease that showcased a king's magnanimity and openness.
"Exactly. As self-proclaimed kings, we must discuss mettle." Iskandar said, his gaze shifting between Damien and Artoria. "This isn't a Holy Grail War but a Holy Grail Q&A."
"King of Knights, King of Conqueror, and… King of Magecraft. You don't mind the title, do you?" He asked Damien.
At the mention of 'King of Magecraft,' their hearts raced.
As expected!
He was the legendary King Solomon!
"No issue." Damien said, offering no explanation.
With Gilgamesh yet to arrive, he'd wait to clarify.
Repeating introductions would be beneath him.
"Who's most suited to be the Holy Grail's king?"
"A sip from the cup will make it clear." Iskandar said earnestly, then smirked mischievously, addressing someone unseen. "By the way, I recall another guy who insists he's a king."
"Enough of your jests, mongrel." A voice snapped.
A blinding golden light flashed before their eyes.
Artoria and Irisviel tensed, recognizing the voice and light.
"Archer, why are you here?" Saber asked, her expression tight.
Iskandar answered nonchalantly. "Saw him on the street, so I invited him too."
"You're so slow, Goldie."
"But unlike me, you walked here, so I can't blame you."
Clad in gleaming armor, Archer appeared, his ruby-red eyes glaring arrogantly at Iskandar.
"To choose such a cramped, stifling place for a kings' banquet... your worth is clear from that alone." Gilgamesh sneered. "I came all this way; how will you atone?"
From the moment he appeared, his gaze never left Damien.
"And you, where did you crawl out from?"
"Invited by this fool, you must be another delusional mongrel claiming kingship."
His words froze the atmosphere.
Not figuratively... a literal, deathly silence gripped everyone.
Shion, Souei, and Hoshiga, led by the Ice Empress, appeared around the garden.
They said nothing, awaiting Damien's command.
A single glance from their lord, and they'd attack Gilgamesh, making him pay for his insolence in blood.
"!!!"
The scene didn't go unnoticed.
All four radiated terrifying strength.
Shion's power was already known.
She'd withstood a barrage of over a hundred Noble Phantasms unscathed.
The other three's auras were no less formidable.
The Ice Empress, in particular, exuded a chilling magical force, as if she could freeze the entire castle.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 106: [TP] 106: Mine
chapters.content:
"…"
Even Gilgamesh felt immense pressure at that moment.
He was formidable, no doubt.
His countless Noble Phantasms included anti-army, anti-fortress, and even anti-world divine construct.
Yet, Gilgamesh had a fatal weakness.
As an Archer, he wasn't adept at close combat.
With the strength of the four... Shion, Souei, Hoshiga, and the Ice Empress... they could deliver a lethal blow before he could react.
"Stand down." Damien commanded.
He hadn't forgotten Gilgamesh's insolence.
But responding to verbal jabs with blades would be petty.
"Ignorance is fearless." Damien said. "I forgive your offense this time."
"But…" His gaze turned icy. "There won't be a next time, Gilgamesh."
"Gilgamesh?"
"He said Gilgamesh?"
"The ancient king of Babylon?"
"No wonder!"
"No wonder he has so many Noble Phantasms!"
Damien's revelation of Gilgamesh's identity caused his brows to twitch, while the onlookers, including Artoria and Iskandar, felt their hearts race.
"Hmph."
Gilgamesh crossed his arms, refraining from further taunts.
Damien's strength had exceeded his expectations.
Moreover, if Damien truly was Solomon, Gilgamesh couldn't easily mock him.
Not because of Damien's power or the threat of Shion and the others.
But because the man before him had achieved the feat of dominating gods and daemons!
What did Gilgamesh despise most?
Undoubtedly, those lofty, self-righteous gods who toyed with mortals.
Compared to himself, a mere pawn, this man could bend demon god pillars to his will.
That alone, king or not, earned Gilgamesh's respect.
Divinity…
When Shion, the Ice Empress, and the others appeared, Gilgamesh had sensed it.
Each of them carried divinity.
This meant they were, if not gods, at least demigods, angels, or divine beasts.
"Alright, alright, the banquet's just started. No need to make it so tense!" Iskandar laughed, easing the strained atmosphere.
Waver and Irisviel, previously paralyzed by the killing intent, exhaled in relief.
Still, they worried Gilgamesh might refuse to join.
Artoria was ready to shield Irisviel if Gilgamesh lashed out.
Yet, events unfolded unexpectedly.
Gilgamesh took the ladle without hesitation, sniffed the wine, and ignored the cup Iskandar offered.
The scene reminded Irisviel of Artoria's earlier words, calling this banquet a 'challenge.'
The most ancient king, facing fellow kings, had no choice but to accept Iskandar's test of heroic mettle.
"This is low-grade swill." Gilgamesh sneered, scorning the wine. "You think this can measure a hero's worth?"
"Is that so?" Iskandar countered. "Among the wines from the local market, this is top-tier."
"You think that because you don't know true wine, lowly mongrel."
"If you say so, you must have something better." Damien challenged. "Don't show it, and I'll assume you're bluffing."
"Hmph!"
Gilgamesh disliked Damien's tone but, unusually, held back his venom.
As he'd reasoned, a man who commanded gods and daemons stood on his level.
Hum…
The space beside Gilgamesh twisted and swirled.
Waver and Irisviel, recognizing the prelude to his Noble Phantasm barrage, felt a chill and prepared to flee.
But what emerged wasn't a weapon... it was a set of ornate, gem-encrusted wine vessels.
"Watch and learn." Gilgamesh declared. "This is a king's vintage!"
From a heavy golden flask poured a clear, colorless liquid. Four golden goblets were tossed to Iskandar, who filled them and passed them to Damien and Artoria.
Damien glanced at his ordinary cup but didn't refuse.
Why reject something superior?
"Wow, this is amazing!" Iskandar exclaimed, eyes wide after a sip.
Damien didn't hesitate either, curious about the wine Gilgamesh offered in the Fourth War.
"Hm?"
The moment it touched his throat, a wave of euphoria struck him.
"Delicious."
Damien wasn't fond of wine.
But this flavor was unlike anything he'd imagined... a supreme taste.
Bold yet refreshing, rich yet exhilarating.
The intense sensory pleasure overwhelmed his sense of smell, even dulling his sight and touch.
"Absolutely incredible!" Iskandar roared. "This wine couldn't be man-made... is it from the Age of Gods?"
Gilgamesh smirked, pleased by the praise.
"Of course."
"Be it wine or swords, my treasury holds only the finest treasures."
"That alone determines a king's worth, doesn't it?"
At some point, he'd sat cross-legged at the head, gently swirling his goblet.
"Is that so?" Damien said, savoring the wine with a teasing tone. "Then tell me, which falls first: a land rich with fields and grain but lacking an army to protect it, or a neighboring nation with a vast military?"
"You…" Gilgamesh's eye twitched.
He understood Damien's implication.
Gilgamesh had presented his wine, proving his kingly worth through wealth.
But Damien's retort was clear.
Wealth without the might to defend it made a king a lamb awaiting slaughter, ripe for plunder by the strong.
In such times, even the weak would take a bite, devouring it piece by piece.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 107: [TP] 107: Left Out
chapters.content:
"If you desire this king's treasures, be prepared to be blasted to pieces!"
"Blasted? You mean those exploding treasures of yours?"
"You fellow..."
Damien coveted Gilgamesh's Noble Phantasms greatly, but he didn't need to resort to theft. With his analysis complete, he could acquire anything.
"Alright, alright, let's calm down for now."
Iskandar smiled wryly as he prevented Gilgamesh from retorting further.
"Archer, your finest wine is indeed suitable to be held in the most precious goblet. But unfortunately, the Holy Grail is not a goblet."
"This is a Holy Grail Q&A to test who is most qualified to obtain the Holy Grail. First, let's hear what great wish you have placed upon the Holy Grail; otherwise, we can't proceed."
"So, the most ancient King of Heroes, Gilgamesh."
"Why do you want to obtain the Holy Grail?"
Heroic Spirits are not supposed to have desires, but since they have been summoned, they must have a pursuit for the Holy Grail.
"Stop giving orders, mongrel."
"Moreover, the premise of 'fighting for the Holy Grail' is already against reason. To tell the truth, it originally belongs to me. Tracing back to the origin, there is nothing in the world that does not come from my treasury. Although a long time has passed, and some things may have been lost, those treasures still belong to me."
This answer made everyone curious. Even Artoria began to ask if the Holy Grail truly has the power to grant wishes.
"Do not judge by the standards of mongrels."
"The total number of treasures this king possesses has long exceeded what this king knows, but as long as an item is a 'treasure,' it is certain that it belongs to this king's property."
"Is that so?"
Iskandar understood, "A treasury that symbolizes the prototype of all treasures, that is the true nature of your Noble Phantasm. Truly worthy of the legendary King of Heroes. Taking back what originally belongs to you, this reason is perfectly legitimate."
Damien didn't target Gilgamesh anymore, and his response somewhat surprised Gilgamesh.
"Since that's the case, you don't really need to take it too seriously, right?"
"It's just a cup; for you, it shouldn't be a big deal, right?"
"Nonsense!"
"This king has no reason to bestow treasures upon mongrels like you."
"Eh~~"
"Is the legendary King of Heroes such a miser?"
"Stupid, those who should receive this king's grace are only this king's subjects and people."
"So, Rider, if you submit to this king, I can reward you with one or two cups anytime."
Obviously, that was impossible.
Gilgamesh's reason was simple: what is mine is mine, and if I don't give it to you, you can't take it!
He didn't care about the outcome of the Holy Grail War or the Grail itself. What angered Gilgamesh was that someone dared to challenge his authority and the laws he had set.
"In that case, next, we can only meet with swords."
In tonight's King's Q&A, Iskandar has received his answer from "My way is to seize what I want by force, because I am Iskandar, the King of Conqueror."
"Then there's nothing more to say. You break the law, and this king will punish you. There's no room for argument."
The two could not reconcile because true kings always adhere to their own principles.
But that didn't mean Gilgamesh disliked Iskandar. On the contrary, they felt each other's reasons and spirit as kings.
At least in their identity as kings, there was no distinction of superiority or inferiority.
In the following Q&A, Iskandar also stated his reason for wanting the Holy Grail.
He wanted to obtain a physical body and then start anew to continue his journey of world conquest.
"Truly someone who sticks to his beliefs to the end, King of Conqueror."
Damien quite liked people like Iskandar, who always stayed true to their hearts, whether in life or death.
"Ah."
Gilgamesh rarely agreed with Damien's comment, "A boring life always needs one or two spices. I await your challenge, King of Conqueror!"
"What a joke!!"
Artoria had been frowning, silently watching the three gradually build a relationship that was unclear whether it was hostile or friendly.
From the beginning until now, the girl couldn't find any opportunity to join the discussion.
Because she believed that the opinions expressed by these two Heroic Spirits were far from her ideals as the King of Knights and had nothing to do with her.
"It's completely selfish!"
"That's not the right path for a king to follow."
Artoria's words finally broke the isolation.
"Oh?"
Iskandar asked, "Then, let us hear your esteemed opinion, King of Knights."
What happened next was already known to Damien.
Artoria expressed her lofty ideal that she had been pursuing, like a vow, "My wish is to save my homeland! I want to use the power of the omnipotent wish-granting device to change the fate of Britain's destruction!"
"...."
Silence, deafening.
Although Artoria's statement was indeed powerful.
But whether it was Damien or the other two, they were not simple opponents who would be intimidated by a single sentence.
Moreover, what she said shouldn't be strange enough to shock people, and the content wasn't too profound to understand.
In Artoria's view, her wish was noble, sacred, and just.
But whether it was words of praise or voices of opposition, there should be some reaction immediately.
Yet, why was the scene silent?
"Sigh..."
Without waiting for Iskandar to leave Artoria speechless as in the original story, Damien spoke first, "By changing fate, do you mean you want to overturn past history?"
"Yes, even if it's a wish that cannot be realized by miracles, but if the Holy Grail is truly omnipotent, it must be able to..."
"Pfft!"
"Hahaha~~"
However, before Artoria could finish her words, she was met with Gilgamesh's heartfelt laughter.
"What's so funny, King of Heroes!"
Artoria felt extremely angry.
Saving Great Britain was the most important thing buried deep in her soul, not allowing anyone to desecrate or trample on it.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 108: [TP] 108: Defenses
chapters.content:
"Calling yourself a king, revered by the masses as a king."
"And yet, you feel regret?"
"Ha! How could anyone not laugh at this? Truly remarkable, Saber! You are the most amusing fool!"
"..."
"Why are you laughing?"
Artoria could no longer endure Gilgamesh's humiliation. "My nation, which I devoted my heart and soul to protecting as a king, fell to ruin. What's so funny about my mourning that?"
"No."
Listening to Artoria's words, Damien shook his head. "Your thinking is somewhat presumptuous."
"What?"
"Saber..."
Damien did not mock Artoria's ideals as Gilgamesh had.
On the contrary, Damien inwardly hoped that a leader would be a wise and virtuous ruler.
But such a thing was destined to be impossible.
"I want to ask you a question."
"You want to use the Holy Grail to save your nation. Then what?"
"What?"
Artoria was stunned, not quite understanding what he meant.
"Is it hard to understand?"
"I want to know, assuming you actually obtain the Holy Grail and have the chance to fulfill your wish, what exactly would you do?"
"Would you simply say to the Holy Grail, 'Please save my nation'?"
"I..."
Artoria was stumped by Damien's question. She hadn't truly considered how to use the wish to achieve the miracle of salvation.
This showed that the title of "King of Knights" for Artoria was indeed fitting.
The girl was not just a little naive.
Despite being so fixated on the Holy Grail War, she hadn't even thought through her wish.
Gilgamesh had no wish.
He participated in the war because every Heroic Spirit vying for the Holy Grail was a challenger coveting his treasures.
Killing and punishing them all was, to Gilgamesh, only natural.
Iskandar wanted to continue conquering battlefields, needing a physical body to live freely in a new world and era.
Artoria had a wish, but did she really know how to use the Holy Grail to achieve her goal?
"You can think about this question slowly."
"Now, let's assume your wish comes true, and your nation is saved."
"Then what?"
Once again, "then what." And once again, Artoria looked utterly bewildered.
What then?
Then what?
"I mean, if the nation is back on track, what about you?"
"I..."
Goodness, Damien's question caught Artoria completely off guard.
To be honest, Artoria had never thought that far.
And according to Damien, if the nation was saved, what use would she, as a king, have?
"If the nation no longer needs me, where should I go?"
That was the question.
When Artoria was alive, to become the King of Knights that everyone admired, she lived like a saint, selfless and diligent.
So, Artoria had never considered what she would do if she were no longer a king.
To be honest, having lived her entire life for others, did she even have a dream of her own?
"If the Holy Grail saves your nation, what about you?"
"Would you continue being the King of Knights of Great Britain, waiting for the nation to fall again under your rule?"
"What?! You..."
Artoria was startled.
At the same time, she realized something.
The Holy Grail saving her nation didn't mean everything was over.
History had already proven that she was not suited to be the King of Knights... at least, Artoria herself believed so.
Britain fell under her rule.
Even if the Holy Grail saved it once, what about the next time?
"When the nation falls again, will you seek the Holy Grail once more, repeating the cycle?"
"What difference is there between such a nation and a puppet of the Holy Grail?"
Damien pointed at Iskandar. "You mocked Iskandar for pursuing the Holy Grail out of personal desire."
"But at least he knows that conquest brought by a mere cup is meaningless!"
"The same applies to your nation."
"If the nation's survival depends not on the collective efforts of its people but on wishing upon a cup, what meaning does it have?"
"..."
Damien's words were calm, but Artoria felt a chill in her heart.
Indeed, a salvation brought by wishing upon the Holy Grail... wasn't it the same as Iskandar's wish for "world conquest"?
"If that's the case!"
Artoria steadied herself and retorted, "Then choose a different king!"
Being a king meant nothing to Artoria.
As long as she could save her people and her nation, what did it matter if she wasn't king, or if she never drew the Sword in the Stone?
"Choose a different king, huh..."
"That's a possible method."
"But..."
"Saber, don't you think your wish is a bit too cruel?"
"What?"
Artoria didn't understand what Damien meant.
Why call her cruel?
"Isn't it cruel?"
"You made a wish for Great Britain to select a king greater than you."
"Here's the question: why would you impose something even you couldn't achieve on someone else?"
"By your logic, a king should be noble, just, kind, tolerant, and benevolent, like a perfect saint."
Damien looked at Gilgamesh and Iskandar, both shaking their heads, and said gravely, "If such a person truly exists, fine."
"But if this is imposed on someone because of your wish..."
"Isn't that cruel?"
"You, Artoria Pendragon, for your own selfish desire, would turn another person into a soulless husk called a 'holy king'!"
"They could have enjoyed fine wine and food, had a fulfilling family life."
"But because of your wish, you'd strip them of their happiness and life!"
"I... I didn't mean that!"
Artoria was shaken by Damien's words. She understood the principle of not imposing on others what she wouldn't want for herself.
And given her character, she could never do such a thing.
She only thought she wasn't a qualified king and wanted someone better to take her place.
"But what if the new king is like the King of Heroes or the King of Conqueror?"
"What if the new king, whom you despise and cannot understand, is the one who can save Great Britain? What then?"
"That kind of thing..."
The very kings she had rejected, even called "tyrants." clashed violently with her understanding of what a king should be.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 109: [TP] 109: The Demon King from Another World
chapters.content:
"It shouldn't be like this."
"A king, a king should lead by example, be a model for all..."
"Then, Saber, do you really think anyone would want to be that kind of king?"
In Damien's view, Artoria's so-called King of Knights was not a king at all but a slave to the title of king.
In contrast, Iskandar's domineering ways inspired countless followers.
His followers were not mindless husks but dream-driven heroes, each aspiring to be a king.
Perhaps this would lead to greater chaos.
But for the human race, Iskandar had indeed planted the seed of ambition to expand and conquer in their very genes.
"The King of Knights does not understand the human heart!"
"!!!"
Damien's final words were like a sharp blade piercing Artoria's heart, causing her such pain that she could hardly breathe.
Simply wishing to save her nation was wrong.
Wishing for a greater king to replace her was her own presumption.
So, what should she do?
Besides fighting for the Holy Grail, besides using the omnipotent wish-granting device, she had no other options.
"And you were wrong from the very beginning."
"As a king, the last thing you should do is deny your own life."
"Even if the nation fell, that was the choice you and your Knights of the Round Table made together!"
"But if the cost is the nation's destruction, shouldn't such a mistake be corrected?"
"A mistake only needs to be remembered!"
"And in this world, where is there a perfect, flawless dynasty that lasts forever?"
"Are you obsessed with Britain's destruction, or with the fact that Britain fell under your rule?"
"If it's the former, let me tell you, even without your nation, these British Isles will still exist in this world."
For a nation to be eternal, two conditions are essential.
First, an immortal king.
Second, a king who remains wise and true to their original ideals forever.
Damien was determined to build his Monster Kingdom.
He, too, hoped for his Monster Kingdom to be eternal.
And Damien had the potential to achieve this, as he truly could be immortal.
As for staying true to his ideals...
If one day Damien grew weary, he would not care about the fall of his Monster Kingdom.
"You cannot live forever, Saber."
"Even if your nation doesn't fall under your rule, it will eventually decline under your descendants."
"So, what you call 'changing' is not salvation but merely prolonging life!"
"..."
This left Saber utterly speechless.
She felt that no matter what she said, Damien could reduce her to silence.
Perhaps, as Damien said, the King of Knights did not understand the human heart.
"Very sharp, young man."
Iskandar had intended to speak, but he felt Damien's words cut even deeper to Artoria's core.
"So, what about you, young man?"
Savoring his wine, Iskandar noticed the tension between the two easing slightly and said, "Won't you introduce yourself, unknown king?"
Hearing Iskandar's words, Artoria, who had been silently retreating into herself, immediately looked up.
She admitted her wish was neither holy nor noble.
On the contrary, it was shameful and selfish.
But even so, Artoria would still fight for the Holy Grail, if only to extend her nation's life by a single second.
She wanted her remembered comrades and people to live happily and joyfully.
"I won't pass my troubles onto others."
"At least, give me a chance to make amends..."
To go back to the past and start anew.
This time, no matter the outcome, Artoria would accept it.
Even if the nation still fell, she would be at peace.
At least she would have tried her best, wouldn't she?
"So that's how it is..."
At that moment, Artoria finally understood the meaning behind Damien's words that struck at her core.
He wasn't truly mocking her wish.
Instead, he was using this method to tell her that if even the direction she was heading in was wrong, was there any point in continuing?
"It's time I told you about my origins."
Damien noticed the change in Artoria's eyes.
"My name is Damien, neither the King Solomon you might think of nor any king you know!"
Damien's opening statement was a bombshell to the group. "I come from another world, a Demon King who rules over all Monsters!"
"Demon... King..."
Damien's identity and origins were beyond anyone's imagination.
Though the summoning of Hero heroic Spirits by the Holy Grail was already miraculous enough.
Even Irisviel and Waver had heard that the Holy Grail could summon Heroic Spirits from the future.
But another world?
That was just too bizarre, wasn't it?
"A king from another world?"
Iskandar rubbed his chin. "No matter what, as long as you're a king, that's fine by me."
"Another world, how interesting!"
Gilgamesh, too, acknowledged Damien's identity as a king.
"I don't need your acknowledgment."
"Unlike you, with your one or two treasuries or ruling over a mere region..."
"What I possess is a gift box called a 'world'!"
Damien's words stunned the group, even Gilgamesh and Iskandar, who he had mocked, showed expressions of disbelief.
"This world!"
"The very planet you stand on, the entire space-time and universe it resides in!"
"To me, they are all treasure chests waiting to be opened."
"Traveling through countless worlds, conquering, plundering, dominating, ruling!"
Damien clenched his fist tightly, revealing his ambitions and desires to everyone. "An unyielding Creator? High and mighty gods? Even the will of the world that created the universe."
"Everything that stands in my way, no matter what it is, will ultimately bow before me!"
"You!!!"
Artoria was completely shaken.
After all this talk, wasn't this guy even more extreme than Gilgamesh and Iskandar?
No, this guy was practically a combination of the two!
World conquest was no longer just a figure of speech.
If he truly treated worlds as territories, claiming them as his own...
And who knew how many worlds Damien had conquered before arriving in this one?
This was far more substantial than Gilgamesh's Gate of Babylon.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 110: [TP] 110: Declare
chapters.content:
"Also, I am not a Caster."
"Huh?"
Damien's words stunned the group.
Especially the Saber team.
Their guesses were wrong... not only about Solomon's true name but even his class.
"No way!"
But the next moment, Waver spoke up, questioning, "If you're not a Caster, then who are you?"
So far, the classes of Saber, Rider, Archer, Lancer, and Assassin were clearly accounted for.
If Damien wasn't a Caster, the only remaining class would be Berserker.
"That woman who appeared that night, wielding a giant hammer... she's the Berserker, isn't she?"
Waver had observed Fran's attributes, and her Berserker class was unmistakably clear, impossible to fake.
If Damien wasn't a Caster, then the Caster must be someone else.
And that meant...
"This Holy Grail War has an eighth Heroic Spirit!"
Waver's revelation shocked everyone, and they quickly realized he was right.
"Exactly."
Damien nodded, confirming Waver's deduction. "In this Holy Grail War, I have descended as a Voyager."
"Voyager, the traveler?"
In fact, beyond "traveler," the term could also be understood as "adventurer."
In the Nasuverse worldview, adventurers often refer to Servants associated with the Lovecraftian.
Damien had no connection to Lovecraftian.
But his nature wasn't much different from that Outer Gods.
"The Caster is already dead, killed by me."
Damien didn't hide this, openly revealing the information about Ryunosuke Uryuu and Caster to the group.
Hearing that the Caster team was a pair of murderous maniacs, Irisviel and Waver breathed a sigh of relief.
The early elimination of such rule-breaking threats, who could endanger ordinary people, was a great relief.
"No one made a move?"
After his introduction, Damien scanned the surroundings but detected no trace of Assassin.
In the original plot, during this Banquet of Kings, the Assassin, Hundred-Faced Hassan, would have attempted to ambush Iskandar.
Without Damien, Iskandar would have been the most prominent Heroic Spirit.
To gather more information, Tokiomi would have sent Kirei Kotomine to test Iskandar.
And the result, of course, was a success.
Iskandar revealed his Reality Marble, the Ionioi Hetairoi, with over 30,000 Heroic Spirit soldiers, which had left Damien quite shocked at the time.
"It seems Tokiomi's death has altered the plot."
With Tokiomi dead, Kirei Kotomine was now completely under Gilgamesh's thumb.
Despite Gilgamesh's arrogant demeanor, his understanding of human hearts was undoubtedly top-tier among Heroic Spirits.
And given Gilgamesh's personality, he would never allow a group of "filthy bugs" To tarnish this banquet of kings.
"Though Hundred-Faced Hassan's strength isn't great, if used well, they could still provide significant support."
Damien had initially thought that, given Kirei Kotomine's magical capacity, he wouldn't be able to sustain both Gilgamesh and Hundred-Faced Hassan.
But now, it seemed he had overlooked some details.
"The Command Seals preserved by the Church?"
Damien recalled the arm full of Command Seals from the original story.
With Command Seals as a mana source, it wouldn't be surprising for Kirei Kotomine to keep Hundred-Faced Hassan.
Even if split into dozens, they could be sent out one by one for intelligence gathering, far more efficient than deploying them all at once.
"King of Conqueror."
Damien sat back down. "Does our previous agreement still stand?"
Agreement?
What agreement?
The others were puzzled, and even Waver was confused.
He didn't recall Iskandar making any agreement with Damien.
"Ah."
"Of course."
Iskandar swirled the fine wine in his golden goblet. "The King's Q&A is over. Apart from that Saber girl, you two are undoubtedly kings with sufficient caliber."
"Hey! Rider!"
"What's that supposed to mean?"
Artoria, repeatedly belittled, was itching to draw her sword and cut down the three infuriating figures before her.
"Calm down, Saber."
"If, after hearing what I say next, you still want to fight us, I don't mind kicking you out of the game first."
"You..."
Ignoring Artoria's darkened expression, Damien continued, "Here and now, King of Conqueror, in the name of the Demon King, I formally declare war on you!"
"Declare war?!"
Waver's heart nearly skipped a beat at Damien's words.
"This is a clash between kings."
"Gilgamesh, Artoria."
"I also invite you to witness my duel with the King of Conqueror!"
Yes, Damien's primary target was Iskandar.
Noble Phantasms were, at best, a means to grant Damien greater power.
But powerful methods? Damien had no shortage of those.
What he truly needed was a way to bypass the familiar contract and bring people back to his Cardinal World!
Through his recent research on Time Alter, Violet had given him good news.
A Reality Marble did indeed have the potential to transport others.
"And the prerequisite for all this is awakening my own Reality Marble!"
Damien was highly confident in awakening his own Reality Marble.
"You're planning to go that far?"
Iskandar's expression grew serious. Truthfully, he had no reason to refuse.
In fact, Iskandar was thrilled, so thrilled he wanted to laugh.
"A war between kings... it's been a while."
And if Iskandar's guess was correct, Damien likely possessed abilities similar to his own.
His Ionioi Hetairoi and Damien's army of Majins.
"Hahaha!"
Iskandar let out a hearty laugh. "Fine! I accept your challenge!"
As his words fell, Iskandar shot a glance at Gilgamesh, his look practically saying, "See that, Goldie? He chose to challenge me first, not you!"
"Tch!"
Gilgamesh glared at Damien, irritated. This damned guy dared to humiliate him to this extent!
"I'm starting to really want to crush you..."
"And your answer, Gilgamesh?"
Damien's invitation was, in a sense, a call for the two to take a stance.
Would they refrain from interfering in this war and stand by as spectators, waiting for one side to fall?
***

chapters.title: Chapter 111 111: [TP] 111: Fair Fight
chapters.content:
"Hmph!"
Gilgamesh didn't need to think twice. He raised his head arrogantly. "Only the strongest are worthy of challenging this king."
Moreover, with such a prime opportunity to gather intelligence on both Damien and Iskandar, he had no objection to watching them fight to the death, allowing him to reap the benefits.
Of course, he couldn't say that outright.
He was, after all, the noble King of Heroes.
Even if he were to accept a challenger, it would have to be the one standing at the end.
"And you, Saber?"
"I..."
Artoria understood the meaning behind Damien's earlier words.
Indeed, after hearing his declaration of war, she had no reason to intervene, no matter her motives.
If she were to take advantage of one side's weakness to launch a sneak attack, the chivalry of King Arthur would surely weep.
Artoria only hoped that Kiritsugu wouldn't act so shamelessly.
Otherwise, even she would despise herself.
"I swear on the honor of the King of Knights that I will not stoop to such despicable acts!"
Artoria was a staunch believer in knightly duels, and she naturally supported Damien and Iskandar's decision to face off.
If Kiritsugu stirred trouble, Artoria would not hesitate to turn her sword on him!
Thanks to Damien's guidance, the King of Knights had grown somewhat.
Understanding her true heart was the key to achieving miracles.
She was now prepared to resist Kiritsugu's Command Seals with her own will.
"The time and place are up to you. How about it?"
Damien gestured to Iskandar, giving him the respect of making the decision.
"As long as it's not on your turf, anywhere is fine."
Iskandar wasn't foolish enough to give up his advantage just for pride.
Even if Damien wasn't a magus, Iskandar had seen his ability to set up a territory... an impregnable fortress.
Only a fool would fight Damien at Ryudou Temple.
"But..."
"It'd be best to find a place with few people."
"How about that big bridge?"
Iskandar thought for a moment. "Let's set it for tomorrow night. Then, let me witness the power of the Demon King from another world."
"You won't be disappointed, King of Conqueror!"
But Damien's declaration of war wasn't over yet.
"And next..."
"Gilgamesh."
Damien turned his focus to the King of Heroes. "If I defeat the King of Conqueror, you're next."
"Oh?"
"Such arrogance, Demon King from another world."
Gilgamesh flashed a menacing grin. "If this sideshow fails to entertain me, do you understand the consequences?"
"I suggest you focus on watching my fight with the King of Conqueror tomorrow."
"Tch!"
Gilgamesh wasn't just provoked by Damien's challenge. "Even for this king, you're the first madman I've met like this!"
Damien invited everyone to observe the battle.
What did this mean?
Intelligence was crucial for Heroic Spirits.
By allowing Gilgamesh and Artoria to closely watch his fight with Iskandar, Damien was essentially giving them a chance to learn about him.
"Because that's only fair, isn't it?"
"I know your histories and legends, but you know nothing about me."
Of course, Damien wouldn't reveal his true trump cards to Gilgamesh without reason.
Dealing with Iskandar didn't require his ultimate weapons.
Those powerful familiars were reserved for Gilgamesh.
Thus, this observation was itself a strategy to mislead Gilgamesh about his true strength.
As for Artoria...
Honestly, Damien had never taken the King of Knights seriously from the start.
To deal with her, he didn't even need force.
Simply revealing the truth about the Holy Grail or waiting until more than half the Heroic Spirits were dead... when Irisviel would be overwhelmed by the Greater Grail's mana... would be enough to break the girl.
The Banquet of Kings came to an end.
On the way back, Waver rode atop the Gordius Wheel, looking at the silent Iskandar with a hint of unease.
"Rider?"
"Are you really going to fight tomorrow night?"
"What are you trying to say, kid?"
"I mean, this is the Holy Grail War."
"Since it's the Holy Grail War, there's no need to follow any rules."
Because Iskandar hadn't revealed his Reality Marble, Waver was unaware of his Servant's true strength.
In his eyes, Damien was simply too powerful.
Among the four Servants at the banquet, Waver felt Iskandar couldn't beat any of them.
Smack!
"Ow, that hurts!"
Clutching his forehead, Waver lunged at Iskandar in anger, only to be held back by a single hand on his head, unable to move. "What are you doing, Rider?! I'm worried about you, you jerk!!"
The atmosphere gradually fell silent again.
Iskandar didn't immediately explain.
The red-haired giant drove the thunderous chariot through the deserted night.
"That guy is strong, completely different from any opponent I've faced before."
Iskandar was quiet for a moment before smiling. "It's great to be part of the Holy Grail War."
"What?"
Waver was utterly confused by Iskandar's sudden shift. "What are you even talking about?"
In life, Iskandar led his army from Macedon, conquering every nation in his path without lingering over the territories.
He pressed eastward, driven by the desire to reach the "end of the world" And see the legendary "Ocean at the World's End."
Sadly, Iskandar never fulfilled that dream.
He collapsed from exhaustion before reaching it.
Not long after, the historical King of Conqueror, Alexander the Great, passed away.
"I never saw the Ocean at the World's End, nor reached the world's boundary."
Iskandar shed his usual carefree demeanor, now resembling a true king.
Damien's image appeared in his mind.
Sailing across endless seas, landing on islands called worlds, witnessing, conquering, leading, and then moving forward without attachment until the true end.
"..."
"If you can obtain the Holy Grail, you can surely fulfill your wish."
Waver had no wishes of his own, so he could let Iskandar use the wish to gain a physical body. "You said it, right? You want to continue your conquest."
***

chapters.title: Chapter 112: [TP] 112: Nah, I'd Win!
chapters.content:
"You, kid..."
Iskandar shook his head, knowing Waver hadn't grasped his true intentions.
He wasn't lamenting.
A true king never regrets.
Or rather, if he had reached the world's end before his death, Iskandar would have been left with endless regret.
Because that would mean his journey had reached its end.
Not because he didn't want to go forward, but because he couldn't.
For a conqueror, an explorer, a life without further adventure is dull.
Reaching the world's end, returning home, and watching himself grow old... such an ending was the sorrow Iskandar could not accept.
A great man should die on the battlefield, not in a bed!
The moment Damien declared war on him, Iskandar knew he had met a kindred spirit.
One conqueror had encountered another.
Regardless of victory or defeat, their adventure would reach a fulfilling conclusion.
The loser would become a trophy of the victor.
And the victor would carry the loser's ambitions, witnessing broader horizons.
"Rider?"
"Hm?"
"Will you win?"
Waver vaguely understood Iskandar, grasping the true desire behind his summoning as a Heroic Spirit.
"Nah."
Iskandar flicked the reins, charging forward with thundering might. "I'd win!"
Leaving the confident Iskandar aside, Damien had returned to Ryudou Temple.
He first checked on Sakura's condition and, learning from Shuna that the girl was recovering well, felt reassured.
"Lord Damien."
In the Cardinal World, within the village, Damien withdrew his consciousness from the Heroic Spirit.
He gathered the participating goblins, wolves, and kijin, selecting the pre-positioned team leaders to discuss tomorrow's war.
"This war will be led by Violet as the overall commander."
"Snow Empress, Ogerpon."
Damien instructed, "You two may participate, but don't display excessive strength."
"Bo-ne!"
"I know my limits."
The two women were Damien's strongest trump cards, too valuable to use against Iskandar.
In terms of combat power, Snow Empress alone could, like Gilgamesh in the anime, shatter Iskandar's Reality Marble with a single world-breaking Noble Phantasm.
But such an act would be meaningless to Damien.
He sought not just victory but to analyze Iskandar's Ionioi Hetairoi as thoroughly as possible.
That was why he had assembled a massive army of Majins.
This battle was critical.
"This battle is of utmost importance."
Damien said, "I expect you to deliver a performance that truly shines."
His words ignited a surge of passion among the Majins.
They weren't here to make up numbers.
They were vital forces!
"We will do our utmost to create analysis opportunities for Lady Violet!"
Seeing their determined expressions, Damien was satisfied. "Then it's up to you. Let the Heroic Spirits of this world feel the power of our Majins."
Time passed quickly, from sunrise to sunset, and soon it was the next night.
The crimson steel bridge spanned the riverbanks.
Under the lights, Artoria, who arrived early, and Irisviel, disguised as her Master, watched Damien, who was meditating with closed eyes, with tension.
"Lancer!"
"Please don't worry, Master."
The battle was known not only to Saber and Gilgamesh but also to Lancer.
"You came too, Lancer."
"Ah, I hope my uninvited presence isn't rude."
"But such a grand event... I couldn't resist coming to witness it myself."
"May I have the honor of observing?"
"You may."
Damien opened his eyes, casually granting Diarmuid's request.
"Thank you."
Diarmuid nodded slightly, then stood beside Artoria.
This scene made Sola-Ui, Diarmuid's new Master and Kayneth's fiancée, feel a pang of jealousy.
Enchanted by Diarmuid's charm curse, she felt a sense of crisis toward any woman near her Servant.
The reason Sola-Ui wasn't left at the hotel was simple.
No place was safer than by Diarmuid's side.
Rather than hiding her somewhere, it was better to keep her close.
Having made one mistake before, Diarmuid wouldn't make it again!
"Lancer..."
"Sorry."
Diarmuid was helpless; this was the curse that plagued him.
He truly had no intention of pursuing his lord's woman.
Tap! Tap! Tap!
Suddenly, approaching footsteps interrupted their conversation.
They turned to see Gilgamesh, clad in golden armor, striding slowly toward them.
"What?"
"He hasn't shown up yet?"
"Tch!"
Gilgamesh grumbled, "Making this king wait... such a crime deserves death!"
"He's here."
Soon, Iskandar descended from the sky on his Gordius Wheel, like a bolt of lightning crashing onto the bridge.
"You're already here?"
"I was delayed slightly by some matters."
"No matter."
Damien looked up, meeting the eyes of Iskandar and a noticeably changed Waver.
Clearly, they had undergone some personal journey of their own.
"So, have you said all your last words?"
"If not, I don't mind giving you more time to settle your affairs."
"Pretty sharp, aren't you?"
"You're actually upset, aren't you?"
"Come on, don't be so petty. Even kings have their inconvenient moments."
Iskandar's goofy demeanor was, in truth, a tactic to provoke Damien's emotions.
Unfortunately, he miscalculated.
Not to mention Damien had Violet's support.
Even on his own, he wouldn't lose his temper over something so trivial, unlike Gilgamesh.
"Enough, King of Conqueror."
Damien said calmly, "Let's begin our war."
"..."
Seeing his little trick noticed, Iskandar dropped the act.
"Phew~~~"
Suddenly, those standing on the bridge felt a whirlwind rushing toward them.
It was a scorching, dry gust of heat.
Gradually, whether it was an illusion or not, they seemed to hear the roaring wind sweeping through a blazing desert.
"Hm?"
Waver felt gritty sand on his tongue and spat a few times.
"Sand?"
"Why?"
Diarmuid, puzzled, instinctively shielded his Master, as did Artoria.
The strange wind carried hot sand that shouldn't exist here.
All eyes turned to Iskandar.
The mana emanating from him was surging.
Clearly, this phenomenon was his doing.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 113: [TP] 113: Ionioi Hetairoi
chapters.content:
"And so, here!"
"Saber, Archer, and Lancer!"
"What does it mean to be a king? To stand alone in grandeur?"
Iskandar stood at the center of the swirling hot winds, his crimson cloak billowing on his shoulders.
"Grandeur..."
Before, Artoria would have said that a king must be solitary.
Only one who stands apart from the world can become a king!
But now...
The King of Knights does not understand the human heart.
This painful realization reminded Artoria of the knights who followed her.
"Finally showing your true power, King of Conqueror."
"Come, let me see the power you possess, the same as mine!"
The same power?
What did he mean?
But they didn't need to ask.
In the next moment, a transformation beyond imagination left everyone speechless.
A scorching wind from nowhere began to disrupt and erode reality.
Distance and position lost all meaning.
In their place came a blazing sun and an endless desert ravaged by dry, fierce winds.
"How... how is this possible!"
"This kind of thing..."
"How could this happen?!"
Shocked voices came not only from Waver and Irisviel but also from Sola-Ui.
As someone from the Clock Tower, she understood better than anyone what this scene signified.
"A Reality Marble?"
If Kayneth were here, he would have been obsessed with it.
A Holy Grail War created by a third-rate magus family in Japan had achieved such grand magecraft!
The scorching sun burned the earth, the horizon stretched endlessly to where violent sandstorms obscured the skyline, and the cloudless sky extended far beyond.
Waver had never been so awestruck by his Servant's might as he was now.
If he had held little hope for Iskandar's clash with Damien before, now...
"We can win!"
"We really can win!"
Waver excitedly looked at Iskandar beside him, asking, "You materialized a mental landscape, and you're not even a magus?"
"Of course not."
"This isn't something I could do alone."
Standing tall in the vast desert battlefield, Iskandar's face bore a proud smile as he dismissed Waver's question.
"This is the land my army once galloped across, the vision etched deeply in the hearts of the brave warriors who shared my triumphs and hardships."
As the world transformed, even the relative positions of those drawn into it shifted.
Waver remained with Iskandar.
Damien, however, was transported to the other end of the battlefield, facing them from afar.
The remaining spectators... Artoria, Gilgamesh, and the others... were isolated on a towering sand dune outside the battlefield.
The vantage point was perfect, offering a clear view of the entire battlefield.
Heroic Spirits with keen eyesight could see the upcoming battle in vivid detail.
"Hey, hey, hey."
Diarmuid's eyes widened in disbelief. "Are you kidding me?"
"This kind of thing..."
Artoria stared intently at the mirage-like shadows appearing around Iskandar.
There wasn't just one shadow... two, four...
The hazy figures of mounted warriors multiplied, forming ranks.
The shadows gradually took on color and depth.
"This world, this landscape, can take form because it comes from the collective mental image of us all."
Under the astonished gazes of the onlookers, the cavalry materialized one by one beside Iskandar.
Though their races and equipment varied, their physiques were robust, their gleaming armor adorned with heroic splendor, each vying to outshine the others in magnificence and strength.
Without exception, every one of them was a Servant!
"All of them?!"
Diarmuid looked at Sola-Ui, incredulous at her observation.
He considered himself formidable, a legendary hero.
But...
The number of Servants before him was beyond counting.
No matter how skilled Diarmuid was, how many could he face?
A few dozen?
A hundred?
Against such an army, the only outcome for Diarmuid would be utter annihilation!
"Behold, this is my unparalleled army!"
Iskandar raised his arms, his voice brimming with pride as he boasted of the assembled cavalry.
"These are heroes whose bodies have perished, whose souls were summoned by the world as Heroic Spirits, yet still pledge their loyalty to me."
"They answer my call across time and space, my eternal comrades."
"The bond with them is my greatest treasure! My path as a king!"
"This is my proudest Noble Phantasm... Ionioi Hetairoi!!"
An EX-rank Anti-Army Noble Phantasm, continuously summoning numerous independent Servant entities.
Generals, maharajas, and founding monarchs of later dynasties.
As many heroes as there were gathered here, so too were their legends.
Each was a supreme Heroic Spirit.
Beyond their individual renown, they took pride in their shared origin... warriors who once galloped across battlefields with Alexander the Great.
A single riderless horse approached Rider, a particularly robust and fierce steed, worthy of being called a beast.
Though not human, its valor was no less than that of the other Heroic Spirits.
"It's been a while, partner."
Iskandar, with a childlike grin, wrapped his arms tightly around the horse's neck.
This was the legendary steed Bucephalus, later revered and deified.
In Iskandar's ranks, even a horse had ascended to Heroic Spirit status.
"Kid, come here!"
Iskandar pulled Waver from the Gordius Wheel onto the horse, riding together.
"Huh?"
"Why, Rider?"
Waver didn't understand, especially since the Gordius Wheel was so powerful.
"Moo!!"
But soon, Waver got his answer.
The unmanned Gordius Wheel, pulled by the majestic Divine Bulls, soared into the sky.
Boom!
Thunder roared, lightning crackling.
Countless blue-purple bolts illuminated the sky, adding an apocalyptic solemnity and severity to the battlefield.
"..."
At this moment, everyone was too stunned to speak.
Faced with such a magnificent army, even Gilgamesh, with his own EX-rank Noble Phantasm, set aside his usual mockery.
These were heroes who entrusted everything to their king's dream, who once followed him across the earth.
Iskandar had transformed their unyielding loyalty after death into this Noble Phantasm.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 114 114: [TP] 114: Otherworldly Power
chapters.content:
"This is your path as a king?"
If anyone was shaken by the spectacle before them, it was undoubtedly Artoria.
It wasn't the power of Iskandar's Noble Phantasm that intimidated her.
Rather, the very essence of this Noble Phantasm shook the foundation of her honor as the King of Knights.
Unwavering, wholehearted devotion.
The profound bond with his followers, elevated to the level of a Noble Phantasm.
As an ideal king, this was the treasure Artoria had never attained in her lifetime.
"If only... if only I could have..."
Artoria thought of her own Knights of the Round Table.
She was not without followers.
But compared to Iskandar, she couldn't even unite her subordinates as one.
"To be a king!"
As if responding to Artoria, Iskandar bellowed, "It means living more vibrantly than anyone, inspiring awe in all who behold you!"
The ranks of mounted Heroic Spirits echoed his words, clashing their shields in unison, roaring in celebration.
"To unite the aspirations of all warriors, to stand tall as their exemplar... that is a king."
"Thus!"
With overwhelming confidence and pride, Iskandar, standing below, seemed to tower above all Heroic Spirits, gazing down upon them.
"A king is not detached from the mortal world."
"A king embodies the will of all their subjects!"
"Exactly! Exactly! Exactly!"
The Heroic Spirits' unified shouts shook the earth, piercing the heavens.
No army, no matter how fierce, nor any fortress, no matter how sturdy, could withstand Iskandar's comrades, whose fervent battle spirit could split the skies.
"Come!!!"
"Show me your path as a king before me and my heroes!"
"Demon King from another world!!"
"..."
"That's right!"
Perhaps it was the sheer awe of Iskandar's Ionioi Hetairoi that struck Artoria.
She suddenly realized something.
Damien, too, possessed the power to summon strange Servants.
Before, she hadn't understood how he did it.
But now, with Iskandar's example before her, the existence of Shion and Snow Empress made sense.
"A truly captivating speech, King of Conqueror."
Damien stood alone at the other end of the desert.
Yet his voice reached everyone's ears without delay.
Especially Iskandar, his chosen opponent.
"I must thank you."
Damien slowly raised his right hand, then clenched it. "Thank you for providing me with such a magnificent stage."
Crack!
As Damien's words fell, the sound of shattering glass echoed from above.
"What?"
The sky split open.
This phenomenon startled Iskandar.
He tried to repair his Reality Marble, only to find it needed no repair.
"What's happening?"
Crack, crack, crack!
Despite the Reality Marble being intact, spatial rifts grew larger and more numerous.
Bang!
Finally, with a crisp shattering sound, countless crystalline snowflakes fell from the sky, blanketing the vast, scorching desert.
"Snow?"
"It's snowing?"
Before anyone could marvel, more changes unfolded before their eyes.
The desert churned as massive tree roots burst from the ground, soaring upward.
Green sprouts emerged from the roots, spreading the color of life across the desert in an instant.
Boom!
But it wasn't over!
Flames roared, sand dunes began to melt, and a volcano spewing thick smoke rose in the distance.
Winds howled, rain poured, thunder rumbled, shadows loomed...
A myriad of conflicting magical attributes... fire, ice, wind, and more... abruptly appeared within Iskandar's Reality Marble.
Like blooming flowers, they flourished in someone else's domain.
Crack! Bang!
Behind Damien, a slender, pale hand swept through, violently shattering the endless desert landscape.
Crack, crack, crack!
The rift didn't stop but extended outward on both sides.
It was as if someone had torn the distant heavens and earth apart with immense force, splitting them in two!
"Amazing, so amazing."
"Is this the kind of opponent Lord Damien faces in other worlds?"
Meanwhile, in the kijin village of the Cardinal World, all residents looked up, gazing at the reflection of another world's scene in the sky.
When Iskandar unleashed his Reality Marble, it wasn't just Artoria and the others who were awestruck.
Even the Majins in the Cardinal World felt the heroic spirit of ancient warriors.
It was inspiring, admirable.
Though from different worlds, their hearts resonated with this loyalty.
Step, step, step!
Within the Reality Marble, from the shattered spatial rift behind Damien, figures poured out like a tide from a dark world, assembling into thousand-strong formations around him.
"The enemy numbers over 30,000!"
"Each one has strength comparable to a C-rank Heroic Spirit, with elites rivaling B-rank and even peerless heroes matching A-rank!"
Five thousand goblins against 30,000 C-rank Heroic Spirits... Damien's side was clearly at a disadvantage.
But!
He had an advantage Iskandar lacked!
Rumble!
The earth began to quake, the first change coming from the distant volcano.
A colossal figure stepped forth from it.
Standing fifty meters tall, covered in sharp crimson fur, with magma flowing across its body like pulsing veins or a beating heart... this was Honooga, one of the eighteen Wolf Guards personally named by Damien!
Behind it, dozens of equally massive werewolves exerted unprecedented pressure on Iskandar's army!
Howl!
A wolf's cry echoed, and a chunk of the sun hanging in the sky vanished.
Darkness began to descend.
A chilling wind blew, and the Frost Wolf of Winter emerged from the ice, its scarlet beastly eyes greedily fixed on the ancient heroes, like Fenrir from Norse mythology.
"Another one!"
While Artoria showed little reaction to the wolf beast, Gilgamesh's expression grew darker.
As a Heroic Spirit from the Age of Gods, Gilgamesh understood the terror of divine beast and phantasmal beasts far better than Artoria.
Damien wasn't Solomon, unable to summon the seventy-two demon god pillars.
But the wolf beasts he summoned now, in Gilgamesh's eyes, were no less formidable than any daemon.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 115: [TP] 115: Life and Competition
chapters.content:
"What a realm bursting with life and competition."
Damien looked at Snow Empress beside him, her form like an ethereal spirit or goddess emerging from ice and snow, so sacred that no one could harbor a single blasphemous thought.
"Those words sound a bit ominous, don't they?"
To better understand Damien, Snow Empress had learned much about Earth from him.
"Haha."
Damien laughed, unbothered by the jinx. "In short, the advantage is mine!"
"..."
Snow Empress sighed. "Keep planting those flags."
But, to be fair, Damien held a significant advantage against Iskandar.
The Eighteen Wolf Guards were stronger than typical A-rank Heroic Spirits, only surpassed by Shuna and Shion.
Hoshiga's strength was nearly on par with Snow Empress, making him one of the two main forces in this battle.
Under his leadership, eighteen peak A-rank Heroic Spirits, along with a group of B to B+ rank werewolves in various forms, occupied their respective positions, encircling Iskandar's army completely!
"Preparations are complete. Please give your orders."
Snow Empress, setting aside her usual ferocity, respectfully awaited Damien's command.
"Attack."
Standing at the rear, Damien issued the order calmly.
"Roar~~~"
The Eighteen Wolf Guards charged from all directions.
"All forces, advance!!!"
The five-thousand-strong goblin legion, led by Rigurd and his two sons, pressed forward.
The kijin split into two groups.
One protected Damien, while the other hundred, led by Shion, charged at the forefront.
"My lord?!"
A massive ice-blue wolf beast loomed above Damien, but a girl's voice emerged from its maw.
"For the wolves, forget formations... just charge in."
Snow Empress relayed Violet's orders, commanding in her stead.
The wolves' speed far outstripped that of the goblins and kijin.
Their massive forms were perfect for disrupting enemy lines.
"Finally, our turn!"
"That army over there belongs to our Blaze Fang pack... no one steals my prey!"
"This side's mine!"
"Hahaha, charge! Slaughter them all!"
"Roar!!!"
Leading the charge was Koriga, riding a frost wolf.
This hundred-meter-tall ice wolf, formed from dozens of ice-aligned werewolves, was as formidable as the Sea Demon from the original story, save for its recovery abilities.
"Sorcerers, prepare!"
"Form the bounded field!"
However, the giant wolf head couldn't breach Iskandar's ranks, stopped a thousand meters away by an invisible bounded field.
"Hm?"
Koriga frowned, looking down to see a group of hooded sorcerers, led by an old man, casting a defensive spell.
And not just in front... bounded fields enveloped all directions.
This forced the charging wolves to halt, searching for a breakthrough.
"Damn it!"
The girl swung her ice halberd, unleashing a terrifying beam of freezing light like a storm. "Get out of my way, old man!"
"How dare you act so arrogantly!"
The old man, clutching an ancient tome, glared at Koriga and the frost wolf relentlessly battering the bounded field.
Porus, king of the Punjab region in ancient India, defeated by Alexander in the Battle of Hydaspes.
Impressed by his courage, Alexander appointed him governor of the southeastern territories.
In the Ionioi Hetairoi, Porus was a supreme warrior bearing the title of Maharaja.
His mastery of magecraft was rivaled only by Ptolemy, the "Savior."
Crack!
"Hm?"
Porus frowned as the bounded field, cast by hundreds of sorcerers under his command, began to fracture.
"Hmph."
But Porus remained unfazed, sneering, "On the battlefield, focusing too much on one thing can lead to peril."
"What?"
Before Koriga could question Porus, a deafening thunderclap roared overhead.
"Moo~~~"
The Divine Bulls, pulling the Gordius Wheel, descended from the sky with the force of wind and thunder, targeting Koriga and her frost wolf atop the highest point.
"Heh, you think you're the only one with allies?"
Boom!
Golden lightning clashed with blue-purple thunder in the air, tearing and vying for dominance like two fearsome thunder beasts battling for the sky.
For a moment, the heavens flickered, the world hummed, drawing everyone's gaze to the clashing forces.
Whoosh!
"Too slow, Koriga."
A robust golden werewolf appeared beside Koriga, arms crossed, arcs of golden electricity dancing around him. "Leave the sky battle to the professionals."
"Now, let's break this turtle shell together!"
"Alright!"
As Koriga spoke, Raiga stomped downward.
Instantly, a surge of lightning poured from his foothold into the frost wolf, turning its ice-blue form golden.
"Roar~~"
Thunder and ice fused, unleashing a beam far more terrifying than before, erupting from the golden wolf's maw and slamming into Porus's defensive spell.
"We can't let this attack land!"
Iskandar, recognizing the strike's danger, raised his Noble Phantasm, Via Expugnatio. "Stop it!"
"Moo!!"
Empowered by its master's mana, the Divine Bulls grew stronger.
What was once a localized thunderstorm began spreading in all directions, faintly threatening to engulf the entire battlefield.
"Hm?"
The situation surprised Damien. "Such a wide-ranging mana coverage with Iskandar's mana..."
Then it hit him.
He looked at Waver beside Iskandar, noting the absence of red Command Seals on his hand.
"The power of Command Seals?"
"That kid, like in the original, gave all three Command Seals' mana to Iskandar before the battle."
This explained why Iskandar's performance now far exceeded his anime depiction.
In truth, if not for facing his natural counter, Gilgamesh, Iskandar would have been the most troublesome Heroic Spirit in the Fourth War...
***
[1] If you forgot, Damien created 18 Wolf Guards consisting of 18 wolf packs with different strengths, each pack's name taken from the English name of its leader, such as the Storm Fang pack, which comes from Ranga's name in English.
1. Storm Fang: Ranga
2. White Fang: Shiroga
3. Rock Fang: Iwaga
4. Steel Fang: Hagane
5. Earth Fang: Chiga
6. Thunder Fang: Raiga
7. Dragon Fang: Ryuga
8. Vile Fang: Akuga
9. Fight Fang: Tataga
10. Flame Fang: Honooga
11. Spring Fang: Haruga
12. Sprout Fang: Mega
13. Ghost Fang: Yureiga
14. Mind Fang: Kokoroga
15. Ice Fang: Koriga
16. Moon Fang: Tsukiga
17. Glow Fang: Hikaga
18. Venom Fang: Dokuga
***

chapters.title: Chapter 116: [TP] 116: Aid!
chapters.content:
"Leave it to me, my lord!"
Ranga, who was destined to become the new leader of the Star Wolves under Rimuru.
Due to Damien's presence, it couldn't take its father's place.
Even so, Ranga remained the foremost of the Eighteen Wolf Guards, with the highest potential in the clan.
"Koriga!"
"I'm here to aid you!!"
A pair of sky-blue wings sprouted from Ranga's back, carrying it and its flight-aligned kin soaring into the heavens.
"You're not the only one who can fly, Ranga!"
Following Ranga were the wolves led by Dragonfang.
Whether beast-eared girls or werewolves, their bodies were covered in glistening dragon scales.
Moreover, they inherited dragon power from Damien, able to summon dragon wings and claws in battle, granting them formidable aerial combat abilities.
"Moo~~"
"Woo~~"
Alongside the bulls' roars, Ranga's howl resounded.
In that moment, gales and thunder clashed, turning the sky within the Reality Marble into an apocalyptic thunderstorm.
"Gulp!"
Waver, standing with Iskandar, swallowed hard.
Even from this distance, he could feel the stray winds and lightning, a testament to the intensity of the clash.
Bang!
But before the aerial battle could be decided, the bounded field could no longer hold.
With a crisp shattering sound, a beam of interwoven thunder and ice descended from the sky.
Boom~~
Unfortunately, weakened by the bounded field, the attack caused little damage.
But that didn't matter.
Koriga and Raiga looked at the panting, visibly mana-drained court sorcerers.
Their task was complete.
The rest could be left to their kin.
"Finally, it's broken!!"
"Hahaha~~"
With the bounded field's collapse, the Blaze Fang, led by Honooga, was the first to charge in.
"Such powerful mana."
"Step back, I'll handle this!"
A burly blond man spoke, wielding a long spear, directly facing the dozens-of-meters-tall Honooga.
Hephaestion, Alexander's closest friend and one of the joint commanders of the Companion Cavalry.
"As you wish!"
Honooga signaled its kin to press forward while intercepting Hephaestion's attack.
Boom!!
The clash of spear and fiery claw sent a terrifying mana shockwave through the air, producing a piercing sonic boom.
The immense strength from Honooga's massive size was not something a mere human could withstand.
Even a warrior like Hephaestion, facing such an onslaught, was pushed back, sliding across the desert-magma ground, carving two deep trenches.
"Ah!!!"
The blond warrior roared, veins bulging on his arms, forcibly halting his retreat against Honooga's claw.
"Impressive, Heroic Spirit from another world!"
Honooga praised the man who, like an ant shaking a tree, managed to block its strike.
"How about this?"
Massive fireballs coalesced in the air behind Honooga, crashing forward like meteors.
"Still not enough!"
Hephaestion leaped, his spear dancing, shattering the boulders laced with lava and flames.
Boom~~
As the two fought, dozens of fire wolves and werewolves charged into Hephaestion's formation.
In an instant, the formation melted like butter under a hot knife, penetrated deeply.
But that was as far as they got.
Hundreds, thousands of C-rank Heroic Spirits against dozens of B+ rank fighters might falter initially.
But the wolves' mana was limited, and they would eventually be worn down by the relentless Heroic Spirit legion.
"Hold fast!"
"Do not fear!"
"Our king is watching us!!"
The commanding voice came from a man with long black hair, dressed in a black court robe, exuding the stern authority of a judge.
Eumenes, the royal secretary.
After Alexander's death, he rose quickly in the Diadochi conflicts, defending the Argead dynasty's legitimacy.
Though a scholar, his intellect and command rivaled any, ultimately becoming the appointed commander of Asia Minor.
"Ha!!"
Shields stacked before the soldiers, forming a flawless phalanx that linked mana into an invisible bounded field, blocking the falling fire rain and flames.
What followed were hundreds, thousands of spears.
"Annoying!"
Fire-aligned wolves leaped, crashing onto the bounded field, leaving only cracks, unable to advance further.
"Such a tough formation."
Facing the wolves' breakthrough, Iskandar's side responded immediately.
They shielded their main forces within, while the outer layer consisted of shield-and-spear formations.
With mana flowing through, their durability far exceeded the wolves' expectations.
Unlike in the original story against Assassin, this was a clash of armies, and the Heroic Spirit legion displayed the discipline they had in life.
Different units coordinated, countering various environments and enemies.
Damien's side was no less formidable.
The Majins didn't understand formation tactics.
What they had was sheer power, charging with overwhelming force.
Towering werewolves were the first to engage, their massive bodies easily breaking gaps in the opposing shield formations with a single charge.
Pfft, pfft, pfft!
Yet Iskandar's army, heedless of casualties, charged relentlessly at the fearsome beasts.
Their spears struck... some shattered by wolf claws, others unable to pierce their defenses.
But!
A portion, after depleting the wolves' mana shields, tore through flesh, piercing their bodies.
"Roar~~~"
The intense pain brought not retreat or panic but fury and even more savage slaughter.
Boom!!
A fire-wreathed werewolf's heart was pierced.
Yet in the next moment, dazzling flames erupted from its body, instantly engulfing enemies within a hundred-meter radius in a blazing inferno.
This wasn't an isolated case but a common sight across the battlefield.
Be it werewolves or giant wolves, they fought like monsters oblivious to death.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 117: [TP] 117: Successors
chapters.content:
"They're self-destructing!"
Artoria, Gilgamesh, and the others watching from afar were left speechless by the shocking scene.
Even in the Age of Gods, such a war spectacle was remarkable.
"Rider..."
Waver, who had briefly felt reassured, grew anxious again.
In his view, Iskandar was already formidable.
But he hadn't expected Damien's forces to not only match but suppress Iskandar's Ionioi Hetairoi.
The numerical gap of tens of thousands showed no effect.
There was no helping it... Damien's troops were simply too powerful!
"Lancer?"
Sola-Ui clung nervously to Diarmuid's arm.
He could only reassure her helplessly, "I'll protect you."
Though he said this, Diarmuid knew well.
If he faced this meat-grinder battlefield, he would be torn apart instantly.
"Mm."
But a woman in love lacked clear judgment.
If Lancer said he'd protect her, what more could she want?
As long as Lancer was by her side, Sola-Ui would face even death with a smile.
"Sigh..."
Diarmuid, far from foolish like Sola-Ui, knew he had no chance in this Holy Grail War.
"So be it."
Diarmuid sighed, turning his gaze to the equally stunned Artoria.
To have come this far and served his lord loyally, Diarmuid had no regrets.
Once this war ended, he would challenge Saber.
Crunch!
"Aaah, what's happening now?"
Waver stumbled, noticing the once-impenetrable formation suddenly thrown into chaos.
Boom! Boom! Boom!
The shield wall could guard against frontal and overhead attacks but not from below.
The earth churned as a group of wolf-eared girls, adorned with flower crowns and green leaves like druids, rode giant wolves to reinforce the fray.
Their mana flowed beneath the ground, seeking weaknesses, then erupted in a devastating explosion at the rear of the enemy legion.
"Ah!!"
Some Heroic Spirit warriors were flung into the air.
Before they could land, vines and roots ensnared their limbs.
Swish~~~
In an instant, many warriors were decapitated, their bodies dissolving into golden particles in midair.
Different Star Wolvess favored different forms.
The fire-aligned wolves, led by Honooga, charged as fiery wolves or werewolves.
As for the grass-aligned wolves...
The female wolves didn't take beastly forms but appeared as priestesses, led by Mega.
Slash, slash, slash!
A bare-chested youth wielded a Roman sword, cutting through massive vines.
His gaze met the wolf-eared girl standing atop a giant wolf, distinct from the others.
"My opponent is a woman?"
Seleucus, the "Victor." founder of the Seleucid Empire, had once led a thousand soldiers gifted by Ptolemy, the "Savior." To reclaim Babylon.
Following Alexander's example, he campaigned eastward, expanding his territory, becoming the last of Alexander's Successors.
"I've been targeted, have I?"
Mega's gaze sharpened as she stood atop growing vines, looking down at Seleucus.
"Come, show me your strength!"
The girl raised her hands, a glowing green energy sphere forming, growing to several meters in moments.
But she didn't hurl it as Seleucus expected.
Instead, countless green motes swept toward the enemy like a storm, only to be expertly blocked by their shields.
Those that landed on the warriors' armor failed to pierce their defenses.
"What's this?"
Seleucus paused, confused by Mega's actions, a faint unease stirring within him.
"No rush, you'll understand soon."
Mega smirked playfully, as if anticipating what was to come.
"What's this?"
"Damn it, they won't come off?"
Indeed, the blocked green motes weren't energy blasts but parasitic seeds crafted by Mega's mana.
"Damn!"
As many soldiers were bound by strange vines, Seleucus saw invisible mana flowing toward Mega, who channeled it to her grass-aligned kin.
"A different ability from the fire wolves?"
If Honooga's fire wolves broke formations with brute force, Mega's grass-aligned wolves had the most terrifying endurance among the Eighteen Star Wolvess.
Absorbing the enemy's mana, they restored themselves.
Injuries, stamina... everything was endlessly replenished.
You want a war of attrition?
Fine!
The grass-aligned wolves could fight all day!
"This needs to end quickly!"
Seleucus suddenly accelerated, rushing to Mega, forcing her into close combat.
"Bring it on!"
Mega remained unfazed.
No Star Wolves member was weak in close combat.
The girl summoned vine-woven weapons from the air while commanding roots from the earth, turning them into tendrils that lashed at the legion and ground.
Wherever they passed, grass bloomed, and green fluorescence drifted to her allies, healing their wounds.
"This is the power of the Demon King?"
On the battlefield, Iskandar was undaunted by the scene.
On the contrary, the sight of Damien's wolves filled him with exhilaration.
"We can't just take hits... javelin throwers, prepare!"
"Ha!!!"
At Iskandar's command, tens of thousands of javelins soared into the air.
Thrown by Heroic Spirits, their power rivaled C-rank Noble Phantasms, if not surpassing them.
At this moment, Damien's goblin legion was still some distance from Iskandar's main force.
"You won't succeed!"
Led by Iwaga, the rock-aligned wolves weren't suited for offense.
Their massive, less agile forms stayed back, protecting the main goblin and kijin legion.
***
