chapters.title: Chapter 118 118: [TP] 118: Got You!
chapters.content:
Boom!!
The earth heaved, layers of massive rocks fusing into a towering wall dozens of meters high in an instant.
Boom, boom, boom!
The next moment, javelins rained down, their impacts resounding like exploding shells.
The stone wall shattered, dust rising in clouds.
From within charged the Star Wolves led by Hagane.
Hagane transformed into a five-meter-tall werewolf.
His muscles seemed forged from steel, each hair glinting like a blade, his claws the sharpest weapons in the world, unbreakable.
Zzzzt~~
The Heroic Spirit warriors' weapons struck them, producing a grating buzz.
Sparks flew, yet not a single mark was left on their bodies.
"What?"
"How are they so tough?"
The warriors' faces froze, unable to believe their weapons couldn't breach the enemy's defenses.
"Hahaha!"
Hagane swatted away a daring soldier with a single blow, a ferocious grin on his face. "Let's go, boys... charge and slaughter!!"
"Ooohhh!!"
The steel-aligned wolves excelled in close combat.
Their defenses were astonishing, each move glowing with white light, the hallmark of steel magic.
For a moment, the steel wolves tore through everything in their path like an unstoppable force, shredding all opposition.
Buzz~~~
On another front, werewolves and beast-eared girls in pure white martial arts uniforms darted through the enemy ranks.
"Fire Punch!"
"Thunder Punch!"
"Ice Punch!"
"Ora, ora, ora, ora~~~"
They needed no armor or weapons.
Their bare fists showcased their martial prowess to perfection.
"Don't engage them in close combat!!"
"Use ranged weapons!"
Arrows and javelins flew. The fighting-aligned wolves were few, only dozens.
By surrounding them with shield formations and advancing with spears, they could be easily overwhelmed.
"Is that so?"
But Tataga, with his square-jawed face, scoffed at such tactics.
He prepared to gather energy for a fighting magic strike capable of demolishing walls.
Before he could act, the surrounding Heroic Spirit warriors were lifted into the air by an invisible force, struggling and wailing.
"Ah!"
"What's this?"
"Damn it, let me down!"
"..."
Amid the chaos, a girl floated down from the sky, seated cross-legged in midair.
Beside her stood werewolves, their eyes glowing blue-white, one hand holding a metal spoon, the other manipulating something with deft fingers.
"Hey, Kokoroga!"
"No need to steal the spotlight so blatantly!"
The wolf-eared girl was Kokoroga, the leader of the psychic-aligned wolves.
It wasn't that she disliked it, but it didn't fit her enigmatic psychic persona.
"Get it straight... when did I steal your glory?"
The girl, eyes closed, suddenly opened them.
In an instant, a terrifying psychic wave radiated outward, blasting the encircling soldiers away.
"I took out more with one move than all of you combined."
Kokoroga smirked disdainfully. "Steal your glory? What a joke!"
"You, you little..."
Tataga was furious but couldn't refute her words.
Unlike other attributes, fighting-aligned wolves excelled in one-on-one combat, not battlefield warfare.
"A bunch of fools."
"Killing small fry, no matter how many, what glory is there?"
A girl hidden in the shadows sneered at Kokoroga's smugness.
Whoosh, whoosh, whoosh!
Yureiga, like a true specter, used the battlefield's shadows as stepping stones, dimensionally weaving through them, rapidly closing in on Iskandar's position.
"Got him!!"
Soon, Yureiga found her chance.
She leaped from the shadow of one of Iskandar's guards.
Damien had ordered not to kill Iskandar.
But Yureiga wasn't aiming to kill.
If she could touch him, she could pull him into the shadows.
Then, wouldn't he be at her mercy?
"Rider, watch out!!"
The moment Yureiga appeared, Iskandar's guards sensed her.
"Assassin!"
The elite guards displayed extraordinary skill, immediately blocking her path.
Outer soldiers reacted swiftly, rushing to protect their king.
"Stop them!"
"Understood!"
As Yureiga's command rang out, more shadow wolves materialized from the void.
They wove everyone's shadows into a dark curtain, enveloping hundreds, including Iskandar.
"What's this?"
The eerie, sinister black dome sent chills down spines.
But these were legendary Heroic Spirit warriors, unafraid of mere ghosts or evils.
Yet, as they stepped into the darkness, they found themselves not inside the dome but on the other side.
"The space is sealed?!"
They quickly realized the truth.
This strange black dome was a spatial bounded field, completely isolating the inside from the outside.
This meant their king had to face the attacking assassin alone!
In the dark world, Iskandar stood protected by hundreds of his most elite warriors, ready for battle.
"Over here!"
Yureiga was spotted the moment she appeared.
The girl couldn't help but marvel... indeed, Iskandar's warriors were full of powerhouses.
These elite fighters were no weaker than the Star Wolves, each at least B-rank.
Some were even A-rank Heroic Spirits.
In a direct fight, Yureiga had no confidence in escaping alive.
"But I'm not here for a frontal assault."
Yureiga flashed a sinister smile, then rushed toward Iskandar like a phantom.
"We won't let you harm our king!"
An armored warrior, exuding formidable presence, swung a long sword at the approaching Yureiga.
However...
"What?!"
The warrior gaped as his blade passed through Yureiga's body, his face filled with disbelief.
"Damn it!"
"What's with this one?"
Weapons and attacks rained down on Yureiga like a storm.
But no matter the move, Yureiga, as if in another world, ignored them all.
***
Bonus Chapter:

500 Power Stones = 3 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 119: [TP] 119: Analysis Complete
chapters.content:
"This ability?"
Iskandar hadn't expected Damien's forces to include such a being.
"My king, retreat... this one's strange!"
"Our attacks can't touch her!"
Iskandar didn't hesitate, pulling the reins to guide Waver away from Yureiga.
"Pointless!"
Yureiga locked onto Iskandar's position. As a ghost-aligned wolf, physical attacks were ineffective against her.
Even magic, if she prepared in advance, could be blocked.
Her ability was akin to Obito Uchiha's Kamui from Naruto.
But Yureiga's power was even more extreme.
It had no time limit.
"Can't touch her?"
As Yureiga closed in on Iskandar and Waver, the guards near the king's chariot grew frantic. They hadn't anticipated someone breaching so close undetected.
"Even mana attacks don't work?"
Outside the bounded field, a silver-haired old man in a star-embroidered robe curiously examined the shadowy bounded field before him.
"Intriguing magecraft."
The old man was Ptolemy, founder of the Ptolemaic Dynasty of ancient Egypt and ancestor to Cleopatra.
He also built the Pharos Lighthouse, one of the Seven Wonders, and the famed Library of Alexandria, a powerful Heroic Spirit with both youthful and aged forms.
"How about this?"
Ptolemy raised his hands, boundless light blooming from them. "In the name of Ra, lingering souls of the mortal world, return to dust!"
"Hm?"
The moment Ptolemy acted, Yureiga, confident in her victory, sensed immense danger.
Without hesitation, she retreated.
But before vanishing, a Heroic Spirit's blade grazed her shoulder, leaving a shallow wound.
"The attack worked!"
"Why?"
"Wait, that light... was that Ptolemy?"
As the girl retreated and the shadowy bounded field shattered under the light, Iskandar's guards sighed in relief.
"My king, are you alright?"
"Thanks, Ptolemy."
Iskandar felt fortunate; that had been a close call.
He didn't know Damien had ordered his forces not to kill him.
Yureiga's goal was to capture Iskandar alive and present him to Damien for glory.
Sadly, her plan failed.
Yureiga hadn't expected her ghostly state to be countered by Ptolemy, leaving her furious.
"Oh, isn't that Yureiga?"
"Missing for a few minutes, and you flop like that?"
Kokoroga, floating cross-legged in the air, teased her.
"Don't gloat!"
"Capturing the enemy leader alive would bring glory to the entire Star Wolves!"
Good grief!
Kokoroga was speechless.
As if she were doing it all for the village.
Who didn't know the Star Wolves's loyalty to Damien was like that of faithful hounds?
Craving their master's praise and affection was ingrained in their bones.
If Yureiga succeeded, her tail would wag to the heavens!
"That old man isn't simple."
Tataga, Kokoroga, and Yureiga looked at Ptolemy beside Iskandar.
He was the founder of an ancient Egyptian dynasty.
Egypt, perhaps the civilization most versed in death and soul magecraft worldwide.
Yureiga's ghost alignment was less about darkness and more about death and spirits.
And no one was better at handling spirits than Ptolemy!
"Let's go together."
"Tataga and I will hold that old man; Yureiga, you grab the target, and we split the credit!"
"Deal!"
After the battle, the trio's mana was depleted but still sufficient for another fight.
"Rider?"
"Now's not the time to hold back."
Iskandar instructed Ptolemy, then raised his sword. "The enemy is upon us... how can we shy from battle?!"
"Soldiers! Charge with me!!"
"Ooohhh!"
Of the 30,000-strong army, nearly 10,000 were tied up by 400 wolves.
The remaining 20,000 split, with infantry guarding the flanks, keeping all threats outside the main battlefield.
As for the cavalry...
They would follow Iskandar, cutting through the goblin legion led by the kijin to reach Damien!
"A mythic war."
In less than fifteen minutes, the battle surpassed Irisviel's imagination.
"The Demon King is losing."
Artoria made her judgment.
"Hmph, losing?"
Gilgamesh scoffed at her assessment. "Fool! He's not even serious!"
"What?"
Artoria ignored his venom, wanting to know what he meant.
"What do you think those are?"
Gilgamesh pointed at the kijin in the goblin army. "Those, and the damned woman leading them!"
Gilgamesh had experienced Shion's strength firsthand.
She was powerful, stronger than the Star Wolves leaders already in action.
Yet she hadn't moved.
Why?
Because Shion and her kin were Damien's true elite!
"That woman and her clan..."
Gilgamesh's expression grew grave as he considered how to face Damien's challenge next.
No doubt, Iskandar had no chance of winning.
Which meant the one to face Gilgamesh in the final battle would be Damien!
[Reality Marble 'Ionioi Hetairoi' analysis in progress]
[Analysis progress: 90%]
[Analysis progress: 91%]
[...]
Meanwhile, watching the rising analysis progress, Damien calmly observed the battlefield.
With Shion and the kijin's speed, they should have been the first to engage.
But for Damien's plan, the kijin held back.
They gave the spotlight to the Star Wolvess.
[Analysis progress: 100%]
[Reality Marble analysis complete]
[New Reality Marble generating...]
"Success."
Through analyzing both the Time Alter and Ionioi Hetairoi, Damien successfully gained his own Reality Marble.
This meant...
"It's time to end this."
Damien turned to Snow Empress. "Tell Shion and the others... send the King of Conqueror off!"
***
Bonus Chapter:
100 Power Stones = 1 BC
300 Power Stones = 2 BC
500 Power Stones = 3 BC
700 Power Stones = 4 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 120: [TP] 120: Defeat
chapters.content:
"Ah!!"
"They're dead!"
In the Cardinal World, at the central square of the village, one goblin after another awoke from their immersive experience.
"That was too quick!"
"Damn it!"
"Those Heroic Spirit warriors are too underhanded, ganging up on us!"
"..."
For a moment, the village buzzed with noisy chatter.
This was because Iskandar's personally led legion had clashed with the goblins.
As for the outcome...
The Hobgoblins' strength was not weak, comparable to the average Heroic Spirits under Iskandar.
But the enemy numbered over 20,000.
Their sheer numbers were four times that of the goblins.
Combined with the Heroic Spirits' excellent coordination, the goblins struggled briefly before showing clear signs of defeat.
While not collapsing instantly, it was close.
"Well, no matter."
Damien hadn't placed high expectations on the goblins. "At least they didn't flee in disgrace, preserving our side's honor."
Goblins were the lowest-tier Majins in the Cardinal World.
Even with Damien's blessings enhancing their racial traits, they were unlikely to become elite warriors.
Moreover, Damien's purpose in subduing the goblins was to make them citizens of his Monster Kingdom.
His only expectation was that they not be cowards.
In this, Damien had confidence.
From the original novel, it was clear that goblins were loyal to Rimuru.
Unlike the vile, cowardly goblins of other fantasy worlds, these were intelligent, honorable majins with a strong sense of belonging to the Monster Kingdom.
"However..."
Damien looked at the Hobgoblins and goblinas still in meditation. "No matter the race, even the weakest goblins can produce exceptional warriors."
"Huh?"
"Look, Gobwa's still fighting!"
"As expected of Gobwa!"
Gobwa, a female goblina, was an exceptionally talented goblin girl with the potential to evolve further.
"Eh?"
"What's up with Gobta?"
"Hey, Gobta, why are you still sitting there?"
"Wake up and watch Gobwa and the others fight with us!"
To facilitate the goblins' participation, those in the war were gathered in the square.
They sat cross-legged, using meditation to better control their other bodies.
"Don't touch him!!"
As someone moved to nudge Gobta, a cool voice rang out nearby.
"Ah! It's Lady Snow Empress!"
"What did you say, Lady Snow Empress?"
"Don't disturb him... he's still fighting the enemy."
Snow Empress ordered the crowd to disperse, then looked at the small figure still seated.
As the village's overseer of Majins, Snow Empress had shifted from her icy demeanor in the far north, now focusing on unlocking their potential and talents.
This battle was meant to temper the Majins.
In such training, some were bound to stand out.
"Let's see which goblins can hold their ground against the Heroic Spirits' onslaught."
As the crowd parted, Snow Empress scanned them, spotting several she had already considered promising.
She didn't underestimate the goblins.
The Cardinal World's magical beings had an evolution mechanism.
Even the weakest goblin, with enough potential, could grow to the level of a Demon Lord Seed.
Snow Empress had few hobbies.
One was helping Damien unearth talent.
It was like sculpting ice, revealing dazzling brilliance through careful crafting.
This was a rare pastime Snow Empress had found to pass the time.
"Uh..."
But when she saw Gobta, even the usually composed Snow Empress faltered.
"This one..."
Snow Empress scrutinized Gobta. "Are you sure he's a Hobgoblin?"
Hobgoblins and regular goblins were vastly different.
The latter were deformed little monsters.
Hobgoblins, however, were barely distinguishable from humans.
The females, aside from slightly green skin, were nearly identical to humans.
But this one...
How to put it?
Snow Empress could only say he had the classic goblin look, with a foolish expression.
"This..."
Snow Empress decided her standards for nurturing talent might need to be raised.
She didn't want one of her "works" To be such an outlier in the future.
"No wonder you were skeptical."
Snow Empress nodded inwardly, understanding. "Alright, don't disturb the meditating goblins. Let them keep fighting."
"Yes!"
"Understood, Lady Snow Empress."
Following her orders, the goblins instinctively shielded their still-fighting kin.
Meanwhile, those who had left the battlefield looked up.
They watched the projection, where the battle had reached its final stage.
The shattered earth, deserts crystallized by heat, and countless elite Heroic Spirits bound by spatial threads.
The 20,000-strong army had crushed the 5,000 goblins.
Without a moment to mourn the goblins' deaths, nearly a hundred kijin elites rushed to the battlefield.
Initially, Iskandar thought the kijin were merely B+ rank Servants like the wolves.
Only a few, like Shion, reached or surpassed A-rank.
But reality was far crueler than he imagined.
Each of the hundred kijin was equivalent to an A-rank Heroic Spirit.
Among them were powerhouses rivaling Shion and Souei.
Take Hakurou, for instance... his strength was on par with Souei's.
Only due to Damien's appointment did he act discreetly as part of the Shadow Squad.
If singled out, at least fifty top-tier warriors could be found among the two hundred kijin.
And so...
Without suspense, the 20,000 Heroic Spirit legion was slaughtered by a mere hundred.
"Monsters..."
Iskandar and Waver were unharmed.
Due to Damien's orders, the kijin deliberately spared them, allowing their passage.
Waver stared blankly at the kijin.
In that moment, their displayed power shattered his understanding of Heroic Spirits.
Too strong... unimaginably so.
It was hard to fathom that there were a hundred such terrifying beings.
And Damien, commanding such a force, seemed like an insurmountable chasm between the Masters and the Holy Grail.
***

500 Power Stones = 3 BC

chapters.title: Chapter 121: [TP] 121: Discontent
chapters.content:
"He can't possibly win."
"How could anyone defeat someone like that?"
Waver wasn't the only one with such thoughts.
Irisviel, Artoria, Diarmuid, and even Gilgamesh shared the sentiment.
Only those who had witnessed the kijin's might could grasp just how extraordinary Damien was as a Heroic Spirit.
Clop, clop, clop...
The sound of hooves echoed across the scorched earth as Iskandar, with Waver, approached Damien under the watchful eyes of the kijin.
With each step closer, the pressure from the kijin on either side intensified.
When only ten meters separated them, Iskandar's beloved steed could no longer withstand the magical pressure and collapsed.
"Are you satisfied with this battle, King of Conqueror?"
Damien stepped forward calmly, unconcerned that Iskandar might lash out.
Not only were the kijin glaring intently, but with Snow Empress and Ogerpon's strength, they could strike Iskandar down before he could act.
"Exhilarating!"
Iskandar, despite the pressure, forced himself to stand tall.
He had no regrets about challenging Damien.
He had given his all and still suffered a crushing defeat.
But losing to a stronger foe was no shame for Iskandar... it was another honor in his conquests.
"Rider..."
"Can you give me a moment?"
"No problem."
Damien raised a hand, and the kijin instantly withdrew their pressure.
"Phew~~"
"What a terrifying bunch."
"Haha, looks like this is my end..."
Iskandar set Waver down, gazing at the boy as he began his final instructions.
Waver, as in the original story, swore loyalty to Iskandar, vowing to become his familliar.
Damien didn't interrupt, quietly waiting for Iskandar to finish before issuing his final command.
"Kill!"
The moment Damien spoke, countless blades struck from all directions, piercing Iskandar's body.
"Rider!!!"
Waver tried to rush forward but was held back by Souei, forcing him to choke back tears.
"Your journey ends here."
"Ah..."
Iskandar swallowed the blood in his mouth, smiling. "What a thrilling battle..."
Splatter!
As the blades were withdrawn, blood sprayed, and Iskandar's body began to dissolve into golden particles.
"I feel the same."
Damien had no intention of subduing Iskandar.
"Thank you for your gift."
Though he admired Iskandar's character and demeanor, the King of Conqueror was a true king.
He could die but would never bow to another.
Even if Damien offered the chance to conquer the multiverse together, Iskandar would likely just laugh it off.
He didn't advance to see new sights; he admired new vistas while advancing.
Buzz~~~
Soon, with Iskandar's death, the Reality Marble began to collapse.
The remaining Heroic Spirits, along with Damien's wolves and kijin, vanished like phantoms.
"Your Holy Grail War is over. Return to where you belong."
Damien patted Waver's shoulder before approaching the three remaining Heroic Spirits.
"Demon King..."
Diarmuid was the most nervous as Damien approached.
Artoria and Gilgamesh, however, remained relatively composed.
"King of Heroes."
Damien ignored the other two, focusing on Gilgamesh. "How about we settle this with a duel?"
"Arrogant."
Gilgamesh, never one to shy from battle, accepted. "But you are worthy of challenging me!"
"Prepare well!"
"Tomorrow, I will come to you myself!"
Unlike Iskandar, Gilgamesh wanted to face Damien at his peak.
But today's battle had depleted much of Damien's forces.
Gilgamesh, who never bowed to anyone, couldn't accept fighting a weakened Damien compared to Iskandar.
So, the Ryudou Temple!
Gilgamesh chose Damien's territory as the battlefield to compensate for the losses from the fight with Iskandar.
"Fine."
Damien calmly accepted Gilgamesh's request.
If Gilgamesh had such confidence, Damien would oblige.
"Hey!"
"You challenged them one after another... what about me?"
Ignored repeatedly, Artoria was both furious and frustrated.
She didn't believe her strength was inferior to the other Heroic Spirits.
Iskandar's Ionioi Hetairoi was formidable.
But with Excalibur and Avalon unleashed, she could blast through to Iskandar and defeat him.
Never mind whether Saber had enough mana for that.
Such a strategy did have a chance of victory.
Of course, it wouldn't work against Damien.
His kijin were too powerful.
Excalibur's map-clearing blast couldn't kill them.
The outcome would be the kijin taking her down at some cost... no other possibility.
"Defeat him first, then ask me that question."
Damien didn't answer Artoria, merely glancing lightly at Lancer before turning to leave.
Having just acquired his Reality Marble, Damien needed time to stabilize and shape it.
He had no time to linger and chat with Artoria.
"Hey!"
The Invisible Air around Artoria's sword surged violently. "There's a limit to your arrogance!"
But before she could act, two figures blocked Damien's path.
"What do you think you're doing?"
"Bo-nehm!"
Snow Empress and Ogerpon stared at Artoria, exerting immense pressure.
"No, I didn't mean... "
"I just..."
She wasn't planning to attack Damien now.
All Artoria wanted was an acknowledgment.
Just as he had challenged Iskandar and made a duel with Gilgamesh, Saber hoped Damien would show her some respect.
Pick a battlefield.
Even if it became her grave, Saber would have no regrets.
But no!
Damien simply didn't take her seriously!
"Our war ended at the banquet."
Damien, back to Artoria, said gravely, "Someone who can't even see themselves clearly isn't worthy of being defeated by me."
"You..."
Humiliation, unprecedented humiliation.
Yet Artoria couldn't find words to retort.
Without Damien's questioning at the banquet, she wouldn't even know where she went wrong or why she fought.
In this light, she was the one being unreasonable.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 122: [TP] 122: Reality Marble
chapters.content:
"Mind if I test my skills?"
Snow Empress sized up Artoria, a spark of battle lust in her eyes. "Is that alright, Damien?"
She had few hobbies, but one was sparring with strong opponents.
Not the brute-force types like Iskandar or Gilgamesh, but those skilled in swordsmanship, spearmanship, or martial arts.
Without a doubt, Artoria and Lancer were exactly the kind of opponents Snow Empress craved.
"Bo-nehm?"
Ogerpon was a bit confused.
She had only come to back Snow Empress up.
Why was there suddenly a fight?
What should she do now... join Snow Empress in taking them on?
"..."
Damien gave Snow Empress a wry smile. "You're making it sound like I single-handedly took on the entire Holy Grail War."
Defeating Caster, subduing Berserker, and dealing with Iskandar.
Next, challenging Gilgamesh.
If Snow Empress took on both Saber and Lancer, Damien could truly say he'd steamrolled the Holy Grail War.
"So, is it okay?"
"Do as you please."
Damien waved dismissively, then patted Ogerpon's head to snap her out of her daze.
He had full confidence in Snow Empress.
In terms of martial prowess, her 700,000 years of refinement weren't just for show.
That was her initial state.
After becoming Damien's bonded martial soul, Snow Empress gained the unique skill Sword Saint.
Sword Saint didn't just mean mastery of swords.
It represented the pinnacle of martial arts, the ultimate realm of technique.
Not to mention this Diarmuid and Artoria... even the endlessly trained their version wouldn't stand a chance against Snow Empress's current skill.
Meanwhile, Damien returned to Ryudou Temple with Ogerpon.
"Big Damien-nii~~"
The moment he arrived, Sakura anxiously rushed into his arms. "Are you okay? Are you hurt?"
"Don't worry, Sakura."
"I'm fine. Iskandar was no match for me."
Damien had left twenty kijin at Ryudou Temple. With Gilgamesh and the other Heroic Spirits present, he wasn't worried about Assassin's sneak attacks.
Hassan of the Hundred Faces lacked the ability to breach the kijin's defenses and harm Sakura.
"You saw it, didn't you?"
Damien's battle with Iskandar had been projected to Sakura and the kijin here.
"Mm!"
Sakura said, "Onii-san is amazing, and everyone else is super, super amazing!"
At five or six years old, the little girl didn't know fancy compliments.
"Amazing" and "super amazing" were her highest praise.
"Of course, I'm the one who's going to dominate the Holy Grail War."
Damien scooped Sakura up and headed to his room.
He didn't set her down, letting her play in his arms while he focused inward, sensing the new power gained from Iskandar.
Reality Marble.
Damien was filled with anticipation. "Let's see how much of a surprise you can bring me."
"Violet!"
[Here.]
"The essence of the Reality Marble... have you analyzed it?"
[Fully analyzed.]
Violet reported her findings to Damien. "I've integrated this power into your Spirit Space, linking it with the Gate of the Void."
"And the result?"
"I've successfully bypassed the rule barriers between the Cardinal World and other worlds."
Violet's news resolved one of Damien's biggest headaches.
Previously, he couldn't bring beings from other worlds to the Cardinal World, except through familiar contracts.
Likewise, non-familiar beings from the Cardinal World couldn't enter other worlds.
But now, things were different.
The Reality Marble, analyzed from Iskandar, became a privileged channel bypassing these restrictions.
If different worlds were islands, Damien's Reality Marble was a stealth ship that could deceive any world's defenses.
Take Sakura, for example.
If Damien placed her in his Reality Marble before crossing, he could bring her to the Cardinal World.
"Can I take Sakura out?"
"Yes."
"Theoretically, the Cardinal World's purity is so high that Sakura's physical condition would be crushed by its gravity alone."
"Theoretically?"
"Indeed."
Violet's voice carried a hint of pride. "There's a lot of room to maneuver here."
Violet wasn't the Cardinal World's sole will.
But just as she'd bent the rules for Damien's naming, she could issue an "identity pass" for outsiders like Sakura.
"What kind of pass?"
"A reincarnator!"
"Hoho!"
Damien teased, "Nice one, Violet, playing it like that?"
Being recognized as a reincarnator by the Cardinal World meant a lot, no explanation needed.
The Voice of the World would grant Sakura Magicule based on her soul's quality.
With some luck, she might even gain a unique skill.
"In that case, couldn't I bring a whole group back and get a ton of unique skills?"
"Not that simple."
Violet doused his enthusiasm. "Not everyone can withstand Magicule transformation."
"If their soul quality is lacking, forget unique skills... they might not even survive."
Thus, if Damien wanted to bring others back, he'd need to choose those with sufficient qualifications.
Here, qualifications didn't mean talent or strength but their "weight" in their own world.
"Weight?"
"Think of it as a character's importance."
"Like protagonists, supporting characters, villains, sidekicks, or extras?"
Damien felt this resembled the concept of "children of destiny" in some novels.
"Exactly."
Violet said, "The Cardinal World will grant Sakura gifts from the Nasuverse based on her weight."
In other words, it was like diplomatic relations between nations.
The Nasuverse sent Sakura as a guest to the Cardinal World, which would offer hospitality matching her status.
This was the benchmark for how much those Damien smuggled could gain in the Cardinal World.
The more important the character, the more favor they'd receive from the Voice of the World.
In a way, acquiring talent was a form of rule-plundering for the Cardinal World.
Violet had used this logic to convince the Cardinal World.
After all, who'd refuse free benefits?
***

chapters.title: Chapter 123: [TP] 123: Instant Kill
chapters.content:
"So, with Sakura's situation, how much Magicule could she gain?"
"Roughly B- rank."
"Only B-?"
Damien almost said it was too low, but considering the gap between worlds, he realized it wasn't that simple.
First, no matter how high someone's weight, there was a cap.
The Voice of the World could grant up to Special A-rank Magicule, within 990,000.
So, where did Sakura stand in the Nasuverse?
Damien could only say she had an exceptional magus bloodline.
But that was it.
"The Nasuverse has multiple parallel universes and various Lostbelts."
"Sakura is just a relatively outstanding magus in one of those parallel worlds."
By that measure, a B- rating was already quite good.
Moreover, B- rank Magicule was just the starting point... Sakura could still grow stronger.
Her future was uncertain.
This was in the Nasuverse.
In other worlds, protagonists might not even get a C-rank rating.
"Any other restrictions?"
"Yes."
Violet added, "There's a limit to how many can be smuggled at once. Too many crossings would overload the Gate of the Void."
"Specifically?"
"Based on my Magicule recovery rate."
"Currently, I can provide about 500,000 Magicule per month."
For someone like Sakura with a B- rating, it would consume around 5,000 to 6,000 Magicule.
"With some effort, I could manage 100 B-rank slots per month."
This limit would increase as Violet grew stronger.
This process was essentially exploiting the Cardinal World's resources.
Bringing people over, the Voice of the World would grant Magicule.
This essence would instantly elevate someone like Sakura to a B- rank Majin.
In the Nasuverse's Earth, without restrictions, a young Sakura could wipe Fuyuki City off the map with one slap!
The gap was more than a millionfold.
"What if I don't bring her out?"
Damien meant placing Sakura in his Reality Marble and returning to the Cardinal World.
But instead of releasing her, keeping her inside the Reality Marble to live.
"It's possible."
"The current Reality Marble is just a prototype, incomplete."
"Upon returning, I'll work with the Cardinal World to refine it into a true small world."
This small world would belong to Damien, fully under his control.
"You can adjust its rules to shape it as you wish."
Moreover, the small world would expand as Damien grew stronger.
Damien didn't need to worry about the specifics.
As the Cardinal World's "CEO." Violet could easily manage a small "company."
"High-tier chaotic world, mid-tier chaotic world, low-tier chaotic world."
"Evolving a small world into different tiers requires vastly different amounts of Magicule."
With Damien's current capacity, he could only maintain a low-tier world.
To reach the Cardinal World's top-tier level, he'd need to attain the Star Dragon King's stature... something not worth considering now.
"Alright, I get it."
Damien didn't expect to achieve everything at once. He was content with gradual progress.
Most importantly, he'd fulfilled his promise to Sakura.
He would take her away from this world.
From now on, he was her family.
Crunch, crunch...
While Damien and Violet discussed the Reality Marble, on Fuyuki Bridge, Artoria leaned on Excalibur, her face pale.
Strands of cold air swirled around her, frost clinging to her eyebrows and hair.
"Lancer..."
She looked beside her.
A humanoid ice statue was slowly crumbling, then scattering as ice dust.
On the ground lay the broken halves of Gáe Dearg and the shattered Gáe Buidhe.
As for Sola-Ui, after witnessing Lancer's demise, she knelt with vacant eyes, unable to accept the outcome.
"Saber!"
"Don't come closer, Irisviel!!"
Artoria stopped Irisviel, who wanted to heal her.
"This has nothing to do with her... it's our fight!"
"Fine."
Snow Empress lowered her hand, casting a barrier around Irisviel to shield her from the cold. "Now, fight me without worry... she'll be safe."
"Thank you."
Artoria felt no issue with Snow Empress's actions.
The Holy Grail War was a fight to the death.
Damien's promise was to not target other Heroic Spirits during his battle with Iskandar.
But now, that war was over.
Damien was free to do as he pleased.
In fact, after expending so much mana, Damien still sent Snow Empress to face two Heroic Spirits.
They should have the advantage.
Yet...
"How many more powerhouses does that guy have?"
"Summoning so many monsters and still sending out someone like this?"
Their brief clash made Artoria realize something.
The girl before her was far stronger than she'd imagined.
In a single exchange, Artoria was forced back.
Against Diarmuid's two Noble Phantasms, Snow Empress destroyed them with overwhelming force.
Then...
A single, light palm strike on Diarmuid.
The next moment, Lancer's body began to shatter.
"Unfathomable."
"Magecraft?"
"Or magic?"
Despite Diarmuid's Magic Resistance, no curse should have affected him.
Yet the reality was undeniable.
Diarmuid couldn't withstand a single move from Snow Empress!
[Emperor's Palm: Snowless Great Cold]
This was the technique Snow Empress used to instantly kill Diarmuid.
Boom!
Artoria broke free from the icy binds, raising her holy sword toward Snow Empress. "Your magecraft... no, that's practically magic."
***

chapters.title: Chapter 124: [TP] 124: Abandoned
chapters.content:
"A single strike unleashing power akin to magic... are you a magus who has reached the realm of True Magic?"
In the Nasuverse, magic and magecraft are distinct concepts.
Simply put, magecraft is what humans can achieve, like destroying a mountain... something modern weaponry could also accomplish.
In contrast, reviving the dead or time travel, powers beyond the current era, are defined as True Magic.
But if one day humanity invents a time machine, time travel would cease to be True Magic and become magecraft.
So, what had Snow Empress done to make Artoria believe she had reached the realm of True Magic?
"If not for Avalon, I'd be like Lancer... dead."
When Snow Empress's cold invaded her, Artoria sensed it.
This wasn't ordinary cold or heat.
"That palm strike contained the concept of absolute zero, didn't it?"
Absolute zero is the lowest temperature in thermodynamics, where particle kinetic energy drops to the quantum mechanical minimum.
At absolute zero, matter collapses, and all becomes nothingness.
Even light would halt under such power.
No exaggeration... this girl was a walking calamity.
Anything touched by her power would have its rules instantly erased.
And without rules to anchor them, what happens to a Heroic Spirit?
The answer was clear.
Lancer's Saint Graph was directly destroyed.
Even his two Noble Phantasms couldn't escape annihilation.
"Interesting."
Snow Empress wasn't angered by Artoria's insight into the essence of her Emperor's Palm; instead, she said with intrigue, "This Avalon you mentioned... is that the scabbard within you?"
"A special blessing that keeps you in a certain state, eternally unchanging."
"I see."
"Though my Emperor's Palm didn't hit you directly, your quick recovery shows that Avalon's scabbard has some merit."
Damien held some fondness for the King of Knights.
If possible, he had considered contracting her as a familiar to bring back to the Cardinal World.
Thus, Snow Empress hadn't aimed to kill Artoria, only eliminating the troublesome Diarmuid with one strike.
"Come, the nuisance is gone."
"Now, let me witness the martial prowess of the King of Knights."
As Snow Empress spoke, a longsword forged of frost materialized in her hand.
"Emperor's Sword: Peerless Ice!"
Without hesitation, Snow Empress unleashed one of her three ultimate techniques, the Emperor's Sword.
The river froze rapidly under the chilling wind, as if time itself had stopped, the surface now a crystalline sheet of ice.
The once-glimmering river became a massive ice block, and cherry blossom trees swaying on the banks were frozen in place.
Ice beads hung from their branches, gently swaying, producing a crisp sound.
Huff~~
Exhaling a frosty breath, Artoria glanced at the trembling Irisviel.
From the bridge, the world below seemed plunged into a harsh, silver-clad winter.
"Saber..."
"Irisviel, are you okay?"
"I-I'm f-fine..."
The bone-chilling cold made Irisviel's teeth chatter, unable to form a complete sentence.
Fortunately, she only felt the cold.
Anyone else, like Lancer's Master, Sola-Ui, would have turned into an ice statue by now.
Irisviel's safety was due to Snow Empress honoring her promise and her desire for Artoria to fight her without distraction.
"Hold on a little longer... I'll end this fight soon!"
But Artoria's condition was poor.
Thanks to Avalon's scabbard, she wasn't heavily injured.
Yet the Emperor's Sword had drained most of her mana in an instant.
Now, she could barely maintain Invisible Air, let alone unleash a beam attack.
"As expected, the Emperor's Sword alone can't defeat you."
The Emperor's Palm required close contact, its power greatly diminished at a distance.
The Emperor's Sword, while less potent than the Palm, didn't reach the level of True Magic.
But that didn't matter.
Snow Empress had no intention of killing Artoria.
She used the Emperor's Sword purely to create an ideal battlefield.
"Come, no fancy tricks."
"A swordsman speaks with their blade."
Snow Empress raised her icy longsword, descending like a divine maiden. "I, too, will face you only with my sword."
By indirectly sealing Saber's beam attack, Snow Empress ensured a pure swordsmanship duel.
"Fine!"
Artoria had no choice.
Her only option was to accept Snow Empress's trial.
However...
"By the power of the Command Spell, Saber, retreat immediately!"
"???"
The sudden recall of a Heroic Spirit enraged Snow Empress and left Artoria in disbelief. "Kiritsugu, you bastard! I refuse to retreat!"
Artoria wasn't eager to fight Snow Empress.
Her concern was Irisviel.
If she fled, what would happen to Irisviel?
"You can't take her."
Snow Empress was furious.
Her rare battle spirit had been interrupted, and she wouldn't let them leave without a price.
"Kiritsugu! I have to take Irisviel back!"
"Saber, I order you to retreat."
"Kiritsugu, you bastard!"
Irisviel was his wife!
Abandoning even his own wife... Kiritsugu Emiya, are you even human?
"Retreat!"
The Command Spell's power was absolute.
Artoria had no choice.
Even resisting, she couldn't save Irisviel from under Snow Empress's nose.
"Tch."
Though displeased, Snow Empress assured, "Rest easy... this woman will be fine."
"Thank you."
Artoria gave Snow Empress a grateful look before being forced to leave.
How laughable.
Snow Empress, the enemy, showed mercy, sparing women and children.
Keeping Irisviel was merely a matter of pride.
Yet Kiritsugu, the self-proclaimed champion of justice, always turned on his own.
First his father, then his mentor, and now even his wife abandoned.
***

chapters.title: Chapter 125: [TP] 125: Defiance
chapters.content:
"Saber's Master."
Snow Empress enveloped the unconscious Irisviel in mana and carried her back to Ryudou Temple. "Is he out of his mind?"
Damien had described Kiritsugu Emiya to his companions.
A man who dreamed of justice, aiming to be a hero of justice and bring peace to the world.
But what exactly was his so-called justice and peace?
Could justice defined by one person's perspective truly be called justice?
Snow Empress couldn't fathom his strange logic.
"Humans..."
Snow Empress shook her head, then dissolved into ice crystals, vanishing into the air. "So hard to understand."
She took Irisviel with her.
Not just out of spite, but also out of curiosity about the mysterious power within the woman.
Snow Empress couldn't decipher it, but that didn't stop her from bringing Irisviel back for Damien to assess.
"Kiritsugu Emiya!"
Meanwhile, Artoria, recalled by the Command Spell, appeared almost instantly at Kiritsugu's side.
"You've sunk so low as to abandon even Irisviel."
Grabbing his collar, Artoria demanded, "In your eyes, is everyone expendable for victory?"
"Everyone has their mission, and Irisviel is no exception."
Kiritsugu knew Irisviel's role well.
She was the vessel for the Holy Grail, a key to summoning it.
With Lancer's fall, three Heroic Spirits had now died by Damien's hand.
This meant Irisviel's body was nearing its limit.
"What do you mean?"
"Tell me, what does that mean?"
Artoria respected Irisviel far more than Kiritsugu.
If she could, she wished Irisviel were her Master, not this despicable man.
"Irisviel is the vessel for the Holy Grail."
Kiritsugu explained Irisviel's identity and role to Artoria.
The Holy Grail was divided into the Greater Grail and the Lesser Grail.
The Greater Grail, the true form of the "Saint of Winter" Justeaze, was connected to Fuyuki's leylines, drawing mana to fuel the Holy Grail War.
It had the power to connect with the Throne of Heroes, summoning Heroic Spirits as Servants.
The Lesser Grail, simply put, was a tool to control and stabilize the Greater Grail's operations, preventing malfunctions.
This tool was provided by the Einzbern family... specifically, their homunculi.
Irisviel was the vessel created by the Einzberns for the Fourth Holy Grail War.
Each time a Heroic Spirit died, their soul would flow into Irisviel.
Once more than three Heroic Spirits perished, Irisviel's personality would begin to collapse.
"When only two Heroic Spirits remain, the Holy Grail will manifest."
At that point, Irisviel would die.
This was an inevitable fate, unchangeable.
"That's why I summoned you back."
"Staying there would have been a pointless sacrifice."
"..."
Artoria hadn't expected this. "Why didn't you tell me something so important?!"
The thought of Irisviel's inevitable death pained her.
Her entire existence was to summon the Holy Grail.
How was that different from a sacrificial offering?
"The Holy Grail I seek comes at the cost of Irisviel's life."
Artoria couldn't accept such an outcome.
If the Holy Grail was such a thing, could she truly, in good conscience, wish for the salvation of her nation and people?
"With that one's magecraft expertise, there's no way he didn't see Irisviel's importance."
Kiritsugu had already accepted Irisviel's impending death.
So, he wouldn't save her... it was unnecessary.
"You really are a bastard!"
Justice? World peace?
To Artoria, Kiritsugu was just a scumbag lost in his own delusions.
"I'm going to bring Irisviel back!"
Artoria prepared to head to Ryudou Temple to formally request Damien return Irisviel.
Damien was powerful.
But he was also a king with his own sense of honor.
If possible, Artoria hoped Damien could find a way to prevent Irisviel's death.
For that, she was willing to pay a price.
"By the power of the Command Spell, Saber... "
Swish!
Before Kiritsugu could continue, Artoria's blade was at his throat.
"Don't stop me, Kiritsugu."
Artoria saw through him. "Or when your Command Spells run out, I'll kill you!"
What Holy Grail War?
What Master and Servant?
If she couldn't protect someone dear to her, what was the point of her wish to save her people?
She would bring Irisviel back.
Even if it meant risking death.
"..."
Watching Saber leave, Kiritsugu's face darkened.
He deeply regretted summoning Saber.
Any Heroic Spirit with better compatibility would have spared him this trouble.
Per Kiritsugu's plan, with the situation as it was, they should stay on the sidelines, waiting for Damien and Gilgamesh to settle their duel.
Heroic Spirits' mana and Noble Phantasms were finite.
No matter who won, the survivor would be greatly weakened.
Then, Saber could strike, giving him a chance at the Holy Grail.
Unfortunately, Saber despised such schemes.
Meanwhile, at Ryudou Temple, Damien looked at the white-haired woman Snow Empress brought back, surprised.
"What's this?"
Damien asked, "What happened?"
"My trophy."
Snow Empress recounted the events exactly as they unfolded.
"So, you were upset about Saber's sudden retreat."
"And kept Irisviel as retaliation?"
Damien scratched his head awkwardly. "I'm not blaming you, but what do we do with her?"
Killing her was out of the question.
Locking her up?
Damien wasn't so crude as to treat a woman that way.
"Forget it."
"Find a room, assign two kijin, and take good care of her."
***
